Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: merodi
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent a wonderful week here in April. I've never been at a hotel with a better outdoor layout. The patio, pool, and beach are woven together seamlessly, there is plenty of seating, from tables, couches, and beach chairs, and no matter where you sit, you get food and drink service. The young men on the beach are great, they set you up with lounge chairs, a table, and dig a deep hole for your umbrella. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The room is standard, nothing fancy but very clean and nice. The more expensive "ocean front" room has a great view, but the balcony is a bit small, we didn't spend much time out there. But honestly, you have no need to do anything in your room here besides sleep. The grounds are lovely and welcoming, you will want to spend every minute outside. If you like it less crowded, I highly recommend going during the week. We left on Friday, and the place was getting a bit crowded. Of course, the weekend apparently is quite hopping, with lots of music and dancing, so if you like a bit of a party, it seems like the place to be! Please ignore the reviews about the plane noise. It is not an issue, period! You hear the jets when you are outside, a couple an hour, and for a few seconds. You hear nothing in your room with the door closed. Oh, and a tip, it took us a while to read the door sign -- when the balcony door is open, the AC won't turn on. Environmental! The area is a bit remote, but that makes for a great beach experience -- quiet and beautiful. You can walk to some nearby restaurants, and a Walgreens. We ate breakfast at the nearby Piu Bello, mainly because there is a "sister" Piu Bello in New York that is quite good. This place was bad. The food was tasteless, the restaurant was dirty, and service was awful. Not worth it. If you want the best dinner around, though, take a taxi to Jose Enrique. It's located inland in a small house in a residential area. The menu changes nightly, the waiters bring it to you on dry erase boards. This was possibly the best meal both my boyfriend and I have ever eaten, from start to finish. The service was fantastic, also. But I digress, this is a review of the hotel! Put simply, I rarely return to the same place, but will strongly consider coming back to the Isla Verde Marriott, and will recommend it far and wide!

Reviews.Title: “FUN IN THE SUN :)”
Reviews.Author: abc12343
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 7 night stay @ the Courtyard Marriot in Isla Verde with my Teenage Daughter and what a wonderful vacation it was.The staff are some of the most friendliest and helpful people I've ever interacted with,they will go out of the way for you during your stay.The restaraunts in the resort we're def overpriced and the food wasn't the greatest however that certianly didn't rain on our parade.There is a Grocery Store,Dennys,Chilis,Pizza Hut,Burger King,Taco Bell,Walgreens,Ponderosa and more all in walking distance.Not being familiar with the territory we would walk up the beach vs the Street and simply walk through a resort which would bring us out to the area where all these places we're located.The airplanes never bothered us once,we we're never woken up @ night from them either.There are busses for $0.75 that will take you to Old San Juan as well as other places,it may take longer than a taxi simply due to the stops in between but it is certianly well worth it.We did the taxi thing once for $24.00 though I prefer the buss mainly because taxi drivers are maniacs on the road. They are building a patio which will be a great addition to the aleady beautiful atmosphere that exists..Am def planning a return trip!!

Reviews.Title: “"Was everything we were looking for..."”
Reviews.Author: MJS3326
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard one night before our Caribbean cruise began. The hotel was very easy to get to from the airport. Check-in was quick & easy. The staff were very helpful with any questions we had as this was our first visit to San Juan. The dinner we had at Sirena was very good. I had the breakfast buffet the next morning. I enjoyed the made-to-order omelet. The staff allowed us to check-out at the appointed time & held our bags until we were ready to leave for the cruise ship. Therefore, we enjoyed a beautiful morning on the beach. Taxis were right outside the front door to take us to port when we were ready. I also used the gym the morning we were there. It is small, but was not crowded. And there's a nice view of the beach from the tread mills & other machines. We didn't venture outside of the hotel. And we were unable to walk around Old San Juan. But the hotel worked very well for a short stay before our Spring Break cruise. I would recommend highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money to stay on the beach pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: C&CCav
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before a cruise and would recommend this hotel. We were originally booked at the Hampton Inn down the street, but at the last minute decided it was worth the extra $200 to start our vaction on the beach rather than feeling we were in transition - and I think that was a great choice. We arrived early evening and check in was a breeze. We dropped our bags off in our room and headed for the beach bar. The beach (all public) was busy but it was Saturday. Drinks were $6 (though we got 4 free rum punch coupons when we checked in) and service was slow - but that's par for the course in the Caribbean. Isla Verde beach is very nice and watching the sunset was enjoyable. We walked to La Playita restaurant later in the evening for a nice dinner on the water. The next morning was worth the extra cost - rather than sitting in our hotel room waiting for noon to roll around so we could go to the ship, we were on the beach by 8:30 with our complimentary coffee from the lobby (plus a fruit plate, 2 muffins and 3 bottled waters for $18), and spent 3 hours in the sun / ocean / pool. Beach chairs are plentiful and the beach/water is great. We grabbed some lunch from the pool bar ($20 for three huge hot dogs with fries and one soda). A late checkout wasn't available so we left the room right at noon. It was easy to get a cab to the pier for $20. As for the room, the view from the partial ocean view balcony was great if you didn't look directly down (to the roof of the lobby/casino), and though the room was showing some age if you looked really closely (at say the plaster in the corners in the bathroom) it was just fine and nicely appointed. Beds were comfortable and the free bottled water was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but with some mixed feelings...”
Reviews.Author: jb0825
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an 8 night stay at the Courtyard Marriott in Isla Verde. Overall it was a very nice hotel, but here are the pros and cons (for us): PROS: the hotel was right on the beach, and it was fantastic that you could sit at the pool and watch the ocean. Really lovely pool area, with swim up bar, hammocks, and large chaises. Nice fitness room (though small, it was fine, never overcrowded). Every employee at the hotel was very nice, helpful and friendly. Very clean. Great beach, with surfing nearby and a roped off area that turned out to be protecting leatherback turtle eggs (my kids loved this)! Right near the airport, which meant we could stay almost right up until our flight. :) Very good food at each of the restaurants, especially outside (Sirena). The salsa lessons Thurs night looked like a lot of fun. :) CONS: Pretty isolated. You could walk to Walgreens, and a great little restaurant called La Playita, and maybe one or two other things, but that is about it. To get anywhere, you need a car ($20 parking fee) or a taxi ($20 each way to just about anywhere - the Condado, old San Juan, etc. The hotel restaurants were EXPENSIVE, but to eat out anywhere you need to tack on the $40 taxi fare... so overall it was very costly. Even breakfast at the cafe in the hotel was $$$ (2 bagels, 2 coffees, 1 orange juice and 1 corn muffin = $17). We did find a cute breakfast place not too far away (I think it was called Piu Bello) but still, we wound up getting cereal and disposable bowls at Walgreens after awhile. There was also some construction going on (during Easter/Spring Break week? Really?) as it seemed they were putting in a new patio. It was noisy and the red fencing around the area killed the view when we sat outside to eat. I also got eaten alive by the no-see-ums, but luckily no one else in my family did. Lastly, we paid for a room upgrade to a "Junior Suite" and while the ocean view was wonderful, the room was basically a regular hotel room with maybe 10 square feet added. Having the fridge and microwave was great, though. So.... all in all, we had a wonderful time, but next time I think I'd stay in Condado or closer to Old San Juan restaurants, or at least at a hotel with free parking. PS> Yes, you hear the planes when you are outside, but not in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: ToolbeltDiva_23
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and they have 5 restaurants on the property. The hotel is right on the beach. They have 2 pools , a hot tub, a kiddie pool with a slide and a small pool for toddlers. There is something for everyone. The bed was not as comfortable as I would expect for a Marriott property. I know that others have complained about noise from the airport, but it is really not a big deal. The hotel is directly across the street from the airport. Of course you will hear planes take off and land, but I did not find this to be a problem. What bothered me most was the heard of cattle in the room above me. I was on the 11th floor and could constatly hear the folks stomping around above me. I have never had that oroblem at a Marrioot property. I found the service to be slow..EVERYWHERE All in all this is still a nice spot for a couple, singles, families or the business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: dreimer043
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights to celebrate our 25th anniversary. We used points for all 3 nights so it was a very inexpensive vacation. The beach here is a lot less crowded and cleaner than the beach in front of Intercontinental. We stayed there for one night and recommend the Marriott over the Intercontinental. It is within walking distance of a walgreens, Denny's and Pueblo supermarket. I loved that the pool and hot tub were open 24 hours a day. We took advantage every night around 11 to use both and then lay on the comfy outdoor lounges that are new this year. My husband rave about the Puerto Rican buffet from Salsa that they have every sat and sun. I would highly recommend this hotel and hope to come back soon. Also, everyone that worked here were very helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “couple of thoughts”
Reviews.Author: BOUCH8385
Reviews.Content: we had an upgrade to the 17th floor end room....great view and room...walk into a living area,with kitchen and beedroom all in 1 rooms plus bathroom....very nice was an extra 60.00 but well worth it...close to grocery store and dinning....other hotels nearby....check them out at night great lobbys and casinos for drinks....please let me know if you have questions of the area....

Reviews.Title: “Noise pollution and dirty rooms”
Reviews.Author: MegL1234
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I read other poster's reviews about the noise from the airport. I was a little concerned about the negative reviews but, there were also enough positive reviews that I figured perhaps the negative reviews were written by people that were especially noise sensitive. I live downtown in a fairly good size city so I'm used to background noise from traffic construction, etc.... and figured I wouldn't mind hearing a few planes take off. This was a HUGE mistake. The planes taking off were not in the distance but, literally across the street from our room. I don't think it could have been nosier if we were standing on the actual runway. The noise is slightly (and I do mean slightly) less bothersome on the beach but, only because there are other background noises on the beach somewhat cover it up. And the noise is pretty much constant as planes seemed to take off every 10-15 minutes when we were lucky and every 2-5 minutes when not. The Hotel has a nice lobby and pool but, our room itself left a lot to be desired. The upholstery was stained, the furniture was so chipped and scuffed up, it looked like something from a college dorm room and the bed looked like it was thrown together by someone in a big hurry. The noise from the planes was bad enough but, you could also hear every noise in the hallway and every word of conversation in the adjoining room. The balcony had a very partial ocean view but, the main view was of an apartment building next door and some stinky dumpsters. We called the front desk to request a room change and were told not only that we couldn't change rooms but, that this room had been an upgrade! I was so disappointed that we checked out and went elsewhere before we even spent one night. I really wanted to like this hotel because of the Isla Verde location ( I hear it is supposed to be one of the nicest beaches in PR) but, the noise and the poor quality of the rooms was just not worth it. The one thing I can say to this hotel's credit is that the front desk staff was very friendly and they did refund the price of our stay. I might be willing to stay at this hotel if I was just passing through (going to the airport early or to a cruise the next day) but, for a longer term stay and a relaxing vacation, I would definitely suggest to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort”
Reviews.Author: jaye25
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an upscale, clean hotel, right on the beach....then this hotel is for you. We arrived at this hotel with a party of 32; therefore we figured we would have to wait FOREVER just to check in. Well it was the OPPOSITE. We were greeted with an AMAZING front desk staff and was checked in, in a timely fashion. This hotel met all of our needs. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, quite unexpected!”
Reviews.Author: Kaacky
Reviews.Content: We visited the Courtyard by Marriott in Isla Verde in April 2012. We had booked online quite some time ago as an overnight following our cruise. We received a great deal on the room and were not expecting anything special when we arrived. Upon arrival we were pleasantly surprised with the layout, view, and location of the hotel! The hotel is located directly on the beach, with a beautiful pool, lounging area and swim up bar. Staff at the hotel were helpful and the rooms were very spacious and clean. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: ees1207
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our vacation staying at this Courtyard! Hotel Staff was very friendly and helpful! Room was spacious and clean. Pool area and beach were well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Xpressorun12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon. The rooms are nice, we had a balcony with an ocean view. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The beach is beautiful , they provide chairs and towels and have waiters walking around on the beach for drink orders. The concierge was very helpful in our adventure planning, only bad recommendation was the car rental with Allied, do not use! Location is close to other restaurants and hotels. Recommend renting bikes and riding along beach. Beautiful scenery.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Courtyard with a beautiful beach”
Reviews.Author: InNYfromGA
Reviews.Content: I was at Courtyard Isla Verda in early December of 2011. I love Puerto Rico. I like Puerto Rico because you're in a tropical paradise and can still use English (for the most part) and the US dollar. This hotel looks like it's probably seen better days. It's located on a beautiful beach. The ocean water was still warm enough to swim--in December. The beach access and proximity to the airport are the two best things going for this hotel. Platinum status with Marriott didn't really get me much here. My room had a balcony overlooking the beach. I could've sat out there for hours. The bathroom in my room had a wash cloth draped over shower curtain--I'm assuming from the last guest. The "clean" wash cloth next to my sink had a black curly hair in it. Anyone past the age of 9 knows where that probably came from. It would take two seconds for anyone in housekeeping to glance over the towels/cloths/sheets to weed out the previous guests' body hair. Really gross. There is a casino in the lobby. If you're a gambling man you may have heard the term "Caribbean style" of blackjack. This is where geniuses split 20s and make other mentally handicapped decisions. That having been said, if you plan on playing blackjack in the casino, don't be surprised when the guy next to you ruins a winning hand. Beautiful beach. Disappointing hotel. There's a Ritz next door--probably worth the extra money. Marriott Stellaris closer to downtown is beautiful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Price, Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pennsylvaniab
Reviews.Content: This is a Marriott property and, more of less, what you would expect. It is somewhat removed from the other hotels, but it is adjacent to the airport runway. the airplane noise did not disturb us, and the hotel is walking distance of numerous restaurants and stores. We found our room to be large and well-appointed, and the cleaning service does a great job. There is a casino onsite, and a number of restaurants which are fairly priced for the area. The WI-FI is slow, but no other problems. We found the hotel's employees to be friendly and helpful. There were genous refills of coffee provided, but no morning paper. There are a few papers provided in the lobby, but usually they were gone by the time I got up. The beach is excellent, and the personnel who set up the chairs and umbrellas were excellent. The fitness center is small, modern, and lightly used. We had a very loud group of neighbors who blared rap music at 3 AM, but the hotel promptly gave us a new (and better) room when we brought the matter to their attention. I left my keys in the room safe, and they still have not appeared after a number of inquires. All told, I felt that the hotel (which is family-friendly) was fairly priced for Isla Verde, and that it is a "typical Marriott," we had a great vacation at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tony F
Reviews.Content: I was just at the hotel from 3.29.12 / 4.1.12 and it was great! The rooms and views were awesome. The staff were all super nice and helpful. I spent so much time out back on the "porch" just enjoying the view and everyone was great to check on us but not to disrupt the relaxiation at the same time. I have to give special points to Alexis in Valet Parking. Very, very kind, very helpful and friendly. It was a great experience and I can't wait to return again...

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, friendly staff, right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: doubleglo
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because it was right on the beach. It was a beautiful beach! Upon check in, we received a complimentary upgrade to a room with a view. We got a room on the 12th floor and had a WONDERFUL view of the pool and the beach. The room was very clean and housekeeping did a great job of cleaning it every day. It had 2 queen size beds, very comfortable. Bathroom was roomy and clean also - water pressure was perfect and warm water (some hotels we've stayed at have issues with too much water pressure or water too hot). Fee for the room included 2 bottles of water per day which was nice to have. There are washer and dryer machines on the 2nd floor which are coin operated. There was an ice cream shop in the lobby area which was great for the kids (we have a 6 year old and 9 year old so this was perfect). The ice cream shop also sold great coffee which we have to have every morning. There is a restaurant lounge which we didn't try but it must have been good because it was always full. There is also a Casino. The pool area was WONDERFUL. There was a separate kiddie pool with a very small slide. You can literally walk from your lounge chair at the pool a few steps and be right on the beach. My kids LOVED both. Hubby and I were able to relax inside the pool at the pool bar with a few drinks while still able to watch the kids in the pool. The beach was super clean and there was jet ski rentals for $60/30 minutes. Complimentary beach lounge chairs and hammocks for hotel guests. Beach sand was a smooth, brown texture where you can walk barefooted (unlike other beaches I've been too that have too many seashells and hurt your feet if you're not wearing beach sandals). The waves were a little strong so definitely had to keep the kids close but safe enough to swim in. This hotel is on Isla Verde which is very touristy but you are close enough to San Juan so you can go check out some local bakeries (Quesitos -- YUMM). Try La Ceiba on Roosevelt or Panaderia EspaÃ±a on Ave. Baldorioty de Castro (take a cab- not within walking distance). I really have absolutely nothing bad to say about this hotel, there was only one minor thing - the parking garage. You pay for the parking per day so don't loose the ticket that you get the first time - it's what you use to get back in and out. The garage is cramped so be careful turning the corners as you may run into other cars. The visitors to the Casino who are not hotel guests use the same parking garage so it can get difficult to find a parking spot during peak Casino times. I think they should have a separate parking garage for hotel guests only. Or at least they should have a separate floor with card key access for hotel guests only. Overall I'd have to say that we are planning on staying here again for our next vacation because we were impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, updated convenient on Isla Verde”
Reviews.Author: Jane C
Reviews.Content: This is a return visit to this Marriott property because of the location and convenience to the airport. (5 minutes). It has lovely views of Isla Verde and convenient taxi ride to restaurants and shops on the island. Check-in was professional but I had to wait for my room. Several restaurants on site offer traditional island fare. The casino is small. Pool is very nice with efficient chair service which has been updated. Conference services available for business meetings appeared very nice and there is a small business center with limited offerings. Gym on site. The beach is small but quiet. It is a place that locals go to surf and body board. Rooms were pretty standard, dated but comfortable. Balconies available for all rooms. Good value for the $ for vacationers with family. Be patient for your room and don't hesitate to request accommodations or reward upgrades. Overall enjoyable stay and Marriott quality!

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: auntbee2
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four nights at the Courtyard by Marriott Isla Verde. It is a great hotel - beautiful beach with many oceanfront rooms (we were lucky to get one!) - all the amenities you would need - clean beach chairs and large umbrellas brought to you by pleasant "beach boys"...the pool is clean and plenty of chairs. The bagel and coffee bar in the lobby is great for a light breakfast and the flatbread pizza in Picante restaurant in the lobby is a good late night treat (along with the fun band and the dancing) We were able to walk to the Ritz for dinner one night and walked to the El San Juan to meet friends staying there. The Marriott beach was just as nice as this beach for a better price! I would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a well priced, pleasant home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless night 3/15/2012-3/23/12”
Reviews.Author: MONKEYDEE23
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel before last year same time the only thing is this year was a complete disaster. First room yes you heard me right the first room was a room with no view which I requested a room with a view their answer was call in the morning we can see what we can do. I called in the morning and they gave me a run around after being on the phone for about 20min they were like ok I found one but we will have to contact you when its ready which meant waiting around so that we could move our stuff. Now its 4pm and no call so I went to the front desk the girl looked at me like I was crazy she said she had no record of my room being moved. Ok now I'm upset she say hold on please walk away to the back door now another 15min goes by she comes back oh I spoke with my supervisor her we go here is your new room key. So we gathered our things moved finally a great view just what I paid extra for now my vacation can start. NOPE here we go was time to go to sleep that night and the air in the room was not working it became 80 in the room hot and unbearable I called the front desk they sent someone now I have to get dressed for someone to come into my room at 2am really he messes with it now it works ahhh great : ) Nope guess again on and off on and off. So I call in the morning at 8am and they send another tech. he says its the batteries next night air worked. Room 423 Bed is hard but great view the bathroom floor is all stained and gross looking they really should try some bleach. The cleaning people in the hallway in the morning yelling to one another guess no sleeping in. Pool is nice if they kept it clean I think I found plastic floating past rappers of some sort floating by me. I do have to say the beach is perfect. The outside bar a great touch that wasn't there last yr. Sitting out not he balcony is very noisy from the fans down below from the other part of the hotel so between that and the plains flying over not to relaxing to sit outside. The staff was nice but its hard to enjoy and be happy when allot had gone wrong and it had to be a fight to fix it all. When it was our last day I received a bill under my door that I was not expecting had to call the front desk and find out what it was it was in error. REALLY now a bill of 394.00 that was a mistake really one problem after another. Will I stay again no I let them know that since I stayed in the hotel 2011 to 2012 they have gone down hill and they should work on improving. Thank god for being able to venture out of the hotel : )

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: japjv
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to exspect. This hotel is the last hotel geographically in Isla Verde....but that is the only thing they are last in. They have beautiful grounds...well priced food...and the music was the best I had the chance to listen to! By the way the are in walking distance of the El San Juan Towers and the Ritz! My only negative was it was a bit difficult to sleep in since that staff was chatting up a storm all morning!

Reviews.Title: “A slice of paradise with great service!”
Reviews.Author: 4partharmonygal
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay 3 days at the Courtyard by Marriott Isla Verde Beach Resort before getting on a cruise ship. Our room was very nice, the bed was comfy, the outdoor pool and beach were gorgeous. The best thing about this hotel resort is the staff! We had many questions for Karla the concierge when we arrived and she did her very best to try and get us a tour of the biobay but it was a full moon and you can't really see the luminescence unless it is dark. She did successfully get us on a tour of the Camuy Caves and Arecibo Observatory (see separate rating). We had a terrific server, JenMarie, our first night at the restaurant, Salsa, in the hotel. You'll know her by her dimpled smile. We asked what Puerto Rican specialties we could have for dinner and she recommended the bean soup and rice, skirt steak with chimichurri sauce or the pork dish with a dipping sauce that we suspect is a combination of ketchup and mayonnaise. She surprised us with an appetizer of Mofongo which is a mashed plantain dish with garlic & oil. It was delicious! JosÃ© suggested the bottle of house wine Trio (Chilean) and it went very well with our selections. We loved the soup and the skirt steak was tasty but a bit chewy and stringy since it is a cheaper cut of meat. Andy enjoyed his pork. They served us 2 other variations of plantain but we liked the Mofongo best. Even though we were stuffed and a bit drunk from the wine we let JenMarie and JosÃ© talk us into trying the Tembleque, a firm coconut pudding. If you like coconut don't miss trying it! We loved it and asked for it every night we were there. We both enjoyed the Puerto Rican cafÃ© con leche (strong coffee with hot milk) and it spoiled us before getting to the cruise ship. The next morning we were served by very cheerful, friendly and competent, YoaMara. Even though we didn't show up for breakfast until just before they closed breakfast service she made us feel like honored guests. We also met Angel, the Food and Beverage Manager, and JesÃ¹s, the Food and Beverage Director, as they were preparing the restaurant for lunch service. They obviously love what they do and made us feel very special. I really felt like I was on vacation once I got in the pool and had a drink at the swim up bar. If you like rum you must try the Puerto Rican Ron del Barrilto, either 2 star or 3 star. It is far better than Bacardi. In fact, they make this rum from Bacardi and age it in casks. My husband drinks his rum straight up but I notice the difference in quality even in my Pina Coladas. It is much smoother and complex. The bartenders did not object at all to making my mixed drinks with the better rum. YoaMara even brought us a homemade treat on our second morning for our afternoon snack. It tasted like a yummy bread pudding but we didn't get the chance to ask her what it was called or how it was made. We tried eating off the property at the Metropole down the street on our second night but we liked the food at Salsa on the resort better and ate there on our last night. Lorna the evening manager at the restaurant was pitching in and bussing tables since the restaurant was packed but she made sure she came by to ask us if we enjoyed our meal. It was excellent again and we told her so. The only small downside to this property is that it is adjacent to the airport so you do hear all of the planes taking off when you are outside but our room was well soundproofed and we slept undisturbed.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: anon0423
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an eight-day vacation to Puerto Rico and stayed at the Courtyard by Marriott Isla Verde. A word about the negative aspects of certain of the reviews on this site: 1. It is true that the hotel is right by the airport. It is true that there will be airport noise, which we found more prevalent on Sunday than any other day. However, it is also true that the airport noise is intermittent even at its worst (think perhaps two planes per hour, and then only four or five hours of the day), the noise lasts for approximately three minutes, and the sound of the crashing waves more than drowns out the sound. 2. It is also true that the service at the restaurants is extraordinarily slow. I'm not even sure that begins to describe it. But you will quickly find that will be your experience at nearly all Puerto Rican eating establishments - we even suffered through it at the airport on our way back home. The worst part about the restaurants in the resort is that the food is exceptionally so-so. Absolutely nothing to write home about, so if you have to wait for food to be delivered, why not venture out of the hotel and find one of the good local restaurants down the street a short way? 3. Others have noted that, despite the resort fee, nothing is free. That is true and false. Each day, we secured three beach loungers, a table to put drinks, etc., on and a large umbrella to provide respite from the Puerto Rican sun. You will not be so fortunate at some all-inclusives throughout the Caribbean, where hoarders will drape towels over multiple chairs at ungodly times of the morning, so that they can use them once they are really up many hours later. We were also provide beach towels that were actually beach - not bath - towel sized. But beyond that, plan to bring your wallet. The boogie boards were $15 (unless you were lucky enough to snag one of the two or three mini-sized boogie boards). Glasses of soda that are mostly ice will cost you $4 per cup, regardless of whether you fetch them yourself or pop up one of the red plastic flags attached to each chair that cause waitstaff to come bearing menus. 4. Others have noted that the rooms are dark. Our room was in fact a little dark, but only because it was oriented toward the breathtaking balcony view (and we stayed in a run-of-the-house room). With the shades open and the light on by the door, the "it's too dark" problem quickly vanished (not to mentioned we used the room primarily for sleeping, where "it's too dark" is never a problem). Now, on to the good: 1. The fridge helps. We had breakfast in the room each morning (cereal and milk was not only inexpensive, it was expeditious for the little one who wanted to race outside immediately upon awakening anyway), and made sandwiches, etc., to bring to the beach for lunch. Because it is a public beach, the hotel staff cannot preclude you from bringing your own food and beverages along with you there, even though they can (and do) preclude you from eating it next to the pool. 2. The cleaning staff was very accommodating - once, they even gave us a gallon of water when we were short on bottled water that is provided in the room each day. They gave us more than enough toiletries and towels each day, which can be a challenge at other resorts. 3. The hotel is within walking distance of several really good restaurants (see above re. extremely slow service, which we experienced at each to varying degrees). We enjoyed Metropol and Plato's, as well as Mi Casita (which is in a strip mall, but was so good, we ate there twice). 4. The beach was beautiful and not crowded at all. 5. We had a little trouble with a rental car, which the concierge helped us sort out quickly and without hesitation, even though the trouble had nothing to do with the hotel or its staff. 6. The fitness center was clean, well-maintained, and actually had nice equipment. In all, this is certainly a report worth returning to - the inconveniences are more than made up for by its (relative) affordability.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: BeachBabe
Reviews.Content: I transferred here from the El Conquistador where I attended a wedding. The hotel was perfect for R&R after a very busy weekend of wedding activities. The beach is amazing! Staff could not do enough for me from the front desk to the head of housekeeping checking my room when I arrived to beach staff, pool staff, room service, etc. A huge difference from the El Conquistador where the service was slow and poor (see my review). The pool is fairly small but not crowded at all. Lots of hammocks and couches on the beach which I loved. The only drawback is the hotel is right near a runway and you can hear planes taking off regularly. That is the only reason I would think twice about staying here again. The room was stocked with 2 bottles of water each day and free coffee in the lobby. Prices were very reasonable (can of coke in the vending machine was $1). And yes they charge $25/day resort fee. This is pretty standard for a resort and I had no problem paying it.

Reviews.Title: “Better beach than the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Real_Grenadine
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect place to stay if you are arriving late in the day/night or flying out early. That is because, as you can tell from all the other reviews, it is directly in the flight path of all the airplanes. The noise is definitely a major factor. However, I found that while lounging in one of the hammocks, the sound of the surf was enough to drown it out. But you can't sleep with your balcony door open to enjoy the sound of the waves, because the first flight of the day will certainly startle you wide awake (if it doesn't give you a heart attack). With the door shut, it's manageable, if not ideal. The beach is the best part of the whole stretch. I made a point of checking the entire sand situation, and at the Ritz, the beach was a mess - with seaweed all over it. The hammocks are divine - and I am an hammock aficionado. There are, of course, not enough of them. But I was always able to get one. Yes, the rooms are dark-ish. But you are at the beach, so why would you be hanging out in your room? At check-in, when I was initially not thrilled about this, the lovely and extremely patient front desk person showed me several other rooms, and I had to admit that she had given me the best of the bunch in the first place. I had a cute little balcony that looked up the beach to the left (I recommend asking for a room with such a view, if you plan on spending any time on your balcony. The other side has parking garage "views"). Even the direct ocean view rooms did not impress me. I did think it was odd that a beach hotel would have carpet on the floor, but everything seemed perfectly clean. The small fridge in the room is a giant bonus. You can easily walk to Walgreen's to get snacks and beverages. A longer stroll - but totally feasible - will take you to the supermarket where you will have more options (& slightly better prices). If you will be in the hotel for more than one night, you should take the initiative to get your own supplies. Their drink prices are astronomical and the food is quite average anywhere Marriott fare (& also overpriced). Also, while on your foray, you will locate a couple of local breakfast spots where you can go. Staff is either wonderful or dismal. Some of the concierges were very helpful. Some were disinterested (or not there at all). But I have high praise for the manager (at the time of my stay) whose contact information I got by reading his replies to comments here on TripAdvisor. I had an issue after business hours and sent him an e-mail. His response was immediate and helpful. He is awesome. The only thing I think they should change is a shuttle service. They are only a 2-minute drive from the airport, so why can't they pick you up and take you there? (Maybe there is a law, I don't know. Some airports have weird restrictions regarding on site transportation.) Also, you are far away from the main attraction in Puerto Rico: San Juan. It takes almost 20 a half hour and costs $20 to take a cab there. Then another $20 to get back. There should definitely be a regular shuttle service. There is basically nothing to do in this part of Puerto Rico except for hang out on the beach, or be at the airport, and San Juan is too far away to cab back and forth to more than once a day. All in all, I would stay at this hotel for a day or two at the beginning of a trip to Puerto Rico, and maybe plan to unwind here for one more to have a decent shower before flying home. It's a pick-up spot for the totally amazing EcoTour which would be fun to do before heading off to one of Puerto Rico's other islands for a more relaxing, quiet, and rustic time.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience I have EVER had.”
Reviews.Author: Ryan G
Reviews.Content: A little background: There were 4 of us total and we made the reservation on Orbitz for four people. Upon arrival we were told we had to pay 25 extra PER PERSON PER DAY. So 50 dollars a day for the two people that we already paid for. We put a credit card down on the room for incidentals, which we knew. Here is the bulleted list: -We paid with our credit cards for drinks, but they kept randomly charging them to the room. -We paid cash and they still were charging them to our room. -They charged the room $140 dollars randomly that we caught and they apologized and had to take off. -They charged drinks at 3:24am and 3:25am (so double charged the credit card). -The maintenance were hammering into the walls at 9 am and then using an electric saw on our floor to where we had to call down to make them stop. -We would go to management and they were not helpful and very rude. -Upon leaving. The credit card that was put down for charges was randomly charged 103.22 last night and we left there a week ago. Every time we would call the hotel they would send us to voicemail and not listen, and Marriott corporate were not helpful. -The resort tried to blame the bank and say that it was the bank who double charged, but after the bank called them they said it would be fixed tomorrow. So they were lying to us. -We were not the only people who had issues. After talking to other people on the resort they had issues too with random charges. One couple got randomly charged 60 dollars and another couple got charged 224 dollars. - I have traveled a lot in the Caribbean and to resorts and this is by far the WORST experience I have ever had. DO NOT GO HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay in Puerto Rico!”
Reviews.Author: dyvawoman77
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Marriott. There was only things I had issue with, the taxi service charges a minimum $30 fee no matter what zone you are going to if you use your credit card. This was a major issue for my boyfriend because he was there on business and had a company card. The other thing was the walls were thin and we could hear everything! Which made me self-conscious that anyone else could hear us too. Outside of that, the hotel was great. Never saw the breakfast buffet but we had breakfast outside at Salsa. The casino was very slow when we were there. Everyone was pleasant and helpful. Would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing beach but LOUD airport”
Reviews.Author: ninkasigirl
Reviews.Content: Beach = awesome. Great sand, clean, fun waves, not too crowded, and lovely rum drinks. Also, the lobby had salsa all weekend, which was awesome to watch. It seemed like the locals went there. However, the airport is painfully, and I mean painfully close. You can hear the planes fly overhead and sitting outside, it sometimes is hard to hear each other. The windows and sliding doors are double paned, which helped but didn't heal. It is a little dirty, and the hot tub was full of algae. Gross. Would I go back? No. Was the beach awesome? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “loved the beach”
Reviews.Author: Puertoricofirsttimer
Reviews.Content: Great area for a quick getaway. Staff was great Front desk Nancy was very helpful with rooms. also Breakfast had great wait staff. Jay was very friendly and great. Also during other days, we also had Joanna, Brian, Aracelis and Alexis and they were all very professional and very friendly. The beds were very comfortable and slept really well. Some of the younger beach staff were more focused on talking to young girls rather than helping with setting up chair, at times we had to wait 15 minutes to get chairs and umbrella, despite giving them a tip.... Location : despite the runway of the airport it was not too much of a nuisance. Loved that stretch of beach- the Ritz Carlton was close by so obviously that beach is among the better ones in San Juan

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Property with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Mamere17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our annual anniversary trip and used our Marriott points for our room. This is not the typical Courtyard in the states. I wasn't expecting to get upgraded because of our use of points but we were pleasantly surprised when we were upgraded to an Oceanview room on a high floor ! It was an amazing view. I can't say enough about the customer service and polite and attentive staff at this hotel. They lived up to all the reviews that I read about for this hotel. The only real bummer about this property is that fact that it sits parallel to the take off runway to the airport. But after the first day or two, it didn't really bother us. Great happy hours at the bars but after 6 they are regular price so it gets a little pricey. We hit the Walgreens down the street for room stock which worked out well. The area is located a bit away from all the attractions but easy enough to find travel. Public bus is really cheap 75 cents and you get a real feel for the locals ! We did take two excursions, Rain Forest (didn't really think it was worth the $65 each for half day) but the Catamaran snorkel trip was fantastic ! Long bus ride to Fajardo but totally worth the day and for $95 each you got the bus to the marina, lunch, all day rum drinks and snorkeling at two reefs. There is an amazing restaurant at the La Playa Hotel which is a short walk down the beach it is so quaint right on the ocean literally you sit on the dock with the waves crashing in front of you ! Best burgers here and really nice menu. Another good restaurant is called Metropol which is a short walk just past the Ritz and that has authentic Puerto Rican and Cuban dishes. Soooo good ! I would not recommend this trip if we took our kids, there is just not enough that would have entertained our children ages 11-16 and its expensive for food and drinks. We would definitely stay here again as a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: PassionateNewyorker
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights and 6 days. Booked it through priceline for $83 a night for a standard room. Check in was super smooth. Upgraded to junior suite( As we needed Microwave and it was available only for Junior Suites). Amazing ocean view. Upgraded for $40 a night. Isla Verde beach is the best in San Juan area and these guys are right there on Isla Verde beach. Very sweet staff, good but expensive food at restaurants, amazing pools(both cold and hot). We had a great vacation and i will definitely refer this hotel for someone looking for a peaceful vacation. Walgreens and bus stop to catch a bus to Old San Juan area are just 3 blocks away from hotel. 16% resort fee might look ridiculous but we didn't mind paying after experiencing their super fast wifi and complimentary rum drinks..:)

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeChick
Reviews.Content: We debated whether to stay here or the Marriott Resort. Certainly not the usual Courtyard and perfect for our "requirements". Great location and one could use public transport however we did rent a car. No activities for tiny tots but there are many families here. Beach is quiet and nearby airport is not a problem. Excitement on the weekends and 24 hour casino, not for us. Internet all over the place for those of us can't leave laptops at home. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A great place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Marcopolo111
Reviews.Content: This is our favorite hotel in San Juan. We have been in half a dozen others, chains, boutiques, in the old town, el Condado and Isla Verde and in this hotel over 10 times during the last 5 years. It is a tipical Marriott Courtyard in terms of service and amenities although the building is nicely designed with all the room with an ocean view. It has a decent restaurant, a mid sized casino, a good fitness center, a nice swimming pool in a non plastic natural garden settings. It has a spectacular beach. Unlike other hotels in Isla Verde (the equivalent of Copacabana in San Juan) which are bumper to bumper and crowded, this hotel is at the far east of the island and on the east side there is nothing but several miles of beach and no building. The beach is quiet and it is one of the best in the area. The hotel is next to the airport: you can walk from the terminal in 20 min although it is not advisable. Can hear planes take off from beach but not from double glass door rooms, though it didn't bother us at all. its not intrusive. You can reach the old town and el Condado in 15-20 min driving. What we found interesting was the variety of customers at any time: the expected US and Canadian tourists, groups from Japan, European tourists but also local business people from different parts of the island, local honeymooners, small conventions and a large number of puertoriquenos gambling at the casino or dancing on the bar lobby to the sound of live latin music. The hotel seems to manage superbly all the needs of these different communities. Staff are universally courteous and knowledgeable. The rates in season are quite expensive but most of the times you may find specials. You also have to add a large number of taxes and, if you rent a car, $15/night for parking. It is not for you if you like to be surrounded by bars, Tshirt stands and crowds. You will love it if you like quiet, a wonderful beach just outside the elevator, excellent service and well run facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Appearances Only!”
Reviews.Author: bumpensero1
Reviews.Content: Dissapointed is all I can say by all appearances this should have been a five star weekend, at best it was one star. First a Tip the GPS locator icon is the actual street address marker NOT the entrance to the hotel a half mile back. Check in went smooth I presented my Marriotts reward card and inquired for any available upgrades, the knid gentleman Carlos said we were automaticaly upgraded. We arrive to RM 1018 which is a wheel chair accessible room which had a roll away desk that came in handy the TV was bigger than in the two other rooms I peaked in on but other than that I could not tell the difference from the other rooms bathroom was bigger(wheelchair accessible). Ok I figure I am not going to complain its a weekend getaway lets start having a good time. We arrive at the hotel around 930pm check in get settled we are back down in lobby by 1030 there are five restaurants on this facility, we tried Salsa, first the staff was super sweet and nice just terribly slow! Now on their behalf they close at 11 we just sat down us and everyone else on our flight lol. The food looked deliscous magazine cover but my steak tasted like shoe leather! Appearnces! I did have some work to do so I will comment that the roooms roll away desk allowed me to find a spot to work glimpse up at tv and talk without my back being turned. On a business traveler note there are enough outlets for charging but the safe can hold a Ipad and maybe a smaller netbook but not a full size laptop. Room Service took forever I ordered a pot of coffee 45 minutes later I got a cup of coffee for 4Buck s and change! We ordered breakfast the next morning it took and 1hour I was about to cncell when they knocked at the door. Aside from the Jets rumbling by throughout the night it was relatively quiet. I dont plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Irie12
Reviews.Content: Our room was great with a nice small balcony overlooking the ocean. The fridge was not that cold though. The beach was great with nice sand and water. No problem getting a chair. Pool was also nice with a swim up bar. We ate at Spice and Metropol and Papaya at the hotel. All were pretty good. Walking distance to restaraunts, walgreens, and supermarket. We also did an old san juan tour as well as rainforest and laquilla beach. It is very close to the airport, but the planes did not bother us. You can hear them when outside only. We got a promotion though Marriott for an upgrade as well as a 50$ gift card. Would definently stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for Extra Charges!”
Reviews.Author: Lakesfam
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here for one night before our cruise. First they lost our hotwire reservation. Luckily they had a room for us. They added all these resort fees even though all we did was sleep there for one short night. So we paid for the hotel through hotwire, and got another bill from the hotel for $60. So this is not a good option if you arent planning to use the resort features. Room was nothing special either.

Reviews.Title: “"Okay hotel and beach"”
Reviews.Author: LiveandLoveToTravel
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Marriott before on a visit to the Cayman Islands, which is what made me choose this hotel. However, Puerto Rico is NOT the Cayman Islands and this hotel fell short of my expectations. If you're expecting crystal clear waters, no waves and soft sand, you will have to choose another destination for your getaway. The sand directly in front of the hotel was covered in seaweed, which means having to walk to other parts of the beach to go swimming. Also, don't expect to lounge on a beach chair until sunset- the hotel takes the beach chairs away from guests at 5 p.m. so you're left sitting on your towel in the sand (hoping not to get bitten by the sand fleas that the hotel warns about). The best thing about the Marriott's section of the beach is that guests were not seated on top of each other- which seemed to be the case at the Ritz where the beach was packed and there was no room to walk. The room itself was acceptable but the bathroom needed a major update. The cleaning service was adequate but often failed to replace cups and tissues. Thankfully, I didn't spend too much time in my room so this was not a major issue. One of the best features of this hotel is the red flag service which allows guests the comfort of ordering lunch or drinks right from their beach chair. However, be prepared for limited dining options overall and the surrounding area doesn't offer much beyond a Chili's and Denny's. The food itself at the hotel was decent and most of the wait staff was friendly, but not overly attentive. On the nights the hotel had salsa music, the wait for food was far too long (over an hour for a quesadilla) and the waitresses were not particularly nice, focusing on the regular customers and those who were ordering lots of drinks. On the day of my checkout, there was an unexpected charge on my bill. When I brought this to the attention of the front desk, they stated the charge was for a different room and removed it from my bill...without an apology. Make sure to keep track of your room charges. Overall, if you're looking for a quick getaway from the US and plan to spend your days by the beach and pool, this hotel is fine. There is nothing particularly exceptional about it and the location is somewhat isolated. You can probably do better at a different hotel or different part of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: tawana78
Reviews.Content: This is one of three hotels that I stayed at in this area and it is by far my favorite! The check in was smooth. The ocean front view was amazing. The common areas were bustling but not too crowded. The food was decent but a bit over priced like at any resort. The casino was nice but small. The free arcade was nice as well. The beach was great! Not overly crowded and the staff was attentive. And unlike other hotels, you walk right out the back entrance to the beach instead of having to go through a maze and a gate. Would definitely stay here again if in the area and would recommend to others

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable spot for the week”
Reviews.Author: Traveling-Texan3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Puerto Rico for the first time in February 2012, and used our Marriott points to stay at the Isla Verde Courtyard. I had read many of the reviews, and were leary as to how much we would enjoy it. So, we set our expections a bit low. However, we were very pleasantly surprised. We were in a corner room on the 11th floor on the east side, and though we did hear some planes, it by no means hindered our stay at all. The beach was beautiful and clean, the staff was VERY helpful, the small casino had fun slots that kept you there awhile, and the restaurant food was comparable to some of the midpriced restaurants in Texas. We even opted to have our Valentines dinner there, which at Sirena (their beachfront restaurant) was quite lovely. We were very happy that we chose this location which is a tiny bit more remote than the full service Marriott on Condado Beach. Condado is very big city feel and quite congested, and having rented a car and drove to almost all corners of Puerto Rico, we were SO happy not to have to navigate out of Condado every time we wanted to go somewhere. As Americans, we found the driving in PR to be very nervewracking and extremely stressful, as very few laws are abided on the roads. Stay at this Courtyard and you will feel quite relaxed if you choose. If you want a bit of party excitement, though, there is also great salsa music on Friday and Saturday at their bar, Picante. All ages were really enjoying the fun there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice beach but noisy”
Reviews.Author: VacationgirlSandy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in Feb prior to a cruise. The beach area is beautiful but the planes are very noisy as you are right next door to the airport. Outside is loud but inside isn't too bad. Our room was fine - we were on the 4th floor. The housecleaning staff was not the best as we found a dirty rag on the floor when we checked in and our dirty glasses were never replaced with clean ones. One day we were out all day and came back at 3 p.m. and our room hadn't been cleaned yet. When we told the front desk, they did send someone up to clean it but again when we returned to the room our dirty glasses were still there and our empty tissue box had not been replaced. The food and drink in the hotel are pretty expensive. It is quite a walk to other hotels and restaurants so you do feel confined to staying inside the hotel especially at night. We booked a tour through the hotel to El Yunque which was quite enjoyable. All in all the hotel was fine but next time we would stay somewhere closer to the town or in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and caring of staff with an amazing attitude”
Reviews.Author: Rajat K
Reviews.Content: Our family vacation at The Courtyard Isla Verde, Puerto Rico was made memorable on acount of the people and their attitude, at this Resort Property. A few names that come to mind immediately, for having made our children and us feel special are :- 1) Nancy in Front Office - for being extremely considerate in giving us a room with an amazing view 2) Jay and Brian (Brain), for taking care of us every morning over breakfast, at the outdoor sea facing Patio. 3) Jean Pierre at the Papaya Grill - who was a constant for us during our long hours at the beach, where the kids inavraibly reached out for either a Burger or Hot Dogs at the Pool Side grill. 4) Javier and Sandra at the Banana's DEli with Pizza's, Ice-Creams and Coffee's. The other members of the staff were also very friendly and caring, not to say the least. We are convinced that what makes this palce memorable are the people...the view and the location is a bonus. The property could however, in some areas do with some maintenance and up-grades (in order for it to be contemporary with Resorts across Mauritius, Bali, Pataya, Maldives or for that matter in Aruba, Jamaica etc.)...but that is only because one is comparing with other "physical ameneties" elsewhere. In terms of "people and hospitality" - this place beats the others all hand doen...coming from a group of travelers who have tried and tested global vacation resorts and spots over the years. Rajat Kapoor

Reviews.Title: “great beach”
Reviews.Author: brambl67
Reviews.Content: this hotel has a great beach plus a good pool and outdoor seating area. Free morning coffee and reasonable snacks. Inside restaurant is near bar and can be very niisy if there is a band. There were several places a short walk away to eat and shop. Bus to Old San Juan is a bargain at 75 cents.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time here...”
Reviews.Author: Wislie
Reviews.Content: It was our second time here... and can't wait to come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place”
Reviews.Author: tabitha25
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here 3 times and we love it. We have stayed at other hotels in the area, but this is our favorite and we now only stay here. The beach is very nice and not crowded. The rooms are nice with very comfortable beds. Great view of the ocean from the balcony - we like the higher floors as they have better views. The pool area and grounds are very pretty and well taken care of. One of the best things about this hotel is the people who work there. Everyone we encountered always had a smile and went out of their way to make sure we were enjoying our stay It is close to the airport and you do hear planes when you are outside, but it didn't bother us at all and inside the room you barely heard them. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Airport”
Reviews.Author: torobuque
Reviews.Content: Our room had a spectacular ocean view with a great balcony on a higher floor. Isla Verde beach and the pool were right below and planes took off and landed in front. The bed and room were very comfortable...nice chairs, good lighting for reading. To get to the pool or beach you must pass through the busy lobby's reception area which includes the registration area, the cafe, and the adjacent bar. The pool is not heated. The beach has lots of people. Bands are loud but there is great dancing at all hours of the day and night. Within a 10 minute walk there are restaurants, bars, and convenience stores. Major problem, however, is noise. The hotel is directly across from the airport runway which makes the noise from the planes very loud from early morning to late evening. Sound proofing does not shut plane noise out. The room air conditioner is also a problem as its location allows your neighbors normal speaking voice to be heard in the room....annoying. If you need to be close to the airport for your flight, Isla Verde is OK but there are so many other beautiful beaches and places to be in Puerto Rico, we recommend exploring elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “My Weekend escapade at the Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: ar2ro
Reviews.Content: This is my first time staying in this hotel. I went with my wife for the weekend. The staff and the employees are friendly and willing to help you anyway they can. The hotel is clean, with 3 restaurants, casino, nice pool , including one for children and a very beatiful beach. The rooms are big and comfortable , with balcony looking at the beach. Even though the hotel is very near the Airport the rooms have double glass sliding door that keep most of the noise out. I had the chance to dine at the Sirena Restaurant which is located at a Terrace looking at the beach with was very relaxing and romantic. The food and service was great. Saturday night, is Salsa night at the bar. If your brave enough get few drinks an dance with the locals or you can stand in the sidelines and hear the music and admire the dancers. The hotel doesn't have a SPA, but the concierge was able to find us professional massage therapist that gave each one of us a one hour massage treatment for a very reasonable price. So we had great time at this hotel. Now my advise to you; before you do a reservation ask about the Resort Fee that you are going to be charged and what it includes. Remember there is nothing "complimentary " at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for vacation and business with great staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelingSalesMgr
Reviews.Content: This was my fifth or sixth time staying in this hotel for business, but my first review due to time. Among the choices in San Juan, this Courtyard offers a great package for the both the business person or those looking for a relaxing vacation. I usually request a high floor to enjoy the view, and I have been pleased with the rooms where I have stayed (even those with a partial view of the ocean). When I stayed last, I hit the jack pot as I enjoyed a special online package that included a US$50.00 debit card, US$50.00 toward a rental, and free breakfast (I stayed for a five days). The hotel is easily accessible from/to the airport (10 minutes) and, once in the rooms, one hardly hears the airplanes landing or the casino on the first floor of the hotel. The windows have a triple seal of glass that keep the rooms quiet. The beds are very comfortable and the furniture is well kept. Access to the beach and the chance to jog for miles and miles, should not be take from granted as this is one of the few hotels that offer that kind of perk in San Juan. On the business side of things, I can comment: * Excellent wireless connectivity within the room and public areas * The hotel has a set of business rooms, which are ideal for business people. * Rooms are roomy and well organized, the desk is wide as well as with plenty of outlets. * There is a good supply of in-room coffee and tea at all times, for those like me who need to stay late working. * The front desk staff, bell boys, and taxi drivers all are friendly and knowledgeable about the surroundings. The bell boys are always helpful, with a very pleasant personality despite the hour of the day. * The taxi drivers can tell you up front the fares they will change you, but it always good to ask first as taking taxis can usually add up quickly. Overall they are committed to offer a good service or to take you from place to place, if one informs them on time. * The business center is fine and the staff is available when needed. * The check in and check out is always fine, without funny charges. * The gym, which is at walking distance in a separated building, offers a good selection of machines, dumbbells, and cardio machines. It is very good and included at not additional fee. * The hotel is at walking distance, 10 minutes, to a large group of restaurants and additional hotels. It is safe to walk in the area, and prices range according to the taste. CONS - So far I can not think about any major issue that needs to be highlighted, ah! Sure, there is a resort fee that ones need to pay which is not out of proportion. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who has business around Isla Verde, San Juan, Rio Piedras, Santurce, Carolina, and Cupey.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ThaÃ¯s
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Courtyard Isla Verde for a full week in january/2012. The hotel is very good, nice beds and nice rooms with balcony, right in the beach of Isla Verde which is beautiful and pleasant (it was hard to find anyone unless near the hotels). The services provided by Courtyard very much pleased me as you have beach towels, chairs and umbrellas without having to pay anything else as already payed (the hotel charges a resort fee that covers that services, wireless internet and two bottles of water per day per room). Knowing how much it is charged for this kind of things in Miami Beach, for example, made me really happy that everything was included in the resort fee (I guess it was around U$ 20,00 per room per day). There was only one thing that did not please me but it was not the hotel's fault, althought I believe that the hotel could manage things in order to avoid this kind of situation with their guests: the overpriced taxi fare that the cab drivers that stop at the hotel charge. I explain: in San Juan when you go by taxi from one place to another you already know how much you are going to pay as there is a flat rate to every place. The taxi drivers that stay at the hotel, in a regular basis, do not obey the fixed rate. They always charge you a bit more. If you walk outside of the hotel you will find taxis that will take you to the place you want to go for the right rate. I complained about that to the manager and I know it is not the hotel's fault but I believe that one call to the company that owns the taxis would put an end to this story. I believe that Courtyard has to protect their guests from this kind of procedure as it is not right at all. I doubt that the company would keep the same drivers at the hotel if there was a complaint about their procedure. This was the only if.

Reviews.Title: “The beach is nice”
Reviews.Author: Lorena O
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and two children. The shower stays on so I was unable to give the kids a bath only a shower. The towels are scratchy. Best to get them from the pool area for the shower. I ordered room service. The lobby being so busy I went down to get the food. The food was not exactly what I ordered. I was given a dessert however, no apology. I was also charged a 15 percent gratuity? For getting my own food? I also grabbed a menu from the pool bar and requested service. Nobody ever came over. Even after spending $15.00 for a 1 oz shot! The parking garage is so full there is nowhere to park on the weekends. The room was never vaccuumed during my stay. Despite the fact my son had spilled some cereal on the floor. The coffee,soap,shampoo and water was never replaced without asking. I have stayed in cheaper hotels that were cleaner. it was not a horrible experience. I just expected more for almost $300 a night. This hotel needs to lower their prices or provide the services they say they do.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: dukeboy1951
Reviews.Content: Hello; I want to express my deep appreciation to the Staff and especially Alexis, the bell stand attendee. We arrived at the Marriott Isla Verde on the 25th of December. We departed for the Princess Cruise on the 26th via a taxi that we took from the hotel. When we arrived at the ship, the driver left without giving me my computer bag. The bag contained all of my electronics etc. I immediately called the hotel and got the front desk, and was transferred to the bell stand. A gentleman named Alexis said he would try to contact the taxi driver, and would assist in any way. After a few minutes Alexis called back and said he found the driver, and my computer bag. Alexis, then called me two additional times to make sure I got the bag, and that everything was fine. What are the chances of ever getting my bag back? I had little hope of ever seeing my computer etc again. The service I received was beyond exceptional. Alexis personally took charge, and did everything humanly possible to make sure I got everything back. Great service, and a great employee. John Desmond Marriott Silver elite

Reviews.Title: “marriot courtyard isla verde resort”
Reviews.Author: kroert31
Reviews.Content: my stay at the marriot was absolutely awesome. The rooms and facility were spotlessly clean with a very nice friendly and professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations - good value and good location too!”
Reviews.Author: athena97
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the tail end of a business trip, I was there on the weekend and my company wasn't going to cover it so I paid on my own - got an excellent rate. But I had just stayed at the Ritz so I remember feeling like moving to the Marriott was going to be a huge downgrade. Happily, this was not the case. When I checked in, I was greeted by friendly staff and informed that they were providing a complimentary upgrade to a junior suite. It couldn't have been more perfect, as I was staying with a friend/coworker and the setup allowed us to each have our own private space. We were also given free matchplay coupons and some other freebie which I can't remember (maybe a free cocktail? not sure). Our room was clean, spacious, and comfortable, with an excellent ocean view. We had a (full size!) refrigerator, microwave and a quasi-kitchen area with a counter. It was more of a small apartment than a hotel room. The bed was extremely comfortable and my colleague was comfortable on the pull out couch.The only drawback I can think of to the room was that the bathroom didn't have alot of counter space - but it was still more space than the counter in the bathroom at the $700 per night Plaza Hotel in NYC! So I'm not complaining. The beach was gorgeous, clean, not too crowded, and the staff was very helpful in getting you towels, drinks, etc. There is live music/dancing on Saturday nights, and it was really nice! There were locals of all ages dancing, it was a ton of fun. The casino was also lively and the game attendants were friendly. Doesn't hurt that I won some cash too. The only true area of improvement would be with the food options. We came down a little late for dinner and they were offering nothing but buffet in the restaurant. The options didn't look appealing and my colleague is a vegetarian and it was pretty slim pickings for her. The outdoor restaurant was closed a little early. We didn't want to eat in the bar area because it was so loud and crowded (the live music had already started) but we gave it a try. The food at the bar was quite good and the drinks were excellent! The next morning, the breakfast buffet was decent - not the best, not the worst. The waffles were excellent and made fresh. To me, this hotel is the perfect balance between value and amenities. You get beachfront property (Isla Verde is arguably the best beach area in San Juan), a casino, a fitness center, laundromat and a nice bar. There is no spa or salon, but you can take a short walk to the Ritz if you want to get a massage. Really pleased with the experience and I plan to return in the future!

Reviews.Title: “We really liked this hotel much more than we thought we would”
Reviews.Author: AnneinNewton
Reviews.Content: Our room faced the beach and we were very happy with the view from the 5th floor there. I would stay there again in a heartbeat- especially if I can have a room facing the sea again! The beach was beautiful and we had a great walk there going from from one end to the other (which took about an hour altogether). They also have nice hammocks to lie in around the property, and free lounge chairs and umbrellas too, by the ocean. Everything was very clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful.We were really very impressed with the high quality of the place. it was much nicer than other courtyards we have stayed in in the past. The hotel is very near the airport so there is some noise from the planes -we were aware of this during the day when we were at the pool. We did not notice it at night- and we slept with our balcony door open as I don't like airconditioning! I loved the salsa band that okayed at night, and the steel drum band that played at the pool during the day that we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Good value with good service and great beach.”
Reviews.Author: MinCam
Reviews.Content: The staff was great. Everyone was super friendly and helpful. The beach and pool area were great, not crowded and very clean. The few negatives are that there is no real lounge area in the lobby. You can only sit at a table near the bar or at the restaurant. It is a bit of a walk or a cab ride to go to shops or any other restaurant. Be prepared to hear all flights from the airport. But do not hesitate to stay here if Isla Verde is the location you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “nice place on the beach”
Reviews.Author: samas
Reviews.Content: very close to the airport and on the beach several good bars and places to eat with in walkoing distance

Reviews.Title: “We aren't coming back...”
Reviews.Author: Ally S
Reviews.Content: This is probably the cheapest hotel on the beach you could find in San Juan area and there is a reason for that: 1. Location is terrible. Next to the airport, we could hear planes taking off and landing - powerful noise of engines and a strong odor of fuel fumes lingering for a while afterwards whether you are on the beach, pool or balcony were very annoying. Money saved on accommodation we spent on transportation to and from the Old San Juan - taxi fare was $21 one way, car rental for one day with a child safety seat came up around $55. It wouldn't be so bad if it wasn't for the precious time wasted on formalities (took us 1 hour to get and 30 min to return the car), traffic (awful during the day), finding our way around (use your GPS), and creepy taxi drivers (beware of unlicensed taxi cabs when getting one anywhere other then your hotel, especially at night). 2. Service. We didn't use much service in the hotel. Bell boys were fast, polite and helpful. Cleaning lady made face when I asked her for an extra tea bag. Service at Banana Cafe was very slow. 3. Room. We had a room on the eastern side of the building on the 6th floor. We paid $25 extra for upgrading to the ocean and pool view room as opposed to the western side where you have view of hotels. Not only it was just partial ocean view but the balcony was facing the roof of the hotel's casino and restaurants with many AC units on it working non-stop and producing a lot of noise (on top of the airport noise). Needless to say, we couldn't use our balcony for that reason and even double doors could not prevent the noise from getting into the room. On top of that the receptionist didn't tell us that the room was handicap accessible which was quite inconvenient. The room itself was in a decent condition though the dresser was broken, and was long, narrow, and somewhat dark. The AC unit in the room is very (and I mean VERY) loud. Night rest was not peaceful. Our valuables were safe in the safe deposit box. 4. Pool area is very pleasant. 2 hot tubs. Kid's pool with a slide. The beach was dirty early in the morning - plastic cups, straws, pieces of lime, and some smelly sea grass. 5. Overall. If you are to stay in San Juan for one night and need to get to and from the airport quickly this might be a place of your choice. Other then that it's worth to spend a little more money on a better hotel close to old town, farther from the airport, with better rooms, especially for a family.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Front & Affordable”
Reviews.Author: Hex M
Reviews.Content: I like the hotel. Almost all rooms have views of the beach. They have a nice salsa band on the weekends. Very good dancers of the area come to show their stuff. Nice staff and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: restomor06
Reviews.Content: I'm a local from the Westside of the Island. I stayed with family at the Marriott, Isla Verde on Jan 6-8-2012. Good place to stay, nice pool, on the beach, casino, live latin music at night, friendly staff. Waves are a bit high during winter season but okay to wet your feet and take some sun. Rooms are clean and comfortable and have partial view to the beach, still needs some update. Good place to be with family. Very close to everything; Old San Juan, Condado Plaza, shopping stores and other tourist attractions, 1-hr from our famous rain forest "El Yunque". Could be noisy for some guests because it is very close to the airport, I don't mind. Cannot complain, everything was good.

Reviews.Title: “Destination Wedding 12/29/11”
Reviews.Author: Michelle P
Reviews.Content: We chose the Courtyard Marriott Isla Verde in Puerto Rico as our location to have our destination wedding because of their location on the beach, pricing for our group and knowing we could count on the 'Marriott' accommodations. Little did I know that we would also be blessed with a wonderful staff from check-in, to the casino, to restaurant management and staff, to the pool attendants, to check out! Everyone was absolutely wonderful! And we sincerely thank them so very much for setting up our perfect wedding. Everything was beautiful and even better than I had envisioned it. The food was incredible, the staff was very quick and we barely saw them as they swept away our plates and broke down the tables, etc. The bartender was very nice as well.
