I can't tell you how happy I was with everything and how many compliments I received on everything. Michelle Cotto, you must have been the orchestrator of this and I truly appreciate it all. Thank you to Frances for keeping up with the madness of the group reservations - there were quite a few different schedules that needed to be worked out but you kept it all organized very well. And thanks to you both for the special deliveries to the room for us! That just added to the special feeling you gave us! It was great working with everyone and it made a lasting impression. I have no hesitation of visiting the Courtyard in the future - I know I can depend on it being a great experience. I will recommend you to everyone I know that is thinking of either a destination wedding or just somewhere to stay during their trip to San Juan! One note - just use bug spray if you're on the beach after sunset! Those no see-ums are nasty! The lobby has some spray for you and I used Skin So Soft on my legs under my wedding dress and I was fine that night. :)

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer D
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Marriott Courtyard on our last day of a week long trip around Puerto Rico/Vieques. We selected the hotel based on two things (1) price and (2) the limited amount of time we would be spending there. On the plus side, we asked for and received a room on a high floor with a balcony and ocean view. The front desk staff was pleasant and the breakfast was decent and a real bargain! We also liked the access to the beach. Other than that, the hotel needs a complete facelift from lobby to restaurant to the rooms. Everything was clean and well kept but if we'd stayed there any longer, the old fashioned and uninspired decor and furnishings would have left me feeling rather depressed. Seems like Marriott is missing out on a big opportunity to update an ideally located beachfront property.

Reviews.Title: “sand fleas!?!?”
Reviews.Author: Alessandro S
Reviews.Content: Just spend 6 days at this hotel: 1-food is below standards in the industry at any of the facilities and very expensive 2-drinks are watered down and expensive 3-facilities needs updating 4-staff is very relaxed and their priority is not the customer 5- VERY IMPORTANT... FLEAS ON THE BEACH AND MOSQUITOS.... MAKE SURE THAT YOU SANITIZE EVERYTHING YOU USE BECAUSE IF YOU SPEND TIME ON THE BEACH YOU WILL NEED MASSIVE AMOUNTS OF ANY FLEA/MOSQUITO REPELLENT SPRAY. ONCE THE FLEAS ARE IN YOUR CLOTHES IT WILL TAKE A LOT TO GET OF 6- NO SHUTTLE!!! you have to walk to everywhere to get a decent bite or you will have to pay a taxi....very expensive as well.

Reviews.Title: “Dont take tour or drink in the lounge”
Reviews.Author: capecodsailor
Reviews.Content: NIce resort however, drinks are very prices in hotel. Pool bar closed at 5 pm !!Walk just down the street and drink for half the price in local bars. DONT take the "new/Old" San Juan Tour! WASTE OF MONEY!! Take Taxi to old san juan and pick up the audio tour with Master card 2 for 1. Go early its a 4 hour walking tour of old san juan. THIS IS A NO SMOKING HOTEL ony smoke on beach

Reviews.Title: “Good outweighs any negatives”
Reviews.Author: Carol_Flynn-Rice
Reviews.Content: We went to the Marriott Courtyard during Christmas week, arriving very late on Christmas night. The hotel staff was so nice. We had 3 rooms total for my family and we were so grateful that the hotel upgraded our room to a Junior Suite. We bought the rooms on Priceline and got a great price, so this was an unexpected treat. The hotel is nice, the pool is just ok. The restaurant food was good for breakfast, but lunch service was a little slow. We took the local bus often to Old San Juan without any problem. The bus only costs $0.50 and is a great bargain. Also taxis to the beach and local restaurants were anywere between 10 and 18 dollars, so not a big problem. The taxis are big vans in the tourist areas, so they were able to accomodate our 6 person group without any problem. Overall we had a blast and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good outweighs the bad”
Reviews.Author: amballensky
Reviews.Content: The Marriott at Isla Verde is a good property which does a lot of things right, but also has a few issues to consider. First of all, the service I had was exemplary. Every person I dealt with was friendly, efficient, and helpful, not an attitude in sight. As for the value, I give it a four, with a few caveats. If you are paying their listed price, I would give the place a 3 in value, but if you can get a discount like we did where the price was under $100 a night, it was well worth it. You have to keep in mind however, that there is a $15-$20 a night parking fee and another daily resort fee, which I believe was $15 a day. As far as the hotel amenities, there are several places to eat, but I cannot attest to their quality as we ate at local places every night. If you are into convenience and don't mind standard fare, it is probably a bonus. There is also a pool, casino and gym if those are important to you. The location is also a mixed bag. It is nice in that it is literally right on the beach, it is bad because there are sand fleas and it is so close to the airport that you will hear planes all day. Additionally, located in Carolina, it is at the end of the tourist section of Isla Verde, so it will be a moderate walk to get anywhere of interest close, and cab costs will add up for anything farther out like San Juan. I would highly recommend renting a car if you plan on sight seeing at all. As for the rooms, they were decently spacious, the decor was nice, though starting to show signs of wear. It was all in all, nicely apportioned, but not luxurious by any stretch. To sum up, if you can get a deal, it's definitely worth the quality on a budget, but if you're looking for something really nice and you have a little more money, there are nicer places to be had in more convenient locations.

Reviews.Title: “The Marriott is Isla Verde is a great value”
Reviews.Author: Pattihoney
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is located at the far end of a lovely beach. The public areas of the property are very updated, and really nice. The staff were very friendly and efficient. The room was a little outdated, carpet was somewhat shabby, threshold between bath and room was loose, curtains looked beat up. Maybe guestrooms are next on the list for re-do, and they may not all be in the same shape as ours was. We would definitely go back, as the property is in a great local for access to restaraunts and other hotels. The waves in Puerto Rico are pretty big during the winter months, so swimming was a little bit of a challenge, but the pool area was great and right next to the beach. The noise of airplanes at the nearby airport was not invasive at all.

Reviews.Title: “SAND FLEAS, BLAND FOOD!!!”
Reviews.Author: DDChicago
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD- The hotel itself is in a great location, less than a mile from the airport and about a 10 minute cab ride to San Juan. The hotel is right on the ocean and it is beautiful. THE BAD - The food at all 3 restaurants here is bland and expensive, but the service is fantastic. We ended up becoming friends with a few of the waiters, they were all so friendly and nice. But, I have never had such bland food in my life, and I have traveled to many, many resorts, including several all-inclusives. The breakfast buffet sucks, I can best describe it as hospital food. Actually, hospital food might be better. Now, the best part-- SAND FLEAS!!!!!!! Be aware, you don't know when they bite and they come out early in the morning/late night. OFF does not work, even though they offer it complimentary at the front desk. Make sure to bring a spray that works on fleas!!! Overall, the hotel is ok for the price, just bring your flea spray and hit up some other places in the area to eat.

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous beach!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NewtownSquareBaldies
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter, wife and I spent the week ending 12/31 at this hotel. The beach is managed by a wonderful man named Reuben. He and his staff are so friendly, courteous, and attentive that it's impossible to describe. Joanie, at the beach desk, when told of my wife's birthday had a cake prepared and the staff sang to us at our lounge chairs. Very memorable moment. My daughter had her first surfing lesson from Johnny and it was great. Also helpful were Rey, Felipe, Valarie, and Marcus. Drinks & lunch on the beach were delicious and fairly priced. We are planning to return to this hotel next year and REALLY hope that Reuben and his crew are still on the job.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Price, Great Beach and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Fed M
Reviews.Content: Nothing but good things to say about this hotel. Staff was so friendly and helpful. Nice property with swim up bar one big pool and two smaller ones plus a hot tub. Casino is small but has all you need. Sales on weekends at the main bar. Beach was very clean. Now..if you are young and looking to party, this hotel doesn't have a "party" atmosphere. Its more family oriented. So if you are in your mid 20s (like us) you should stay here but then visit the El San Juan Resort and the Intercontinental hotel.for more parrying and stores. They're within walking distance so no problem. But don't waste your $ staying there. 101 sports bar n grill is a nice dive bar if you want affordable drinks. Old San Juan is a must. You do hear the planes take off but its not too bad, I kind of enjoyed watching planes take off from the beach. Only bad thing to say is housekeeping staff was kind of loud which can be a problem if you're trying to sleep in :) But I would stay here everytime I go back to PR and I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: BostonMama50
Reviews.Content: Just got back last night from a great stay at the Courtyard. The beach is beautiful, and the staff was very warm and welcoming. My husband and 2 teen daughters also loved the stay here. The ideal beach weather also helped:) We visited the other big name hotels in Isle Verde, and we all agreed we picked the right place. Have stayed before at the Marriott in Condado, and the beach is soooo much nicer here. We had a nice visit at the pool with a huge friendly iguana! Can't wait to go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Fraudulent Billing”
Reviews.Author: babettetravels
Reviews.Content: We presented ourselves at the front desk just after 4:00p to check into our one-bedroom suite (over $500 per night) only to be told quite matter-of-factly, and unapologetically by Christina Alvarez (yes, shockingly, she handed me her card with pride) that the suite was not yet ready. Christina calmly handed us a restaurant pager and motioned the four of us and our eight bags to the luxury-bereft lobby and told us we could expect to wait three to four hours for our suite to be cleaned. Incredulous, we asked if we could downgrade or upgrade so that we could settle in, but, apparently, no other rooms in the hotel were available. I pointed out that the reservation confirmation I received stated that check in-time was listed as 3:00p, and that there was no mention that check-in might be delayed. We were told, again quite calmly, that the previous occupant had selected a late-check-out which meant that we were to have a late check-in. Christina confirmed that Marriott received a late check-out fee from the previous occupant of the suite. I pointed out that this was more than a little fraudulent on the part of Marriott â€“ the hotel receives a late fee, and then prevents the new occupant from enjoying the suite. With check in time of 3:00p and check out time at noon, we are already paying over $500 for 21 hours. Delaying our enjoyment of the room for four hours meant that we were expected to pay over $500 for 17 hours of room use. Christina tried bravely to follow this logic but failed miserably and fell back on what I assume was a stock answer: â€œEvery hotel does it this way.â€� Dear Marriott, no other hotel has ever done this to me. After one hour of wrangling at the front desk, our suite, Christina announced, was actually ready. Clever strategy, I must admit. Nevertheless, relieved, we trundled up to our one-bedroom corner suite, only to find one large room with two queen beds and a gloomy â€œkitchenâ€� counter with a sad little microwave and anemic refrigerator. The carpet was new, and it was on the corner, we will give it that. The bell-hop was very helpful too. He held the door open while we unloaded our bags. Then he held his hand out for a tip. The resort itself feels cheap and very short on luxury or opulence. The towel desk closed at 6:00p, essentially closing the beach down and precluding quiet enjoyment of the lingering Caribbean sun. We found all staff seemed to share an undercurrent of resentment. Our only moment of joy, if it can be called that, was the incredibly swift response of the maintenance department when we called to complain about a clogged shower drain. The gentleman who came to deal with our problem appeared less than five minutes after our call, was polite, focused, solved the problem immediately, and even brought us new towels and soap. Other than the maintenance department, we have nothing to recommend about this resort. This is the place to go only if you want to pay $500 to be treated as if you are waiting for a table at an over-crowded chain restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely Christmas trip!”
Reviews.Author: JanieD
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I flew here on Christmas Day for a warm getaway. It was great! The hotel is close to the airport so we were off the plane and on the beach within a half hour. Yes you do hear planes landing and taking off, but it was not a problem (and the people at the Ritz Carlton do too, but at a much higher rate!). The Courtyard is the last property on this lovely stretch of beach--really the prime location with a pretty view from the even-numbered rooms. They charge a resort fee on top of the rate --you get everything included: beach chairs and towels, internet. . . I prefer this to the charge for every little thing. And there were nice touches at check-in: two coupons for a complimentary rum drink and two $5 coupons for match play if you like to gamble. The pool deck (with swim-up bar!) is really nice and the beach is broad with plenty of chairs and great hammocks too. We ate at the two outside restaurants and preferred the ambiance of the Sirena near the pool. One night we walked to the Ritz Carlton for dinner; it was fine but rather boring because the Ritz seems pretty much the same everywhere. Other nights we at at Marmalade in Old San Juan and Pikayo in Condado. Bother were excellent--check my reviews for more details. The staff are very friendly and accommodating and the Christmas tree in the lobby and other decorations were very festive. I am thinking a warm weekend this winter is a good idea and we'll go back to Courtyard Isla Verde.

Reviews.Title: “McCune wedding in December”
Reviews.Author: MMcCune3
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a "destination wedding" without need for a passport, then Puerto Rico should certainly be your first choice. And if you do, then I would highly recomend hosting your event at the Courtyar Marriott, Isla Verde. The venue is extremely reasonably priced, and their packages are amongst the BEST "all inclusive" offers you will ever find - open bar, excellent food, beautiful location. The staff is AMAZING and severely accomodating. They made us feel like we were the royal couple getting married. In terms of aesthetics, the lobby is beautiful and has lots of entertainment. The pool area (where the outdoor weddings take place) is nice, and has a beautiful backdrop of the ocean. The rooms are really nice and spacious as well! In terms of downsides, they dont close the pool for weddings, and the beach is public, so there are often additional uninvited spectators for the weddings - for our event we had quite the crowd gather from both the hotel pool and the beach. This made some of our wedding photos interesting (there was one with a gentleman in the speedo in the background). There is also the challenge of the airport being 5 minutes away from the hotel; however this did not present an inconvinience during the wedding, even though I thought it might. The best thing about this Marriott, and the reason why I would highly recomend it to anyone, is because of the staff. They moved mountains for us! Anything that we requested, they found some way to accomodate - which was excellent since we had about 30 guests coming into Puerto Rico from out of town, and another 60 from around the island. They made our event very special and I guarantee it would not have been as successful without them. Special thank you to Michelle Coto, Frances Rivera, and Moraima (Catering Manager). This venue is also convinient in terms of its accesibility for tourism in the island. It is a 5 minute ride from the airport ($11 cab ride generally), and has access to bus stops near by that can take you to Old San Juan without need to rent a car. It has easy access to the beach - located right behind the hotel - and has some fabulous entertainment right in the hotel (salsa at night, and a fairly large casino). The hotel also rents bikes to guests for traveling the area. Again, if you are planning a wedding in Puerto Rico, seriously consider the Marriott Courtyard Isla Verde. It was the best venue in terms of its packages and staff!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not idyllic”
Reviews.Author: Rubystar888
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott in Isla Verde Dec. 8 - 15, 2011. There are a lot of very good things to say about this hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I called for more toilet paper and it was delivered within the half hour! That's good service. The beach is great! Big with nice sand and very long for walking. The pool area is very pretty. The hotel provides chaise lounges, beach towels and you can get a drink all day at the bar (you can swim to the bar too). I enjoyed the casino and it was open ALL the time. The one cup coffee pot in the room was lousy, but they made up for it by serving FREE coffee in the lobby every morning. We ate at the restaurant one night and had the soup and salad bar for $9.99 - a great deal! The soup was excellent, but the salad was so-so. The bar was large and there is great dancing there Thursday - Sunday with a live band - really neat! The location of the hotel is very good. We caught a city bus within a short walk of the hotel and you can walk to restaurants, bars, fancier hotels (Ritz Carlton and El San Juan are very close!). The hotel is very close to the airport. This is a good location to get to, but it means that you hear (loudly!) planes taking off. This is the worst feature of the hotel. It is not quiet! Also I was on a timeshare and they gave us a room on the 3rd floor - bad! Our balcony looked over a roof of the hotel with all the ac compressors so that was very noisy. We had a view of the ocean, but it was obstructed by the roof with the acs. I suppose someone has to get these "bad" rooms, but I was not happy that it was me! I had read on Travel Advisor to get a room above the 4th floor and they were so right! So, other than the placement of our room and the airplane noise, this hotel is really nice!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Beach Hotel Choice in Isla Verde”
Reviews.Author: upthehudson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights prior to a cruise departing from San Juan. We were satisfied with this decision for a lot of reasons. The staff was wonderful and friendly everywhere we encountered them. The front desk staff was anxious to be helpful, the waitstaff at the restaurants and bar efficient and warm and gracious and even the pool staff cooperative about providing multiple towels for an offsite excursion. Our room was spacious, comfortable and included a refrigerator and balcony. On the downside, the walls were kind of thin and noise from adjacent rooms hard to shut out. Climate control is in need of updating and, while I knew we would be near the airport...I wasn't aware of just how close (refer back to thin wall comment). Our room was described as having partial ocean view and this was accurate. Unfortunately, the other part of our view was diminished by an apartment building next door which, over the years, has been allowed to become something of an eyesore. Back to the good: the pool, hot tub and fitness center were a treat. The restaurants in the lobby offered limited menus, but the food was good. Friday & Saturday night found the lobby lounge bursting with loud Latin music and enthusiastic dancing. And then there's the beach...lovely and every bit the pleasure it should be. A staff member took it upon himself to make sure that we had clean lounges and even brought a second set of clean towels when we returned from the water. As we drove (by taxi) into Isla Verde en route to the Courtyard, we noticed the long, tight cluster of bigger, better regarded hotel brands. Frankly, I preferred the location of this property. It was the final hotel and so the beach felt more private and was definitely uncrowded. If we returned to this part of San Juan, I could see staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “POOR SECURITY”
Reviews.Author: Ileana C
Reviews.Content: At a recent private event, I went to the dancing floor 5 feet away from my table and in a blink of an eye the stole my brand new cellular phone. I immediately ask the banquet crew if any of them had seen the phone but no one care to help me. I went straight to the front desk to file a report and complaint about the POOR SECURITY of the Hotel and they told me they are NOT RESPONSIBLE if I get robbed.. (which makes no sense since it was inside of the Hotel.) So my trip experience was horrible, and my most sincerely advise to future visitors is to be very, very careful and buy a travelers insurance when visiting the Courtyard by Marriott at Isla Verde.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and on the beach”
Reviews.Author: Alicia B
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights here, it was right on the beach. The beach was nice for swiming and it was long stretch so you could take a long walk in either direction. They had a pool, pool bar and a jacuzzi which was nice as well. They had a casino which we didn't use but it was nice if I felt the urge I could go down there. It was a 18 dollar cab ride to Old San Juan. I would definitely take a cab instead of driving in old san juan. Traffic on those one way streets could be horrible. Defiinitely explore the 187 road further east. There are a lot of isolated beaches and is a good break from the craziness of old san juan. Good hotel location, but definitely not in the middle of things, you will have to drive or take a cab to town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - could use an update...”
Reviews.Author: SarahBG
Reviews.Content: We got to this hotel from a discount hotel website. (think it is a bit overrated as a 3.5 stars though). Nice enough for a family stay - has GREAT beds, refrigerator, nice pool and beach, free wifi. Friendly staff, too!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Cape May Court House, New Jersey
Reviews.Title: “Great if only staying in San Juan....”
Reviews.Author: Mazzahs
Reviews.Content: My girfriend & I stayed here one night early this week for night 1 of our week long trek around the island. This was my 6th trip to PR but my girlfriend had never been. I love Isla Verde since it's so close to the airport and I have friends who own at ESJ Towers. I've stayed up and down the strip and this place is phenomenal. I checked reviews on TA and they were spot on. The staff is super friendly and the front desk girl (forget her name) showed us 2 additional rooms above and beyond our reservation that were only an additional $40 $ $60, respectively. We chose the 11th floor Suite which added $60 but gave views of the mtns, airport & beach which was essentially 180 degrees. For $300, (with the brutal additional tourism tax) I feel it was worth the expense due to the location, amenities & beach front location. They give you 2 rum drink vouchers & 2 casino vouchers which we never used, though they're a plus. The front staff girl stated she would send up a maintenance man to address a light/outlet that was bad that she noted while showing us the room, although he never knocked to rectify it (no big deal). The lobby is great and has 3 restaurants (1 is also the bar & 1 is mainly sweets). We never hit the casino so no comments here. (The El San Juan near by is a much better choice if you're looking for luxury and/or a big casino & the Ponce Hilton Golf Club & Casino is the better choice for business if you're looking for a reasonable, large resort & casino, though this is on the south side of PR.) Overall, this is a great hotel that's on the beach next to the airport with awesome amenities including pool, jacuzzi, hammocks, restaurants & a great staff. It's at the far east end of the Isla Verde beaches which is a bonus since your easterly views are unobstructed looking towards Pinones. For business travelers, I would look no further; and for those looking for a close resort/name brand hotel near the SJU airport, this is your place. Good stuff....

Reviews.Title: “Quality Service, Friendly Staff, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: bklynKat
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Courtyard Isla Verde. I found it to be different from the typical Courtyard experience. I'm sure they have business travelers stay there, but I found that it was primarily occupied by tourists. The staff consistently went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and assist with whatever we needed. When we checked in and went to our room, there were several staff members working in the room. One of them (Demitrio) greeted us and took care of calling the desk to have them assign us a new room, then he escorted us to our room, made sure that it was in good condition, and had one of the staff from the desk bring up our new keys. I've certainly had the experience of arriving at a room that was not ready, but Demitrio made sure that we did not have to wait for resolution, or try to resolve the problem ourselves. This was a great indicator of the level of service we experienced throughout our stay. The room was clean, and well maintained. We had new carpet in our room, which you could tell from the smell. Our balcony provided a view of the beach and pool area. The bathroom was the only part of the room that showed a bit of wear, but it was very clean and met our needs. The bed was very comfortable, and I am very picky about beds! I found it to be more comfortable than some of the higher level Marriott branded hotels I've previously visited. The pool and beach area were great. In the pool area, there is towel service, a kiddie-pool, hot tub, regular pool with swim up bar, a walk up bar, and an area where you can have table service for a light meal. The pool area was very clean and well attended. Along with towel service, the staff makes sure that you have enough lounge chairs for everyone in your party, either by the pool or on the beach. Another nice touch! We did not take advantage of the casino during our visit, but it is open 24 hours, and is smoke free. In the evenings, there is live music (I'm not sure if this is just on weekends or every night) in the lounge in the lobby (Picante). We enjoyed the hotel breakfast twice during our stay and found it to be delicious and convenient. A bit pricey-- around $15 per person, whether we ate the full breakfast bar on the weekend or ordered from the menu for a weekday breakfast. The hotel is right by the airport, and you definitely can hear the planes pass overhead. When you're inside the room, the sound is muffled, but is still audible, so very noise sensitive people might have a problem. One important thing to note about the plane sound is that it is primarily only during "normal" flight times, so it generally does not go on all night. In the Isla Verde area, not far from the hotel, a few minutes by car, and maybe 15 minutes by foot, you can find a huge selection of chain restaurants including fast food and fast casual, as well as other casinos within hotels, and some more authentic restaurants and bars. There is also a grocery store and Walgreens nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: CYLau
Reviews.Content: Rooms are comfortable and clean. It was very helpful to have a complimentary business center. The facilities and beach are convenient. Price was quite reasonable compared to other places we've stayed in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and large rooms”
Reviews.Author: D0nLucifer
Reviews.Content: I travel to San Juan a lot for business and have stayed in many hotels here. This hotel is one of my favourites. The rooms are very big, wifi connection is great, great food and a casino to keep you amused in the evening. Would definitely recommend this hotel for both business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are fine but watch out for extra charges for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: whw_11
Reviews.Content: Our room rate included continental breakfast. The breakfast buffet, however, included both continental and non-contingental food, with no signage as to which foods are non-continental. Be extra careful when the waiter brings the bill and make sure you check the amount due before signing. They will automatically charge regular buffet (instead of continental) for everyone at the table even if only one person had regular buffet and everyone else had continental. The rooms are fine and the location of the hotel is good.

Reviews.Title: “Hit or miss”
Reviews.Author: Cavaliere1
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice now. Once was a 5 star and once was a 3 star. Both times I was in an ocean front room. The first time I was on the north side of the hotel and LOVED it. Balcony was awesome, view was amazing, I fell asleep to the sound of the waves. Second time my room was facing north east. I hated it. The shape of the room meant you couldn't see the ocean unless you were standing on the balcony. The roof a/c unit was deafeningly loud. Door closed and tv on and we could still hear it loudly. Plus the balcony was wet with a steady stream of water from the floors above. It wasn't even raining. The house band was good and we enjoyed the dancing at night. The pool is small and filled with children most of the time. I wish with a swim up bar they would close off that side to kids since the pool is divided already. Pool bar was fun but had very limited hours. Beach is easily accessible and quite nice. I was thankful for the lounge chairs and umbrella set up by the attendant. Loud planes overhead which is annoying, but that close to the airport it's expected. Parking is . . . I think $25/day. That stinks. Concierge was a joke and I had to wait for her to stop her phone conversation (about 5 min) with her mother. Even then, she was less than helpful. Desk attendant was really nice and very helpful. Wish I had gotten names. I would probably recommend this hotel to a friend in a pinch or if they were able to select their room carefully. There are better options in the area though.

Reviews.Title: “True Piece of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Julianne W
Reviews.Content: Stayed from Thursday to Tuesday and the whole trip was fantastic! Checked in without any problems and went up to our partial ocean view room (700), which was clean and smelled nice. The view was iffy... we were mostly looking at the top of the casino roof (complete with loud vents), and could see a corner of the pool. But I did request a corner room, so maybe it was my fault that that's what we looked over. The beach was great, staff was extremely attentive to get you chairs, tables, and flags for drinks. I always tipped them. The sand wasn't even hot! The sun is great until about 3:30 when it dips behind the hotel. We went in the pool once and it felt great, and it's open 24 hours which is a plus! Live salsa music most every day both inside and out. I think a lot of locals come to our hotel to dance, some of them were really good. Casino was meh... Kind of small, not too much excitement. We played blackjack there several nights. They have three restaurants in the hotel, all of which are a tad overpriced but decent for a 2am meal. That was the only drawback to this hotel- because it's the last one in the string of Isla Verde hotels there isn't anything within walking distance. When we took a cab a few minutes West, all of the hotels had local flavor right across the street. Our last two mornings we were woken by hammering, I guess they were putting new carpet in the floor directly above us (at 9am), which was rather irritating. I have a feeling this doesn't happen too often, so it was probably just a fluke. Overall, the hotel was clean, the staff super nice, the beach beautiful, and the drinks strong- GOOD TRIP!

Reviews.Title: “WHAT AN EXPERIENCE!”
Reviews.Author: GRAMPS99
Reviews.Content: My wife and i have just returned from spending 4 glorious days and 3 nights on Isla Verde at the Courtyard by Marriott. Jose Padin, the General Manager, went out of his way to make sure our stay was perfect. He upgraded us to a suite with full ocean view. This suite was huge. He provided a friut plate and water upon our arrival, which was much appreciated. the views from our balcony was spectacular. All of the amenities were first class. Mr. Padin has shown what a true dedicated person will do to make his guests feel at home. For this we thank you, Mr. Padin The thing that sets this hotel apart from any other I have ever stayed at is the help staff. From the moment we arrived, everyone made us feel welcome. From the valets, to the taxi drivers, to the front desk people, all were gracious and kind. i want to focus in particular on the waiters and waitresses at the 4 in house restaurants. Never in my life have I been treated with such respect and kindness. I took the time after my last breakfast in the Salsa restaurant to personally thank all of the waiters for their professionalism and kindness. They are truly top notch and know how to treat their customers. The beach was great, the pools inviting, and it was overall one of the best experiences I have had in my 62 years of life. If you want to be pampered and treated like a king, then the Courtyard Isla Verde is the only choice in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional beach property”
Reviews.Author: captainbobCt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for a pre cruise stay. We stayed in an ocean front suite that was exceptional. We could sit on the balcony and watch the surfers ride the waves. Pool area has a great snack bar with burgers to die for. Fantastic clean and safe beach. This has got to be one of the best beach resorts in SJU. A great value too!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, and I mean amazing, value”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl B
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel with extremely low expectations. I stayed here on business, visiting a company that has a location in Carolina, PR, not realizing that Carolina is the center of the "Isla Verde" resort area, and I had a much bigger selection of hotels. Touching down from the airplane, I saw the pink building in which I would be staying and immediately started dreading the trip. Upon arriving, I realized that this was not the typical Marriott Courtyard to which I am accustomed. It has a much less business traveler feel, with the casino, restaurants, and lobby bar. I spent the first morning there preparing for the next day's meeting, but used the afternoon to explore and enjoy the beach/pool/pool bar. The hotel is located on the same beach strip as all of the other resort hotels (El San Juan, El Conquistador, etc.), so the beach is exactly the same as these luxury resorts. Service - both beach service and at the pool - was great, I can't say it's the same over-the-top service that you receive at a truly luxury resort, but it was fantastic for a business trip. The rooms are exactly the same as at every Marriott Courtyard. Marble vanities in the bathrooms (whoever said it was fake is mistaken), flat screen tvs and mostly updated furnishings are in the room. The casino is much smaller than at many other resorts (and obviously Vegas casinos), but it served its purpose if you had any interest in playing table games or slots. I went to both of the restaurants during the course of my trip and they weren't great (full disclosure - I'm from NYC), so I would recommend visiting some of the more authentic restaurants along the main avenue, or - if you have a car - the restaurants in Old San Juan (although I was here during Mother's Day and the place was FULL of locals, with a 2+ hr wait, so some people must find the food good). I have also stayed at the El San Juan years ago, and while that is obviously a much higher-end resort, I found the Marriott to appear newer, with the beach and pool to be comparable. If you are looking for a truly luxurious experience, the Isla Verde Courtyard is not the place, but the value for your money is astounding, and I can see it being really quite nice for a family trip.

Reviews.Title: “Veteran's Day in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Allycat2011
Reviews.Content: Wonderful service. The staff was accomodating and friendly. They really wanted you to enjoy your stay. The hotel had live music on Friday and Saturday nights that played Salsa, so we had a lot of fun. The ocean is beautiful. There are a lot of restaurants in the area or you can take a cab to the Condado area or Old San Juan. Check out the El San Juan Hotel a few buildings down, it is beautiful with a huge casino and they have an awesome nightclub that really comes alive on weekends ... lot of energy! Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing great except price”
Reviews.Author: kim c
Reviews.Content: Pretty much the best price in Isla Verde...but you get what you pay for! First room had 2 queen beds with collapsed mattresses as well as a broken refrigerator (think more of 'cooler'). The manager of household was extremely receptive to our complaints and we were relocated to a nice room with good bed/mini refrigerator. You pay for parking and the casino is disappointing. The staff is the standout here and were very friendly and helpful. Service animal friendly. The hotel is located right on the beach and just about on top of the airport though the rooms were quiet.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about expectations”
Reviews.Author: Irvine-Robbie
Reviews.Content: My flight was late for a connection out of Antigua and I was unable to make my connection. The airline gave me a voucher to stay at this hotel and I expected to be staying in a dump. I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is not your typical Courtyard. It has a few restaurants and even has room service (I did not use room service, I only saw the menu). I ate in the Picante restaurant and thought it was decent but not great. I am sure that I was given one of the least desirable rooms (location) because I was paying with an airline voucher. I was on the second floor with a view of the lobby/restaurant roofs. I would highly recommend getting a high floor, if you stay here. The hotel is on a busy street. The rooms are closer to those you would find in a older Marriott (not courtyard). They were clean, had free internet, and a flat screen TV. I think the standards are a little lower for the courtyard brand as far as the bathroom goes. It was a little dated, but not bad. It had that fake marble counter and an older faucet. Other than that the room was up to date. It is on the beach and has a pool. I did not use either. I was tired from my airport activities. The feel of the lobby is really interesting. Some people are in nice dress outfits and others are in sloppy beach attire. There are also a lot of locals who were in the lobby bar. This may have been because the band that was playing in the Picante bar/ lounge. I overheard a couple next to me saying that they were here to go on a cruise. I asked if many people come here the night before or after their cruise and she said that many come a few days before or stay a few days after. Honestly, for a few days "vacation", I don't think this hotel would be my choice. A few days on business would be fine though. I would even stay here overnight before or after taking a cruise. One comment on the casino. I am from LA so I've been to Vegas casinos, and this thing is tiny compared to what I expected. If you want a distraction, it may do the trick but don't expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very nice service”
Reviews.Author: Angelr_mh
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel 100%. Good hospitality, beatifull beach and pool. Good to have a casino!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in Isla Verde, very close to the airport, very noisy”
Reviews.Author: hobiecatsailor
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at this hotel and for me it was just average. My room was sufficient and had a small balcony that had a gorgeous view looking east down Isla Verde Beach. Upon arrival, I used the valet parking service. My check in was flawless and the front desk associate was very friendly. I was given two coupons for a free drink at the bar and some casino coupons. I used Marriott reward points for this stay and had requested a non smoking, high floor room with a king bed. All of my requests were honored. The hotel rooms need some updating, but for the most part my room was clean. My complaint with the hotel is that I was unable to get hot water for my showers. I could never get any water that was warm enough for my comfort and I was actually cold taking a shower. Another area that needs improvement are the pillows. The pillows in my room were the worst I have ever had in a hotel room. They were very low quality and uncomfortable. A refrigerator in the room was supplied with 2 bottles of water and there was coffee and tea in the room which was nice. The balcony had a fabulous view of the beach and ocean and a small table and chairs to sit outside. The drawback to the balcony is that there is a large vent that blows out hot air directly at the table and chairs. Shortly after check in I made my way down to the pool area and beach. There were lots of people of all ages and lots of families with children. I did not care for the pool area in person, they make it look much nicer in the hotel photos. Also, if you are someone who likes sun, the pool is very shaded in the afternoon. The beach is huge and you can take a long walk up and down the beach if you want to. The sand quality is average and hard for me to be excited about after vacationing in the Virgin Islands. There is no comparing a Puerto Rican beach to those in the USVI - they just don't measure up. The water clarity is not good. The location of this hotel is extremely noisy and for me would not be my idea of a relaxiing vacation. All you hear constantly all day long and into the night is the roar of jets taking off and landing at the airport less than a mile away. In addition, the hotel lobby bar plays loud, obnoixious Salsa music for hours on end. It is so loud that practically had to yell out what I wanted to drink from the bartender and he still could barely hear me. Don't get me wrong, I love Latin music and think it adds to the ambiance, but seriously this hotel just plays it too loud to be enjoyable. In general I do not like the Isla Verde strip area. It is dirty, crowded, and loud.

Reviews.Title: “Love to come back...!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wislie
Reviews.Content: To begin, I called to report that I was doing a "Late Check In". The employee immediately asked my name and located my reservation and informed me that there was no problem to arrive late. When we arrived at the desk, Jaen greeted us with a great welcome. When we got to the room we had problems with the keys, but as soon as my boyfriend went to front desk, Jaen told him that immediately someone would help us. While I waited for my boyfriend to comeback an employee (I think from housekeeping) Evelyn and asked me if I needed help and opened the door quickly and explained me how it works. She was very nice. The next day at breakfast we were attended by Jay, he is very helpful the waiter, besides very attentive. We cannot wait to return. The place is beautiful but the service gives a special touch. Thank you! The only dislike: we went for a walk at the beach, and when we came back, a pool attended stop us and ask us if we where guest because we werenâ€™t identified which we didnâ€™t know. But itâ€™s ok, itâ€™s good that the employees are watching who comes in the hotel for security.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the”
Reviews.Author: Lucy V
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our first time to Puerto Rico. We stayed in an ocean terrace room, and had a partial view of the ocean and beach. This hotel was not super luxurious, but for the price it was a great value and had everything we needed. The room was clean and came with a fridge, dvd player, great flatscreen with all US cable channels, a coffee maker and he whole hotel also has free wifi, no passwords or login needed- what else do you need? The bed was super comfortable and everyone who worked there was really nice and friendly. The decor of the hotel wasn't stunning, but they seemed to be doing a lot of renovation while we were there, so maybe the hotel will be even nicer in the future. The grounds were lovely- huge pool and gorgeous beach. The guys on the beach were great and set up our chairs and umbrellas cheerfully and promptly. It was super quiet when we were there- the hotel didnâ€™t really get busy until Friday and Saturday nights. It seemed like a lot of locals came to the hotel for the live salsa band. There were definitely a few families at this hotel which Iâ€™m not a fan of, but the kids seemed mostly confined to the pool area. We didnâ€™t try any of the restaurants, but we did have ice cream (mmmm Ben and Jerryâ€™s chunky monkey!!) and lattes at Bananas and they were great. We didnâ€™t find Puerto Rico cheap- prices were very similar to NYC. A few tips: -there are plenty of Walgreens and supermarkets outside the hotel on the main strip. We would buy our own beer and bring it down to the beach in an ice bucket. It seemed like quite a few people did this. It was also nice to have beers out on the terrace. -the bus to old san juan is efficient enough (bring quarters). It takes about twice as long, but saves a lot when you keep going in and out. Stops in front of Dennyâ€™s. Only downside- service ends at 9PM. -the excursions cost a lot for what they are. We rented a car to get to El Yunque one day and it was the best decision! Super easy to get to and it was nice to spend the day there on our own time. A car was $33 for 24 hours- about half of what the tour cost for one person. With the car we were also able to drive to Los Pinones- a less touristy area past Isla Verde. We got food and beers on the side of the road and there was a lovely beach there. It was definitely a cool experience to see a different side of PR. We also used the car to drive into Old San Juan- parking in a garage was $3 after 6PM. -for the days you donâ€™t want to travel to Old San Juan there are some places within walking distance of the hotel. Metropol was a nice PR restaurant with typical (Iâ€™m not an expert though) PR food. 101 sports bar (right next to the ritz) was awesome! Very American bar, but beers were cheap, wings were good and they had a jukebox=) My boyfriend was able to watch football there one Sunday and was very happy. Also- although itâ€™s a little further, try Espana. Amazing sandwiches and soup and TONS of pastries (yummy tres leches cake, something Iâ€™d never had beforeâ€¦ the options were endless there!!). Really local spot, we went there twice for lunch. Brush up on your basic Espanol though! All in all the Courtyard Marriott was a great hotel for a great price. You get the best of both worlds- an amazing beach if thatâ€™s all you want to do, but youâ€™re also close enough to many of the other activities PR has to offer. We visited the other hotels in the area (Ritz, El San Juan) and they were gorgeous but they seemed really stuffy. Marriott is definitely more down to earth and easygoing. Again, itâ€™s not super luxurious or a resort you could spend 24/7 at â€“ but why would you want to in PR?! Go to a different Caribbean island for that =)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: binsu16
Reviews.Content: We were able to check in early and were greeted with a welcome drink. The room view was fantastic and it was a good value. The beach was great and the pool bar was perfect. The food left a little to be desired but overall a great visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great long weekend”
Reviews.Author: Beachgirl24
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel for a long weekend. While the hallway to our room needed some updating, it was clean, just a bit worn. I think the best thing about this hotel is the employees. Everyone we met was very positive and helpful. Terry the bartender is exceptional and I apologize, we had a server at breakfast who was very accomodating to me. I wanted just a grapefruit and coffee and he was able to get a grapefruit from the kitchen and charged me a very reasonable and fair price. BTW the grapefruit was not available on the menu, but I asked and they were able to accomodate me. So nice! We also ate at the outside restaurant for dinner. It was also very nice and the server out there (can't remember her name either) she was very helpful and nice. I have invisalign braces and I forgot my container so I put them inside a napkin while I was eating. Of course I forgot them when I left and it was a while before I remembered. When I returned I learned she had found them and set them aside for my return. She also cautioned me to clean them before I put them back in, which of course I was going to do, but it was a thoughtful gesture. I have more examples of the great employees, but hopefully you get the picture. Another thing about this hotel is it is a hot spot for locals to dance on the weekends. The lobby is full of energy on weekend evenings and so if you like to dance the salsa or to watch others dancing the salsa (some we swear are professionals or should be), this is the place for you. Just sit at the lobby bar and enjoy. We stayed at the Ritz in February and while that hotel is much nicer (it's the Ritz people), this hotel is very nice and the service is, in my opinion on par with the Ritz. As far as an affordable hotels go, Marriott Courtyard in Isla Verde is the best. Two restaurants I would highly recommend (and it's a short walk to both): Metropol, which has Puerto Rican and Cuban food is excellent. We have eaten there twice and both times the food was wonderful. Lot's of locals eat there. Don't miss this one. The other restaurant is a little further down the road from Metropol but on the same side of the street as the hotel. It's called Don Jose and looks to be a cheap cafe kinda place. It advertises American breakfast, so we looked at it one night and decided against it (don't want to eat American food when we are in another country, we want to eat their food). Anyway a friend who is from there took my husband and another friend back the following day for lunch and they could not stop raving about the soup. And these are not soup kinda guys. The next day we flew out so I have not had my chance to try the soup, but based on their response I feel very comfortable recommending it. We also went to Guavate (a town about 30 minutes outside San Juan) for lunch. If you like pork and are a bit of an adventurous eater, this is the place for you. They have a street called "Pork Alley" and it has many lechoneras (roadside cafes (lechon is roast pork). They roast the whole pig, so if you don't like to see where your meal comes from this is not the place for you. However, you will not find a better place for roast pork anywhere. Just know, this is not a place a lot of tourists go, so you may need a translator. And even though a lot of tourists don't go there, I always felt safe, it's not a scary place at all and would feel very comfortable bringing my young son along. The other upside is that you will get a great meal for cheap. It's an experience if you want to see some of the real Puerto Rico. We toured Old San Juan on one day it was interesting and nice. I think enough others have reviewed that I won't spend time repeating their reviews. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for San Juan-Carolina, Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: MyZenworks
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard by Marriott is an excellent choice for easy access to the area. Staff is always helpful. The hotel is an older hotel with some updates. The Pool more than makes up for the some nuisances like Airport noise. More importantly, the beach front property makes you suspend all reality and expectations, if any. Absolutely beautiful beach (public beach with semi-private service from the Marriott. Live Salsa music in the Lobby bar which you get a free coupon at check-in for a Rum-based drink since you are in Rum territory. The balcony views are fantastic, but you need to understand this is right next to the airport. As a result, you will definitely here planes taking-off and landing when you are outside or on balconies, but I found it not to be a big issue the rooms are quiet. The price point with sometimes special weekend rates are great... You can take a cab to hotel for (~$13.00). You can walk to hotel row in the area as well as Walgreens or bars along the hotel row. I typically eat at the other local restaurants. Beware of the typical high hotel prices along the hotel row. $26.00 for a mini-burger at Hotel El San Juan (Hilton property) The Ritz Carlton (Marriot property) a block away if that... Great "little" sports bar around the corner. First local food/bar outside the hotel. Beware of the others magic trick gimmick restaurant in the same area look for people in the place to ensure the vibe is right for you. I love Puerto Rico... Enjoy the rain forest (El Yunque). Rent a car and really see the area like the Fort in San Juan or Rum factories and the local favor. The people are the real reason to go to Puerto Rico if any.

Reviews.Title: “One night wasnt enough!”
Reviews.Author: michelleewart1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my husbands birthday weekend and checked in late, leaving early the next morning. We are Marriott Rewards members, so were greeted with a gift, as well as rum and casino coupons upon checking in - the Front Desk assistant was extremely friendly. Our room had its own balcony, overlooking the ocean - the view was amazing! Room was clean, the bed was super comfy and the bathroom was well lit and very clean also. Room service was prompt and friendly too. Next time we come back to San Juan, we will definitely stay here again - hopefully for longer than just one night!

Reviews.Title: “2nd wedding annv getaway”
Reviews.Author: Boricua51
Reviews.Content: We just recently came back from our 2nd wedding annv and we enjoyed everything, your courtesy, nice staff from front desk all the way to housekeeping. For the GM there is only two things I would make changes, they are the standard rooms need upgrade change wallpaper and the bathroom need a new facelift too; and, parking for guest it is a real ordeal trying to find parking on weekends challenges with the people going to the casino, parking is a hassle. Suggestion on the parking for guest first 2 level and the rest can be for outsiders. Last but not least fine those people who takes 2 parkings promising they will think twice to double park again. But all in the facility is fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: Josh D
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here for up to two weeks at a time and it is a pleasure. If you're going to have to be away from home, this is where you want to be. The staff is very helpful and attentive, and offer to help you at every turn. The property is stunning, with beautifil swimming pools and a terrific view of the beach. The hotel is located very close to the airport and is right on the beach. The Salsa bar is great, breakfast buffet is to die for, and make sure you see Gloribel is the Banana cafe in the lobby for a Cuban sandwich. She is very nice and is always pleasant to the customers. The fitness center is world class, and the hotel casino is great as well. The property is very secure and offers secure parking as well. There are many shops and places to eat within walking distance. The price is much lower than other luxury hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “"Fun in the Sun" --Puerto Rican Style”
Reviews.Author: GCSMaryland
Reviews.Content: The Isla Verde Marriott "welcomes guests with a smile". Starting at valet checkin, Alexis is warm and friendly. The entrance is surrounded by a beautiful mini rainforest that relaxes you immediately. Checkin was immediate and welcoming with a complementary drink ticket and $5 casino table ticket. The hotel is beachfront that is beautifully landscaped. Palm trees abound the property. The grounds are manicured and well thought out for sun and shade. Beach chairs are provided around pool areas and on the beach front. Large swings under palm trees beckon. Large 2-part pool is stunning with one side swim up bar that serves great frozen drinks. Tented area with tables/chairs to have lunch which is provided also if desired. Towels provided complementary so guests don't have to remove from room or self provided. Again, staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Room very clean and all amenities provided including fridge. Large queen beds sooooo comfy. Only downside was bathroom, although sufficient and large needed update especially countertop. Other than that, room safe and closet space was nice. Balcony partial ocean view was wonderful from our 8th floor overlooking the beach on the west side. Being close to the airport is not a distraction overall if the door is closed. Sleeping quietly was not a problem. Being a frequent flyer loved seeing the planes after takeoff and was not bothered by the noise. The Lobby floor was very spacious with the "Banana" cafe that serves a great continental breakfast for $6. Coffee, juice, milk, bagels, toast, muffins and pastries were a hit. A Buffet breakfast was available in "Salsa" restaurant for $16 which we bypassed. The Mon-Fri Buffet in "Salsa" was a better deal. Either soup/salad OR pasta dinner at $12 was a better deal. They had a Latin combo with vocals in the Lobby open bar area on Saturday and Sunday with a dancing area which was jamming. Really felt the Puerto Rico rhythm and charm. Was not pressured to drink. Every hotel staff member really wanted their guests to enjoy their stay and hospitality "Latin" style. They all deserve an A+ for their efforts. Lastly, kudos to the Concierge, Karla Crespo. She was extremely friendly and helpful to us regarding our Old/New and Fort in San Juan tour. Management should take note and appreciate their GREAT STAFF.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: The-Blue-Monster
Reviews.Content: The location is lovely - beachfront, but the hotel had a slightly sour smell and the patio doors would never completely close. The beach is lovely and the hammocks, lounge chairs and palms are inviting. It is right next to the airport, however, and it difficult to fully relax when planes are taking off every 5-10 minutes. It is, however, a great value. The Ritz Carlton is just about 300 yards away and it about 3 times the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very good beachside resort”
Reviews.Author: gabrielfcb
Reviews.Content: Close to the Airport and with a fantastic beach and swiming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: TEC4174
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort. Our children loved the outdoor pool area. Outdoor hammocks made a romantic liesure. Right on the beach, which has nice sand and calm waves. Entertainment is local on the main entry floor. Has buffet and also a snack/dessert bar. Pricy food items. Have to pay extra to park in the garage. Security wasn't visible until very late and police arrived to patrol. Rooms were comfortable and large. Bathtub was clogged with hair and when we attempted to get it serviced, the facilities rep did not understand English enough to assist without having to return to service desk for clarification.

Reviews.Title: “My husband and I go to this hotel every year.”
Reviews.Author: luv2vacationtorelax
Reviews.Content: The pictures that you see on their website are what you get when you arrive. Their beach, is sooo clean and beautiful. All of their rooms have balconies. We love dining outside and taking in the views.

Reviews.Title: “OK... But not what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: RominNaomi
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this Marriott in Isla Verda for some post-cruise down time before leaving back to the states. We stayed a the Marriott Stellaris in Condado which was fabulous. I spent MANY hours on trip advisor and other review site before making my hotel choices. I was somewhat dissapointed in this location. I knew it was near the airport, but that was really not a problem. The rates were higher then the other Marriott so I expected the same level of quality and service. Not so, this location needs serious updating, the bathrooms were aged, the beds had bad "valleys" and the overall condition of the hotel really is showong its aged. I paid extra for an ocean view, which I did not expect ocenafront, but ...did not expect the ugly roof and parking garge with a cliver of ocean. The pool area is very small compared to other hotels in this area, the pictures on the website are very misleading. We attempted to get drinks from the poolbar but after an hour of have our chair "service flag" up for 30mins, I went over to the bar area and waited from another 30 min and was just ignored. I finally just got up and left. Local dinning in the area was about a 15 to 20 min walk, was really good, but over priced. The one bright spot at the resort was the resident Iguana named "pepper" that entertained the kids and adults alike, my father had never seen one and was able to take a turn feeding him, which he loved. Other then pepper, I was not inpressed by this Marriott and in returning will stay in Condado.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Courtyard room, very nice beach area, but lacking in hygiene in some areas!”
Reviews.Author: sg4878
Reviews.Content: This hotel is basically a Marriott Courtyard, with a casino and a few restaurants in it, along with a lovely beach and pool area. The rooms are standard for a Courtyard, although the balconies overlooking the beach are obviously an added bonus. Restaurant options range from bar fare to a nice seafood place on the beach - I had a wonderful snapper there! The beach and pool areas are what make this place worth checking out, as both are not terribly overcrowded and are clean. What makes me not want to return to the Courtyard Isla Verde Beach is the state of the bathroom I had in my room, as well as the maintenance of the property in general. Puerto Rico is a humid place, no question, but the mold and mildew in the bathroom - particularly in the shower and tub - was revolting. I cannot believe that anyone cleaning that bathroom could miss the black mold growing in the shower/tub. There was clear moisture damage to other parts of the hotel as well, which left an overall impression that the place was a bit unkempt and unsanitary. Also, in one of the restaurants, I found a piece of steel wool in my shrimp caesar salad! The waitress was apologetic, and the kitchen remade my salad, but there is absolutely no excuse for something like that happening! Bottom line: if you are on a budget, this is a fine place to stay - lovely beach and pool; nice staff; $10 cab ride from the airport. However, be aware that the maintenance of the rooms and building is a bit shoddy, and somewhat lacking in the cleaning department.

Reviews.Title: “Can not wait to return”
Reviews.Author: wendysuzette
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were going back and forth between booking this hotel and the El Convento in Old San Juan for our honeymoon. I am so happy with the choice that we made. We wanted a nice, relaxing hotel and that is what we got. The staff was wonderful and incredibly helpful. We ate in the hotel facilities several times and the food was incredibly fresh and the service was excellent. Who knew that I would go to Puerto Rico and get the best made-to-order pasta that I have had in years? The pool and hot tub were awesome. We were able to walk out our door and go straight to the beach. Our hotel room was an upper floor panoramic view of the ocean. There was nothing that I disliked about this hotel. This is what we will book for the next trip and I can't wait to get back there.

Reviews.Title: “A great, relaxing vacation!”
Reviews.Author: MishAu
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend, his son and I just got back from San Juan. Our stay at the Courtyard by Marriott was great. The staff was friendly, service was great, rooms were clean. I'd definitely stay there again the next time we come back.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: rmeade2849
Reviews.Content: After our Cruise, we stayed here for one night before going home. I am glad I planned it this way because, New York had very bad weather and alot of flights were being cancelled and people were scurrying for a place to stay. The Hotel was very nice, it was right on the beach. I asked for early check-in because we had to be off the cruise ship by 10:00am, the hotel had one of our two rooms done for us which was great since we were able to change and relax on the beach and at the pool by 11:00am. The staff was very friendly the room was nice, the bathroom in our room looked "tired" but it was clean. The hotel is very close to the run way of the airport so yes you do hear the planes when you are outside, but in the room you can only hear them slightly, it didn't keep us up or wake us up at all during the night. I read some of the comments regarding the cleanliness of the beach, but its a public beach and anyone could be on it, however, I did notice the staff does try hard to keep the area right near the hotel clean as possible. Price of food is high in their restaurants, but I believe food is high anywhere you go on the Island. We did the buffet breakfast cost 15.95 per person, but all of us enjoyed it and the staff was very friendly. Reading some of the negative comments regarding this hotel was not seen by me.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice and relaxing stay.”
Reviews.Author: Ome12
Reviews.Content: I stay on the 9th floor in a full ocean view room. And it was a full ocean view and was so beautiful. I loved hearing the sounds of the waves as my balcony door was open. The room was a nice decor and simple. I don't need much in a room especially if i am not going to spend more than 20% of my time there. The customer service was wonderful. They had no problems going out of there way to help you, if not find a way to do so. They lobby does get very lively in the evenings. They have great music, but it does get a bit loud when going back up to your room. I did eat at one of the restaurant located in the hotel (Serenity). That is a separate review. The pool and jacuzzi was very nice. All of the facilities are open 24 hours which was nice since we didn't feel restricted. The only down size i would say is that weekends the parking lot gets full and is hard to find parking. Valet did help us out though. I would definitely stay at this hotel when i return to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “We had a most wonderful time do not believe the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: Stephen M
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful,the staff was great and friendly,the food was exellent,the casino in the hotel, we went there and won.I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a great trip to Puerto Rico.My family and myself had a super time and would go back in hearbeat.

Reviews.Title: “more than a courtyard, and on a nice beach”
Reviews.Author: theislanddog
Reviews.Content: this hotel is an outstanding example of how one hotel in the same category can stand out head and shoulders above others in the same category. the hotel is spotless, the food is offered in a variety of restaurants, buffets, and outside on a large covered sand side veranda, with the surf within earshot, and quite visible. palm trees all around, and fresh fruit offering as well as full meals and lite ones too. the service is so pleasant from all the staff, and there is a small casino off the lobby. there is a salsa bar in the wide open lobby area, and you can just relax or try it for your self, with live music most of the time. the beach is very nice, and the rooms are very nice. the pool area is not huge, but nicely done and adequate and again, spotless. the only negative, if you care, is that it is across the main road and through the palms from the airport. from your balcony, you can watch the planes take off and land, and it can be a little noisy. it di not bother us, because we can appreciate where we were. it was quite nice, and is certainly worthy to carry the marriott affiliation. if you are a marriott rewards member, the points usage isn't that bad either, so you have extra cash for other things. i love puerto rico, and this is just a great spot to stay, or the start or end a cruise, as we often do.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great View for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: JLuisP
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days, 4 nights and unfortunately for us Mother Nature threw a tropical storm our way. We didn't let this affect our trip however they closed the Bacardi factory and El Yunque Rainforest so we have an excuse to come back. The hotel was great! The room was clean and had a great view of the beach. The were plenty of restaurants inside hotel, but be prepared to spend an average of $30 per meal. The best place to eat inside was the Salsa Restaurant, great steak! I would definitely stay at this hotel again. One last note, even though hotel is across the street from airport, never heard the planes once from the room, just outside in the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed very much--when on a budget, this is the way to go!”
Reviews.Author: Beret2010
Reviews.Content: Loved Puerto Rico! Hotel staff was courteous and hotel was clean and relaxing. The food is not a selling point though, overpriced and just not good. We agreed before went would walk to eating and try different place so worked out. The pool was nice, great beach service and loved how close beach was to pool! Awesome beach with soft sand and beautiful shells to hunt for. The pool was pretty but does need a bit more skimming. Overall, would highly recommend! Loved visit to old San Juan--saw one of forts--amazing--and shopped--so pretty and people very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel right on the beautiful Isla Verde Beach”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkScatterling
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, right on the beautiful Isla Verde beach. We spent most days either on the beach or at the pool. Service is excellent - loungers and umbrellas are carried out to the beach by request. The beach and pool are family and kid friendly and the rooms comfortable and clean. The restaurants are OK - a good buffet breakfast at Salsa restaurant. The restaurants are not vegetarian friendly. Our breakfast was supposed to be â€œincludedâ€� but consisted of only coffee, not-so-good pastries and bread (no fruit). We ended up paying for breakfast at Salsa often. The very affordable rum cocktails (especially the pina coladas!) during happy hour at Picante were delicious. The kidâ€™s game room is good but can, according to my 8-year old, do with a wider variety of games. Watch out for the beach bugs - they bite and it itches like crazy a day or so later. Take them up the offer of getting insect repellent from the front desk. We had a beautiful week at the hotel and will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: aedude9683
Reviews.Content: This was probably one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed in! Took 3 hours to get room (and we had requested early check in when booking), and when I went back to the desk to ask for the status of when we get it she responded with a rude tone saying "check in is at 3, so you aren't supposed to get it till then", and then when I looked back I saw her telling another desk worker about me! The room was nice looking, but almost everything was broken or moldy... The balcony was nice, although with the airport literally in the front yard of it, it sounds a little like someones blowing a trombone in your ear. Concierge knew NOTHING!! Like seriously she didn't know where a good restaurant was (she responded with "uhhhhhhhh I don't know....."). The outdoor grill servers need to stop their socializing with other staff and actually serve food! There were 8 people at my table and I was served after 3 of the, were done with their food! I had to go over to the kitchen and get it myself. Also there were little bugs all around the room! Pool was nice, as were the bellman, but that's it. Don't waist your money and invest the extra money for the ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, mediocre food, awful service. Avoid this one.”
Reviews.Author: BlueLighterPK
Reviews.Content: Older hotel that has been somewhat upgraded. 3 restaurants that sell food available at most Denny's on the mainland, only for triple the cost. Indifferent staff that seems to go out of their way to ignore customers.

Reviews.Title: “Room was fine, beach is good, staff was nice, planes are loud, kids run free”
Reviews.Author: lookingforhome
Reviews.Content: Had a Marriott Award coupon and stayed here the night before leaving Puerto Rico. The front desk upgraded us to a room on a higher floor. The room was basic, normal Courtyard. Beach was fine. Service on the beach was friendly but food is way overpriced. I know that it is going to have a mark up more than normal - it is service on a tropical beach, so I get that. However,when I ordered nachos, I did not expect them to be nachos with melted cheez whiz. You can get a better plate of nachos for a better price at a ball park...really. Drinks - had a few pina coladas that were good and not crazy prices (I think $8 - which is not bad for a drink on the beach). They have non alcoholic smoothies as well, those were refreshing. Location: There is the airport right behind the hotel and the planes landing at the airport are loud (when they are landing especially). Not a tranquil beach experience is that is what you are after! I did not mind since it was a day and a half there and for free, but had I paid for this hotel and was staying a few days it would have been an issue. A plane landing in your backyard is loud,. don't kid yourself! Also, there is a casino and live music in the evening on the lobby floor. I don't know if parents are too busy having fun to watch their children but it was chaos down there - kids roaming around and playing seemingly unsupervised. FIne if it stayed down there, but the kids on the playground atmosphere overflowed to the floors above. We were sound asleep at 1 a.m. and there were kids - approximately 8 through 12 - running the halls, clearly with no parental supervision. They were running in and out of the stairwell, slamming doors, screaming like they were outside. My husband went out to tell them to stop and they did not, we call ed the front desk who sent security up, but by then (after about 20 minutes of this) the kids had run to down the stairwell. While I understand that kids in a hotel running wild is not specific to the hotel in general, it did seem like the hotel did not have any rules about supervision of kids which may have contributed to this occurrence.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it...great family vacation hotel”
Reviews.Author: Evelyn099
Reviews.Content: Courtyard by Marriott in Isla Verde Puerto Rico is the best family oriented hotel in the island. My husband, 3 grandkids ages 6, 9, 10 and I had the best time ever in our 3 day mini vacation at this hotel. We enjoyed our very comfortable room, the beach with big hammocks to rest on, the swimming pools and Jacuzzi. The food was great and reasonably priced and to top it off the adult playroom (Casino) is conveniently located right in front of the kidâ€™s game room; so we can gamble a little and still look over our young ones. I will most certainly plan a longer stay next timeâ€¦loved it!!! Tip...If you need help planning your stay ask for Jazmin Rivera, Senior Sales Manager she is the best and most friendly person you can meet at the Courtyard, Isla Verde

Reviews.Title: “Old Property. nice beach”
Reviews.Author: trami74
Reviews.Content: property could use some updates. The rooms/bathrooms. Faded.chipped paint stained bathroom walls carpent torn in some places Beach is very nice & pool area if you can also deal with the sound of airplanes over your head this is the place for you Not up to the usual standards of other Marriotts

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: JudyRI
Reviews.Content: My adult son and I were here for 4 nights for the wedding of a family friend. All of the personnel we had contact with from the desk, to maid service, to towel service and guys who set beach chairs and umbrellas, wait staff, conceirge...everyone was professional, accomodating, and helpful. There was excellent live music thurs, fri and sat night. Food was excellent, Great beach. Rooms with great views. We left for a night to join family and friends in another part of PR and returned to this hotel the night before we flew out because we were so comfortable here. There was a great cheese and fruit platter waiting for us when we arrived to check in on our return stay late at night. Rooms were comfortable, Bedding comfortable. Rooms were quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful venue for Wedding in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Carol7664
Reviews.Content: I am an airline employee and travel quite a bit for my job, and while I use Trip Advisor regularly to decide at which Hotel to stay, this is my very first review. My now husband and I decided to hold our ceremony and reception at the Courtyard Isla Verde in San Juan Puerto Rico for several reasons. Chief among them was the fact that they offered reasonable packages and what I knew to be a picturesque beach location. We also chose Puerto Rico because of the ease in which US citizens could travel to the island without a passport. The hotel itself is located near the airport and while you can hear an occasional plane pass overhead it was never intrusive or disruptive. The hotel is located in an area in which we felt comfortable walking. We walked to dinner at a nearby oceanfront restaurant, La Playacita, one night and walked to breakfast near the hotel on another occasion. In talking with one of their staff one morning, we learned that the Hotel conveniently located on a bus route. This allowed up to ride the bus to Old San Juan as opposed to taking a taxi which would have cost approximately $20. We paid .75 cents to ride down to old San Juan were we spent the day sight seeing and having an all around good time. As for our ceremonyâ€¦.. Unfortunately, mother nature decided to rain on the day of our wedding. I was told that this brings good luck, so I tried not to be to bummed out about it. However, the rain caused a change in ceremony and reception location that NO BRIDE wants to hear about on the day of her wedding.
