Michelle Cotto, the Event Manager at this Hotel assured me that everything would be okay, AND IT WAS!!!!! We ended up having both the ceremony and reception in the area that normally houses the Sirena restaurant and IT WAS BEAUTIFUL. The rain stopped right before the ceremony began and the sunset was beautiful. My guest commented on how elegant and beautiful the ceremony was and I could not have been happier. Iâ€™ve had several guest tell me how good the food was and how much they enjoyed our wedding. The whole thing was a blur to me, but luckily, I have pictures I will treasure for a lifetime. One note of caution, if you plan to have an evening ceremony on the beach, please, please, please, spray yourself before hand to avoid being bitten by any bugs. The Hotel offers complimentary bug spray and those who used it fared better than others. While not everyone was bitten, there were some who noticed bites upon their arrival home. However, this should not dissuade anyone from getting married on the beach in Puerto Rico and getting married at this wonderful hotel. I've had several people tell me they can't wait to go back. The staff was extremely helpful!!!!!!, courteous and knowledgeable. Overall, I enjoyed my experience and wanted to get the word out to future brides to look into this Hotel for your wedding location.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, but I have stayed in better.”
Reviews.Author: chrisandbeth7508
Reviews.Content: My room wasn't as clean as it could have been, and I didn't get shampoo and conditioner everynight like I should have. There were lots of little things that weren't up to par.

Reviews.Title: “Check in and Check out was difficult”
Reviews.Author: Ginger07305
Reviews.Content: My family and my brothers family checked into 2 rooms when we arrived and gave our credit card information for them to have for our room. Different rates for each room but for some reason it took 3 tries to get the correct rate for each room. Mind you we showed the email confirmation. One room was ready before 3 and was given a beeper to let us know when the other room was ready. The beeper never went off and we went to the front desk around 7pm to ask for the room. Checking out we were warned by someone to go to the front desk because they said that they usually mess up the final bill. And they were right, the rates were wrong again plus room charges were mixed up. We asked them to look at the initial rate from when we checked in and it took about an hour to get this matter fixed. And then they had someone else's credit card information for the rooms. This is a big deal, they should not be mixing up credit card informations especially if they took an imprint when we checked in. The room was eventually charged to the correct credit card but I know I would have been very upset if I found charges that wasn't mine on my credit card. The Marriott Courtyard was ok. The rooms were decent but it needs upgrading. The restaurant was a bit pricey, prices for food and drinks were comparable to NY city prices. There are fast food restaurant within walking distance but it is about a mile away from the hotel. On the positive note the pool area and the beach was nice. The service in the beach was great. We spent most of our time in the pool and the beach area.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: hghumphrey
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Marriott Courtyard at Isla Verde and had a great time. We requested a queen/queen room but instead got a king room with a sofabed for the 2 kids and it worked out much better. The room was very comfortable and clean and we were very content. The only downside was the view out our window of some old apartment building that looked as if it needed to be demolished, but that was minor considering how good everything else was. The beds are comfortable and the sheets are very soft. The tv was nice and the bathroom was nice. The maid was very nice and did an excellent job of cleaning our room. We tipped her daily and she left us some extra coffee (which is delicious by the way) and some extra water bottles. The drinks are a little expensive at the hotel bar and the food we had was nothing great. The pool was nice -- it needed to be skimmed really badly -- but we enjoyed it nonetheless. The beach is great and the towel/umbrella/beach chair service was impeccable. Everybody we dealt with was very nice and accommodating. Some tips for anybody staying there...the best eating is about 3-4 blocks down the street. Piu Bello is a great place for breakfast...cheap, and good food. We ate at Platos and it was delicious as well as Metropol and both are a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Jhrbr
Reviews.Content: Pretty good hotel. We checked in late on a Sunday, live salsa music from the bar meet us as we came. Rooms were clean and ours had a fair view of to ocean. Pools were ok, staff was VERY friendly and everyone spoke English.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: cookmb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is extremely close to the airport (like you could cross the street and be on the runway), but I didn't find the noise to be obnoxious and constant. The rooms are nice, beds comfortable. The downside is that this hotel is at the very end of the strip in Isla Verde. The closest restaurant outside of the hotel was between a 5 and 10 minute walk. The hotel restaurants were overpriced and nothing phenomenal. The hotel does have a nice beach and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Bring a lot of Insect Repellent”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter201125
Reviews.Content: The hotel has extremely comfortable beds and has an awesome double windowed patio which keeps out noise. Also useful was access to the internet--a set of three computers with 24 hour access. Swimming in the pool at night was a treat--nice system of lights. Cons: We were on the fifth floor facing a ghastly-looking condominium complex that needs a major face-lift. Additional cons are that there are so many biting insects--they need to seriously spray for mosquitoes/ sand flies since it is impossible to enjoy the outdoors without being attacked by biting insects. The surrounding public beach is not very clean--dog waste--perhaps a sign which warns residents where the Marriot's property ends would be great.

Reviews.Title: “My Wedding and Resort Accomodations were amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Mari19106
Reviews.Content: I had my wedding at the courtyard so we stayed there with about 70 guests. It was a dream come true! The food at the wedding was to die for. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The manager of special events, Michelle Cotto, helped every step of the way. I would recommend getting married at the Courtyard in Isla Verde to any bride.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Vacation (Solo Traveler)”
Reviews.Author: loucaz
Reviews.Content: I picked the Courtyard by Marriott because it was the hotel in IslaVerde with the best reviews. I was a little leery of going on vacation by myself, but not leery enough because I went anyway. This was my first time visiting Puerto Rico. I had such a fantastic time at this hotel and I met some really great people on this vacation. The hotel has some pros and cons. More pros than cons. Although I didnâ€™t spend too much time in my room, it was clean and comfortable. I slept very well. I had a view of the beach from the balcony, and it was fantastic. The beach outside of the hotel is wonderful. Itâ€™s clean, serene and safe. Nothing beats swinging in a hammock on the beach as the sun beats down on you. The beach was not crowded at all, it was lovely and peaceful. The pool area is also clean and not crowded. With the hotel begin able to house so many people you would think it would be crowded, but it was wonderful. The water temperature in the pool also won me over, because it was comfortable. I never understood why some places keep the pool water so cold that you have to work your way into the water, but the pool water temp was perfect. I would stay at the beach until 3pm when happy hour begins at the pool bar (Papayaâ€™s). I would order whatever was the happy hour special for the day (The drinks are $3. Happy hour from 3pm â€“ 5pm) and then you can go to the bar inside the hotel and continue my happy hour there (Picante. Happy hour from 5pm â€“ 7pm). I only ate at the hotel once on my first night because I wasnâ€™t too sure if I should venture outside of the hotel in the dark, but the next night I walked about 10 minutes and had dinner at Spice. It was delicious. The food at the hotel is â€¦eh. It wasnâ€™t horrible, but after the first night I didnâ€™t want to eat there again. Who knows, maybe I ordered the wrong thing. I also ate at a bar called 101, tasty food, even though it is a bar. There is a juke box I heard Pinones was good, and Iâ€™m sorry I never made it there. But being a solo traveler I stuck to walking in the same direction every day. I had breakfast at Dennys, which was a short walk from the hotel and much less expensive. There is a Walgreens right next to Dennyâ€™s which is great, because you can stock your room with water, snacks and whatever else you might need to lessen the cost of your trip. There is a bus, the T5, that stops outside of the hotel. Itâ€™s $.75 cents. The last stop on the bus is also the first stop to bring you back to the hotel, so you canâ€™t get lost. The last stop will take you to the beginning of Old San Juan. I had booked the Old San Juan tour in the hotel, which was cancelled for some reason (a blessing in disguise) and I got to visit Old San Juan for the lesser cost. There is a free trolley that takes you from where the T5 leaves you, through Old San Juan, but if you are not afraid of walking, you will get a better view of the city on your feet, plus, there are two trolleys making the journey and a lot of traffic so you could end up waiting an hour for the trolley. Not worth it â€“ time is precious when you are on vacation. Old San Juan is only a 3 minute walk up a hill and you are in the city. Everything is recognizable so you cannot get lost. Back to the hotel, the only con I have about the hotel is the government taxes and fees. There is a resort fee, I knew about that, but the resort fee charge is also taxed by the government. So on top of the $11 you will pay a day in resort fees, there is $11 a day that you will pay in additional taxes. AND donâ€™t charge anything to your room because those taxes will be added on to whatever you charge to the room. Pay cash or use your credit card. Other than that, I had a fantastic time and as someone who gets bored after a few days and wants to come home, I didnâ€™t want to leave. I canâ€™t wait to go back to PR and I will definitely be staying at the Courtyard by Marriott again!! More on my vacation to Isla Verde: http://louisecazley.blogspot.com/2011/06/to-puerto-rico-and-back.html

Reviews.Title: “Nice beach, but other than that a total scam!”
Reviews.Author: GabrielafromSF
Reviews.Content: This place has okay rooms, a decent casino, and a decent location. It is good for kids in that it's not too nice and no one cares if they run wild through the hotel. It IS NOT A GOOD VALUE FOR KIDS however...the kid options for food and drinks are a total rip off. The bellboys are nice. Other than that it completely blows! The food is horrible, the pool is tiny and dirty, and the service is slow and rude. DONT TIP ANYONE THE HOTEL AUTOMATICALLY CHARGES YOU A TIP FOR EVERY SINGLE FOOD/BEVERAGE/SERVICE PROVIDED AND DON'T TELL YOU UNTIL CHECK OUT. On the day of checkout, I had nearly $70 worth of charges in tips, an parking fee when I didn't have a car....and when I contested it I had to wait OVER 30 MINUTES at the check out desk while 3 people looked through a stack of unorganized paper receipts. I nearly missed my flight. The two good things about this hotel are the live music and the proximity to the airport if that's something you're looking for. The beach is nice, but you can find way better hotels on the same beach or a better one. I would gladly never come back to this hotel. I'd rather pay way less to stay at a guest house, or pay a little more to stay at a legitimate resort such as the San Juan Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Not horrible, but need to improve on cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: acaballero22
Reviews.Content: Lets start with the best things about this resort: -Beach and outside of resort was beautiful -People were generally friendly -The weekend is popular at the bar with the live band and lots of people dancing to salsa. -The drinks and food were pretty good too. A little pricey but still good. -I loved the service on the beach and the chairs to lay out on at the beach. Also the umbrella service was a good touch! Towel service was nice as well. -There were nice hammocks on the beach so someone could easily take a nap or relax looking at the water. -I had a great view from my balcony but I know my other family members didn't in their rooms. Bad: -Rooms can be a million times cleaner. They definitely need to renovated. The maids didn't really vacuum or change the sheets. They just made the bed. After a week of sleeping on the sheets it felt dirty. I almost wanted to mess up the sheets in hopes that they would put new sheets on. They also like to do this whole eco thing with saving the towels of which are dirty and which are clean, but I didn't know not cleaning is a new environmentally friendly trend. Also they don't clean the filters on the air conditioning. It was giving this mustly recycled air feeling. Multiple members of my family weren't feeling well. -The service was friendly but sort of slow. I know I know we're on vacation, but sometimes the wait was a little ridiculous. The staff was definitely stretched a little thin. The service would be better if there were more people helping. -Casino was dirty. And not enough waiters. Also the lighting was so dark. If they just made it brighter it would be significantly better. -Swimming pool needs to be cleaner. So many people go in and out of that pool its gross whats in it. Bottom Line: It was a good for the value ($300-400 a night), but definitely needs to improve on the cleanliness. If it were up to me though I would think twice about going back since I am very particular about cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, Not Great.”
Reviews.Author: Strongbow99
Reviews.Content: I had a bit of a run around form Mariott on getting the correct room and price here. First they put me in the wrong wedding block of rooms which was a higher price. It took a few calls and emails to get my refend. They also told me there were no rooms with two queens left. I found out later that was not true and ended up with the room I wanted. It all turned out fine, but was a big hassle. Ok, on to the review of the hotel. The beach is fantastic, no comlaints here. It is sandy and gorgeous. The rooms are a bit dated, but good enough for me. The food at the hotel is overpriced and not very good. I did only eat at the breakfast buttet and grabbed a Pizza from the quick eats area. The breakfast was ok. I asked for a waffle and the guy put one in there but after about 15 minutes he left and I guess he forgot about it. The omelet station was acceptable and the fruit was good. For $15 its a bit expensive, but it was convenient. I didn't eat much at the hotel so I can't review much. The pool isn't very big, but did the job for me. I've been to other places that blow the pool area of this hotel away for a lesser price. Hotel service was fine. I didn't have any problems at all. One thing to keep in mind is this is Puerto Rico and they are not very prompt or in a hurry. I was woken up one night from some party going on. I was too tired to compain about it, it must have been 4am. The one bright note of this place is there are no rooms near the pool or loud areas of the hotel. That means the pool is open 24hrs. I take that as a huge plus. I hate it when pools close at 10pm or earlier. I like to hit the pool late at night.

Reviews.Title: “I would pay a little bit more and stay at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: stickeq
Reviews.Content: If you really want to stay in this hotel do not stay over the weekend. It is too loud and you can hear all that it's happening next door. I was a little bit sad because the last time I stayed at this hotel the rooms were better. This hotel needs major renovation. The service was excellent. The location is great but the rooms need renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for my group”
Reviews.Author: dschmidt1007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property because of it's location "outside" of San Juan, near the airport. We stayed for 2 nights prior to going on a cruise leaving from San Juan. My husband & I traveled with my parents, my aunt & uncle, another uncle & 3 cousins with one of their significant others. We had 5 rooms between us and none of us had issues with our room types or the cleanliness. I used to work for Marriott, so I still have some friends that work within the company and was able to get the Friends and Family rate for my room & my parents room. This location is directly across the street from the airport, so yes, you will hear planes taking off all day long (usually about every 2 or 3 minutes). We live within the flight path of Newark airport, so while it is not that noisy near our home, after the first 5 plans or so, we didn't really notice it any longer & were able to continue about our business. While we did not use the pool as we were busy in downtown San Juan doing "touristy" things, my parents said the pool was great. They enjoyed the "resident" iguanas, although my cousin was grossed out that they were going in and out of the pool during the time she was there. We loved the bar in the main lobby - we had a wonderful bartender who knew our names before we left (not sure if that's a good or bad thing - haha) & our drink orders. We did not utilize the casino attached. We had breakfast there both mornings, very reasonable coming from the NYC area. Others in our party did walk up the street to Denny's, and while they did save some money, breakfast the one morning took almost 3 hours. A Walgreens was also located within walking distance (next to the Denny's) in case you forget anything. I do think I would come back to this location if we should go on a cruise again leaving from San Juan (and even if I could not get the discounted rate), but I am not sure I would choose this location for an entire vacation.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back"”
Reviews.Author: 2oldladiesescape
Reviews.Content: Hotel is on the beach and is beautiful!! There are hammocks in the sand and if you are a pool person, you can lay in a lounge chair by the pool. They have great food, with a full bar and a Casino. We spent the night there before going on a cruise and we'd like to go back for a vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but full of bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: vacagirlBoston
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great...the scenery was awesome...there was an abundance of activities...but BED BUGS...they have a serious case of bedbugs...I left with about 15 bites...its ridiculous...and with that comes the risk of bringing them back home with you....great hotel but if you are scared of bed bugs not the right choice.

Reviews.Title: “I would love to come back!”
Reviews.Author: jerkate07
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here from 1 June- 6 June, it was a getaway for us before our deployment to Iraq. We showed up at the hotel and everyone was so friendly. We received our two free drink coupons for any rum drink at Picante (restaraunt/bar at the hotel). We also received something for the Casino, the casino would match it up to $10. We had a delux ocean view room, so it was a king size bed with plenty of space in the room. The hotel was clean and nice enough. They have big flat screen tvs, a desk/work station, love seat and chair, and a balcony. This isn't the most upscale hotel we've stayed in, but we didn't plan on spending tons of time in the room either. There are so many things to do in Puerto Rico too, and the Concierge was full of information. Make sure to eat at one of the little local vendors. Try Pincho, meat on a stick. And Mofongo, your choice of meat in a plantain "bowl". We ate down the street at Plato's (ok, but pricey). We ate brunch at Denny's (American, but cheap). Salsa's (restaraunt in hotel- great make your own pasta, but things were expensive, other food kind of bland. La Playita is a restaraunt in another hotel on the beach, we had a horrible experience at though. 2 hour wait for food, and given no compensation on ticket. Each plata we ordered was over $20. We rented a car from U-Save Car & Truck rental, about $60 a day because of the insurance added on (bring a copy of your own). We drove to El Yunque, the rainforest- Wear a swimsuit and swim in El Mina Waterfall. Definitely bring a change of clothes. We took the bus for .75 cent (T5, A5, or C53 to go to Old San Juan. The bus goes to the bus station which is where you need to get off, so relax and enjoy the scenery on the way. You can then take a ferry for 50 cents to Catano and go on the Bacardi Rum Tour. You get two free drinks, and cheap liqour in their gift shop. A lieter is about $12.75, and the stores around here it would be alot more expensive. Also, make sure to do a Catamaran tour with snorkeling! We had an amazing time!

Reviews.Title: “Salsa!”
Reviews.Author: phxnative77
Reviews.Content: They had a great people watching on Salsa nights. The live band was great, the people were colorful and fun. The Staff was always helpful and willing to attend to your needs. Great taxi service and zero attitudes, just smiles. A little loud next to the airport and that was the only thing I could think would damper ones time but I really loved it there. Nice spot on the beach and the pool was always nice for the end of the night too. No problems with our room a couple of problems with card keys but that would be it. So if you really like to Salsa dance and were great shoes they matter.

Reviews.Title: “After 3yrs I'm moving on.......”
Reviews.Author: Jazzgrl
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times and this was most disappointing for me.....my room was poorly located and was dirty upon my arrival. There were hairs on the commode (yuk! Double yuk! And the carpet hadn't been vaccumed which made me upset bcuz there's so much sand tracked in from the beach. I felt gross about the cleaning, thank God I didn't have one of those illumilight things or I probably never would've been able to sleep there! I asked to speak with the manager and was asked to wait (30 min later) it was too much so I cut my losses went to the pool and asked her staff to have her call me....I left a message every day i was there.... well I stayed a week am home now for a day and a half and I have yet to hear from Rose

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at Isla Verde”
Reviews.Author: Snickerbilly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Saturday May 14th the night before our cruise. We really enjoyed this hotel. The beach and hammocks were very nice and the guys would set up and umbrella and chairs at your request. There are decent waves on the beach and lots of surfers. Had a Mojito at the bar as they gave us two coupons for free rum drinks at the bar. Room was comfortable with nice ocean view. The pool was nice and open late which we took full advantage of. We did not try any of the restaurants or go in the casino so cannot comment on that. For Puerto Rican food we recommend Mi Casita which is just a few blocks down the street to the right of the hotel. Lots of restaurants/bars within walking distance as well as a Walgreens. We would stay here again. We did not even notice the noise from the planes in our room. Its like a $10 cab ride from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Staff Incredible, Beach Wonderful, Restaurant Very Good, One ooops”
Reviews.Author: 2trvlppl
Reviews.Content: Right up front, you have to know that the staff in Courtyard Isla Verde Beach in Puerto Rico tries hard to be friendly, efficient, and concerned with the quality of your stay.Whatever it is that management does here works well because the staff really is genuinely nice. The beach is a pretty, large, white stretch of sand with plenty of on- and off-beach seating. We found the dining to be very good, and although we love dining in Old San Juan, we did not venture out but ate on the premises. Papaya's and Salsa's are tasty and would work well for families. Sirena's is great for an adult dinner with a lovely ocean view. The only caveat that we have regarding this hotel is that neither of our rooms were clean; both were really very dirty and two out of two is not good; we could hear and see the cleaning staff at 11PM so they must be very overloaded. All in all, though, this is a good find near the airport in San Juan. And, the staff does try so hard to make your stay a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to savor Puerto Rico's charms.”
Reviews.Author: thecowboylawyer
Reviews.Content: I researched extensively on travel sites trying to find a hotel in the San Juan area that had excellent reviews. Many had very mixed reviews. The Courtyard by Marriott Isla Verde was the only hotel that had all excellent reviews. So, I went online and booked a week and used my Marriott Rewards card and got a discount on the rate. I reserved it with my credit card and then called the hotel directly and asked if I could pay cash upon arrival. (I don't incur debt on credit cards and prefer to pay cash, but many resorts want your credit card so they can nickel and dime you to death. If you want to pay cash, many hotels want a huge cash deposit to rip you off...) The lady said it was no problem to pay cash and there was no cash deposit required. I already had a good feeling about the hotel. We flew into the airport at dusk and took a short cab ride to the hotel. The hotel doesn't have a shuttle, which it should. Upon arrival we were greeted by the nicest, most courteous and professional hotel staff I've ever encountered, especially Hector, the front desk man. He was gracious and confirmed I could prepay the entire week in cash. He accepted my money discreetly and confirmed that there would be no deposit required. Our hotel room was perfect, facing west, overlooking the beach and the other hotels and condos on Isla Verde. We went downstairs to eat at Sirena, the restaurant outside on the beach. The atmosphere was superb and the wait staff was solicitious and perfect. They didn't hover and bother, but appeared miraculously whenever I needed something. The food was good, but bland. My wife and I like local foods when we travel. The inside restaurant is called Salsa and it has American breakfast buffet in the morning and semi-Puerto Rican dinner. Again, the food was good but bland. What was not bland was the marvelous Salsa bar off of the lobby. The live salsa music on the weekends was superb and the place was crowded and we enjoyed salsa dancing the nights away. The casino off the lobby is great, too. We gambled only a little, but we felt welcome and appreciated and no pit bosses hovered over us when we were winning, as is common in other casinos. The beach staff was courteous and solicitous, making sure we had beach chairs and umbrellas whenever we needed them. The pool and hot tub were perfect, but the hot tub had temperature problems, and was under-heated on occasion. The beach was clean and the entire experience was superb. The entire stay our housekeeper kept our room tidy and was responsive to any need we had. The business center was small and only two computers, but we weren't there to work. We did not use the fitness center, but it was busy all of the time. There is one caveat to this hotel: The Courtyard Isla Verde is across the street from the airport. During the day, flights take off overhead and it's noisy. There are no flights at night so there is no jet noise. If you're addled by jets flying overhead, you won't like the daytime. My wife and I could've cared less. We spent a week at Courtyard by Marriott Isla Verde for less than a week in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: reds9
Reviews.Content: Read previous reviews and the biggest concern was the noise from the nearby airport. So who got the bright idea to put the airport so close to the beach? Of course the beach will be the main attraction for many hotels so this was the best spot for the airport? Having said that, the hotel was very nice, the rooms spacious enough and the beds comfortable. We had an oceanview room overlooking the pool. Our assessment of the property is that no oceanview rooms have a great view unless you are on the top floors as the pool view overlooks the roof of the restaurant and the other side of the hotel has another building very close. We were on floor 6 and were only there for 2 days pre-cruise so it was perfect. The pool was huge and very clean. The hot tub was extremely hot one day, almost too hot to go in, but that evening the temp had been lowered which made it very comfortable. The beach is beautiful and well kept but the biggest attraction in our opinion was the wonderful hammocks on the beach! Contrary to what we had heard they were not often occupied so getting one was not a big issue. They were roomy and very comfortable. The staff was pleasant and accomodating. We arrived hungry the first day and after cruising the lobby for a place to eat and not finding anything that interested us at that moment we ventured out of the hotel to see what we could find. As we passed by the taxi stand we noticed several taxi drivers eating from styrofoam containers. As we approached the street we noticed a woman serving food from her vehicle. What a treat! The food was tasty and inexpensive and plenty of it to feed 2 hungry adults. We could not locate her the next day but I had always heard the local food is the best and the street vendors if you can find a good one, are a real treat. As we did not speak Spanish and she did not speak English we could not find out how often she visits the various establishments but we sure missed her the next day. Bananas in the lobby of the hotel is also very nice for a quick bite to eat. We didn't spend much time off the hotel property as we were only there 2 days to get a jump start on our vacation and only wanted R & R. As for the airplane noise it was bad only if the huge jets were taking off and then the noise was deafening but only for a few seconds. The smaller planes were almost not noticeable. This is certainly no deterent though as the hotel and the location were otherwise perfect! No complaints from this guest and intend to go back the next time we cruise from San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “great for transit stay”
Reviews.Author: mheyns
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here several times on our way in and out of PR. It's location is great; about 10 min cab ride to the airport. The rooms are nice. The beds are spectacular. Very comfortable. The rooms are quiet. Not much noise heard from other rooms; like doors slamming etc. Room service food is good. It's just a really nice place at this price range. Will keep booking here. Oh, almost forgot free internet which is great!

Reviews.Title: “Little Slice of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: 8lablovr
Reviews.Content: I picked the Courtyard after reviewing the Isla Verde resorts. A friend sugested the El San Juan however that was a little out of my price range so I chose the Courtyard. I was very happy with my choice. I was looking for a place to relax and unwind for a few days and this fit the bill. Beautiful beachfront location with great service. I was able to lay by the pool, sit at the beach, or just sit on the patio and take in the view. The restaurant/food service is adequate and slightly overpriced, however this is usually expected in resorts. This hotel is the closest to the airport however the takeoffs are infrequent enough you barely notice it. I am a light to moderate sleeper and never once woke to the sound of an airplane. The hotel is a five minute walk from the public bus that can take you into Old San Juan, and there are plenty of restaurants/food in the area. The bathrooms are slightly dated, however the rooms are super clean and the bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, and not to shabby of price for what you get”
Reviews.Author: T-Mac32
Reviews.Content: Went here for my birthday. Hadn't got my passport, so this was my exotic get away and it turned out amazing. Resort is located on the beach, which is keep very clean, the water was amazing too. We rented a car and drove into Old San Juan, car rental wasn't to expensive but its cheaper if you bring your insurance card, if not they make you purchase insurance. But we did a tour of Bacardi(in which you get free drinks). I was cheap, you take a 50 cent ferry and a $2 taxi and there is no admission fee for the Factory. Also ate an amazing restaurant called Cafe Puerto Rico, the food was amazing, and they have their own house rum in which they keep giving out free shots. Puerto Rico is a beautiful country, and a nice get away for people who want to get out of the country and don't have a passport. The hotel also had an amazing buffet and the casino wasn't bad also. I would recommend this hotel and stay here again in future travel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has what you need for an enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraTuckertonNJ
Reviews.Content: I've learned not to believe all read in reviews. We have been here for 2 years now, and will most likely come for a third. The airport is nearby, but I actually liked seeing and hearing the planes take off. You can't beat the beach. The views are great, and being at the end of the beach makes it more private. We have always had great service. It is not a new hotel, but is one that I would rate better than the Category 7 hotel n St. Thomas. Everything is easy to walk to, the town bus is fine for getting into Old San Juan and is only 75cents each way. The front desk fixed an issue for me with absolutely no problem. My husband has terrible allergies and they were very helpful in what we needed.For the price you cant beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Enough If You Like Your Neighbors”
Reviews.Author: gadgetamor
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel a full two weeks for business and tried at least 3 times to change hotels. The pictures do justice for this hotel; highlighting its spacious rooms and beautiful beach. I was aware that being so close to the airport what kind of noise I could expect, so that was not a problem. What was a problem was that even when people in the neighboring room were talking at a typical level, I could hear every word they were saying. I tried to change rooms for one that would not have this problem (as no one would stay in this hotel if it were the same for every room) but was told that a large party was taking up most floors in the hotel and they were sure to be loud as well. I would have changed hotels but it was too much trouble finding a hotel that had a room available for the length of stay I required. I'm just happy no honeymooners ended up in the room next to mine.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and something for everyone”
Reviews.Author: soccerandsurf
Reviews.Content: Staff are consistently attentive 24-7 and the customer service excellent. The location is good for wandering the island and doing day-trips--or just staying put and enjoying the a beach and pool. We had no problem with the proximity to the airport although if you are a very light sleeper who goes to bed before 10 pm the noise could be an issue. Overall this is one of the best run Marriotts I have stayed in US or elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Over all good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melike2travel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two days for beach and had a good time. Little noisy at Flight times but rooms had double glass so a lot of the noise stayed outside. Beach is the best of four that we went to. Things I like were the rooms, the beach, and the friendly staff (help me numerous time to get me back into my room because of lost keys. Things that I didn't like are the RESORT FEES (hate them) and the parking fees, these are getting way out of hand. To do anything on this Island you need a car or lots of taxi money, I had a car and a GPS unit is a must in San Juan. Oh, and watch out for the drivers. Stop signs mean stop and go there but after awhile you get used to it and the traffic does keep moving but awful scary.

Reviews.Title: “High quality hotel, excellent value, great beach”
Reviews.Author: Travelingman16
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off the "Courtyard" name - this is a very nice beach resort. All rooms have a beach view with a balcony. The rooms are long and relatively narrow but well laid out. The fridge comes in handy. The free wifi is speedy. The breakfast buffet is excellent and includes and omelette station. The hotel has an outstanding beach and a very nice pool, including a swim-up bar. The lobby area is very spacious and has a nice lunch counter, with a relatively small casino off to the side. The hotel is closer to the airport runway than the terminal itself, yet jet noise is absent in the rooms. I paid $159 a night, which included breakfast and wi-fi. I highly recommend this hotel for business or a 2- to 4-day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beach, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: LPonch
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard is not one of the more "ritzy" hotels in this area, like The Ritz Carlton just down the street, but it's a very nice hotel with a beautiful beach and excellent service throughout. Our room was just fine - clean and ready for us when we checked in early. Staff members, from doormen to front desk personnel to waitresses to the staff who set up your beach chairs and umbrellas are all friendly and very accommodating. Luz at the excursions desk was enthusiastic and very helpful with recommendations of excellent restaurants and interesting places to visit. We had an excellent meal at Sirena on the veranda overlooking the beach, and a great waitress (Christina) there. Enjoyed the atmosphere in the Picante lounge, where live music and enthusiastic salsa dancers (mostly locals?) had the joint jumping on the weekend! Service at the poolside cafe was a bit on the slow side, but the food (and drinks) were quite good. The pool area was very nice. The pool is a nice, free-form pool and small-ish, but we spent the majority of our time on the beach, so no big deal. A short walk down the street takes you to several good restaurants, including Metropol and Spice, a Walgreens, Dennys, a liquor store, etc. A bit further down, and you'll find more fast food and shopping areas, along with the Intercontinental Hotel and the El San Juan Hotel, very nice to stroll through or stop by for dinner. The main runway at Luis Munoz Marin Airport is directly across from the front of the hotel, hidden by only a treeline. There is certainly noise, but it didn't disturb our sleep, didn't bother us at the beach, and since I love planes, it didn't bother me at all. All in all, a great place to stay!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, soon to be Chicago
Reviews.Title: “Very nice.... Great beach”
Reviews.Author: lklein1976
Reviews.Content: We are having our wedding at the hotel in July. We came down for a few days to check the place out. It is really nice. Not a 5 star hotel, but very nice. Great beach, nice pool, good casino. The rooms are nice, but could use some updating. The hotel is really close to the airport, which is good that you don't have to travel far, but you hear the planes taking off constantly.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, with above average beach, not a good value for the cost.”
Reviews.Author: ZeeZee666
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights in late March. The Courtyard by Marriott is not a bad hotel, it's a bad value. This hotel would be acceptable for an average nightly rate between $140-180, but we paid $260 a night and for that amount, it was a not a good value. Personally, I am not a gambler and find the presence of a casino about as unappealing as having a strip joint on the premises, but that's a very personal and rather specific issue so I didn't fault this location for that. Most large hotels in San Juan have casinos, but there were specific issues with this hotel related to the casino. Unlike the Ritz and El San Juan next door, there was so separate entrance/parking for the casino patrons, making it difficult to park on the weekend when the casino was busy. The rooms are super outdated, which would be fine, if they didn't cost so much. We had a VCR in our room and the fridge was a 'cooler' that did not really keep perishables fresh. I must say the beds were very comfortable and the double glass doors kept a great deal of the airport noise out. We did sleep well in this hotel, save for the presence of some sort of bugs in the room, I am not sure if it was bed bugs or fleas but my husband and I both woke up itchy and bitten. The partial ocean view room balcony is nice to sit and watch the sunset and enjoy a beer (bought off property), but a better bet are the hammocks down by the beach which were my single favorite feature at this hotel. This property is in Isla Verde adjacent to the Ritz and a few feet from the El San Juan. The Marriot happens to have the best stretch of beach compared with the other hotels in the are and the public beach next to the hotel is also very nice. For are more 'authentic' Puerto Rican beach going experience, guests can walk down to the beach and sample some food from the "Kioskos" including BBQ and fried delights. The pool was extremely disappointing. It was cold, dirty and small. We only popped in once and did not return again. Luckily the stretch of beach in front of the hotel is great, which we enjoyed. We did not eat at any of the restaurants at the hotel but did purchase drinks from the bar while at the beach. The drinks were expensive/weak but in keeping with the standard resort fare in the region, sticking to beer is a better value. The 'Banana' Cafe makes an excellent cafe con leche but it is pretty pricy at $4 a cup, but nothing out of the ordinary for a resort. None of the the other restaurants seemed appealing enough for us to try, the crowd at the casino was not really our scene. We were on a road trip through Puerto Rico and this is an easy driving location, parking was expensive at $15 and often difficult on the weekends, cab to the airport was $15 despite the proximity of the hotel to the airport. Condado was $15 one night and $17 a different night. Old San Juan was $20. (We didn't drive at night in order to avoid driving after drinking). I didn't recommend this hotel because I wouldn't stay here again for the price. In all fairness I don't think I'd stay at an Isla Verde resort again because I just enjoyed other areas of San Juan more, despite the amazing beach. I think this hotel can be nice for families or college students interested in several late night establishments right off the resort, it just wasn't for us. The staff is generally friendly, although the person who checked us in wasn't very nice and was rude about us having booked through Priceline. We had good service at Cafe Banana except on Monday, March 28th AM when a very young barista could not figure out our order, told us the coffee at the continental breakfast was 'free.' It just seemed like she was more interested in talking to the other person behind the counter instead of making us what we wanted. Other than that the staff was fine, nothing extraordinary. In conclusion, if you are only worried about the airport noise, don't worry, the ocean is amazing and after a while you don't even notice the planes. If you are looking for something stylish, upscale, luxury, this isn't it. In retrospect we should have either paid a few dollars more and stayed some place nicer, or paid a lot less for a cheaper place.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Padge9281
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay and would certainly go again. We knew in advance that the rooms were not going to be the most up-to-date and that didn't bother us especially since we only stayed in the room to sleep (the bed was super comfortable); I also want to note that the view from the balconies are superb. Yes there is noise from the airport but everyone should be aware of that prior to visiting if they do a little research. The staff was extremely friendly from the bell hops to Adrian at the tour center (who was always smiling and extremely helpful), Beatriz at the pool (who always appeared happy to be there) and all the ladies at Bananas. Mickey in Salsa and the entire casino staff made us feel right at home. Being that we were only in for 4 nights we only had dinner once at the Marriott once... Picante. It was a great scene getting to watch the dancers and kicking back some Bacardi Gold and Coke! Following this we went to the jacuzzi, pool and ocean which are all open 24 hours a day! Other dinners were in Old San Juan at Dragonfly Too (excellent), Ritz Carlton's lobby bar (Orlando the bartender is the BEST) and Il Mulino. Absolutely everyone in Puerto Rico is friendly from the hotel staff to taxi drivers, airport employees and random encounters. We always felt welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure if we would stay again. Definate pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: rjkpmk
Reviews.Content: The hotel and grounds are beautiful, as nice as any Marriott we've stayed at. Well maintained, clean, and comfortable. We were greeted with enthusiam by the valet and front desk. It's a great location as far as the beach is concerned. However, the hotel is located directly across the street from the airport runway. The jet noise from landings and takeoffs is unbelievably loud. The planes start very early in the morning and go continuously throughout the day and into the late hours of the evening. Not Courtyard's fault, none the less, it's there! We were greatly disappointed in the service at the hotel bar, restaurant, and pool snack bar. We were seated at the restaurant patio for lunch, and after 5 minutes of waiting for a menu, we left. The next day we tried the pool snack bar. Service there was just as terrible. When we received our lunch, we asked for an additional condiment, the young server brought it when we were finished. We paid our bill with cash and was told, "it may take awhile to get change". So we waited, and waited, and after 10 minutes, yes, 10 minutes, the young girl standing at the counter, reached into her pocket, produced a roll of money that would make Donald Trump look twice and returned with our $6.00. Don't fall for this scam. The snack bar inside the hotel, Bananas is the exception. The girls working there were friendly, attentive and did an outstanding job. I indicated I would recommend this hotel, but read all the reviews first.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Property, But With One Fatal Flaw”
Reviews.Author: BHL
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights at the Courtyard in February 2011. On previous visits to San Juan I've stayed in Condado, but this time I wanted something beachfront and thought I'd give Isla Verde a try. This is a lovely property, but unfortunately I would not be able to recommend it. The pros: beachfront location, friendly staff, clean & spacious rooms, plenty of dining options and a great live music scene Wednesday through Sunday nights The cons: the walls are paper-thin; lots of people on this site complained about the sound of the airplanes, but for me it was the interior noise that was really a problem. All the doors slam shut, and I could hear everything that was dropped on the floor of the room above me. The people next door were some loud frat boys one night, and then a group of southerners with children a couple days later, and I was privy to all of their conversations. I could even hear someone yawn. You know the walls are thin when you can hear someone yawn. Between the noise and the bed that was much too soft for my taste, it was a pretty sleepless trip. It's a shame, because otherwise it was really nice property. As others have noted, there are hefty "resort fees" attached, so make sure you're really going to use all of the amenities of the property before you decide to book. It doesn't make sense to pay for something you're not going to take advantage of. And if you don't rent a car, be prepared to shell out a lot of cash for cabs. A one-way trip to San Juan Vieja is about $20, but you can walk down the street and catch the city bus for 75 cents. There's not a lot within walking distance, so you can feel a bit isolated. Further down in Isla Verde there are other hotels with more stores and restaurants nearby, but if you really want to just be able to walk around and have lots of choices, Condado is your best bet. I'll be staying there for my next trip, but I'll definitely come back to the Courtyard when they have live music. They had great bands playing salsa, merengue, bachata and boleros. I met some locals who like to come there to dance, which is always a good sign. The lobby area was packed when the bands were there, which was in stark contrast to Monday and Tuesday, when it was dead as a doornail. Again, I went to Condado for some signs of life. One last thing. If you're like me, and you feel like you haven't arrived in PR until you hear the coqui, this definitely isn't your spot. They were very difficult to hear in that particular areas, as opposed to other parts of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: slinger6
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend using Marriott Rewards Points. The staff did go out of their way to recognize us several times for being platinum members (which was nice), but overall, it was average. I read all of the reviews on here before we booked. Most of them were pretty accurate. PROS: beach is pretty empty. You never have to worry about finding a chair on the beach or by the pool. The resort is the last one on the strip as well, which means if you walk down the beach to the right, it's virtually empty. Having the casino was nice, and their Picante bar with Salsa dancing gets pretty busy on the weekends. About a quarter mile walk down the street there are many places to eat and a walgreens to get some snacks. We really enjoyed walking into town each night. The hamocks on the beach are also very nice. Cons: It is literally right by the airport. It can be very loud at times, but all in all, it wasn't that big of a deal. Drinks and food are very expensive at the hotel. I highly suggest going somewhere else for dinner (Spice down the street was amazing. So is La Playita if you are not in a rush). Also-- one of the nicest things about this hotel... Free internet! It's great to have when you want to research things while down there. It is also about a 12 dollar can ride from the airport. One of the cheapest.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with a stunning beach!”
Reviews.Author: reggaesue
Reviews.Content: This hotel while not the prettiest, has one of the most beautiful beaches in all of San Juan! The pool is very nice with the swim up bar. The property is kept very clean and well manicured. The gym was a pleasant surprise! One of the best things about our trip was our beach side waitress Lorraine! She took very good care of us! The only area I feel that is lacking at this location is that there are no scheduled children's activities and programs. Being such a family friendly location, I think this is necessary.

Reviews.Title: “most reiaxing visit”
Reviews.Author: magg60
Reviews.Content: Friendly, efficient staff. Our room was very clean and comfortable, the t.v. did not work very well but we were too busy at the pool and sightseeing to care. There was a choice of restaurants with good food. The location on the beach was fabulous and we would definitly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great for pre or post cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: dreimer043
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night post cruise and wish it could have been longer! A beautiful hotel although a bit expensive. My husband raved about the Caribbean buffet. The kids enjoyed the 24 hour pool and hot tub. Great beach! Would def go back there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Needs a few small Improvements”
Reviews.Author: Lovemesomefoodnyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my boyfriend for two nights (in an ocean front room) at the Courtyard Isla Verde. This was my second stay, the first being two years ago with my mother. While the room was clean, it could have been alot better for the price. The carpet near the terrace door was coming up and detached from the floor. The television did not pick up HD channels and we had to call for it to be replaced with an updated television. While I greatly appreciated the helpful and super kind staff, these things should have been worked out before arrival. But overall the room was standard and clean. Overall we had a good comfy stay at this hotel and would recommend it to families (especially with kids). If you are looking for luxury, then perhaps this is not the hotel, however the beach (Isla Verde), staff, and pool are quite nice! Great parking lot if you rent or own a car. Good salsa and bachata in the lobby on weekend nights.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service-all around”
Reviews.Author: Sarago36
Reviews.Content: We stopped at this hotel for a short time between flights as it is very close to the airport. The service at this hotel is exceptional; from the front desk area to the baggage claim attendants, the restaurant servers, pool staff, beach attendants, they were all extremely friendly, accommodating and pleasant. Whomever runs this hotel has reason to be proud. It is rare to run into this kind of consistently great service, and it was noticed and appreciated. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “We did not want to leave.”
Reviews.Author: 1968Crowdog
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel for the location on the beach. We were not disappointed. We upgraded to ocean front room with balcony. Spectacular view and location. The beach was great. The staff was friendly, helpful, accomodating. Did hear plane noise, but was drowned out by crashing surf. Pool area was large and nice, but spent most of the time on the beach. Service on the beach was outstanding. Not too crowded. Breakfast buffet was excellent. Kind of pricey, but you pay for the location. Hotel value was excellent. Oh, and the bed was extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Vacation.”
Reviews.Author: kitkatjp
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from Feb 11-16th. The hotel is very close to the airport and a flat cab rate of about $11. The front desk staff was great and I was able to upgrade to an ocean front room. I walked in the room and saw the view from my balcony and was amazed. The beach is literally 20 feet from the hotel. The room was great, very clean, had a mini fridge and king sized bed that was quite possibly one of the most comfortable beds that I have ever slept in. I had the patio doors open almost every night and feel asleep to the amazing sound of the ocean waves. You can hear a random plane taking off but to be honest the sound really didnt bother me. The beach was amazing and the attendants there are very quick to help with chairs and umbrellas. The water was nice and the pool was great as well. The food at the Banana Cafe and the pool side bar I found to be priced well. You could get a burger or chicken for about $10 which is good for a resort. The Picante bar does happy hours every day so catch those if you can for drink deals. The concierge was great and booked me on a great tour of the Yunque rainforest and I had a blast. About a $15 taxi ride to Old San Juan. You can take a bus for about $1 but I was on vacation and didnt want to bother. Cant say enough good things about the staff or my stay. I will definately be coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Maizy72
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in this hotel. Everything was excellent, room were clean, modern, food was tasty, beach and pool area beautiful. A very nice place to go with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty disappointing overall”
Reviews.Author: Maycarp
Reviews.Content: Maybe the problem is that we never intended to stay here at all, but a glitch in the reservation at another hotel in San Juan made a late switch necessary and we were sent to the Marriott for an overnight stay. We found it much less attractive than many reviewers on this site. Starting with the positives, the high end restaurant (Sirena) was very good with excellent service and food presentation. The hotel and rooms were clean and reasonably modern as one expects at a Marriott, but the room was not very large. The beach and pool areas seemed pleasant enough, although we did not use them much (others obviously might find these more important). Now the downsides. Perhaps we were unlucky, but check-in was very slow with several people ahead having apparent problems with their reservations. Other service was good. The view from the room's small balcony looking to the right out over the beach was fine as long as you didn't look left to the rundown high rise apartment building next door that looked to be close to demolition status, or down to the a/c, generators and other miscellaneous junk and debris below. The hotel is literally yards away from the airport runway and the noise level on the balcony as jets revved engines for takeoff was truly deafening. Having double doors kept the the noise level in the room to something more reasonable but it could disturb a light sleeper since take-offs continue all night. Overall the hotel seriously lacks ambience and charm, is poorly located apart from the beach, and has only modest characteristics of a resort. It is not a place I would want to do more than spend an overnight near the airport (and for that the Hampton Inn is better value). The price, of course, is quite high and it does not provide a particularly impressive overall value. The price is even less acceptable because of the Puerto Rican intent to aggressively soak tourists, not only with a hotel tax of about 12% but also by adding a daily "resort tax" of $33 making $65 in taxes for one night! Finally, there is no airport shuttle (I haven't found any hotel that has one there) - obviously the taxi drivers have excellent political connections in San Juan and want their cut too. Oh yes, and the slots in the casino seemed pretty tight. You can surely do better if you try.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant holiday & value for money right on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: 186338Traveller1
Reviews.Content: I had a great holiday in San Juan. It was made even better by the fact that I was at this courtyard Marriott that can stand up to any of its equivalent Marriotts in the world. I had a partial Ocean View room on the 6th floor which in my opinion could almost be classed as an ocean view room. Key point is that I could see the ocean from my bed.lol! The rooms were cleaned promptly every day, receptionists were polite friendly and helpful. It was great to have the live bands each night and insight into local night life. I was particularly fascinated by all the salsa dancing by local families of all ages. I really enjoyed the buffet breakfast especially the fresh omelettes that are made as you wait. But best of all the view and ambience by the beach as you have breakfast was brilliant. I had the opportunity to visit someone who was staying at the Ritz Carlton on the same beach. I am very happy to report that Courtyard beach area & sand is much better and the environment is better. Even my room in terms of value for money was easily comparable if not better than the Ritz Carlton. There were plumbing issues on my last night when I got back to the hotel at around 2am. I called reception and immediately a plumber came and resolved the issue and cleaner came and mopped up. So even though there was a slight problem it was resolved very quickly, what more can you ask for? Seems a pity that the Bar in the pool & the pool area seem underutilized and closes early! I guess it is because of lack of use but the fact that it closes early might be why it is under utilized Previous reviewers have complained about plane noise. Personally it was not a problem at all. You cannot hear it in the rooms. Even when you are on the beach, the planes taking off or landing at infrequent time-frames are not much louder than the waves. If/when I go back to San Juan, I shall stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best to know before you go.”
Reviews.Author: BradVanD
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night after our cruise. The location of the hotel is really what made us decide to stay here. The views on the beach are really beautiful and they do a really good job at keeping the common areas clean, especially around the pool and in the lobby. Besides that, we really weren't that impressed. We decided to eat dinner at Picante (one the restaurants inside the lobby) and were shocked at how expensive things were. We split a $14 plate of chicken nachos with cheese that looked, and tasted, like it came straight from the jar. We also ended up talking to the Tours and Excursions desk about visiting Old San Juan. The lady tried telling us that the only to get there was a $20 taxi, each way. We discovered by asking a lady at the bus stop, if you walk up to the bus stop in front of the Denny's the 53 or the 5 (or T5) will take you there for 75 cents and runs every 30 min or so. I don't think the buses take dollar bills so make sure you bring some change. Also, I recommend taking the 53, it goes through a nicer part of town and sticks closer to the beach. The noise in the hotel was a little more than I expected. Just by walking down the hall I could hear conversations in the rooms we were walking by. Also, since the hotel is right next to the airport we heard planes taking off all night. The room wasn't horrible, but it was a little dirty. It seems that if a vacuum can't reach it, it won't get cleaned. So just don't look in the corners or under the bed. Also, the paint looks pretty old on the walls, especially in the bathroom, so it makes the place look older than it actually is. I read some complaints about mold in the bathrooms, but didn't notice any myself. I did notice that there was some garbage behind the toilet that had been left by a previous guest, apparently left unnoticed by the cleaning staff. Overall, we enjoyed out stay, just be aware that you are staying in a tourist part of the city and they try to take advantage of you for that. It is only a 5-10 minute walk up the street to find some local restaurants that aren't as expensive and a Walgreens where you can buy your water or beer. And, I highly recommend a visit to Old San Juan. The old part of the city is so beautiful and reminded my wife of parts of Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Good for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: whatalife
Reviews.Content: Went to Puerto Rico for 2 days with a few friends to sit on the beach, relax and have a nice time. The Courtyard was reasonably priced (in comparison to other hotels) and was a decent location right on the beach. The manager who checked us in was great, as was most of the other staff we dealt with. The Good - Staff, Beach (with service), location - The Bad - our bathroom was partially flooded and they really were not to concerned, we had to ask to be moved. The staff although helpful, always had to confer with their manager before really being able to help. The Ugly - although on the surface the rooms are reasonable, when you look at the corners and the details, it is a worn down hotel with the need of some serious TLC - the lobby is like checking into a Travel Lodge and the Airport is literally in your back yard - and as much as other people have said "no big deal", I think they must be hard of hearing because it was really really really loud, all the time. The rating of 4 1/2 stars by no means is earned - more like a 3 star

Reviews.Title: “surprised”
Reviews.Author: whitneaem
Reviews.Content: 1/23-1/28 vacation. We wanted to see what Puerto Rico had to offer. It was very easy to get around once we learned the bus system(.75c one way one to Ole San Juan ) and rental cars(avg.day rate $43.00). Many places to see yet we would definitely recomend the Rainforest national park(bring rain gear and hiking shoes!). Rent a car to drive to the beaches on the southern half of the Island and drive the East coast up to Fijardo. Take a day and ferry to the Isla of Culebra,absolutely the most beautiful beaches around(Flamenco beach all the facilities you need,just bring a suit and towel). Spend at least a day in Ole San Juan and see the Fort too!. The Bicardi rum factory tour is a must, very informational. The Hotel was clean and comfortable. Liquor and food was very expensive, the Casino was entertaining. Airport noise was noticable but didn't bother us (very tired after a day of running around!) The bed was ok,we've had better at other Marriotts.Partial view of the ocean was nice. Very helpful and cordial doormen and concierge.. The A/C fan was loud even at the low settings

Reviews.Title: “clean, efficient”
Reviews.Author: rach3000
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here overall. However my partial ocean view was hardly that- we saw a sliver of beach when we looked past some ugly orange structure [part of the hotel] and the noise of some fan outside was so loud i couldnt hear the ocean. while the style of the hotel could use some updating, i was mostly ok with that. however, i wish there would be a more comfortable area to lounge around inside. the only places to sit were by restaurants. which was fine, they let you hang out there, but i felt uncomfortable not ordering a drink. the beach hammocks were wonderful, and the pool was beautiful as well. the service was excellent, and we had quite a few requests that were all fulfilled.

Reviews.Title: “Precruise stay”
Reviews.Author: Hols008
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights before catching our carribean cruise. Arrived at 10pm on the first night after a long flight, hotel is only 5 minutes from the airport. Was offered an upgraded room with a better view which i took, but be careful, when i asked how much for the upgrade i was told a price which i assumed was for both nights. Wrong, found out later that this was for each night and once they add on the taxes it was more expensive than i thought. Room was good size, clean, comfortable. Although we were on the top floor so i think the sound of the planes was much louder!! Pool and beach were ok, nothing special, plenty places to eat. theres a casino and the bar has live music in the evening, but pretty crowed then night we stayed as had 2 birthday parties booked. IF you have a problem with planes flying over all day then don't stay here There is a denny's a short walk down from the hotel were we had breakfast but thats about it. The cab to the ship port was about $15 about a 10 minute trip. All in all fine for a couple nights stop over, but would not consider staying for a longer time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach, great value, nice staff, convenient, laid-back atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: dancingledge
Reviews.Content: Pros: gorgeous beach with palm trees, hammocs, lounge chairs, food/bev service, nice pools, friendly staff, convenient to airport, fantastic night life,safe, unpretentious neighborhood setting, reasonable rates. Cons: Occasional airport noise at pool and beach, bathrooms are basic. Housekeeping is O.K., but unreliable. The views from the rooms vary from fabulous to not so great. Ask to see your room. Some of the lower ones have an intimate view of a really ugly roof below. No-see-ums at the beach- bug bites!, The food is just OK If you are looking for an uncomplicated, economical beach get-away, this is the place. Literally a 5 minute taxi drive from the San Juan airport, is this wonderfully laid-back resort is situated directly on a stunning streach of beach. It has most of the amenities of a large resort without the crowds and pretention. The swimming pools were a perfect temperature, with a swim-up bar. Lounge chairs,palm trees, and food/beverage service at the pool and the beach. Umbrellas at the beach upon request. Several convenient dining options on premises- more within an easy walking distance, as well as a Walgreens and (overpriced) liquor store. We decided not to rent a car, and were happy about that. There is plenty of public transportation- taxis and busses. A car would be handy for day trips, but we enjoyed the resort so much that we didn't feel the need to tour much. We only had 4 days. We took a taxi to Old San Juan.-$19. Busses are also available if you have the time. The taxi fares are regulated from the airport, and you are told what the fare will be before you get in. It was $10 plus $1 for my suitcase. I joined my friend at the resort. First time in PR. We were pleasantly surprised at how nice everyone was to us. We also felt very safe. (Two females) walked the beach and neighborhood at night without a worry. During our entire trip we never encounterd beggars or peddlers, on the beach or anywhere else. That was a nice change from other island I have been to. The hotel is right on the beach. The beach, the pools, and the restaurants all flow into eachother. That was great. The nightlife at the hotel is fantastic. Especially Friday and Sat nights. There are really good latin bands playing, and hords of locals come to dance salsa. It was so much fun to watch. There is a casino there, but I can't comment on that, as I know nothing about casinos. The bar, lobby, and casino are all open to eachother, and the place was hopping when I went up to my room at 1:30 a.m. To sum it up, I think this hotel offers a great value if you are willing to overlook the sounds of an occasional jet taking off and landing in clear earshot. You only notice it at the beach and pool, which are so lovely, that it is easy to forgive the intrusion of an occasional sonic boom. The rooms are very quiet. Close the double sliding glass patio doors, and you won't hear a thing from inside or outside the hotel. If you like the beach, you will like this place. If you like to relax, you will like this place. If you like Salsa music, you will really like this place. It might be a little boring for older kids and teens, as it seems more geared to adults. There are, however, kiddie pools for the very young. We love good food, and were not impressed with anyplace we ate, no matter the cost. Everything seemed very dry- fish, pork, chicken. Rice and beans were better. For convenience on our first night, we ate at Serena's at the hotel. It had a lovely atmosphere in a beachside setting, but the food was expensive, and our fish was so dry. I didn't think it was worth it. You can sit at those same tables during the day for free. We ate dinner at the Metropole 2 nights. It is walking distance from the hotel- a local spot. The food was OK there, also dry, but 1/3 of the price. Another night we went to an expensive tapas place in the old city that all the guide books recommend, and thought it was a rip-off. The worst paella I ever had. Basically $28 for a plate of rice with a few bits of seafood in it. My advise- eat cheep. The expensive places aren't any better. We did have lunch at the pool-side grill 2 days for convenience, and that was nice. I liked the fact that there were convenient dining options on site, as well as others to walk to. If you vacation in this area, be prepared with bug spray, and/or some kind of anti-itch cream, or antihistimine. I got bitten badly by the no-see-ums at the beach. My friend did not, so it depends on the person. But I was happy to have some benedryl on hand in the middle of the night when I was itching like mad.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ory123456
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights (1/23) and had a wonderful time. The beach/pool is so beautiful and our kids (ages 9-16) had a great time. Great service and the staff are so nice. They're offering complimentary Coffee, Danishes and Cakes until 10:30 every morning and live music every night from Wednesday-Sunday . Great location (very close to the airport). We were concerned about the noise from the airport before we booked for this hotel, however when we got there, we didn't noticed any noise until late in the afternoon and even then it didn't bother us at all since we were so busy enjoying the beach. If I'll go back to PR, I will definitely stay in Courtyard by Marriott again and will recommend this hotel to everyone. Can't wait for next time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: amyinwi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard Isla Verde for a week in January 2011. We chose this hotel because we were looking for something tropical but ultra convenient since we were traveling with our 10 month old son.Â  We chose it for it's location but that was also my major concern. It is literally right across the street from the airport runway. It turned out this was a not a big deal at all. I really only noticed the planes a handful of times and was only bothered by them once or twice.Â  The location is beautiful. The grounds are lush and well maintained. The pool area is very nice and surrounded by palm trees.Â  The rooms were clean and the beds are exceptionally comfortable. My only small complaint is that the view from the lower floors included a not so lovely view of the roof of the lower part of the building. At check in they did offer to upgrade us at no charge to a room on a higher floor with a better view but they didn't have any rooms with a king bed on that floor so we opted to stay on the lower floor. However, I didn't spend much time on our balcony because of it.Â  There are several restaurants and the food is good, but a little pricey, at all of those we tried. The live salsa music in the lobby bar is a highlight. Our son sat for an hour one night just listening to it. The hotel is only about a 10 min walk to several other restaurants. There is also a Walgreens in that area. We found a very large, very nice grocery store about a 20 min walk away. There is very very little in the way of other shopping near the hotel which I found surprising given the large number of hotels there.Â  The best part of our stay was the exceptional service. The front desk staff was very welcoming and helpful. There was a mixup with our reservation when we arrived and they immediately resolved it. We also had exceptional service several evenings in the Picante Bar and Iris at the Banana Cafe was fantastic. She was so kind to our son, extremely thoughtful and even remembered our drink orders each time we came.Â

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, close to airport”
Reviews.Author: Ednedfred
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights this month while on business. The hotel is located right on the beach and, is extremely close to the airport. You could walk to the airport (assuming no fences along the way) in ten minutes. Otherwise, it's a $10 cab ride. Airport noise never really bothered me; I just didn't notice it. Overall the hotel is similar to other, newer Courtyards in the U.S. Check-in was very easy and the rates and everything else was as it should be. The main floor is very open with a casino on the right, a bar and restaurant in the center portion, and an ice cream parlor and small snack bar as well. If you are traveling with kids, the casino is tastefully done so that is not offensive for families. The beach is very nice, as is the pool. There were plenty of chairs and towels at both. The fitness facility was fine and overlooked the pool. We ate dinner one night at the main restaurant and it was excellent. We were able to sit outside and the warm weather was nice. The rooms are very clean and serviced daily. Iâ€™m pretty easy to please since I travel so much on business, however I would bring my family here in a minute. Assorted other stuff - The casino is a full-service casino with lots of slots, craps tables, card games, and other gambling games. I won $20 bucks playing blackjack and called it a night. They have entertainment some nights in the area next to the main bar. They were teaching people how to salsa. Those who participated appeared to have fun. If you need to get a cab from the hotel, there are plenty and wait times are in seconds, not minutes. Safety was never an issue as the grounds were well maintained and patrolled. Old San Juan is about a 20 minute cab ride away. Itâ€™s a nice spot for a quick stop or to spend a few days. Iâ€™ll stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Bring Your Dancing Shoes & Your Sunblock to Courtyard/Isla Verde!”
Reviews.Author: GringaGrrrl
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel...it's got a lot of personality! The main lobby offers a casino, fantastic open lobby lounge with seriously some of the best local salsa bands (Weds-Sat) in Puerto Rico. They even offer free salsa lessons Thursdays at 8PM! The beach is very well-maintained and the pool is set in a very lush tropical landscape! There are double hammocks lining the beach for guests. The only drawback was the food prices, a bit too high (you'd be amazed how inexpensively one can eat in PR if you go to the local places). So, I just bought muffins and enjoyed breakfast in bed with coffee from the in-room coffee maker which suited me fine. Besides, it's fun to sleep in a bit and catch "The Flintstones" on TV in SPANISH! What a hoot! The truth is, once you leave the lobby and go upstairs, the hotel is blissfully quiet and I slept well each night. Each room has a mini-fridge so if you like "real" milk in your coffee, you can buy some and store it there. There's a lovely guy from "Down South" who is at the Tour Desk in the AM's, great guy, the hotel offers many guided tours with transportation, definitely sign up! Great hotel, clean and the setting is totally TrOpIcAL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great beach - close to airport - if you don't mind the planes”
Reviews.Author: rwgrncrd
Reviews.Content: We didn't find the noise of the planes taking off distracting. The rooms were huge, with a great view. The service was good and the location was great. We enjoyed the bar and restaurant for dinner. We were told the only option for breakfast was an expensive buffet which was a little over-priced. On the whole we enjoyed the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Even better”
Reviews.Author: Phillylad
Reviews.Content: Fourth trip: this is a great value for anyone wanting to crash on the beach or hang at a set of nice pools. Very much a family place, so children are always around during the day. Breakfast is o.k.; lobby grill is also o.k. (though sometimes overwhelmed). Staff are always pleasant, and well-trained. Very clean. This location is on the edge of San Juan: not really close to anything except its own neighborhood, the airport (right across the boulevard!), the Ritz-Carlton, and a couple of excellent local restaurants (this is a residential neighborhood basically). Several times a day in your room or around the pools or on beach, you'll hear jets blasting away at the airport. This will either be a small or a big deal. Big price differences depending on how much ocean/beach view you do/don't get.

Reviews.Title: “AIRPLANES!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LuckyPuddin
