Reviews.Content: This is a very nice place to stay but just keep in mind that you are not far from the airport and all you hear from 6am to midnight is airplanes and jets taking off and landing. We would only recommend that this a transit point...

Reviews.Title: “It's the little things that make a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: waterbabyNY54
Reviews.Content: It's the little things that make a great hotel...... >sleep late if you want.....there are plenty of lounges & umbrellas by the pool or beach >well kept beautiful grounds with 4 pools & a hot tub >drink & food service everywhere including to your lounger at the beach! >live salsa music most nights >coffee served with steamed milk >flat screen TVs with high-def channels >showers have bowed shower rods (no annoying clinging shower curtains) & Speakman shower heads >extra beach towels if you so desire >exceptionally friendly & courteous service by all we came in contact with >management very visible & genuinely interested Airport noise not an issue for us. Breakfast buffet was great, with lots of choices. For you "foodies" the hotel is a $15 taxi ride to one of the finer restaurants in San Juan, Chef Mario Pagan's "Laurel" at the Museum of Art (so good we ate there twice!)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: TAIBORI
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my spouse, in-laws, and my children ages 4 and 10. Everyone loved this hotel. They have a casino, pool, gym, and situated right along the beach. Beautiful scenery! The buffet breakfast was pricey but fair given it is located in a tourist area but absolutely great! The have awesome local bands playing every night and welcome families on their dance floors which were a plus since the inlaws ran off to the casino. The staff was very friendly. It is also about a 15-20 min. drive to San Juan. Definitely close to alot of restaurants and local shops. We stayed in Puerto Rico for 2 weeks and stayed here for about 4 nights, Wyndhm Rio Grande, and rental vacation homes. This hotel was by far our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe I Expected Too Much...”
Reviews.Author: jc072
Reviews.Content: First the good: Hotel is right on the beach - it was awesome being able to look out at the ocean while we ate breakfast, and after take a stroll on the beach or just get right to laying out. The pool area is also nice and clean. The rooms are spacious and beds are very comfortable. The casino was great (probably my favorite part - although I'm not a huge gambler). Food at Salsa/Banana's/Papaya was decent. Now the bad/annoying: Service - Perhaps everyone is just on island time, but I felt the speed of service at the hotel (and literally everywhere we went on the island) was atrocious. The "best" were probably the waiter's at Salsa (all they had to do was bring us drinks though), and the cashier's at the casino were fairly quick. The worst were the people at Banana's Cafe - absolutely the worst service I've gotten anywhere. Took them 20 minutes to make some icecream for us (ran out of BANANAS of all things), and the day we left we ordered hotdogs - of which they had zero ready. It took a HALF HOUR to get 2 hotdogs. Word of advice, when you go out to eat, ask for the check way earlier - like well before you're finished eating. Otherwise you'll be lucky to get it before it's time for your next meal (this goes for all local restaurants/bars as well). And forget about getting anything in a remotely timely fashion at Papaya (the outdoor grill/pool bar). First day we got there we ordered a burger and two mixed drinks, and once again waited 25 minutes before we went up and asked where the blank our food was, at which point they started making it. Wonderful. And ordering drinks on the beach if you're already thirsty is a death sentence in that hot sun. It'll take 20 minutes to get back to you. I understand that there are many guests and I'm sure the staff is very busy, but it still takes much longer to get anything than it should. And for someone on vacation who wants to do as many things as possible in a compressed amount of time, this is beyond annoying. Which is a major let down, because so many reviews we read spoke so highly of the staff (not to say that they weren't friendly, but I was by no means impressed with them - I've gotten the same level of service at Motel 6). Other minor annoyances- -The pump/generator that powers the bubbles for the jacuzzi has a high pitched whine. Got used to it after a while, but it was still pretty annoying. -The planes at the airport across the street could sometimes ruin the atmosphere, but this wasn't a huge deal (we live next to train tracks so we're kind of used to stuff like that) -The "Resort Fees" - other reviewers had warned of these, but they were quite a bit more than I had planned on. Expect an extra $50-60 per night on top of whatever rate you paid for the room. I know this isn't necessarily the hotel's fault, but it still impacted my opinion. -There seemed to be a different requirement to get towels literally every time we got them. One day we could just get them by asking. The next we gave our room number and needed wristbands (which is lame, since most people are out there to tan!). The next day it was wristbands, room number, and signing a piece of paper. It just got old really fast, especially since I could just take my wristband off and walk up and get another towel w/o question (what was the point?). -Be sure to spray down with bug spray before going to the beach, you'll get annoying, itchy bug bites otherwise. Pick up some of your own at Walgreen's. Probably also wouldn't hurt to have some "after bite" cream handy as well. -The sand on the beach is pretty grainy and not all that great. If you're a Florida traveler, the sand is more akin to the Atlantic Side (Daytona, Cocoa, etc) than the Gulf Side (Pensicola, Destin, St. Pete area, etc). Just don't go there expecting it to be some kind of white, shimmering sand (not really the hotel's fault, just an observation). ---ADVICE--- If you go here, get your booze at Mad Dog down the road by Walgreens - Unless you enjoy paying $10 for a mixed drink and $5 for a beer (+tip). Maybe I'm a cheepskate (or an alcoholic), but getting a fifth and some mixers for the week kept the cost WAY down. Staff there was very helpful - we got the BEST service at the liquor store than anywhere else on the island. If you decide to visit Old San Juan, and want to do it on the cheap via the bus system, be prepared to wait at the bus stop indefinitely. Bus drivers are also on island time, and just sort of come and go whenever they feel like it. We were going to go one day, waited for an hour in the hot sun, then said screw it. Tried again the next day and waited 45mins and the bus finally came. Go ahead, ask the front desk what the bus schedule is. They'll say "there isn't really a schedule." On the plus side, the 2 of us got to Old San Juan for $3 round trip. On the down side, the bus drivers are clinically insane and you have to deal with the constant nagging fear of getting stabbed. ---SUMMARY--- I wasn't super impressed with the hotel in general.I felt it was lacking in some form on almost every level (some much more extreme than others). I also just wasn't very impressed with the island itself. If I had to plan this vacation all over again, I would have chosen a different location entirely. Puerto Rico is cool in that it's still America (sort of), and it can be relatively inexpensive. But this hotel and the island were certainly not what I was expecting, and I highly doubt I would return. Although despite my mostly negative review, we still had a fun vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great anniversary stay”
Reviews.Author: mbeach89
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently celebrated our 10th anniversary over the New Year holiday at this wonderful hotel. We arrived from the freezing cold of Ohio to a warm 80 degrees in beautiful Puerto Rico. Check in went smoothly and we had a room with a great ocean view on the 11th floor. Some previous posters mentioned the noise from the clubs/casino, but not an issue at all on the 11th floor. We are timeshare owners at Oceanwatch Myrtle Beach, and we are accustomed to the clean, quality standards found at Marriotts. This hotel did not disappoint! Top notch all the way. Jose Padin, the general mgr. and his staff went above and beyond expectations in making our anniversary a very special one. So thank you Mr. Padin and staff! The breakfast buffet at Salsa restaurant was very good. I particularly liked the omelets made to order! No grits though?!?!? Those must not be popular in Puerto Rico. LOL I wish I could remember the rum drink my wife absolutely loved that (if I understood correctly) was invented by one of the bartenders (Jorge' ?). If interested, it is listed at the bottom of the cocktail menu. New Years Eve they had a salsa band come in to perform for a huge crowd. I only wish I knew how to salsa...or dance at all! Everyone was having a blast! The Beach was clean ....and of course I stayed out too long and got sunburned badly. Do not forget your sunscreen (This sure ain't Ohio sun down here!). Pool areas were clean, and I especially enjoyed the jacuzzi. Smoking area for my wife was appreciated. Don't miss Old San Juan! We enjoyed del Morro, Parrot Club bar, Racia's restaurant. I will have to learn to Salsa at my next visit . *note . they do offer Salsa dance lessons Thursday nights at Picante there in the hotel...but I was too chicken to try.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: Emil14
Reviews.Content: We just returned from seven days (because of the Northeast Blizzard) at the Courtyard Isla Verde and were pleasantly surprised. Usually Courtyards are for quick business trips, not vacations. We chose the hotel because we had Marriott points and we did not want to stay at the Marriott Stellaris again due to a bad experience a few years ago. The staff are friendly, kind and helpful. The room was nice with comfortable beds. The casino is fun. The food at the restaurants was very good. Not five star dining, but we weren't expecting that. The best part of the hotel is the beach and pool area. It's large, clean, there are plenty of chairs and a helpful staff. I also have to compliment the staff because when they heard we were stranded due to the blizzard, they booked us for two extra nights at only 99$ a night until we could get our flight home. If you want to stay at a laid back, friendly hotel in San Juan, then I would definitely recommend the Courtyard Isla Verde. We're already planning on going back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel as long as you remember it is a courtyard not a resort”
Reviews.Author: MarkNH
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights after our flight home was cancelled. Check-in was efficient and pleasant although as Marriott Gold we were a little disappointed to be upgraded to a 9th floor room on the "partial ocean view" side of the hotel instead of the "pool view" side of the hotel (partial ocean view means the ocean is off to the side and you are looking directly into some older apartments). The room itself was very nice with a comfortable king size bed and lots of space, the bathroom was a little cramped and dated and the balcony was small with hot air blowing onto my legs. The AC in the room was very good and the housekeeping staff did a good job of keeping everything clean and tidy. The lobby bar was nice and we liked the complimentary coffee every morning. We didn't eat at the hotel as the main restaurant had a Puerto-Rican buffet every night and the nicer restaurant was closed. The pool and beach area were very nice, the beach is wide and the staff are attentive and go out of their way to make sure everyone is happy and comfortable, the pool area has a nice swim up bar, neither the pool or beach were crowded when we were there as it was cloudy most of the time but despite the lack of sun it was relaxing to sit on the beach looking at the ocean. During the day there was a lot of noise from planes taking off but it didn't bother us in the evening and at night as the balcony door was well soundproofed and there were fewer takeoffs. There is a walgreens about 10 minutes walk down the street and a few nice local restaurants but to get into Old San Juan for shopping and restaurants you have to take a 15 minute cab ride (costing $19 plus tip each way).

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel to relax and enjoy the beach”
Reviews.Author: Galant
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard for one night. The Hotel is located 1 mile away from the Luis Munoz Marin International Airport (SJU). It have an airport shuttle. Hotel is very clean, the rooms are neat and beds soft. Great to sleep. Air conditioner was great. The hotel is in front of the beach were you can surf, swim or simply enjoy the view as much as you want. . It have a restaurant and a casino inside. There is live music to dance and the facilities were very clean. Employees were very friendly and helpful. There is buffet breakfast for $15.00, but you can have a continental one for $6.00. You can drink and dance. Drinks are $5.00 each one, average. Security and environment is very nice. Parking is $2.50 per hour, if you stay, ask in the lobby, they can charge your room only $16.00 per day. Because of its location, you can travel to any part of San Juan in a beat. There is a restaurant just less tha 1 mile away. Is the Metropol Restaurant. We went there and food was excellent. I recommend you this hotel i am sure you will enjoy it. See my pictures you will see why.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kingfish10
Reviews.Content: Stayed a number of times at this hotel over the past several years, primarily because of its location (beach front). The rooms are spacious and generally clean -- hotel staff are pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Full resort right on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: GabyLawry
Reviews.Content: The hotel was every bit great. We had a car and parking wasn't cheap. To 'Self Park' costs 15 bucks a day or the valet service was 20 dollars a day. Check-in went smooth, the room was clean, and the bed was extremely comfortable, the hotel service was good as well. Our room had a 3/4 view of the ocean with a walkout balcony, it gave us a wonderful view when we woke up. They gave us 2 complimentary bottles of water everyday. (they were kind of small bottles but satisfactory). On the weekends they have a live Salsa band in the main lobby and it gets crowded with a diverse crowd of guests and locals. Very nice atmosphere. ...The beach was spacious, had hammocks and the water was warm. The beach service had waiters to take your drink or food orders and bring it right to you on the sand or poolside. LOCATION: The hotel was at the end of the strip and is a long walk to the main strip. One major compliment was to the gentleman who gives advice and instructions in the lobby. I wish i could remember his name... but i cant remember it. He was knowledgeable and very helpful. He gave us great advice and directions to the places we wanted to see. Bacardi Factory etc..

Reviews.Title: “Rocky start but great ending avoided Francisco”
Reviews.Author: vcampo2006
Reviews.Content: We book our stay through expedia to take advantage of the $25 per day Food and Beverage credit they offered. We arrived at 2am on Friday, November 26 and were greeted by Francisco. Although he thought he was being accommodating fell miserable short from just that. We had to wait for a room in the lobby like homeless people until 4:30am which made my slight cold turn into a full blown flu because the lobby as anyone who has stayed at this hotel knows is like being in a refrigerator. I didn't understand why waiting for a room for 2.5 hours was such a requirement since we saw no one checking out at 4:30 am. Either way I was not about to let the pompous Francisco ruin my vacation and thank God never saw him the rest of our stay. We did try to complain about our unreasonable wait to the manager the next day, but realize that there would be no remedy for such a thing. I also fail to mention we had booked a non smoking room, but I guess since Francisco wasn't done with us yet he decided to put my coughing up a storm self in a room that had extreme evidence of smoke. So now my little cold that change to the flu was combine with an almost asthma attack. Now trying to use our $25 daily credit was another advanture in itself. It was virtually impossible to get this credit, because everytime we tried to use the credit we were looked as aliens for even mentioning that we had a credit as though I made the whole thing up. I really didn't think the customer service was to par as everyone else has mentioned maybe it's because we looked like locals so why bother right?. Either way the hotel itself is beautiful and if you like to be around a mature crowd than this is the place for you. At night they have a salsa band and great ambience for the mature crowd. We did notice that it was cougar central. We had a great time at the pool and beach. It does get quite noisy because you are directly behind the airport, but like anything else in life you get use to it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach and pool with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: dixiebelle06
Reviews.Content: My husband, son (17 months) and I stayed at this hotel in mid October 2010 for 5 days. We absolutely loved it. The pool area and beach are just wonderful. They even have 2 pools for the kids. One is a baby pool that is about 18 inches deep and the other that is larger and 3 feet deep with a small slide. The landscaping around the pool is very lush and tropical and the swim up bar is great. We ate most of our meals at the hotel and the food was very good. There were a few nights with live entertainment and if you opt for the buffet it always changed so you never got the same choices. The most outstanding part of our stay was the service. The staff is wonderfully polite and accommodating. The food and bev manager Angel went out of his way to accommodate us and was always friendly. We felt like our business was very much appreciated. I gave the hotel a very good rating and not an excellent rating for 2 reasons. First, the bathrooms in the rooms should be updated to be considered excellent. Second and most unfortunately, the hotel is right off the runway and it is noisy when the planes take off. I say that this is unfortunate because this hotel is a little slice of heaven, but it can be loud. Our room was on the side of the hotel and I would imagine that the rooms that directly face the ocean do not get as much noise from the planes. The planes don't take off constantly and must use another runway sometime because there are long periods of quiet. If you are going for a party weekend I doubt that you would even notice it much. Two more things....there is a Walgreens within walking distance if you need supplies. Also, the hotel provides free bottled water which was a BIG plus for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beachfront Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nebraskatraveler26
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Marriott one night post-cruise (and used Marriott rewards points, so cannot comment on the price) Checked in around noon, but since our room was not ready yet, we were given a pager that would notify us when it was. Only had to wait about 45 minutes for the room. While we waited, we ate at the hotel's beachfront grill. Food was okay, but it was kind of over priced. There was another restaurant located in the hotel, but it too looked kind of pricey (although I'm sure their prices were on par to what you'd find in most Marriott-type hotels). We had a king-sized bed and a room with a small balcony, and both the room and the bathroom were quite large (however, a little outdated). Everything was clean. The pool and hot tub at the resort were very nice and clean as well. Beach was great! Did not go in the casino. Would not hesitate to stay here again. One tip: If you walk about 5 minutes to the right of the main entrance, you will find several restaurants and a Walgreens. Also, there is a small business center in the hotel where you can access the computers and Internet for free.

Reviews.Title: “Don't overlook this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DIZNISE
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for its value and proximity to the airport. I didn't imagine I would have access to the many amenities the hotel offers. The bar area with dance floor was hopping with one of the best bands playing spanish music. Good size casino with many gaming options. The service at check-in (and out) was superior. The room was spacious, clean and had a beautiful view of the ocean. The bed was very comfortable and the sheets soft. There is a parking garage on site and there is a fee. Although the sounds of the airport may bother some, I found the location to be convenient to shops, restaurants and nightlife. I wish we could have spent more time enjoying the beautiful pool and beach front hammocks. Although some may not be happy with the taxes and fees, remember where you are...right on the beach in a hot spot. Value received for price paid - well WELL worth it! Great hotel for a cruiser or spending the night before the flight.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff make this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ss99999
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel frequently during the last 6 months while working on a project in Puerto Rico. The hotel is nice - not fancy, but right on the beach with a lovely view and a very nice pool area with 2 resident iguanas! (not in the pool). The other reviewers are correct there is some airplane noise because it is close to the airport, and the rooms are pretty standard, but it is still worth a visit. But it is truly the staff that make this hotel. Everyone was wonderful, always greeted me with a friendly Welcome Back and excellent service. And while all the restaurants and snack bars are very good, definitely try Sirena for a wonderfully relaxing meal overlooking the ocean listening to the waves crashing and with excellent food! I would return to this hotel in a minute should the opportunity arise!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Nista7
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel - located in the Carolina area (barely). close to the airport and a short walk to buses. Take the T9 or 53 bus to downtown Old San Juan. You can catch both at the bus stop in front of Denny's about a 8 minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great short stay”
Reviews.Author: Do3008
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 days and 2 nights before going on a Cruise. Location was fine since it is near the airport we landed at. So close to the airport that we ear and "feel" the planes!! ;-) (we didn't mind since se live near an airport - but someone could be either annoyed by the noise). The hotel is right on the beach - which is great Beach is clean and not crowdy at all Sunsets are fantastic! Room is perfectly clean. A little bit smaller than expected but ok. The food is "ok" and a bit too expensive for the "buffet" style. Location of the hotel is good to have taxi and near airport... but nowhere near other restaurants (absolutely need a taxi to go somewhere else). Overall, we were happy with our choice. If there would be a next time, I would stay closer to Old San Juan to be able to walk and visit without having to go by taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: chipat78
Reviews.Content: The place was great but the location was at the end of the hotel area which wasn't too bad, you had to walk 10 minutes to get food. Other than that the beach was great and the swimming pool was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding / Honeymoon......fabulous the time of our lives.....”
Reviews.Author: snagga72
Reviews.Content: Almost a year now and still we brag to our friends and family about your the Marriott Courtyard in Isla Verde. Our experience was fabulous, have a great time, everything was there no need to go out. Live music in the lounge, casino and entertainment for kids, too. We dine in the Sirena Restaurant which was very romantic outside under the stars. The food there very delicious and with good 'sazon' 'al diente', I know due I work for an Executive Chef in the Fontainebleau in MB. Even though I'm local and my husband is from St. Thomas it was our first time and will be our landmark, especially fo Christmas time. The staff was kind and take time one-on-one to tell you about the resort and the surroundings. Our room was excellent and cozy, the bed WOW! You can really rest, definetly we will come back for more fun!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it”
Reviews.Author: fynexio
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the 3rd time this summer. You just can't beat having the beach (the best in San Juan) within walking distance from the pool & hotel. My daughter & I love the swim up bar/grill. The hammocks are great! Great service and make sure to get the ocean view. Spectacular sunsets!! The food is a little expensive but there are so many places in walking distance to get food at more economical prices, and refrigerators in the rooms to keep the food. We will keep going back!

Reviews.Title: “Weight the Good and the Bad”
Reviews.Author: Harlemnite
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel September 4th to September 7th and booked the package through Price line. Since the trip was pre-paid I only expected the usually extra expenses (i.e. food, tips etc). At the end of my stay I was quite surprised to find out the Hotel charged me $9.95 per day as a resort fee. I re-read all my Price line documents and I could not find any information about such additional fees other than parking, food etc. I have bought several vacation packages through Price line at locations/resorts that were of a higher caliber than the Marriott and were never charged extra fees at the end of my stay. That is the bad. The good is the hotel is a clean, safe centrally located place to stay in PR. The staff is friendly, the beach is great and the casino is fun. In other words it is an average hotel. Yes the food and drink prices at the hotel restaurants are a bit over priced but there are several places within walking distance for you to choose from including â€œDennysâ€�.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Poor service”
Reviews.Author: Ileana1
Reviews.Content: Last year in november I stayed with my family in this hotel on a shopping trip; I put in the safe every room provides $450.00 in cash. I closed it with the "only key" the safe had and went out with some friends...The next day when I went looking for the money in order to go shopping...it was gone!!! I talked with the Manager she told me there was only ONE KEY for that safe and that it wasn't possible to make a copy due to "the special device" the key had....Despite that, I MADE A COPY of the key to demonstrate it was possible....The manager NEVER made an investigation to find out Who took the money.....LOUSY SERVICE

Reviews.Title: “Magical journey and family reunion thanks to the staff and hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ldb01983
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived all 13 of us we felt welcome and pampered. The staff bent over backwards to make sure that all our needs were taken care of and the age range in our group was 88 to 2.5 and everyone felt that they were cared for the most. They arranged special dinners for us with our own printed menus as well as set up banquet tables and staffed them for meals in whatever area we wanted. The rooms were well appointed and housekeeping was more than willing to respond to any needs. The ocean view was spectacular and the proximity to the airport was not in anyway a hindrance and in the room with the double sliding glass doors you could not even hear them. The snorkeling/swimming tour that we took from the hotel was very well thought out. I would give this hotel and the staff at it the highest accolades available, and having been a travel agent in the past I had the opportunity to travel all over the world and this trip ranks up there with the best.

Reviews.Title: “Nice start to a vacation here”
Reviews.Author: shooshman
Reviews.Content: I am writing from the Courtyard Marriott Isa Verde. We will be staying here for 5 days. Arrived yesterday. Great check in experience and request for adjoining rooms taken care of. This hotel is on the beach and has several swimming pools including a kids pool. Water is warm , loved the kiddie pool and the play area as we have kids with us. Isla Verde beach is nice and clean and the stretch is about 2 miles long. Seems like only Courtyard Marriott and the neighborhood Ritz Carlton offer beach chair services to guests. Was lovely to watch the stars from the hammocks adjoining the hotel. Hotel has food options for different budgets. We had snacks at the Papaya at the poolside. Tasted Medalla for the first time but will prefer Presidente ( from the neighboring Dominican republic). Staff are very courteous across all the places. After the beach and pool we went for a walk to Walgreens maybe 1/3 mile - took kids in strollers. Got supplies for breakfast. for beer and wine we need to go to Pueblo. Decided to have dinner at a new restaurant called SPICE ( very reasonable and fantastic experience) Back to the hotel and hang around in the active lobby nice first day. Heard about 2 planes take off when we were at the beach but the waves are making more noise than the planes and I noticed only because my toddler likes planes. Look forward to my Day 2 report . Don't feel like opening my laptop as I am enjoying this vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time had by all”
Reviews.Author: Toot18
Reviews.Content: We had a family reunion at this hotel. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Chapman097
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was everything we had read on Trip Advisor and more! We selected this Hotel due primarily reviews we read. NOT disappointed.We stayed here for four nights. Staff was very pleasant and helpful throughout our stay specially Moryma (front desk) is fabulous she make our experience wonderful. The room was very smart, clean and well presented with a comfortable bed. We only ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant but food was of good quality. The pool area was nicely maintained

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on the strip on beautiful secluded beach...very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Niccibabi
Reviews.Content: I was very leery on staying here after reading some of the recent reviews. But I am glad that I chose this hotel as apposed to the other big name hotels that were double the price. The beach was wonderful, it wasn't crowded with a lot of locals, very relaxing and more private than alot of the other beaches. Great location, only a 30 minute drive to the rainforest , 5 mins from the airport and 10 mins to San Juan. I was not impressed with the food on Isla Verde Ave. The hotel restaraunt- Salsa was so much better, although the continental breakfast for $6 was so not worth it ( but everyone knows that hotel food is expensive). The parking rate was my only complaint-- at $16 per day. I felt very safe, even late at night by the pool area or lying in the hammocks on the beach. The room was a great size, the bathroom was outdated..but clean. the bed was very comfortable. The staff was great. Thinking back , I wish that I would have stayed at the hotel and relaxed more instead of driving around everyday-- COMPLETE CHAOS, SCARY and DANGEROUS!! I would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Resort”
Reviews.Author: truflight7
Reviews.Content: I was born in Puerto Rico and go there every 2 years to visit family. This was the first time we have stayed at the Courtyard and from now on I will stay at this hotel every time I go back! I will never ever go to another hotel. This hotel really has their act together. From the minute we checked in the customer service was outstanding. All the employees are well trained and always had a smile on their face. The valet employees and Rafael (front desk) really treated us to a fantastic reception as soon as we arrived. We spent 7 nights with 2 rooms. (One for us and one for the kids) I truly believe that the pool and the beach are way better than the condado area and the other side of isla verde (main strip) The value for your money is the best. (I have stayed at 4 different hotels in isla verde) The customer service was above and beyond what you would expect from a busy tourist destination. I felt at all times that I was a VIP. It is an excellent location. Only 15 minutes from downtime San Juan and about a 45 minute drive to El Yunque (Rainforest) It is located on a Blue Flag beach. I feel it is the prettiest beach in all of Puerto Rico. I recommend to anybody visiting Puerto Rico to stay at this Courtyard by Marriott on Isla Verde. As somebody who visits every 2 years this has been the best stay I have ever experienced. The value, friendliness of the staff, and customer service is some of the best in THE WORLD. Great job to the Courtyard by Marriott-Isla Verde staff!!! Job well done. You have made me a repeat customer!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good beach, but loud airplane noise and uncomfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: screennamerandomness
Reviews.Content: Went to Puerto Rico to rest and relax and was pleased with the reviews on TripAdvisor, so we booked it. Pros: Hotel staff were generally very nice and helpful. Right on the beach and two nice pool (three if you count the baby pool). The food was good for hotel food and (other than the breakfast) not all that expensive. Easy taxi ride to the airport and Old San Juan. Rooms were clean and had good water pressure. It seemed that 99% of them had some form of ocean view. The beach had some great hammocks and comfortable beach chairs. A/c worked very well. Cons: This hotel is literally behind the airport runway. You could hear the planes taxi, wait for the runway to be clear and take off as if you were sitting on the runway. Not all that conducive to relaxing. It wasn't all the time - seemed like the planes would take off in groups about once an hour or so. This might not bother some people, but it just wasn't what I was expecting for my relaxing vacation. Also - the bed in my room was concave. Nice plush bed, but with a giant sink hole in the middle. Not what I'd expect for a Courtyard. Finally, when I got there I was told my room wasn't ready (which was fine, I got there pretty early). The nice lady at the front desk said that an upgraded room was available for a bit more per night. I took it - sounded like a good deal. After seeing the room, I am 90% sure I was "upgraded" to the same room we would have otherwise had - on the lowest floor in the hotel with a great view of the A/C units (granted, beyond the A/C units was the ocean) and as far away from the ocean as you could get. Since I had reserved a beach view, not sure how this was an upgrade. The room was fine, but I just don't think it was an upgrade from the room I reserved. I think this may have been what caused me to not recommend the hotel. Some could get over the noise and the uncomfortable bed, but this seemed just a touch too shady.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Pool and Casino”
Reviews.Author: ARS819
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple days and had a large group. The pool was fun, and there are swim up bars and great drinks. The casino was fun to hang out in but small. They had a live band and fun "Puerto Rican" dancing. They had a great staff and the people who helped us to taxis gave great advice of what clubs and places to see on our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice common areas and restaurant, but otherwise average.”
Reviews.Author: s10m
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at the end of June. The hotel is on a beautiful beach, but practically across the street from the runway of San Juan main airport. Needless to say, it's hard not to notice passenger jets taking off every 15 min. Very nice common areas, including bar, casino, restaurant and swimming pool area. Staff is very friendly, helpful and accommodating. Restaurant and bar prices were reasonable, compared to San Juan Marriott, a few miles west. The building is quite dated and not in great shape. The rooms are on the small side, and bathroom straight out of Motel 6, with old tile or Formica, and patched walls in the bathtub stall. The first room's carpet was very wet under the air conditioner and near balcony door. We requested another room, but there too the carpet was wet. On the plus side, the beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Firewife313
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights while in PR for our 10th anniversary. We were very satisfied with the resort. The beach is absolutely beautiful!! The rooms are nice and the restaurants are good. Be prepared though, while the restaurants are good, they are very expensive. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY - BELIEVE ME!!”
Reviews.Author: Ginuzza
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel post cruise for 2 nights. Because I trusted this chain of hotels - they claim consistency in their prices and especially their standards of service and cleanliness - I decided to go with the Marriott. At over $200.00 per night room only you would think you are getting something relatively nice. What a mistake. The pictures of the beach are right on; nice beach, hammocks on the property, the location is great - close to the airport but I would never stay here again nor would I recommend to a friend. The lack of cleanliness was unbelievable. There was clumps of hair left in my bathtub AFTER housekeeping cleaned it. The grime and dirt on the glass doors, elevators ....was really sad, not to mention other things that would really gross you out. We stayed pre-cruise at a little not fancy hotel (very clean and excellent service) a 3 minute walk to the beach and it was just fantasitc. It was called the Coral Princess Inn and I should have stayed there post cruise except I wanted something "nicer" and on the beach. Big mistake. WE are planning to cruise out of puerto rico again next year and will NOT stay at the Courtyard Marriott ! Take it from an Italian who is very meticulous with service and cleanliness - stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Great beach and pool, my son loved it.”
Reviews.Author: PSaint60
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had a great time at this place. But choose your room carefully. First of all, we had booked an "ocean view" room. However, when we checked in and went to our room and looked out the balcony, we were facing a not-so-great-looking condo building with a view of the trash compactor at the back of the hotel. Sure, you could see a sliver of the ocean between two buildings, but it's not what I had in mind. I went down to the front desk and they upgraded us to a "deluxe ocean view", but that cost us an extra $30 a night. The view from that room was outstanding. The room itself was great. Roomy. Clean. Fridge was a life-saver. Cleaning crew noticed we drank all the bottled water they left and left us a full case the next day. Always had plenty of clean towels. Pool was good sized, clean and there were a lot of other kids around for my 8 year old to hang out with. He was in there at least 6 hours a day. Nice swim up bar. We all loved the fitness center. We work out a lot at home and were pleasantly surprised at how well appointed the gym was. Nice treadmills, ellipticals and bikes, dumbells up to 50 lbs. Adequate selection of machines, Swiss balls. medicine balls, etc. Best of all, it was always empty. We never saw anyone else use it. The stretch of beach is the largest and cleanest I've seen in Puerto Rico. Not crowded. Beautiful view, took a lot of long walks and swam a lot. Great. Restaurants/Bars: The facilities inside the hotel were very nice. Can't comment on the casino, never used it. Nice bar with live music on some nights. They have a nice soda-shop-type place in front that serves pizza, hot dogs, sandwiches and ice cream. The food at the two "adult" restaurants was top notch. Wait staff was very friendly and accomodating. Our son is not an adventurous eater and when we sat down at the nicer restaurant the waitress was great about getting a pizza for him at the other restaurant and bringing it over. The only other caveat I have is, the prices were a little steeper at the hotel than I expected. We were on a tight budget and maybe I'm spoiled from years of dirt cheap excursions to Jamaica but...Drinks at swim-up bar--$8, $3 for a soft drink. Breakfast Buffet--$15.95 each. Dinners started at $20-25. Like I said, food and drinks were good, and if you're not on a budget, fantastic. If you are on a budget, I suggest taking a walk up the street a bit. There are some nice restaurants within walking distance that have good food at a fraction of the price. There's also a big grocery store close by. We picked up some beer, booze and some snacks, stocked our in-room fridge and a cooler and saved ourselves a ton. I wouldn't worry about the comments you read about the jet noise. It was a non-factor for us. We live on the NW side of Chicago and we have ten times the amount of jet traffic and noise from O'Hare than we heard here. We had a blast and would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag - look elsewhere for real class”
Reviews.Author: fairguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight last week waiting for a flight, used bar and restaurant facilities. Pros: Great location by Carolinas Beach Interesting lobby area - bar, restaurants, live band (if you like loud cha-cha-cha) Casino which we didn't try Outdoor dining experience was pretty good and fairly priced Cons: This is evidently an old property where rooms were remodeled to be up to the Marriott Courtyard standard, So expect the great beds and flat screen tv. The downside was in the bathroom which was kept with all the old fixtures and reminded us more of a motel 66 than Marriott. Everything worked but it wasn't up to scratch there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service at this very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: Keith5186
Reviews.Content: Read reviews on Tripadvisor before booking this resort but our experience far exceeded the reviews. Everyone at this Marriott was very polite and geared towards customer service. Everyone seemed committed to make sure that our family had a great time. Rooms were large and clean. Very comfortable beds. Very nice workout room. Food in all the restaurants was amazing. Our breakfast waiter, Miquel was amazing. The hotel is VERY close to the airport and we were concerned about the noise. However, the rooms are positioned so that as long as you have both slider doors closed, the noise is minimal. From the rooms and pools the airport is not visible. The airport noise is more noticeable while at the beach or pools but very tolerable to our family. A 20 min bus ride from Downtown San Juan (only 75cents). However, I would recommend a taxi which is about $15 to downtown San Juan. The concierge was great at setting up tours for the rainforest and Old San Juan. Must see! Loved this place and will certainly be back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE!!! BUGS , BUGS, BUGS...inside and out!”
Reviews.Author: cupcakecutie1986
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a Sunday morning after a week long cruise through the Caribbean. Our room was not ready when we checked in so we went to one of the restaurants and had a cocktail with one of the free tickets they gave us. We waited about an hour and a half for our room. Yes, the planes are noisy out by the pool. The pool is on the runway. Once inside your hotel room, you cant hear the planes. The views from the rooms suck. The room was ok, nothing to get excited over. The bathroom itself is in need for a facelift. The flooring is dated and so is the countertop.We did like the comfort of the beds, the in-room coffee maker and the little refrigerator. You can grab a ride on the city bus and take it into Old san Juan for 75 cents. There are tiny "sand fleas" around the pool area that sting like crazy , but once you pick off the tiny brown bugs, they stop stinging and usually do not leave a red welt or mark. There are also tons of biting bugs on the beach. Don't even bother trying to lay on a towel out on the sand, you will be eaten alive! Then, there are all of the huge lizards and two giant iguanas around the pool area. One of the iguanas actually got in the pool and scared my mother in law half to death. They crawl under your chair while you are trying to relax, they lay out in the middle of the pool deck when you are trying to walk- they are everywhere! I guess my BIG problem with this hotel started when I returned home with over 90 insect bites on my body, I went to the doctor and found out it was SCABIES from the hotel bed. How do I know it was from the hotel? All four of us were healthy before we left on our tri and since our hotel room had two queens, my husband and little girl slept in one queen and my son and myself slept in the other queen. BOTH my son and myself came down with SCABIES and my husband and daughter DID NOT. I decided to call the hotel and inform them of the problem they were having on the 5th floor, so they could fumigate and so that no other happy vacationer would have to go through what I was going through. I had to have cream spread over my entire body ( all cracks and crevices) from the neck down to the soles of my feet and then lay in it for 14 hours to kill the microscopic insects and kill the eggs they were laying in my body. The hotel manager could have cared less. She basically told me it was my problem and she would check into it. I got an email 3 days later, she said their exterminator didnt see anything in the room...Helloooooooooooo??? Do you understand they are microscopic?? You are not going to see anything with your eyes! Bottom line is: Marriott doesnt care about the health or safety of their customers. Choose another hotel that isn't bug or lizard infested and enjoy Puerto Rico. The people are friendly and it is a beautiful place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence”
Reviews.Author: rafymartinez2010
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in a great place in San Juan, Puerto Rico, stay at this hotel. It is EXCELLENT, extremely customer oriented. You will get friendly smiles from all its employees from the ntrance of the hotel to evry place you visit within it. Excellent service, food, music, rooms, beach, swimming pool, excercise room, bar, casino, parking, etc. What else you want when you want to enjoy your stay in a hotel. YOU WILL FEEL WELCOME AND PART OF A BIG FAMILY> ENJOY. Rafael Martinez

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but next to the airport runway”
Reviews.Author: LynnRLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott a couple of weeks ago. The rooms are nice, the service at the bar and drinks quality is good. Wasn't bowled over by the food offering. Very close to the runway. In a good location for the Ritz Carlton and El San Juan hotel bar and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Quick last minute getaway”
Reviews.Author: cgbeeson
Reviews.Content: Before my husband started a new job we decided to take a trip. It was between Aruba and PR. We decided on PR because if would be a direct flight from Charlotte, NC and we figured we would be on the beach in 4 hours from the time we left home. We certainly were on that beach by 1:30 that day. We left CLT before our scheduled flight (unheard of these days) and made it there in less time than expected. The hotel was literally on the back side of the runway, which was the only negative, but it really didn't seem to bother us during our stay. We were met by a lovely customer service rep. Frances who reduced our already low nightly rate and placed us in a room on the 6th floor with a great view. We did not take the upgrade for full ocean front viewing, but ours was sufficient with a more than respectable partial view with balcony. I understand that by going to the Ritz down the street you often don't even get a balcony and pay soooo much more $$$$. The actual property was well maintained and service was very good, but I'll have to say~ that in PR service is not one of this territories strong suite. We waited entirely too long once off the property wherever we went to be waited on. We didn't care for much of the local food and we had our share. Most local fare seems to be fried. We would return again to the same hotel and shorten our stay. It would be a great place to go to with another couple or group. During our stay, they didn't have many children at the facility, which was great for us. Appeared to be more business travellers or couples. When we walked up the the Ritz it was packed with lots of people and especially children. We also walked down to the Innercontinental hotel, which we liked, again a lot of people. Their beachfront was lovely. Anyway, we enjoyed our stay, but instead of 6 days, we'd make it 4.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Getawaygyal
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at this Marriott! Nice, clean hotel with balconies. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Close to other hotels (walking distance) like San Juan hotel where Club Brava is located. Right on the beach which was clean. Restaurants in the area were great and inexpensive! Must eat at Platos which is located beside Coral by the Sea hotel. In addition, buses ran often...no need for a car. Bus stop is by the Isla Verde Mall (4 blocks from the hotel) takes you to San Juan in 25 mins. The Ferry in San Juan is 50 cents each way. And once is San Juan there is a free bus that will take you to El Morro. The nightlfe was great...as I mentioned Club Brava is close by in San Juan hotel...I also went to Club Bed, and Laser in Old San Juan. PR is a beautiful island!

Reviews.Title: “The best time ever....”
Reviews.Author: Susan_ikt
Reviews.Content: We started our cruise vacation by spending a night at the Marriott Isla Verde on the day of our arrival to San Juan. We were overwhelmingly and pleasantly surprised by this resort. Transfer from the airport to the hotel was only $16 for four (4) passengers and 8 pieces of luggage. We arrived around noon, and only one of our two rooms was ready. They provided a pager to notify us when the second room would be available, which included 10% discount at all their bars and restaurants and four free drink coupons. Although we planned to sleep after arriving on a red-eye from California, this beautiful resort compelled us to change and hit the facilities. We enjoyed rum drinks at the bar, lunch, dinner, and breakfast the next morning out on the seaside veranda. During our short but wonderful visit, we used the fitness center, gambled at their casino, enjoyed the live music at the bar, and had a romantic stroll on the beach. The hospitality was AMAZING, and although the cruise was supposed to be the highlight of our trip, we were all reluctant to leave the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “This was Paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: lonny_10
Reviews.Content: I got to Puerto Rico and was booked into this awful hotel which I booked on the Internet and we decided to change Hotels. We walked down to LaConcha/Marriott to see if they had any rooms.However they were completely booked.Lo and Behold we met Nefdavid Torres who is on the staff at La Concha, who went up and beyond the call of duty and got us rooms at the Courtyard/Marriott. Thank God!! The place is beautiful,Great restaurants,very nice CLEAN rooms,nice little Casino and a Beautiful Beach plus good locations to anything you might be looking for.The staff here is also very friendly and helpful.We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Friendly People”
Reviews.Author: LoveLaughDream
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed for two weeks at the Marriott and had a wonderful time. The weather was amazing 80-90 degrees and sunny every day. The hotel (inside and out) was well-maintained and very clean. The pool area and beach are beautiful. The rooms do not have a mirror and/or outlet in the bedroom, so the only place for us to do our hair and makeup was in the bathroom (which turned out to be a minor inconvenience). When we had a problem receiving telephone calls on our room phone, we were promptly upgraded to a better room which was a corner room on the top floor with an awesome view. It was on the opposite side of the runway and much quieter. Jose Rivera, the Director of Engineering, was extremely accommodating and professional when we had a problem with our refrigerator. He promptly replaced it and even sent us a lovely platter of fruit to apologize. There is a Salsa band that performs in the lounge that we really enjoyed. All in all, I think this hotel is an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: kidelisse
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, i cant wait to stay there again, i love it

Reviews.Title: “Â¡Service was incredile!”
Reviews.Author: Fun_man32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard the first week of March and had a great time.We want to start off regarding the service at the Courtyard is exceptional and they really go above any beyond what you would expect. Everyone is friendly and always smilling, specially Morema from the front desk it was my wife birthday, I spoke to her on the check in and she sent to my wyfe a slice of cake with a card from the staff wish the best birthday to her which was a very nice surprise.Also We upgraded to a oceanfront for about $250 for the week. Was it worth is depends on what you are looking for. The rooms were nice and clean. Is not a large hotel so you can go to the beach and back to your room in 5 minutes.Beach was very nice and clean.The Pina Colada and Fuzzy Mango drinks were off the chart! I believe to be a very overpriced breakfast buffet. The location was appropiate to everything, and just a short taxi ride into Old San Juan. We were there for a total of 7 days, and plan to go back next year. We will stay there again without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location, Service, & Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: kjbz03
Reviews.Content: The staff here is great. Helpful, responsive, and friendly staff made our stay the most enjoyable. Great pool bar bartenders! The location is absolutely ideal, and on the most beautiful beach in San Juan. Hotel rooms are very nice and clean, pool area is awesome and casino is fun! Food and drinks are reasonably priced in comparison to other hotels. Puerto Rico is beautiful and this hotel is amazing. Great staff, great beach, and great rooms at a very good price... it really can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Mar53
Reviews.Content: My party of three stayed here from March 14-19. This is my second time staying here and I must say thought the first time was great - this time was ten times better. The accommodations, the wonderful and attentive staff, the pool, the drinks, the rooms - verything was excellent. Special thanks to Hector (the manager) for taking the time to talk with us about our experience. It is obvious that you listen to your guest's complaints )though we didn't have any) and compliments (we had many!). The entire staff was great: waiters; waitresses; bartenders, front desk staff, greeters, housekeeping staff; groundskeepers and pool. Another special thanks to Sonia Gonzalez, Food & Beveragae Manager, who catered to our every need from seating arrangments to menu items. She is an outstanding member of your team. The only minor thing for improvement is to add more vegetables as side dishes to your menu offerings. Other than that, it was a perfect vacation and I plan to come back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Our Amazing Wedding at the Courtyard Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Solotaroffs
Reviews.Content: The resort: We had our wedding & reception at the Courtyard Marriott Isla Verde on March 13, 2010. Over 80 friends and family made the trip and many of us stayed at the resort that week. Our main point of contact was Jazmin, and she went above and beyond. She gave our party a special room rate, gave us a suite, added mini bottles of rum to the welcome bags we brought for our guests, and even emailed from her personal email when the main email had delays. The rooms are the high Marriott standardâ€”good size, cushy beds, high thread-count sheetsâ€”and they all have amazing views. The resort staff is outstanding; everyone was so nice and accommodating. Other great accommodations include free wi-fi, hot tub outside, and many guests used the large workout facility. After the event, dozens of people told us it was the best wedding they have ever been to â€“ which we owe to the outstanding resort staff along with our wedding planner, Elsa Santini ([--]). The restaurantsâ€¦ We spent time in all of the restaurant areas and loved the outdoor area the best (who wouldnâ€™t). The food is a little pricey but good (donâ€™t miss the churrasco with plantain for lunch). The staff was very accommodating by adding more tables each time more of our group decided to join those already eating. The casinoâ€¦ Our group used every inch of the casino. The entire casino crew is very professional, patient when youâ€™ve had a lot to drink, and also know how to keep it fun. The ATM inside the casino (not right outside) has no fee â€“ nice - so use that one if you need cash. David is the best waiter in the place â€“ SO FUN. Picante barâ€¦ The Thursday night salsa lessons were FUN, the live music was GREAT, and the staff was EXCELLENT. Manager Hector Sanchez always created a table for our group and made sure we were taken care of â€“ and having a blast. While every bartender gets a kudos for keeping our very thirsty group happy, Carlos kept the jagerbomb shots coming, and with a nice presentation. Watch out â€“ Puerto Rican â€œRed Bullâ€� is called Cyclon and itâ€™s way stronger :). A special thanks to the patient and hard working waitresses that always found time to hang out with us while still taking care of the entire bar - - Jessica, Lisette, Natalie, & Ariana - I am sure we are missing some names â€“ these girls are great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Medoux2
Reviews.Content: The location was great in relation to all the activities on the agenda. Car rental was a mere two blocks away, the beach was but 200 feet and any amenities the hotel didn't have were but one to two blocks away. The staff was very friendly and helpful. People should know that staying in a hotel in Puerto Rico that has a casino, such as this one, will cost you a little extra. I would recommend staying here again. 10 minute taxi ride from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Courtyard we have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: monicajay
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and two seventeen year old girls stayed one night at this Courtyard on March 5th before returning home. We used Marriott reward points and choose this hotel because it is right next to the airport. Right next to the airport means you can hear the planes on your balcony. Surprizingly, we found with the double patio doors closed we didn't notice them in the room. We were happy to find out they no longer charge for beach chairs if you are staying at the hotel and the hammocks on the beach were fun for the girls. They also loaned the girls boogie boards at the towel sign out desk. This Courtyard is the nicest we have stayed in of the Courtyard banner and as nice as many full fledged Marriotts. The free welcome drink was a nice touch and can be used at any of the bars. I enjoyed a drink at the lobby bar with a live band. We ate dinner at the Puerto Rican buffet on Friday night ($23pp) and the food was good but not great. We found the buffet lacking in vegetables and there was fish in the potato salad which was unexpected and could have caused a severe allergic reaction in my husband had I not tasted it first. We used the self parking ($15) which was comparible to other hotels in the area. The room was clean, comfortable and the staff were all very friendly. We checked out 45 minutes late being Marriott rewards members which was more convienent for our return flight. In the past we have stayed at the Intercontinetal which had a nicer lobby and pool area but I really liked having a balcony with table and chairs at the Courtyard. I would certainly recommend this hotel to others and would stay again in a flash. It is obviously a well-managed and well-maintained hotel. I can't understand anyone complaining about the airplane noise when they chose the hotel closest to the airport. Oh, there are other bars and restaurants within walking distance for those that want to leave the hotel about 10 minutes or so down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Our family loved it! We would go back. Staff is really nice.”
Reviews.Author: Misty2009
Reviews.Content: This is a really pleasant, cozy, comfortable, friendly hotel right on a beautiful beach! We liked the fact that it is fairly small. Our girls loved the pool, swim up bar (to order fruit smoothies!), hot tub, kids' pool...the iguana walking around. Every member of the staff here was so nice! The business center is free. There are several restaurants, salsa music in the evenings, brunch on the terrace overlooking the ocean and our girls' favorite: Bananas cafe- ice cream and custom-made grilled cheese sandwiches! Comfy beds! We stayed a whole week. Easy to do road trips from here. We rented a car (from Charlie's - very good). This hotel is minutes from the airport - a plus for getting there quickly, but you WILL hear the planes taking off when you are on the beach (rooms are fairly well sound-proofed). Our kids thought seeing the plains take off was cool! This is the last hotel on Isla Verde Beach. Look to the left- see lots of hotels (including the Ritz Carlton). Look to the right - open beach!

Reviews.Title: “Only fit for one/two night airport stay.”
Reviews.Author: kaytee74
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only fit to stay in for the one or two nights between flights and onward travel. Previous reviews rate the food so it must have been a different chef the week we were there as the dinner food was virtually inedible. The rice was like mush and the meat had to be removed with tissue after chewing for about 10 minutes. The A la Carte menu was the same for each night with little choice. Breakfasts were better.. The setting of hotel is great, on a great stretch of white sands. The pool looks good and it could save you a fortune in sun oil as one dip in this pool and you will come out covered in it. There is a smaller area for the children, but they were also in the larger area which I would have thought was for adults only as it had the swim up bar. STaff were very pleasant and helpful. The bedroom was very large, comfy and kept clean. The coffee machine was not cleaned twice and neither was coffee replaced. The air conditioning was noisy and I had the unit changed but although it banged and clanged slightly less, it was still too noisy. I had to turn if off a couple of nights to get sleep and consequently woke up very hot and uncomfortable. Sitting on the balcony is virtually impossible because of the noise of landing and taking off planes at the nearby airport. The room steward was over enthusiastic removing my own face flannel and hair turban along with the hotel towels etc. Didn't bother to report, they were white so I suppose it would have been a job to find in amongst their laundry!!! If you have a room at the side (non sea view) there is a chance you will overlook the delivery area and taxi rank as I was and there will be the additional noise from the drivers playing cards and whistling and shouting, plus the beeps from the delivery lorries reversing etc. Because of the setting this hotel will be good if you want to spend your time on the sands or around the pool, but you need to have a car to take yourselves off somewhere else for entertainment and food as there is not a lot nearby. But if you are staying for longer than a couple of days I would strongly suggest you pick a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel - Good location”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller990
Reviews.Content: This is a terrible hotel, noisy, shabby and poor service. We stayed there for 6 nights as part of a cruise/stay holiday and I can only say thanks goodness for the cruise. On arrival at the hotel, we were told by the receptionist that we were booked in to standard economy rooms on the first two floors and could upgrade at a cost of $50 per night which we declined to do. This made us feel like second class citizens. Fortunately we were put in a room on the 6th floor which was comfortable, clean and large. The hotel is noisy with loud music playing every evening and no where to go if you want quiet, the reception, bar and restaurant are all open plan so you can't have a conversation in the restaurant or the bar. Drinks at the hotel were very expensive $6.50 for a beer and $8.50 for a glass of wine, we went down to the supermarket about two blocks away and stocked up our fridge . The food was indifferent in the restaurant and the service very poor, we waited half an hour for our plates to be cleared and the waitresses just ignored us and we had ask for a dessert menu, this may have been because we did not leave a tip but we did not think they deserved one. The only plus is the beach which is very clean and uncrowded and the sea was nice for swimming but being so close to the airport the noise of the departing planes was deafening and continued all day. The hotel needs updating, it is old fashioned and shabby. We would not stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Best overall hotel”
Reviews.Author: churrodriguez
Reviews.Content: From the fast service of the vallet and front desk to the cleanliness and quietness of the rooms this hotel has it all; casino, two restaurants, pool, beautiful beach, bar with live music and very friendly service. if you want to be in a place near everything with everything, go to this hotel.... trust me.

Reviews.Title: “salsa restaurant had excellent food try the red snapper!”
Reviews.Author: naterion
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mariott Isla Verde compliments of our airline after a flight delay. We were pleasantly surprised. We had a partial ocean view, nice pool and overall enjoyed the atmosphere. What really made it 5 star for us was the Salsa restaurant. Cesar (the manager of the Salsa) was fantastic. He explained all of the dishes (local cuisine) and was so gracious that our flight difficulties were soon forgotten in his fantastic restaurant. I love red snapper and was completly floored when he served me an entire fish! Delicious and highly recommended but beware, the three of us could have eaten one meal, portions were large. The fried cheese with Guava salsa was great. We now are planning our next Carribbean vacation to include a stay at Isla Verde Mariott with a definite dinner at Salsa. Close to the airport, less than 5 minutes, we did not hear air traffice from our room. If you want airport access this can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “review of isla verde courtyard marriott”
Reviews.Author: nataliacp
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my mom and aunts and from the moment we arrived we were greeted by a very friendly staff. the concierge gave us info on the most popular eating areas near by and was very williing to answer any of our additional questions. the beach and pools are very fun and beautiful, including small pools for kids. at night, the restaurant/bar turns into a fun salsa bance floor and the casino is also a local hot spot. even though i did not use the gym, i did see that it is big and you get a great view of the beach as you work out. the room was very comfortable and clean. i enjoyed my stay very much and do plan on returning :)

Reviews.Title: “TROPICAL SAN JUAN!”
Reviews.Author: Tradertom52
Reviews.Content: Very cool service, wonderful staff! Everything was good, good food, enough TOWELS, great views. Good good good!!!!!! HOT HOT HOT!!!!!!! GO there GO there GO there! MARRIOT ROCKS !!! AYE DIOS MIO!!!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has great location and better service!”
Reviews.Author: MassachusettsSusanB
Reviews.Content: Your staff has succeeded in developing a fan club from across both the continental US and also with your local area. I am sure you will continue to have success because you have mastered the essence of the hospitality industry- excellent customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Great valve, cozy and relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: mtaandysoto22
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel on a Tuesday nite. First impressions where, what an excellent staffed and good looking resort. Unfortunately the room had a faulty toilet which was quickly fixed within the hour ,otherwise the room was quite good. Oh and try to get a room facing the ocean if at all possible, the side rooms are much noisy-er either due to the airport or the air conditioning units in the back . There was also a bad smell coming from the garbage in the morning making my use of the terrace unusable. Beds are great as usual and the bathroom was a very good size. The pool area was great and the bar made it even better .A very good beach plus the use of beach chairs and hammocks. Unfortunately I would not stay at this hotel again for the price I paid . My costs were 500 for 2 nites which is way too much for what I usually get at that price. Otherwise if I get a good deal I would certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: FuninthesunOmaha
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a nice beach area and nice pool. It is right next to the airport though. I recommend bringing earplugs because even with double sliding glass doors, you'll hear the jet engines firing up at 6:17am. Otherwise, you get used to the noise. The bar and hotel area gets very crowded on the weekends. Old San Juan has some nice shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “All encompassing vacation spot for family, couples, solo travelers”
Reviews.Author: walkingthemap
Reviews.Content: Well, I have been here since Tuesday and love it. Food is beyond excellent, I have eaten at all of the restaurants, and they also have a coffee counter. Waitstaff is perfect. There was a buffet this evening and it was outstanding, vegetables cooked to perfection, steamed snapper with spices and onions, eggplant soup, and mmm turkey. Something about the meats in Puerto Rico, meat here is just excellent. Once here, you won't want to eat anywhere else. There are casinos for that crowd and every night, an upscale band area that draws the local dancing crowd. I think that is my favorite, you can be a spectator or a participant, I danced for an hour tonight, random men approach you and ask you to dance. Not to pick you up, but to dance. Men in Puerto Rico are charming and they can dance! The children seem thrilled because of the pools, the ice cream bar and large areas to just run on the expansive beach. Also good for couples because of the romantic outside restaurant overlooking the ocean. Then, well then there is the state of the art exercise room. Wow, I have to say, this place is amazing. The planes are nearby and loud until about ten at night otherwise, my room was quiet and restful... but then again, the planes are nearby and getting to and from the airport is a snap. I have not used the travel assistance downstairs yet, but you can book anything you might want to do right from the lobby last minute. My only complaint was that I had to drive into Old San Juan and then west the first three days I was here and the traffic is murder at morning and evening drive times. Driving east to Fajardo is pretty simple though. Life as a tourist in PR is wonderful. I Have visited now several times and will always make PR my winter vacation trip to get away from the snow for a week.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised! Great beach and proximity to lots of good stuff.”
Reviews.Author: leconteurX
Reviews.Content: This was a quick one-night stay as my cruise was embarking from San Juan. I have visited San Juan for vacation before and always love the old city and the surrounding towns. Carolina is in the Isla Verde section, a 15 minute drive from Old San Juan (about a $20 one-way cab ride). It is a 5 minute walk from the Ritz Carlton and a 15 minute walk to the El San Juan Hotel & Casino. The Ritz has the largest casino in the general San Juan area and the El San Juan Hotel has great bars, clubs and music dotted throughout the enormous and hip lobby. But... back to the Courtyard. I've always seen the Courtyard as a business-centric hotel. This one... not so much. First, it was very affordable. Second, a good size bar in the center with spanish music being DJ'd through speakers. Quite loud and a little ... garish. But. There were a lot of people out on the floor enjoying it. There's a small casino and an ice cream / sandwich counter. The room was pretty huge and the bed was wondefully soft and fluffy and a fantastic night's sleep. The beach!!! The back portico area had tables set up and the beach (I think it was open to public access) was pretty large. Very clean, the water was wonderfully warm. In my experience, PR waters, at least on the north side of the island are not bathwater calm like some parts of the Carib, but that particular day, there were nice, rolling waves - not too rough, but active enough to keep it interesting. Beach chairs are provided. The Luis Munos Int'l Airport runway is right behind the hotel. So you'll hear the plane engines fire up from somewhere in the treeline and then see planes pop up a little ways down. Leaving the airport, I saw the Courtyard pass by. Not too bad. Just pop your earbuds in. If I need a cheap, quick getaway from the mid-atlantic chill, I will definitely consider staying here again. The beach was lovely as was the room. I am usually on the beach, running around somewhere in Old San Juan or other hotels' clubs and casinos. The $20 cab ride into town is a little steep, but for the very low hotel cost, not a big deal. Just plan well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at The Isla Verde Beach Resort for Pre-Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: robertoluvsaz
Reviews.Content: We got the hotel off hotwire for $102. We really enjoyed the hotel because it was on the beach. The hotel was close to Aeropuerto de Luis MuÃ±oz Marin and the planes were taking off by the hotel. I liked that because I like flying and planes and I liked seeing the planes take off. If you want peace and quiet, this might not be the hotel for you. The noise wont bother you when your sleeping if you have the balcony door closed, but I dont mind hearing the noise anyway. Very good service and friendly employees. Very good stay at this resort with a great pool! The rooms were big and the beds were comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: Bisykmom
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is not up to Marriott standards as far as updated baths, etc, it is very clean and the staff were all helpful and friendly. The beach was beautiful and not crowded at all, but the surf was rough. The pools and swim up bar was very nice. Prices at hotel restaurants are ridiculous and the food was just ok. I highly recommend renting a car to explore other restaurants and to buy food, snacks, etc (small refrigerator in rooms) or plan to use cabs. Proximity to airport is great - easy in and out, but airplane noise did keep us awake one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great and Loud”
Reviews.Author: dsticka
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with a great beach. It's the last of a long line of hotels, so it feels like you have alot of beach. The staff is extremely friendly, rooms are nice, and the view is terrific. However. It's across the freeway from the airport, so there is the constant sound of jet engines reving up for takeoff. Not too bad in the rooms, but really loud on the beach itself.

Reviews.Title: “Using Marriott properties in Puerto Rico for business and fun”
Reviews.Author: aberprod
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently to PR and usually stay in the Marriott-Condado. This is a great facility but for a change, I booked into the Courtyard Isla Verde on the advice of my customer. I certainly was not disappointed. The beach has to be the best in the San Juan area; shallow so that you can walk a good distance offshore, calm waves but enough that you can body surf a little if desired, wide sandy beach with ample walking opportunities in both directions. For a business traveler, it offers decent restaurants, quick access to SJU airport (the airport noise can be noticeable if a jet is taking off but it last only 20 seconds). Smallish casino but large enough to lose your assets if not careful, like all casinos. Ample supplies of bottled water in the rooms is a definite plus as is the room size. The balconies are functional for two people but nothing more and offer great views. Baths could use some moderization but you can't have everything for around $200/night in the Carribean during high season. I like this facility so much that on an upcoming business trip, my wife and I will stay at the Condado Marriott for 5 days on business but spend 3 days at the Courtyard for relaxation. The dance floor in the bar can be fun and the main job requirement for the waitresses would appear that they be beautiful. I would advise buying beer and taking it to the hotel with you. And, take a collapsible cooler. I really get tired (and ticked off) for paying over $6.00 per beer in hotels. Marriott should know better! Also, find a local restaurant and order Tostones as an appetizer; they're awesome!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: Cubsfanforever
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at the Courtyard by Marriott Isla Verde resort in mid January and overall were quite pleased with our entire stay. Last year we stayed at the La Concha in Condado but decided to try Isla Verde this time because the beach was supposed to be much nicer and the ocean a lot calmer (it is). We took a taxi from San Juan airport (about $12) and arrived at the Courtyard in no time given the property's location is immediately adjacent to the airport. The check in process went quickly and even though we arrived several hours before check in we were given our room so that we could unpack and begin our vacation. Now on to the ratings of this property: Overall the hotel is in very good shape and all of the people associated with it that we came into contact with were very pleasant and gave us the impression that they wanted us to have a good time. When we pulled up to the hotel the valet/bellman greeted us and said "welcome home" and the service and friendliness of the staff continued through our departure a week later. The king room was very nice with an adequate bathroom and a nice balcony that held two chairs and a small table. There was a loveseat (I think it could convert into a bed) and an easy chair in the room along with the standard desk and desk chair. There was also a key lock safe in the closet and a small refrigerator. One nice thing about the hotel is that the room came with two bottles of water and housekeeping left several more each day, again at no additional charge. The balcony gave us a very nice view of the beach and ocean even though it was billed as a "partial view" room. If one leaned over the railing and looked the other way you could see the terminal and runways of San Juan airport. The room had a flat screen TV that received a number of channels and there was no additional charge for wired and wireless internet service. The beach was very nice but remember that the entire Isla Verde beach (as I believe are all beaches in Puerto Rico) is public and access cannot be restricted by the hotels. This was never a problem for us and the beach was never really crowded but had a few more people on the weekend.
