The Courtyard has an attendant on the beach to help set up lounge chairs for hotel guests and also has several hammocks that are located between the hotel and the beach. There is an adequate size L-shaped pool adjacent to the hotel and beach with a separated children's area and a hot tub. There is also a swim up bar in the main pool and servers will take your order at adjacent tables or at your pool/beach chair for food and drinks. We spent most of our time at the pool going to the ocean a few times each day. The hotel staff mans a stand to give guests beach towels just as you leave the hotel lobby and enter the pool area. Immediately adjacent to the pool is a small but fairly well equipped exercise room that is open 24 hours a day with access via your room key card. The hotel has a very small casino that seems to offer most games and slot machines but since we aren't gamblers I won't try to give it a rating. As to food service at the hotel there is an ice cream/sandwich counter in the lobby that is open fairly late at night (good ice cream), a bar (Picante) that really is busy on the weekends with live music and a limited food selection. The food items we sampled at the bar were very good although as I stated it was limited selection. There is a restaurant called Salsa which serves a buffet breakfast every morning for about $15 but it is very good with a lot of selections including fruit and pastries and then the restaurant has menu service during the rest of the day with mainly Puerto Rican cuisine and then I believe 3 nights a week they have a Puerto Rican cuisine buffet which we sampled. The other restaurant Sirena, is more upscale and diners eat outside under a canopy. We did not eat at this restaurant so I can't comment on the food or servce. Overall we found the food to be very good (I loved the hamburger at the bar/pool and in the bar area) and face it folks, it's a resort so you are going to pay $10-$12 for a hamburger and fries. If you want McDonalds get out and walk there! To sum things up I found the following to be negatives about the Courtyard: 1. The hotel is at the end of the resort strip along Isla Verde so if you want to go to local restaurants/drug store/grocery stores you have a good 15-30 minute walk depending on what you are looking for. When we stayed in Condado there were a number of restaurants and other stores within a block or two. 2. If you are sensitive to noise, staying at this hotel will probably bother you due to the traffic at San Juan airport. We basically got used to it and it really didn't make us wish we stayed elsewhere. This is one of the prices you will pay for staying on Isla Verde versus Condado but the plus is you will be at your hotel from the airport in 15 minutes or less. The pluses: 1. The staff was very nice including housekeeping who had our room always made up early in the day. You can tell that management has done a good job training the staff and I always noticed some management type walking around both inside and outside the hotel every day just looking at things. 2. The setting is beautiful on Isla Verde beach whish has relatively calm water thanks to an off shore reef. 3. Nice room with a balcony that we could actually use. We had a "french balcony" at La Concha that was worthless as we couldn't sit outside and enjoy the tropical air. 4. A nice pool but regular style rather than the infinity type. It was perfect for us and everyone we saw there seemed to enjoy it. 5. Overall it was a very enjoyable stay and I feel we got our money's worth. My wife and I love Puerto Rico and while we want to try out the Caribbean side of the island next time I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon-Pre-cruise stay (OK!) but not for the money”
Reviews.Author: vpagew
Reviews.Content: We had planned to stay in San Juan for 3 days before our cruise and search many options for hotels. We decided to go with Hotwire 4 star hotel on the beach for $129 a night (not knowing what hotel it was). We took the risk with Hotwire as it has worked for us 95% of the time. This was not worth $129/night at all but not more than $99/night. The hotel states that the regular price is $200+/night. ha!! Pros 1. The hotel room is HUGE. A regular size hotel room could fit a couple with small kids, as they provided us with a sofa that let out to a bed. 2. All rooms had a balcony. Awesome! They will give you an option to upgrade to a ocean view from anywhere from $15-25. 3. Free internet access. 4. Beach. It is beautiful. 5. They give you a free rum drink coupon for 2, a $25 voucher (can't use it on the slot machines) for the casino and some coconut candy. Con's 1. The bathroom was pretty nasty. It looked like no one had stayed in that room for 6month to 1yr. I kept my shoes on as long as possible in there. The shower...... my husband fell in it (be careful). The nob in the shower looks liked and felt it was about to fall off. 2. Not a good selection of restaurants in the resort. We tried a buffet at the restaurant, Fiesta which was $24 pp. SAVE your money. RUN FAST! It was awful. The other restaurant/bar area that gives salsa dance lessons was better- $12 pp for salad, chicken and fries. 3. The hotel is located at the very END of the strip. You have to walk about 10minutes (not too bad) to get to any food or busy area. Isla Verde is a good area to stay but it's just the furthest hotel. 4. LOUD! We had kids running and screaming through the halls all night. They even knocked on our door a few times. There were lots of teenage groups staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: mcchrisb
Reviews.Content: You can't beat this place. The scenery is great. The pool is nice. There are iguanas that come out when it gets hot by the pool. The service is great. The restaurants are pretty good. The hotel is in a fairly quiet area. Sure, the airport is there, but it's really not a big deal. The business center is free which includes internet. Our room was terrific. Spend some extra money for an ocean front like we did.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, clean, courteous staff, great beach”
Reviews.Author: ezcreations
Reviews.Content: I was there for two days, I combined business and leasure. I spent a lot of time at the beach, I loved the outdoor setup, I always found a quiet place to sit, beach is great, loved the pool. In the morning I practically had the pool for myself. I would go back there whenever I am in puerto rico. Staff was friendly and courteous. I think the front lobby can use some upgrade, but, it doesnt affect the stay. I had a porch with a fantastic view of the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location....dated room!”
Reviews.Author: Tinabel
Reviews.Content: I read all the previous reviews before booking this hotel for one night on Jan 2. Boy were we disappointed! We should have stayed at the Interncontinental for $50 more. Our room was tired, and the bathroom was badly in need of refurbishment. In addition, the bathroom had little ants crawling all over! Ycch! I didn't want to use the coffee maker because it was half full of water....possibly not cleaned? So, at 5:30 in the morning I went downstairs for coffee. It's an airport hotel, right? So you would think that there would be coffee available with people going to the airport. NOT! On a more positive note...the location near the airport is very convenient (although you can hear the jets taking off), the beach is beautiful, and the restaurant food was really good. We had buffet breakfast one morning, and ate dinner outside at La Serena. Staff were very friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: FreidaMn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard Marriott Isla Verde resort one night before our cruise and we were so happy that we did! It was a very quick trip from the airport, check in was quick and we were upgraded to an oceanfront suite, and in no time we were in our swimsuits and on the beach! The beach is lovely, we were given lounge chairs on the soft sand and enjoyed body surfing in the waves. When dinnertime came we couldn't bear to leave so we had burgers at the poolside restaurant and they were very good. We also enjoyed the breakfast buffet the next morning. The beach is really very beautiful, and the rooms are big and roomy, as are the balconies, I felt we got a lot in this hotel and would definitely stay here again, and for longer! There was noise from the airport, but we knew to expect it so it didn't bother us.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant tranquil Courtyard on best Puerto Rico beach”
Reviews.Author: artnuvo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard Isla Verde for 6 nights over Xmas 2009--prior stay was in 2008 over Xmas. The hotel appears to have been updated since our 2007 stay with new furniture and carpet in the large rooms which also include a 42 inch hd tv, small refrig, and key safe, and free internet next to the concierge. The K bed was comfortable but not up to Hyatt's Heavenly bed. Our room was 118 with a nice view of the ocean/large public blue protected beach (opposite side of hotel faces a condo with some beach views and has the dumpster and casino on that side. The staff is friendly and pleasant and the concierge was helpful. Poolside restaurant and outdoors restaurant has decent lunch menus-really good burgers and a nice club sandwich; decent traditional p.r. buffet on weekends along with many locals attending for salsa band and dancing. For breakfast, try the Walgreen about a 5 minute walk and/or the pueblo supermarket open 24 hours, on the side street by the Chili's, a block up from the Walgreenâ€™s, and don jose a small restaurant with traditional food and locals for breakfast.. The beach has the largest strip of the isla verde and condado hotels and also shares the long protected public beach side providing even more space to stretch out. For dinner in the area, metropol and mi casita are good reasonable choice; otherwise, make sure you eat at cafe Puerto Rico for traditional p.r. food with the freshest ingredients and at a reasonable price compared to the fancy restaurants on fortaleza street. A nice diversion is the 1 mile+ walk along the crescent shaped public beach and over the bridge to pinones where you can rent a bike form the co-op across from the entrance for $5 hour. Overall, a very nice place to stay in san juan, even more so if you can snag a promotional rate. We had to deal with a billing error and would suggest, as we did, to bring your marriott logo rate reservations with you as their computer did not fully or properly capture or reserved rate.

Reviews.Title: “Warning if you are staying at this hotel - Credit card copied and used all over Puerto Rico!!”
Reviews.Author: Starshark10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel resort for our honeymoon. We had a pleasant stay but a day after checking out of the hotel my credit card company called to alert me of possible fraud - over $1,400 had been spent at gas stations, Game Stop and a Walmart near San Juan. I confirmed I had my credit card in my possession and told the card company that the check-in staff had made an imprint of my card because their card machine wasn't working. What was interesting was that while on on honeymoon we didn't leave the hotel so the check-in people and the hotel restaurant were the only two places in Puerto Rice where I used my card!! Thieves are working at this hotel and I hope they get caught fast!!! I hope this didn't happen to other guests!

Reviews.Title: “Got my credit card skimmed here”
Reviews.Author: plainsman66
Reviews.Content: A week after my stay here a colleague called me to tell me that his credit card got skimmed here. Since I checked in right after he did I was immediately concerned. That evening I was notified by my credit card company that someone 1100 miles away was trying to use my credit card to charge over $1000. They denied the charge and I had to cancel my card and get a new one. I reported this to the hotel and they assured me that they would investigate. It's been two weeks and I haven't heard from they yet. I reported this by email to Marriott corporate and I haven't heard from them either. I am not sure how you can protect yourself from having this happen when you travel since hotels always want to run your card for "incidentals". If you are not familiar with credit card skimming, and I wasn't, you should Google "credit card skimming" and get educated. Other than that Mrs. Lincoln, "How was the play?" The hotel is on the beach and close to the airport. The room was clean and well appointed and the internet access was at no charge. There is a casino on the property (I guess this is standard in Puerto Rico) but the real gamble here was at the front desk. If I had not had the credit card problem I would rate this property higher.

Reviews.Title: “A distinctive Courtyard on a great beach.”
Reviews.Author: sitesea
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because it was advertised to be on a good beach. We were somewhat skeptical due to its airport location but this turned out to be a non-issue. The beach is indeed fine, and is one of the top rated beaches in PR. The sand is clean and it is possible to go for two+ mile walks along the ocean. The hotel has a very nice, largish pool with plenty of chaises available. As hotels go, it was a basic three-star Courtyard but also had a casino and very lively restaurant/bar scene. The staff was friendly and helpful. We upgraded our room to feature an oceanfront view which provided quiet and privacy. Many of the partial view rooms would be more exposed to the adjacent parking lots, busy street and airport runway so the oceanfront is a great bet to feel like you are truly having a "resort" experience. There were live bands each night which performed some wonderful latin music and lots of the local crowd comes to dance and enjoy the casino. It is possible to walk down the beach or street to visit local restaurants. One direction takes you to hotel row and the other to a village of local fried food joints. This location worked well as a base to explore other sights both in San Juan and farther afield. Very good access to El Junque.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Can't wait to go again.”
Reviews.Author: ReddPupp
Reviews.Content: We always like to go somewhere warm for Thanksgiving weekend and this year decided on San Juan, a place I've never been to. My criteria was warm air, warm ocean, not too crowded, not too expensive, and no rental car needed. I picked the Courtyard and hit the bull's eye. All the good things: Easy to get to: just 5 minutes from the airport Quiet: Even with the airport right there the room was exceptionally quiet. Double sliding doors were the key. Great Sleep: Loved the bed, I haven't slept this well in months (and boy did I need it), easily slept 12 hours a night. Nicely dark room: as I've gotten older (50's) I've become more sensitive to light and the room was delightfully dark. The hotel is the last one on the strip and adjacent to the public beach. So every day (around noon!) we would get some beach towels at the pool and head east away from the hotel. Always found a nice patch by ourselves away from other conversations, cigarettes, etc. Ocean was great for swimming all afternoon (my favorite part). Never did use the pool but it looked nice. Tips: Nearest Starbucks is in the El San Juan (about a 10 minute walk). There's a Walgreens next to the Ritz but it closes at 10PM, Another Walgreens is 24 hours and it is about another 15 minutes from the first one (left side of street) Pueblo is a grocery store behind the Chili's. Take the sidewalk next to Chilis then turn right and walk up a bit, you can't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “best beach and latin music”
Reviews.Author: liltravlr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Oct 28 09. I was coming to San Juan pre-cruise and heard they had salsa lessons at the Courtyard on Thursday nights. They do indeed, they are free, and great (though it was mambo, not salsa, technically). The hotel also has an awesome band in the social Picante lobby bar and is very popular for dancing Thurs and Fri. I met some people on the beach at the hotel and also went to Drums, a bar a few blocks away by the Denny's, which was great for dancing too. The hotel itself is very nice, quiet, good service, good room, and on what I would say is the best beach in the San Juan area. The water was clean, warm, nice beach and waves not too big. There are little sandflies and over 3 days I got about 10 bites, but they are not itchy and you can put on bugspray. The hotel's pools and gym are great (I would suggest some yoga mats), and my room had a peek a boo view of the water. The food in the Salsa restaurant was good with very soft, fresh bread at dinner and a good breakfast buffet. Downside is being a $17 taxi ride from Old San Juan but I combined this hotel with 2 nights at El Convento there for the best of both worlds (ie beach and culture). I did not get a chance to take the bus but I did not feel at all unsafe walking around anywhere. If coming in for a cruise, one must spend some time in Puerto Rico. I saw all of San Juan and will return for a visit to Culebra island's Playa Flamenco and the Bioluminescent bay tour (it was a full moon when I was there so tour not running), and would like to see a lot more of Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Practically On the Runway”
Reviews.Author: wbru83
Reviews.Content: For business, this hotel is just fine. Decent restaurants, clean rooms, pleasant staff. If you like to gamble, there are $5 blackjack tables in the casino. It's right on the beach if you have time for that. My only complaint is that it is situated not only right near the airport runway, but also right near where departing planes crank up their engines for takeoff. The noise and rumble are stultifying. Once that first plane takes off at about 6:20am, you'll be awake.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the price”
Reviews.Author: CTMACCI
Reviews.Content: We were accomodated here on American Airline's tab and I have to say, I was quite pleased with our stay. The customer service was great, the lounge was large and spacious. We were placed in an ocean view room with a balcony and had a great view. The room and the bed could use a bit of upgrading but I guess for the price and it's location in relation to the beach, it would be a good deal. They have an awesome Ice ceam parlor in the lobby and an okay breakfast buffet. Our only complaint was that Sirena's restaurant claimed we could not sit outside at 930 even though they were supposed to close at 11:00 pm. We could not understand why and it didn't seem they cared t=what we thought either, Check out was easy and the concierge and the staff were overall pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing last night spent in Puerto Rico thanks to Courtyard Marriott”
Reviews.Author: monika992
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good things to say about Courtyard Marriott Isla Verde. I obtained a great deal on Hotwire for this hotel, and since it was the last night of our trip to Puerto Rico, we wanted a place nearby the airport for our hotel yet still on the beach and this was a perfect fit. For the low price we paid, I was astounded by the service and quality of the hotel. Staff was friendly and check in was a breeze. The hotel is also located in Isla Verde, a little resort town (we had already spent several days staying in Old San Juan and around the island - this isn't OSJ, so you have to expect less culture and more of a resort feel). But it is close (5-10 minute walk) to some restaurants, shops, and bars/clubs. It was also like a 15 minute walk from where we had to drop off our car rental so it worked out perfectly. The lobby is big and nice. It was a special trip for my partner which I had mentioned and I and we received an upgrade to a gorgeous ocean view room and fruit plate. I wasn't sure what to expect of the room but it had an amazing comfortable king size bed, a huge flat screen tv, a nice if not luxurious bathroom, and view from the balcony was breathtaking. We also got a coupon for a free drink and a casino credit at check in and went downstairs later to use those. The casino is small but serves the purpose of playing a little Blackjack or some slots. We then wandered over to sit outside on the ocean front patio area until it started raining, which is too bad because it was gorgeous out. Since we were only there one night we didn't get to enjoy the pool, beach hammocks or beach itself, but ithey looked really nice. Such a shame we only had one night! We enjoyed the live salsa music in the restaurant. Unfortunately the restaurant was not serving food, so we went upstairs to call room service and they said the kitchen was closed but they could see what they could do. The ended up finding a couple of items we wanted to eat and bringing them up, very quickly too! Great and wonderful service all over. I would stay here again, especially for the price. It's not top shelf luxury like the Ritz, but again, for the price, it is a good solid quality 3 1/2 star hotel and I have absolutely no complaints, everything was wonderful and great. P.S. i noticed some people complained about airplane noise, we didn't experience any of that, but we were inside most of the time so maybe on the beach you hear it but it wasn't a problem for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great deal”
Reviews.Author: SMARTIN133
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the last on the beach which made it a very private feeling spot. This is a very slow time of year for San Juan so the beach and hotel was empty but the weather/water was still great. It only rained once during our 3 day trip and it was barely a sprinkle that lasted only 5 minutes. The hotel is close to the airport so you will hear airplanes during your stay. However, we didn't find this to be an issue but do ask for a rom on the opposite side from the runway. The beds were very comfortable and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The casino was nothing special and the drinks at the bar were expensive but neither were unexpected. The hotel has bug spray at the front desk for the no-see-ums...just ask.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff, Awesome Property, Awesome Food - Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: tcm_crew
Reviews.Content: I stayed five nights. The rooms are quite large and the bedding is EXTREMELY comfortable - I haven't slept so soundly in a LONG time! Live entertainment in the lobby bar, a small casino on the property. Room service menu is VERY limited. I got to the hotel late, and barely beat room service's midnight closing. The cheeseburger was good, and quite filling. Salsa restaurant is adequate, although it also has a pretty limited menu. The pork chop and mashed plaintain did hit the spot. The hotel's higher-end restaurant, Sirano (Serano?) is *very* good. You can dine on the open air patio and listen to the waves breaking on the beach just a few yards away. There are also three dining tables on the grass for a more intimate setting (reservations recommended for those primo tables!) Service is great - very friendly staff. The only detractor is that there's nothing within EASY walking distance., but Old San Juan is a short drive or taxi ride away. This was my first trip to Puerto Rico and I knew English was a second language here, but I was still amazed how almost everyone spoke *perfect* English (and helped me with my horrible Spanish!) The breakfast buffet served in Salsa restaurant is extremely diverse with lots of offerings,from the traditional fattening American choices to more sensible cereals and yogurt. Garage parking (self-park) was $15/night, which I recommend as it's easy and there's plenty of parking. Valet parking is a nice convenience, $20 per night. Next biz trip to Puerto Rico, *THIS* is my place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: arkansas_traveler96
Reviews.Content: This place was very nice. The beach was awesome. Tips: bring bug spray and prepare to pay $15 a night to park here.

Reviews.Title: “Isla Bonita-Isla Verde”
Reviews.Author: maritez
Reviews.Content: Arrived and smooth check in...got the request for the oceanview but it was half condo view and ocean view. The room looks very nice with flat screen..the beds were okay. The bar area was huge, of course its low season so the hotel was not full. The beach was magnificent..the water was warm. People were friendly at the hotel. The only difference with this hotel is that you don't have all the john, dick and harry trying to sell you excursions or if you want your hair braided, etc. The only low point is that the swimming pool is on the wrong side of the building, the swim up bar is not open 24 hours. The building blocks the sun by mid afternoon.. The food in the hotel is expensive, I would recommend walk to the right and you will see a 101 sports bar and they have good food and drinks. They have a hammock that was so comfortable that I was able to lay down there and see the full moon and the palm trees swaying with a little bit of wind. I would definitely go back for some R&R.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely beach front hotel - grat value”
Reviews.Author: karenkaty
Reviews.Content: The view and the beach exceeded our expections. This is not a really fancy hotel, but most folks would like it. It has a lively night club, good drinks, and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for wonderful holidays”
Reviews.Author: Raselex
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the hotel. Although it is a bit old comparing to the modern ones, but the staff, location, view were great! Lots of possibilities in this hotel. Very nice view... Everything was perfect :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip, Wish We Could've Stayed Longer!!”
Reviews.Author: TheWanderer3
Reviews.Content: 3 girlfriends and I stayed here for 5 days and 4 nights in September 2007. We got our room for a GREAT DEAL using Priceline! Sept. is "hurricane season" which is probably why our rate was so great(but it only rained for 15 minutes our entire stay). My advice to people is to go during hurricane season!!! It sounds crazy, but to stay at this amazing resort for under $100 a night is probably only going to happen if you go during that time of the year. The Hotel: -Right on the beach, has great outdoor veranda to eat on. The hammocks are amazing, i slept in one all day! -Pool area is awesome and big with swim-up bar -you're RIGHT BY THE AIRPORT so you will hear planes taking off periodically but it's really not that big of a deal...after a while you just kinda of get used to it -Staff was courteous and helpful -Our room wasn't too big, wasn't too small and we had a partial ocean view. San Juan: -GO TO VIEJO SAN JUAN(OLD SAN JUAN)!!! -Go to El Yunque Rain Forest!!! And take the trail to the waterfall and then jump in for a really fun swim. -Go the the Bacardi Factory! It's just a quick ferry ride from Old San Juan. -**Beware** rent a car, but don't ask locals for directions unless you want to be totally lost!! Also, parking is a bit expensive at the resort so keep that in mind if you want a car. All in all it was a great stay without any problems or issues. The only thing I wish we had done differently was book a longer trip. My best friend is getting married next August and I recommended this hotel as a place to stay for their honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Not Marriott Quality”
Reviews.Author: ksuite
Reviews.Content: While the beach and the pool were exceptionally beautiful, I was disappointed by the rooms and the service at the Marriott hotel. Upon walking into our room we noticed that both beds had a considerable sink hole in the middle of the bed. These beds were not quality and should be thrown out immediately. We slept in this room one night before changing rooms; by sleeping I mean that we slept on the outer edges of the bed with springs poking us in our backs and hips. Before we could move to another room we had to take a shower. The bathroom is outdated, needs caulking, and most importantly the shower nob comes off in your hands. While at the beach we attempted to get service and had to wait 35 minutes before any of the pool attendants came to us (they have red flags which signal you need service on all chairs). Then we had to wait another 35 minutes for Chicken Fingers and a Burger...not to mention we didn't receive our drinks until after the food was served. While at the pool items were stolen right from under us. Not the hotel fault but guests should be made aware that even $2.50 flip flops can be taken. Additionally, the concierge Adrian was quite rude and should be replaced. While all seems to have been bad we did have a wonderful time in Isla Verde. I just wish that the quality that we have come to know from the Marriott brand would have been present in Isla Verde.

Reviews.Title: “GREAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: yasminUsvi
Reviews.Content: I had such a wonderfull experience at the Marriott. The hotel was very well maintained, always clean. Staff was excellent; JORGE at the bar, CYNELLE at the Salsa restaurant, TIJUANA at the front desk. The bellhops can't remember their names but they were always ready to assist me with any questions that I had. I travel to San Juan frequently but this was my first time at the Marriott and I must say that it wont be my last. I work in the hotel industry and know great customer service when I feel it. The employees always seem willing and ready to work at all times. I was not too impressed by the selection at the restaurants but the warmth of the staff over shadowed that and I finally ordered some pork chops which were great. I would definatley refer this hotel to anyone visiting Puerto Rico. It's near a beach, walking distance to restaurants, pharmacy etc. You can even take the bus if you're feeling adventurous.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: rj_traveler_58
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard Isla Verde for the last night from a visit out on the island of PR, since we had an early departure flight. What a pleasant surprise this hotel was! MUCH nicer than any other Courtyard we have ever stayed at! A beautiful lobby, beautiful beach and pool area. A HUGE room, even by Marriott standards. We only stayed one night, but we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Puerto Rico Paradise”
Reviews.Author: lamomma
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough how nice this hotel is. If you are looking for a great beach with palm trees and beautiful sand, gentle waves and great beach lounge chairs this is the place also the pool area is roomy loads of lounge seats and tables to eat at. Swim up bar with food items is a bit pricey but all hotels pool bars are..We did eat lunch there as a treat.We checked in early and we given a room right away Nancy was very nice. Room was clean beds very comfy..nice balcony with view..good size bathroom packed with soaps shampoos etc..great Puerto Rican coffee in room, water bottles, safe and frig again I can't say how beautiful the beach and pool area are

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: greensubmarine
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first and last nights of our honeymoon, going to Vieques for a week in between. The first night, when we mentioned it was our honeymoon, the awesome concierge upgraded us to a wonderful suite with a great view. Our last night, we still got a very nice room, though it was on the small side, I thought the value was excellent. The only reason I don't give this hotel five stars is that I felt that the dining options were overpriced and the food was mediocre. The breakfast buffet was pretty good but cost about $40 for a couple, including tax and tip. Unfortunately we didn't find much to walk to in Isla Verde, so plan on eating at the hotel unless you take a cab elsewhere. That is my only caveat, otherwise this hotel was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect resort on one of Puerto Rico's best beaches”
Reviews.Author: scrubguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on one of the most beautiful beaches in Puerto Rico and its located about 5 minutes from the airport. We caught a cab for about $13 then rented a car for the middle of our trip for about $150. You MUST have a car for at least part of your trip if you want to see any of the sights. The hotel has 4 different pools of varying heights so that the adults and the kids can enjoy. There is also a hot tub that was helpful in meeting many friends during our trip. The beach is just a few steps away from the pool and there are two shower heads to assist in getting the sand off your feet. The food in the hotel is on the expensive side but many restaurants lie within walking distance. I would recommend Metropol and Chili's...about 1/4 mile down the road. The rooms are acceptable though unremarkable but the staff was above average in cleaning and servicing our room, bringing lots of towels each day and stocking us with plenty of free bottled water. We had a small issue with our keys not working on day 4 of our trip, but as a result of this the hotel gave us 4 free drinks in the hotel bar for our inconvenience, a $32 value at least. So, all in all, this will be our destination if we are ever in PR again. Perfect location and solid staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: GottaRun
Reviews.Content: Well-maintained property, right on the beach, clean rooms and comfortable beds. We loved the smoke-free casino with the 4-deck black jack (WITHOUT the continuous shuffling machines). The salsa band was a lot of fun. I highly recommend this hotel if you had a one-night lay-over at the airport, because of it's close proximity and lack of noise. Hotel was booked through Hotwire at $99/night, then we upgraded to a suite for an additional $50 more at check-in. Niccccce.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but the Food and Drink Prices..WoW”
Reviews.Author: Mom_of_Twins64
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Courtyard by Marriott. The hotel was nice, great beach, wonderful pool with a swim-up bar. The staff very friendly and helpful. When we arrived we were placed in a room right over the dumpster which was very smelly and very disappointing we were moved the next evening only to a room alittle higher over the dumpster, they have covered the front of the dumpster now. The food prices are way to high I would have loved to eat at the Salsa buffett but $15.95 each is a bit high when you have children who cannot eat that much, no discounts for kids. The combo's at Banana's were ok but who wants that every meal. I was also shocked at the price of beer and the rum drinks and the price of plain black coffee. We walked daily about 5 mins from hotel to eat. We enjoyed our stay except for the dumpster view I learned not to look down and the high price of food. I do want to say Thanks to all the staff for being GREAT.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: VacationTimeForTwo
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend this hotel. The staff is very, very hospitable and accommodating. This is a reflection of the oversight and leadership of the General Manager, Luis Rivera, and the excellent Restaurant Manager, Hector Sanchez. All the staff went out of their way to make our stay happy and relaxing. Staff would stop and say things such as, "Please feel that this is your home." Since it was the busy season during Christmas week, there was a sumptuous buffet each evening. In general, the food tariff was reasonable compared to other hotels. The location on the beach side is lovely with the only drawback of airplane noise, especially in rooms on one side of the building, but this is unavoidable mostly anywhere if you want to enjoy the Isla Verde beach area. Even though it was a holiday week, there were plenty of lounge chairs around the pretty pool, and we were always able to find a shady spot. We know hotels try to appeal to an eclectic clientele, but we do wish that soft, soothing music be played outside. The room was fine, and housekeeping is conscientious and responsive. Sitting on the balcony just looking at the waves and the colors at sunset was the perfect antidote to job stress and exhaustion. Our goal was simply to relax. We only spent a few minutes in the casino, and there is no gift shop. We basically didn't leave the hotel even though it's an easy walk to other hotels. We very much enjoyed the lively nightly music for listening and dancing. We also watched a beautiful wedding on the beach. If you want a sweet escape with room rates that aren't in the stratosphere, then book a vacation at the Courtyard by Marriott in Isla Verde. I was feeling very guilty about postponing writing a review of this hotel until now since the one I originally tried to submit a long time ago somehow never materialized on Tripadvisor. My husband and I were treated so nicely by everyone, and so I'm trying once again to say some good words in thanks for a wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely would recomend!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lrios86
Reviews.Content: Early in May my friends and I took our first trip to la Isa del Encanto. The hotel reviews had me a bit skeptical but upon arriving I was stunned at the beauty of the hotel. I was a bit upset to find out at check in that there was a resort fee which I wasn't made aware of. Second one of our beds had two stains on it and housekeeping was very nice and immediately came to change the sheets. We received a complimentary fruit plate as an apology, which I though was really nice. The staff was always very helpful and willing to give us tips on where to go whether it be dinning or night activities. The doormen knew us and did greet us everytime we arrived. Friends of ours stayed at another big name hotel and upon visiting ours commented on how many amenities we had and theirs lacked. Free internet and computers with printers were avalible to all guest. Overall I was very pleased with the hotel, view,and location.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need is within reach”
Reviews.Author: DMBFlorida
Reviews.Content: We just got back from PR and all of us stayed at this hotel. Location is the best! Few minutes from the airport, the best beach, casino, music, restaurants. We had a wonderful time and are planning to make it a "traditional yearly visit". Service and food are also excellent. Staff is very friendly and attentive! The maid even remember me from last year's visit! We'll definitely come back again! Congrats to the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: lasfloresdrive
Reviews.Content: Right on the beach, but at the very end of 'civilization' and farther from amenities than other hotels. Friendly staff and comfortable rooms/beds.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: flagirls
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here with Marriott points after a cruise for one night. Our room wasn't ready until 3PM and we arrived at 9AM. They were kind enough to store all of our luggage so that we could sightsee. The beach was beautiful and clean, the pool as well. Sad to say we didn't get to use either. When we arrived back at the hotel later, it was raining and we had to fly out at 6AM the next morning. They gave us free drink coupons and we had the BEST Mojito I had ever had. We made our dinner on appetizers, so it was fairly affordable. The room was beautiful, clean and even had a view of the ocean. We left at 5AM, so did not get to have breakfast. But, the morning we arrived, while waiting on our taxi, we did have complimentary coffee and some wonderful pastries. Later we had yummy ice cream sundaes at the food counter at the front of the hotel. I can't afford the regular price for this hotel, but it was definitely nice. Next visit to PR, I hope to be closer to Old San Juan so we can walk around. The beach is nice, but living in Florida, I can do without it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, a bit far away from things though!”
Reviews.Author: kelleykath
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard Marriott was very nice. Staff was friendly and the beach and pool were very nice. Food was fine - expensive, but that's to be expected. However, I thought we would be closer to things in Isla Verde and found that not to be the case. We could really eat in the hotel, or walk several long blocks to restaurants. I've got a 4 year old and he's slow! Nice hotel, but I wish I had just decided we wouldn't leave the property.

Reviews.Title: “VERY expensive food shop in lobby”
Reviews.Author: ZorroNJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here various times since 2004. Previously we really enjoyed it. Although our stay this time was free, we could not get comfortable there. VERY expensive food shop in lobby. Staff was not helpful.

Reviews.Title: “40th wedding get away”
Reviews.Author: Wallydgator
Reviews.Content: Friends recommended this hotel and it was perfect for us older folks who enjoy a few drinks, a good beach and pool and a very friendly staff. I have nothing bad to say about this place. Close to the airport, good food, weather was nice and warm, nice room.... loved it.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay!"”
Reviews.Author: suavecito11
Reviews.Content: There are many great hotels and resorts in Puerto Rico, but we wanted to stay close to the airport and San Juan so we chose this Marriott. The service at this hotel is outstanding! They go out of their way to make sure you have everything you need for a comfortable stay. For example; we ordered room service one morning and they called after a while just to see how we enjoyed our meal...when's the last time you've heard of that? The staff is friendly and obviously enjoy what they do. The rooms are nice and spacious enough. We had ajoining rooms that both had partial ocean views. Plenty of room to sit out on the balcony as well. The rooms have flat screen TV's with all the options for movies and shows. The beds were very comfortable. There truly is so much to do around the hotel itself you never have to leave. The beach is wonderful. They provide you with lounges, towels, and come by to take your drink order. There is a nice swimming pool with a bar you can swim up to. The beach is kept immaculate. There are several great dining options and a wondeful bar called Picante. We danced to two awesome Salsa bands who play Wednesday night through Saturday night. Great drinks, great atmosphere, and great wait staff. The Casino is smoke-free as the rest of the establishment. There a good selection of slots and a couple of table games as well. We had a couple days of rain so having so much to do at the hotel helped entertain our family when the beach wasn't an option. One last thing: I had misplaced my wedding band...wasn't sure if I left it in the room or somewhere else. Nonetheless, the staff was so responsive that they literally ripped the room apart helping me look for it. The manager even contacted me to offer me all the help he could. After all the trouble they went through I ended up finding it my suitcase! I called to thank them again for all their help and the assistant GM Miguel called me back to hear he was glad everything turned out to be a happy ending. We have family we go every year in PR, so this is our place to stay without question. Thanks and have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff goes a long way...”
Reviews.Author: AuburnTiger1996
Reviews.Content: I checked in on Friday, April 24, 2009. My trip was 1/2 pleasure (Fri-San) and 1/2 business (Mon-Tue). I arrived at the hotel around 2 PM and was promptly checked in. As a Marriott Platinum Member, I was already upgraded when I arrived (I stay in a Courtyard EVERY week and ALWAYS have to ask for an upgrade). It was nice to be upgraded w/o having to ask, especially since I used points for most of my stay. The staff at the pool bar/restaurant was a little dazed and confused but a Manager quickly stepped in and corrected the slow service, taking good care of me. The food was OK...standard hamburger and fries...a bit pricey at $12! I enjoy a pool that has full service; i.e. I can lay out all day and have drinks and food brought to me if I so wish! The nicest restaurant on the grounds was good but again, pricey. All the servers that served me were very attentive and friendly. I asked for some things not on the menu and my requests were granted. Overall, I would stay here again. I would bring some breakfast items with me as the buffet is high at $15.95! Food was good, but not $15 good! Enjoy YOUR time off wherever it takes you!

Reviews.Title: “Changed our mind”
Reviews.Author: artfam
Reviews.Content: Visited friends at this hotel and spent a lot of time there. Great ambiance! There was a salsa band and dancing on Friday and Saturday night. The food was fair.Restaurant was beautiful both inside and outside. We were going to book here, but wound up staying at our first choice, the Embassy Suites. The reasons that we didn't: -Beware of the sand fleas. Yes, this is a part of nature. We never experienced it further down the beach. We usually go to the beach in front of the ESJ. However, a week later, we are still feeling the impact. My suggestion would be to bring the Benadryl, Cortisone, and Cutter. The staff will also give you spray for free. Again, this is a part of nature and the hotel cannot help this and they are so sweet about it. However, it was a bit much for my family. -It wasn't very close to the other hotels or restaurants on the strip. The airplanes didn't bother us at all. We were able to tune it out. But, for all that we wanted to do, it was a little further out. I think that this would be a great hotel! But, for us, we wanted to be a bit closer to the thick of Isla Verde.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach and great service”
Reviews.Author: judyabby
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the hotel for 1 night prior to a cruise and used Marriott rewards points. Although we arrived at 10:30 AM, our room was ready at noon, significantly before regular check-in time. While waiting for our room to be cleaned, we were given a pass to get pool towels and provided with a room for changing our clothes. We had a leisurely wait at the pool and beautiful beach. The hotel has a great resort atmosphere and the pool and beach area was very well staffed with friendly personnel. Although the hotel is near the airport, airplane noise was barely an issue at the beach and planes could not be heard at all from the room, which had double glass doors. As a Marriott Gold elite, I was treated very well. We were assigned to a beautiful top floor ocean front room and provided with free drink and casino match play coupons. Service provided by the Assistant General Manager, Miguel Rivas, and front desk personnel was outstanding. I will definitely return to the hotel for a future longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, wrong island”
Reviews.Author: aaronr
Reviews.Content: let me start by saying that if I were going to return to PR, I would stay here again. It was nice, clean, really hoppin at night and a good value. I will also say that I will not return to PR. The Courtyard beach is great and service was very good. rooms are clean, but nothing special. Beds comfy. Parking was $16/day additional. You can bring your own rum to the beach and no one cares which is cool, they'll even bring you ice and cups. I am a Marriott rewards gold and still had to wait for a room after arriving for check in at 4:00 PM which was disappointing. Overall we found PR to feel very unsafe (especially at night), it was busy, dirty, and I would not go back. For the same money I'd go back to Aruba, Cayman, Cancun, Jamaica, or St Thomas instead.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome place”
Reviews.Author: simonie83
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice and relaxing end to our vacation. We stayed 1 night before we left to go home from a week traveling the island. It was the nicest place we stayed during our trip and we loved the luxuory it provided. Was able to get a good discount rate online and had an ocean view room, with flat screen tv, fridge, and a very comfortable bed. Room was very clean, very large, and had a good view of the beach. Hotel had a small casino in it that we didnt visit and several places to eat. We ate at the outside cafe by the beach which was very good. Also ordered some room service which was so so. Drinks by the ocean were also good a little expensive but on par with everything else on the island. The airport is close by so their will be noise from airplanes flying. However that is the case with any of the hotels in this area. It wasnt a problem for us really barely even noticed it. The beach here was very nice and clean. Had a lot of beach chairs for use and water was great. Would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Choose another hotel”
Reviews.Author: mattbrooke
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Courtyard one night after our cruise. We are Marriott silver elite members and arrived at the Marriott at 10:30am. We were told there would be a room around 12pm and was told that check-in time is 4pm. At 12pm my husband checked back and they kindly reminded us again that check-in is 4pm and our room was not ready. We finally got a call on our cell phone at 1:40pm that we had a room. Very discourteous and unhelpful. We stayed at the Caribe Hilton prior to the cruise and there were cruise people that received rooms at 11am. The noise from the jets on the beach makes it very unrelaxing. Would not stay here again. Staff is very unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, great service, awesome beach”
Reviews.Author: MichaelP64
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard isn't exactly in the quietest part of town (you can hear take offs and landings during the day since it's very close to the runway). After the airport quiets down, it's a nice relaxing beachfront hotel. The casino is small but enough to get your slot machine or blackjack fix in. A wide range of restaurants is in the lobby to serve you. Best of all, the staff is incredibly accomodating, helpful and nice 24/7. The pool/beach attendants are great and the rum drinks are yummy (we even got coupons for 2 free ones). Bed is comfortable, bottled water in the room is a nice touch. All-in-all, a peaceful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: MNfast11
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because the beach front location. Its on a public beach but the beach was not crowded at all during our stay, even on the weekends. The staff was amazing, from the housekeeping we got everyday to the bellhops, who recommended restaurants and called taxis for us, to the cabana workers who brought us chairs and towels. We could hear the planes from the airport if we were outside but it was not bothersome at all. It sort of lulled us into falling asleep on the beach. From our room, we couldn't hear them. Overall I liked this hotel because the staff was friendly and knowledgeable, the beach right outside and the general peacefulness of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Old,like staying on a runway”
Reviews.Author: michelmom
Reviews.Content: Hotel is badly in need of a remodel.Asked for ocean view,received partial view. Rooms were clean,but just hanging a few pictures does not make over a room.Food very expensive,only option for breakfast was pricey buffet.Pool small ,not weel taken care of. Concierge not helpful.Airport noise loud. Would not stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Very nice beach, pool, casino, near San Juan's airport!”
Reviews.Author: Phillylad
Reviews.Content: This Marriott-affiliated hotel has a snack bar, a restaurant, a very nice beach and large pool area (several pools), an exercise center, a casino, and is very close to the San Juan airport -- some might think too close since you can hear the take-offs when out at beach or pool. Very clean, nice personnel; not-great food, very slow service sometimes in eating areas; eat the made-as-you-watch omlets for breakfast, not the pastries or pre-cooked buffet dishes. Not exactly cheap, but struggling with low occupancy even in mid-March 2009, so maybe you can talk them into a better rate. Most rooms have at least "some view" of the ocean. Safe neighborhood, several very good restaurants ("Metropol") and an InterContinental hotel/casino with multi-restaurants within half mile easy walk. Beach is about two miles long: clean, but with a mid-range camping site next door, and a little-used public beach beyond that.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: beatlemaniacs
Reviews.Content: I booked my family to stay here for five nights through New Year's Eve and beyond. The food - very good. Wait service and staff even better. Restaurants are pretty good. Get there early for the breakfast buffet. Everyone very polite and hardworking, a wonderful representation of Puerto Rico. Clean, friendly and generally uncrowded beach with staff everywhere. Airplane takeoffs and landings were not overly frequent and not bothersome. Suggest booking the deluxe beach view. You won't regret it. Casino is convenient, and plan on having a good time losing slowly but surely. Parking garage makes it easy to rent a car by the airport, and head out for daytrips. Getting to downtown San Juan is PITA, due to traffic. Be sure to leave early. We did not and paid the price. On return to PR, we'd definitely return to this Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “What you'd expect from a Courtyard Marriott...”
Reviews.Author: x2fr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in one of the standard â€œOcean Viewâ€� rooms on the 7th Flr . It was not an â€œocean frontâ€� room but provided us a peek-a-boo view of the ocean and full view of the apartments in the building next door. When booking a room here, opt for the â€œocean viewâ€� rooms on the east side of the buildingâ€”the right side when facing the ocean; thereâ€™s no building on that side to obstruct your view. Hotelâ€™s in a good location if you want to be near the airport or want to be around the beaches of Isla Verde. However, the neighborhood itâ€™s in does not offer many attractions, restaurants, and shops; unlike what you would find if you stay in the Old San Juan area. If not for the beach, thereâ€™s nothing charming about the neighborhood itâ€™s in. The hotel grounds, however, are very nice and expansive. The beach area is clean, and the swimming pool is large and fun to hang out in. Our room is spacious although a bit dark because of only one window/balcony. The closets are on the small side but there are plenty of drawers. The dÃ©cor and furnishings seem new; wonderful big flat screen TV; and the bed is very comfortable! The room seems well-insulated for sound and so, we really didnâ€™t hear any noises from the hall or adjacent rooms. The jets flying in and out of the airport, on the other hand, could be easily heard and sound like thunder sometimes. But youâ€™d only hear them intermittently from about 7am to 11 pm. There didnâ€™t seem to be any jets flying in the middle of the night. If there were, we didnâ€™t hear them at all! The hotelâ€™s restaurants are predictably Marriott quality. We had the buffet at the Salsa Restaurant downstairs and enjoyed the wide variety of local cuisine offerings. It was pricey but we had a view of the beach and listened to the live band while we dined. Overall, dining there is not remarkable but not disappointing either; certainly convenient but, again, pricey. The service in all aspects of the hotel is friendly, efficient, and prompt. But of note, we highly commend and are very grateful to the concierge (her name is Yadira) who helped us rent a car. Our request was a last-minute need and she worked way past her shift in the evening calling around rental car companies to secure a car for us. When she did find one, she drove us to the rental car company in her own car, on her own time and without expecting anything in return! She was just so kind and wonderful! Again, a heartfelt thank you and kudos to her! Bottom line, I would recommend this hotel mainly for the beach, convenience to the airport, and easy highway access especially if you use this as your base to do day trips outside of SJ. However, if youâ€™re looking for a charming hotel and want to experience SJâ€™s unique culture, opt for a hotel in Old San Juan. Like other Courtyard Marriotts, this has a business-like ambiance to it. Although the room furnishings seem new, the building and grounds itself are showing its age. If you can get a good price here, it is worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice getaway”
Reviews.Author: RussJ35
Reviews.Content: this is a very nice hotel, nice looking pool that has palm trees around it. nice swim up bar although we didn't use it, for ome reason the water was very cold during our stay. We spent our time on the beach eating and drinking. The hotel has a very nice lobby bar /club. You really don't have to lave the hotel if you didn't want too. At night there's great music along with salsa dancing, you'll have a great time sat nite. Cons food is very expensive and during the weekends there is way too many kids around. I still think this hotel is worth checking out if your looking for a nice room with a pool and beach.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay !!!”
Reviews.Author: linerv
Reviews.Content: We came to the Courtyard in Isle Verde for a honeymoon/baseball tournament and we had the most perfect stay. The staff was so attentive and friendly, we could not have asked for better. The hotel is spacious and clean and the beach was beautiful. There is a casino and five different places to eat right at the hotel. The weekend at the Picante bar was busy with dancing and music until the wee hours but don't worry, it won't keep you up. All of the food was tasty and fairly decent prices in all the locations ( I ate at all of them!) The beach was clean and it was easy to find a good spot out there (the guys bring your chair wherever you want it). We will be going back the same time next year! Thank you to all of the staff that made our stay so special!

Reviews.Title: “Easy and nice.”
Reviews.Author: LLuetje
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just one night as an easy place to get to from the airport before heading down to the southern part of the island. The room was fine, a little musty when we walked in but gone within 15 minutes of air conditioning. The grounds are very nice and feel like a resort. We ate at the buffet breakfast and it was delicious. The night time scene is very fun. They have a casino with slots and tables, live music for salsa dancing and a big bar. The airplane noise was there (true) but between the time we checked in (4pm) and the time we checked out (11am) we heard three planes, none of which were while we slept. There are other hotels you can walk to to check out on the "strip" as well as some good restaurants and convenience stores like Walgreens. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Only downside was a daily parking fee but I guess this is be expected in a city location. I would stay here again, but probably wouldn't make a week long vacation of it--I prefer a more remote spot.

Reviews.Title: “nice beachfront hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFamilyTrip
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few days at Christmas and enjoyed our stay very much. Let me start by saying every staff member we met was just great here --- helpful and friendly, even when working on Christmas day when they might have wanted to be with their family. The hotel is right on the beach, with one restaurant having outdoor tables beside the beach, not to mention the pool and bar area also adjoining the beach. The long Isla Verde beach is very pretty with nice smooth sand, although there was a mild seaweed zone you had to get through to get out into body-surfing depth water. It was never too crowded at the beach or pool. The hotel had three places to eat: a small ice-cream shop which also sold sandwiches, the main lobby bar, and the main restaurant. The bar area is big and it isn't a problem to have kids there to eat at a table, and you can get moderately priced meals there. The food at the bar was not bad and it and the ice cream shop were fairly priced, I'd have to say. The main dining area usually had big buffets and was considerably more expensive. We didn't have a rate that included breakfast so we never had that at the hotel. There are several other restaurants a short walk up the road and a grocery store that you can walk to in about 20 min. Our room for four was nice. Very clean and up to usual Marriott Courtyard standards easily. Very much a standard US hotel room. No complaints there at all. It is next to the airport. In our room, this didn't bother us at all as the windows seemed soundproofed enough. It was kind of annoying to listen to the planes taking off when on the beach or walking down the Isla Verde street to other restaurants. I think we had the same view as many other tripadvisor reviewers -- a small glimpse of the beach, but a big vew of air-conditioning, trash dumpsters , and ugly next door condos. That view plus the noise pretty much rendered the balcony useless. The other buildings around the Marriott looked like condos that were way past their prime and mostly vacant. I'd be very leery of renting a condo in San Juan after seeing them. Overall, we enjoyed our stay there and it is a pleasant place to relax by the beach. It is fairly far from Old San Juan, not just a short walk or bus ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard by Marriott Isla Verde Beach Resort A Great Place to Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Snoopy1California
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the Courtyard by Marriott Isla Verde Beach Resort and found it very enjoyable. We ate at the restraunts located in the resort and found both the resort and restraunt staff to be very friendly and helpful. The food was excellent as well. Really liked eating breakfast out on the patio each morning and enjoyed our Ocean Side View with a partial view of the airport. We liked being able to watch the planes take off along with the view of the beach and ocean. With the patio door closed, airport noise was not a problem, and even with them open at night there was very little noise. Phillip and Sharon Miller

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Sun_worshipper_2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard Marriott Isla Verde the week prior to Christmas. I had read the reviews on this site prior to going, and they were somewhat mixed. We were very pleased with our stay, would come back again and have recommended the hotel to others. It's less than 5 minutes from the airport, and the cab fair was reasonable (less than $20 with tip). The hotel is right on the beach, has a nice beach front pool area, and all rooms have ocean views and balconies. The room was clean and the decor was new, including a flat screen television. There was a small refrigerator, and it was not stocked, so you could actually use it, which was great. It has a really nice vibe in the lobby, with live music on the weekends and a small casino. The hotel is not perfect. The gym/fitness room is inadaquate. One day our room was not made up. The breakfast buffet was only fair. However, the price (we booked through marriott.com) was fantasic! I think with this hotel it's all about your expectations. The property is a Courtyard by Marriott, not a Marriott. If you want a clean hotel with renovated rooms right on the beach you will be thrilled, but it is not super luxury.

Reviews.Title: “very loud jet noise”
Reviews.Author: behappymn
Reviews.Content: Although the staff is very accommodating, and even though the motel is located right on the beach, we would not ever stay at this motel again. The jet noise, with the airport right on the other side of the road out in front of this motel is startling loud! There is no way to mask this loud jet noise, and we wouldn't even use the deck from our room, which had a nasty view of the top of the roof with air conditiong units making their own noise! It is a shame that an otherwise pretty descent motel is not more sound proof. I wasn't able to get any sleep and wanted to check-out ASAP the next morning. I would gladly pay an extra $50.00/night elsewhere on the beach without the jet noise...very disturbing and not a place to relax and unwind and have conversation outside! I am shocked at how little other reviews never mentioned the level of noise from the jets...I would never bring a baby here for fear it would damage their hearing.

Reviews.Title: “cheaper so expect less”
Reviews.Author: familyman42
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business 3 nights. I stay at a lot of Marriotts. . Take away the fact that this is right on the beach and it is basically a super 8 hotel or a holiday inn. (I was told that this is actually an old renovated holiday inn). Room and bathroom were clean. Air conditioning was one of those cheap inside the room motel units where you control the temp by turning knobs on the AC unit. It was noisy but noisy is good because you are VERY near the airport. Room smelled bad when I entered to drop my bags but it was better when I came back that night as I turned the AC up before I left. I was on the east side of the hotel (Even numbered rooms) and had an ocean view. The only problem was that if you look down, you see a really dirty and LOUD roof with lots of AC units on top of it. Stay on as high a floor as possible so you don't have to listen to the industrial sounds out your window. Breakfast is average. . . just average .. workers were doing some repairs on the floor so all you could hear was a floor sander all morning. Location is near the airport but the Ritz Carlton is equally near the airport. It is right on the beach but just a little bit seedy to be walking down the street at night. Beach is clean, nice and safe. Basically, if you are used to the "clean and crisp feel" of a Marriott, this does not feel like a Marriott. If you are going on vacation with your kids and you want to be right on the beach and not worry about your kids running through a higher-end resort, this place is probably fine. I would not stay here again, even if I came with my family but for the money, it is an average place, next to the airport that is saved by being right on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “was a nice room but to expensive evrything”
Reviews.Author: manzanita_light
Reviews.Content: we went on vacation for our aniversary for a week. This hotel, was nice only if we stay inside on our room, we try to used the pool but was dirty, and we try some food at the restaurant we did not like, and it was really expensive. almost everything was over price. but our room was really comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place Despite Late Check-in”
Reviews.Author: Mr G
Reviews.Content: Wireless: Big points for a major hotel offering free wireless (when it worked). Normally these larger chains have wireless available for a fee - and a large fee at that. This one was free. Other Marriotts could learn from this and put their greed aside. Check in was supposed to be at 15:00 and was disappointing - in fact the worst part of the stay. After a long trip from Belgium, the last thing we wanted was an unpleasant surprise to deal with. We arrived around 13:30, announced ourselves, left our bags and went for lunch at the Metropol. So they knew we were waiting. No complaints yet as we were early. Returned at 15:00 to be told that the room wasnâ€™t ready and that check in BEGINS at 15:00. Not at 15:00, but BEGINNING at 15:00. What does that mean? Check in could be as late as midnight??? I became difficult at that point and gave the desk many questions that they either stumbled through or couldnâ€˜t answer without a canned reply from the Marriott book. In the end the room was ready at 16:00. It would have been later had I not been such a nuisance. The desk was professional, mature and polite, but geared to justifying the situation. (Did you know that it takes 45 minutes to clean a room and that there are four cleaners for every twelve rooms, some people donâ€™t check out on time and that a lot of other people are also waiting?) Interesting but not as interesting as â€œCheck-in BEGINS at 15:00!!!. We were told to GO AWAYâ€� and have lunch, or have dinner, or have a drink, or walk around. Also, the desk staff kept disappearing into the rear for us and other people trying to check in which really slowed things. When I told them that we had hoped to have a few hours at the beach for the children, we were told that most families bring a change of beach clothes with them in case this situation happens. That was really helpful. Nothing was offered to make us feel better (free drinks, food coupons, room discount, etc). We were informed that the room was an upgrade from â€œOcean viewâ€� to â€œOcean Frontâ€�, but the room wasnâ€™t on the front, so I donâ€™t know what they were talking about. Maybe there are rooms with Ocean Front in capital letters and ocean front in lower case. But they lost big, big points here. After all, this is a Marriott and Marriott has a lot of beatings of drums over being a great host. (The late check-in appeared to be a daily occurrence.) Room was good size and nice, but average. Bathroom was clean but â€œtiredâ€�. Large screen TV with good channels. Small fridge. Small safe in room. Beds were very, very comfortable. Could have used a bit more storage furniture. Pool had a lagoon motif. Not very big, but always space available. (The beach was so nice that most people went there.) Lots of sun beds pool-side or by the beach. Hot tub was hot, really too hot - but then again, it is called a hot tub. Pool staff very polite and efficient. There was a wedding one afternoon and it was interesting to see how they slowly closed down parts of the patio to accommodate the wedding with minimal impact on the other guests. We had stayed at the Intercontinental (IC, for the purposes of this review) the last time we were in Isle Verde - and the IC was superior to the Courtyard in every category. But then, the IC costs more. Our expectations of the Courtyard were high based on the IC, so some aspects were disappointing from the start. The best part of the hotel was the access to the beach - one of the reasons we stayed here. Clean sand, nice waves, leave the pool and walk right onto the beach itself. Kids loved it. Safe and fun. House-keeping was a bit slow, but they lost big points as we found a used condom on the bathroom floor when we first entered the room during our late check-in. Yuck!!!! Housekeeping resources was also just as strained during the visit as it was during the check-in. The first full day the room wasnâ€™t cleaned until 17:00. I spoke with my friends at the check-in desk and they fixed this. Afterwards, the room was cleaned in the morning. I guess that you have to tell the hotel what you want instead of letting them guess what you want. The hotel had several restaurants, but better value for money could be found outside. There was a breakfast buffet for $15.95, but as a family of four, it would cost about $70 once the tax was applied. There was an ice cream counter that also had some baked items, but despite having three people behind the counter, you had to beat them with a stick to get their attention. In fairness to the hotel regarding food prices, all the other hotels on the beach also price gouge. They will charge as much as they think they can get you to pay. There were people in the restaurants, but many of them were short term visitors who went in without knowing what the damage would be. The prices at the IC were much worse. As a breakfast alternative, there was a Dennyâ€™s ten minutes away across from the Metropol (see below). Normal Dennnyâ€™s food, but service was very, very slow. Accept it and you will be happy. Expect something snappy and you will get into a irritated funk. With the portions they served, our brood of four only cost $20. Also a Walgreens pharmacy in the same shopping area. Speaking of prices, we took it on the chin for the room charge. During Christmas they (and all the other hotels) double the rate. So instead of around $180 a day, the room was $350. It was still cheaper than the other hotels we considered. They also attached a â€œresort feeâ€œ of $45 (13% of the base price) a night. I was told that covered free water in the rooms, towel service at the pools and entertainment at night. Seems like a lot for daily water, one towel per person and loud music. It wasnâ€™t a government required fee (like tourist tax), but just a Marriott policy. Why charge a separate fee for no visible and severable cost unless you are trying to hide a surcharge to make your rate look more attractive? Also a fee of $25 for each person in the room over two people per night. So in our case, another $50 per night. Not a severable cost that they were trying to recover. It was just an additional price that Marriott charges. As they couldnâ€™t associate a cost for the two extra people other than extra towels, I suppose the hotel grabs what it can take. We knew about the fees when we made the reservation by looking closely at the Marriott website, but many of my fellow travelers were surprised to see it on their bills. Why hide these costs in the small print of the reservation? Put it up front in the rate. Greed. And greed will find you by yourself and lonely one day Marriott at Isle Verde. The hotel over charged us on the final bill in that one of our brood was 12 and exempt to the $25 extra person fee and they applied the 13% resort fee to the extra person fee also. We chatted about it for some time and they finally eliminated the resort fee, but kept the extra person fees. As we are now on food, the location of hotel was a little inconvenient as it is on the end of the developed beach. All the non-hotel restaurants were a short walk away along a busy road (busy with cars, but sometimes a little uneasily devoid of people - especially at night - until you reach the Metropol). Lots of â€œfamilyâ€� style or fast food places 15 minutes away on the main rood (across from the IC). As well as the Mi Casita in a small strip mall across from the IC - good local fare at very reasonable prices. Basic atmosphere, but always packed. The bill at Mi Casita doubled charged the drinks one night, so buyer beware. Also a Chinese place a few doors down from Mi Casita. Normally not very full, but tasty. Not great, but tasty. Best non-hotel restaurant remains the Metropol - local food, fairly priced, big portions, nice atmosphere. Between the hotel and the IC and next to the cock-fighting arena (wonder if the losing birds are served at the restaurant next door?). We went there almost everyday. The kids loved the grilled red snapper. I liked the pepper steak Cuban style and stuffed guinea fowl. Service could have been better, but it depended if you have the A team or the B team for waiters. Also, the wife reported that there wasnâ€™t any running water in the ladies room for three days (including flush). So â€œfreshen upâ€� before you go just in case and avoid a seat (at a table) near the toilets. She reported it each time, but what the heck - all the waiters were guys so I suppose it didnâ€™t matter. Menâ€™s room was fine. Sounds like a one-off since this hadnâ€™t occurred on previous vacations there. The worst Mexican food in North America can still be found at Lupiâ€™s on the main drag between the hotel and the IC. Great place for getting beered up and watching sports programmes, but the food is the worst Mexican fare I have ever had. Iâ€™ve seen some good reviews of it on the internet, but I wonder how much these reviewers had to drink before they ate something there. Last year two of the dishes werenâ€™t edible - when we brought it to their attention, the waitress and â€œmanagerâ€� assured us that the food was fine, and we had just ordered something that we didnâ€™t like (grilled snapper or grouper and a traditional Mexican combo plate). Such a disappointment. It looked like the menu had changed somewhat since last time, but after our first experience, why throw money away. Anything that bad doesnâ€™t deserve a second chance. Having said that, we did dip our toes in the water and tried the Lupiâ€™s Nachos during a beering session. I thought they were so-so, but the wife thought they were the worst sheâ€™s had. Guacamole was described as slimey and the beef suspicious. She couldnâ€™t eat it. That was yesterday and I donâ€™t feel sick, so I suppose it was ok to eat it. The pool guys at the hotel also thought that the food was bad - with the exception of the buffalo wings. Looks fantastic from the outside as a Mexican sports bar - your mouth will water, but such a disappointment. Itâ€™s hard to mess up Mexican food (even Taco Bell Express and Old El Paso at the supermarket get by), but they found the secret (its even worse than mine). One thing we didnâ€™t like (not related to the hotel), was the absence of small grocery stores. 7-11â€˜s, etc. to stock the fridge in the room There was one across from the IC of good size, but the shelves were only one third full. Strange place. There was also a Pueblo market on the other side of the Holiday Inn, but not very easy to get to. Would I go back again? If my first choices were too expensive or full, I think that I would. But I would watch the bill like a hawk and let them know ahead of time that check-in was at 15:00 and rooms were to be cleaned in the morning. After all, the beach was great and the people tried hard to make it a nice stay (once you checked in).

Reviews.Title: “could not have been any better!!”
Reviews.Author: KathyGlow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard Marriott pre-cruise in January. I have read the other reviews before we went to San Juan. When we pulled up to the hotel via taxi I was so surprised! Nice fountain and beautiful hotel! The beach is wonderful! Beautiful palm tree's, nice hammocks to lounge in and wonderful pool area. We arrived in the afternoon and our rooms were already ready. We were again surprised that we were offered some coupons for the bar for a free drink. That was so nice. We didn't have oceanfront rooms but were again shocked to find out we did have ocean views! Our views were from the sides but still nice! We had a really clean and comfortable room. The room was large with a nice size deck. All the rooms will have a deck. We were on a higher floor room which was nice. We only stayed one night but wished we could have stayed longer. You could easily stay right here for a week or longer! The outdoor restaurant was very nice. We didn't eat there but menu looked good. We ate at the buffet and that was good. Salsa night club was fun with people dancing and good drinks. We went into Casino for a few mintutes & my husband did win! Fun! Cute little gift shop and little cafe also on the main floor. The next day we ate at the cafe and brought our food outside by the pool. The bar opened up at 10:30 and we had our first Pina Colada. So good. Very nice pool area. The beach was wonderful and we had fun in the large waves that were splashing up that monring. I would stay here again without hesitation. Wonderful stay. The only negative is that we only were able to stay one night. We had fun on the cruise but would like to return to the Courtyard Marriott Resort. I agree with a previous review that the website pics don't do the resort justice. Oh...you do here the planes but I found it fun as you are on a tropical island!! If you stay at a smaller island anyplace on the island you can hear the planes!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel inside and out - 5 Stars As Far As I'm Concerned”
Reviews.Author: farrisva
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Expedia using their hotel/air combination. What a great deal. The pictures on the website do not do it justice -- you really have to see the place.
