From the time our cab pulled up in front - it was a delightful experience. The bellman was friendly and we never touched out bags until they were up in our room. Expedia said we had an ocean view room but when we arrived, we didn't. The hotel gave us a free immediate upgrade to an ocean view room and also to a higher floor for a better view. Our balcony faced the ocean from a side view and it was great! The airport is very close, so if you don't like the sound of airplanes taking off and landing, don't stay here. For us, it was music to our ears and enhanced the excitement of being away. This beachfront hotel is the nicest we have stayed in bar NONE! Hammocks, beautiful pool, hottub, sandy beach and the ocean - who could ask for more? Several nice restaurants inside the hotel. Seating outside for a beach breakfast, lunch, or dinner. Staff welcomed us with open arms. Nice and close to the pier. They arranged for a van to take us to the pier and it was ready outside in the morning at a specific agreed-upon time. I would recommend this hotel to families and couples. Very romantic and a lot of fun!

Reviews.Title: “Only 1 Negative”
Reviews.Author: caltone
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel October 24-27. No problems checking in. We arrived at 2:45 and there were 4 people ahead of us. We were in our room by 3. Our room was very nice, large with a partial oceanview. We did, however, hear the airplanes in our room. Not a big deal, I could have been at work instead. The beach was beautiful and we didn't experience any problems wih sand fleas. We ate several meals at the hotel and the food was delicious. We also walked to Dennys for breakfast one morning, about a 15 min walk from the hotel. A Walgreens is in the same shopping center as Dennys. The staff at this hotel is the best! If you stay there, look for Pedro at the bell stand. He was very helpful with information on Old San Juan and made several recommendations. Also, the manager of Salsa (can't remember his name) does a great job. The only negative is the resort fee. Many hotels in San Juan charge some type of fee so this is not exclusive to the Courtyard. But we thought it was ridiculous that guests had to rent beach chairs ($6 each per day). The chairs should be an included amenity if a resort fee is charged. Or allow guests to pay for the services they actually use (chairs,gym, internet, etc) instead of paying a resort fee. All in all, we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “No problems whatsoever”
Reviews.Author: g_a_r_y6
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a quick getaway 11/15 - 11/18. Check In: Check in was smooth, the welcome drink was a nice touch. When we arrived our room was not ready so we took a walk to the grocery store (15 minute walk)...I think it was called Pueblo. We bought supplies for the next few days snacks, bread, sandwich meats, beer, rum etc. Room: We had an ocean view room on the opposite side from the airport. The view was so-so but we don't spend much time in the room so we didn't mind. We went to the beach instead where the view was just fine. Hotel/Lobby/Grounds: The pool was very nice but we spent our time on the beach. We rented chairs ($6 per day)..drink prices we high so we made our own in our mugs and brought them to the beach. The hot tub was luke warm one day and scalding hot the next so we didn't get to use it. Casino was nice, entertainment in the lobby was lively. We don't do the salsa but those that do were fun to watch. Meals: For breakfast we are "bagel and coffee" people so that's all we did...got our bagel and coffee at banana's. Lunch we did on our own..brought our own sandwiches and snacks to the beach. We did dinner one night at Chili's and the next two nights in Old San Juan (Dragon Fly & Parrot Club) both were excellent. Taxi: Taxis are expensive. A taxi into Old San Juan is $21 + tip each way. The bus is free. We did the bus. Walk out of the hotel, go left, and wait at the bus stop in front of Denny's. Take the A5 or the C53 into Old San Juan. The last bus out of Old San Juan is at 9:00pm so if you are late you will need to take a cab. Also, leaving the hotel a taxi will cost $12.50 + tip to take you one mile to the airport. The bus is free...you do the math. Car rental: I would not rent a car unless I needed it for a certain day. Parking in Old San Juan is very difficult and it costs $15 per day to park in the hotel. We went to the rain forest one day and rented a car just for the day from Charlie (15 min walk) San Fleas: They a little bit of a problem in the early morning or late evening but non-existent during the day. We brought bug spray but never used it. Airplane noise Airplanes makes noise. The hotel is next to the airport. This was not a problem for us. Every plane I heard was a plane that I was not on. I was on a beach. no problem. Summary: Great place to stay. We'd do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Communication”
Reviews.Author: Bigfoot64
Reviews.Content: I have sent 3 requests for information from this hotel over a 2 week period. (We have a wedding party staying in San Juan) No response from reservations, or the information email addresses. Based on this experience, if you want to stay at this hotel, book it. If you need information before booking, don't waste your time waiting for a response.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for sand fleas!”
Reviews.Author: natlopez
Reviews.Content: Pros: * Nice and helpful staff * Plenty of food options * Casino * Concerige is great Cons: * Rooms have carpet that get wet and full of sand and sand fleas that bite you all day / night (I suggest they remove the carpet like most resorts with pool / beach access) * The beach is nice but filled with sand fleas (they offer a free bug spray that doesn't work * The front desk is too slow. They either need more people for a streamlined process for check-in. It took me ~15 mins to check-in. Way too long * For the price, there are nicer places on the same street (namely the Ritz Carlton) * Food isn't that good in Picante (burger was bland) or Salsa (all food was tasteless) * Pool was kinda gross. Needs updating. The hot tub is very small and because of the way the jets are setup it throws sand at you

Reviews.Title: “We loved our trip to PR”
Reviews.Author: twotwin
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Courtyard was GREAT!!!!!! I had read so many reviews and was a little nervous about our stay but was pleasently surprised. The view was excellent of the beach from our room. We rented a car for the week and was glad we did. We went out for breakfast several mornings so the car came in handy. There is a Denny's a mile or so down the road. The staff was very helpful and nice to talk to if you needed anything. We would stay here again if we went back to Puerto Rico!!!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: rixon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 2 nights before a caribbean cruise. Room was on the corner with a partial see view. Nice view of the airport. Hotel was good, very large room. Thought the breakfast was pricey, so went to Denny's 4 minutes away. Hotel right on a great beach. Pool area very good. Although a lot of noise from aircrafts taking off and landing. 10 minutes taxi into San Juan. Old town lovely - good shopping. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Short Trip EVER”
Reviews.Author: SnoopyFla
Reviews.Content: I never in my life have had anything stolen from my hotel room until I said here. Going with an expensive, name brand hotel doesn't mean you get the safety of knowing your belongings will be in your room when you get back. I stayed at this particular hotel because my friend getting married thought it was safe as well and is from PR. Well when I got ready to leave and pack my belongings my favorite dress was NO WHERE TO BE FOUND. The only thing the front desk, Corporate, and Security said to me is that it was being investigated. Nobody had access to my room except me and the staff at the hotel. You tell me where my dress went. Why is it that it is three months later I have yet to hear what happened to my favorite dress? I have got no compensation for my troubles or the fact that I will never see MY BELONGINGS AGAIN. Please do not stay here. If the treat case like this just image if something happened to you and your belongings. It isn't worth the fact that nobody from Management to Corporate has yet to help me with my problems. I've never been so disappointed in all the places I've ever traveled. I doubt I will ever stay at a Courtyard by Marriott ever again thanks to this troubling experience. Whatever you do don't stay at Courtyard by Marriott Isle Verde in Carolina, PR!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobettern
Reviews.Content: We arrived in San Juan the day before our cruise in May, 2008. We chose the Marriott Isla Verde hotel despite the many reviews regarding the airport noise. While the hotel does sit across the highway and the plane noise does get pretty loud, we could only hear the airport faintly from inside the hotel and rooms. The hotel was clean and the accomodations were comfortable. Checking in and out was expedited quickly. The hotel staff was service oriented but friendly and personable. My friends and I enjoyed our first Mojito at the Picante and later dinner and breakfast at the Salsa buffet. We especially enjoyed the delicious Puerto Rican food among the many entrees and choices offered. The price of the dinner and breakfast buffets were reasonable for the many selections offered. The pool area and hotel grounds were clean, beautiful, and well maintained. All in all my friends and I enjoyed our stay. However, if staying for more than a couple of days, we agreed that we would prefer to stay somewhere more quiet. R. Farkas Gahanna,ohio

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay - Can't Wait to Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: Liberatr
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for four nights (Monday-Friday) last week and we absoultely loved it! We checked in early around 1:30pm on Monday and were promptly handed two free drink coupons and match play coupons for the casino. We got to the room and we saw we had been upgraded to a full ocean view! A fruit platter along with a note from Mrs. Ng wishing us an outstanding stay really impressed us and right there, we knew we were going to have a great time. We spent most of our time at the beach or by the pool. Beach is excellent, it was very quiet (maybe because it was mid-week?) and it was very relaxing which is what we wanted. We sucked it up and paid the $6 for a beach chair (over the week though it adds up) but I still dont understand why that cant be included in the resort fee. Pool area was very nice and clean and we spent a lot of time at the swim-up bar. Jacuzzi is right next to the pool and it was usually empty. Hammocks are further back- all in all a very relaxing enviornment. We ate dinner at Salsa which was very good. Another night we went to Picante for drinks/small dinner and that was good as well. Wished we tried Sirena but ran out of time. For breakfast/lunch Banana's was a great option because its quick and more afforable then the breakfast buffet. One night we also ventured to Metropol and that was outstanding Cuban food. Worth the 10-15 minute walk. For nightime activites, we usually hung out in Picante or hit the casino in the hotel. Casino is small but gets the job done. Some dealers were friendly and talkative - especially Omar. I wish they rest were like him. One night we went down to the Ritz to check their casino out, which is a little better but really isnt much different. Next time I come I would advise to stay at least one weekend night as the resort seemed dead at times (though not always a bad thing). I could see on Thursday night the place was more crowded with the Salsa dancing and live music, so I'm assuming the weekend would be like that. All in all, a great stay with special thanks to Mrs. Ng and Mr. Arroyo. You made our 1st trip to Puerto Rico special and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Custumer doesn't matter, It's all about the $$$”
Reviews.Author: 4girlss
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week and experienced problems as soon as we got there. It was me and 3 of my girl friends and we made this reservetion over Priceline over the phone to make sure we'll stay in one room. When making the reservation I asked about 3 different times if besides resort fee if there's any additional charge we should expect. It was repeatedly said no, of courae not. WE got there and Marriott wanted additional $400!!! taxes + 2 additional fees for each night since it was 4 of us!! but we made that reservation for 4!!! we had 4 plane tickets!! twice they asked us to pay the taxes and when we answered that it was already paid for, the aswer was, oh yeah, I'm sorry, the SYSTEM told me wrong. We almost felt like they're on commission on how much they can charge a customer! Priceline pulled my recorded phone call as a proof that the agent didn't disclose any additional fees and guaranteed us no other fees upon arrival. but still nobody wanted to take the charge! They have a different manager every day and when asked to talk to the GM, my request was declined. I felt like on the open air market, the mgr started negotiating how much they would cover. Absolutely unproffesional. Their answer was that they have experienced similar issues with priceline before but they couldn't do anything. So who pays for their lousy contract..yes, sadly enough the custumer . I always stay at the Marriott for business purposes and this was my first stay as a personal vacation. How differently we got threated when 4 young girls in sweatshirts showed up comparing to my business trips wearing suit and using corporate credit card!! At the end we didn't have to pay anything but it completely spoiled 2 days of my vacation being on the phone and arguing with priceline and marriott. Not a great way to start your vacation. My recommendation is to hire professional and experienced manager who knows how to handle a problem on a spot.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, relaxing, excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: Ray57Rules
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at this lovely hotel and ejoyed our stay thoroughly. Very clean and pleasant and the staff is very helpful. I don't know if everyone noticed but I find that the view from the restaurant to the beach is awesome. My one and only suggestion would be to lower the price of the breakfast buffet. It is excellent but, I think $15.95 is a bit steep for this lovely resort. I'm not sure how many stars it has but I would consider it a nice 4 star hotel. In any case, I found that we had to eat out for breakfast to economise where I would much rather have stayed in for breakfast. We loved the room, the ocean view, the flat screen TV restaurant and Casino. The Pool Bar was excellent also. I would recommend this hotel for family or couples. They have a live band playing most nights and especially lively on Thurs. -Sat. evenings. Saturday is the most lively with Salsa dancing at it's best. We look forward to returning again.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved my stay at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jandaroe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the courtyard in July and it was the best choice Liberty Travel made. Let me start from the beginning. I emailed Mr. Arroyo a week before getting there regarding my stay and asking him for a early check in and later check out within minutes Mr. Arroyo emailed me back letting me know tht he took care of my requests. When we got to the hotel at about 12:30 pm from a long flight with a baby. I was check in to a beautiful room on the 7th floor with the most beautiful view anyone can see. A fruit platter with Mr. Arroyo's card was there and it just started a great weeks stay at the hotel. The rooms are very spacious and clean and the mini fridge is big enough to hold some drinks and snacks if you are traveling with kids. The staff was great here also from the guys in the front from when you walk in to the staff in the restaurants to the general cleaning staff, everyone wants to help you. We ate at Salsa Restaurant quit a few times because the food was the best , it was a buffett style Puerto Rican Cuisine but it was absolutely delicious and enjoyed it there. Picante is always great at night with live entertainment and great drinks and appetizers if you need that late snack. The beach was great even though its a public beach and the pools were fun but kinda dirty by mid week (that was the only complaint I had). This is the place to stay if you are in Isla verde, Great location 5 minutes from the airport but you do not hear the planes. Walking distance from everything you can imagine. And if you stay here try Metropol Restaurant another good Restaurant. One last thing THANK YOU MR. ARROYO your curtious ways with the people that stay here make people want to come back. I will be back in July to see you all again.

Reviews.Title: “great place~”
Reviews.Author: BAR2AG4
Reviews.Content: My 2 daughters and I stayed here this past weekend and loved every minute of it. Check-in was a breeze; friendly staff and the room was ready when we got there (around noon). We had a corner room on the 10th floor, a junior suite with an ocean front view and also a window to the west. Spectacular views of the sunrise and sunsets! Our room was large and clean and the queen size beds were SO comfortable! Everything in the room worked fine for us, and having the DVD player was great for late at night. The pool and beach area were very clean and even though the hotel was nearly full (3 weddings!), we never felt crowded anywhere on the property. We ate dinner at the Sirena restaurant 2 nights in a row. Great food and very nice staff. Plus, you sit outside so you can watch the sunset while you eat! We got lunch from the pool side grill. You put your order in and they bring it to you--even if you are out on the beach! The beach chairs do cost 6.00 per day but are worth it. We ordered room service breakfast 2 days which was very good and ate at Banana's cafe the third morning which was also good. The Picante lounge was a fun and jumping place. We didn't go into the casino, but it is large and looked fun. They also have a game room right off of the casino with quite a few video games. Check out was simple. We did it on the TV screen. I've stayed in other hotels in San Juan and Carolina and of all of them, this was most definitely the best for what we wanted. It's close enough to Old San Juan and other attractions around the area and is right on the beautiful Isla Verde beach. The airport is literally a stone's throw away, but we didnt hear a single plane in our room. The balcony's have double doors but we only had one closed at any given time. You do hear the planes on the beach, but being from the NY/NJ area with 3 major airports nearby, planes dont bother us. In fact, it was fun to watch them! When I reserved this room, I had some communications with Mr. Arroyo, the assistant manager. He personally confirmed our requests, responded almost immediately to every email and sent a personal welcome when we arrived. Every traveler looks for different things when they book a hotel. We were looking for a home away from home specifically in Carolina. A relaxing place to go back to and we found it in this Marriott. Everything was just great from start to finish. A big thank you to Benji and our waitress (cant remember her name at the moment) at Sirena; Carlos at Picante, and most of all to Mr. Arroyo. Hope to see you all again in January!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: kevinkmt
Reviews.Content: not much activity inside the hotel except for salsa bands the hotel is 12 mins away from the major malls and old san juan. the bell boys were terrific, staff polite and friendly buffet breakfast was good - pools were nice, gym was basic, internet was fast enough, clean spaious rooms. i just wish the rates were cheaper. there is only one restaurant in the hotel and its not the greatest but its "OK"

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beachfront”
Reviews.Author: tropicalfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 4 nights in July- it sits on a beautiful stretch of beach right outside the airport. We had a full-oceanfront room on the 10th floor, which had great views. From what I can tell, the oceanfront rooms are a little smaller than the ocean view rooms, you sacrifice the "sitting area" for the view. This was fine since it was just the two of us. The free bottled water in the room everyday and the mini-fridge was a nice touch, although the fridge was truly mini- you wouldn't be able to fit a bottle of wine in there, only cans and small bottles. With the oceanfront room we did not have any airport noise. The ocean was a bit rough for swimming, but would be fun if you had a boogie-board. Staff were friendly- location is great right on the end of Isla Verde, walking distance to restaurants. It is a public beach so the hotel charges $6 for beach chairs- we brought some beach towels for ocean swimming and did our sun lounging by the pool for no charge!

Reviews.Title: “All the conveniences”
Reviews.Author: ccurtis
Reviews.Content: We stay in Marriotts if they're convenient and because I'm a member. We stayed at this hotel the evening before we were to fly home. I wish we could have stayed a bit longer; the facilities were very nice. We had the dinner buffet in the Salsa restaurant and the food was very good. We had a coupon for a free drink and used that in the lounge while listening to a great band. It was fun to watch all the people dancing. I wish they had lessons! The casino was fun for a short time as well. Our room was fine, 2 doubles, decent size, and had a distant view of the beach. If we had been there longer, I might have more to say! I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: savti
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here post cruise. We were impressed by the very professional and friendly staff. Everyone from the bell staff, front desk, housekeeping, and restaurant personnel were smiling, and eager to please. Check-in was a breeze. We were especially impressed by Rafael, a waiter at the breakfast buffet. We ate outside, with a beautiful view of the beach. We enjoyed the casino, and loved the band and trio in the lobby bar, which is a fun place to spend the evening. The rooms were clean, spacious, with remodeled baths, and very comfortable bedding. The view of the beach from our balcony was stunning. The beach was wide, and clean. The ocean was clear, warm, and calm when we were there. It was great to have the hammocks by the beach! The only area that needs work is the pool area. We saw cigarrette butts and what looked like floating oil in the pools, and the pool bathrooms were dirty. We don't know if this was how the pool area usually looks, or we happened to be there on a day when things were "off". It didn't seem to match the level of cleanliness and care, in the rest of the hotel. Other than that, we truly enjoyed our stay, and would recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: luv2trvl07
Reviews.Content: This is our second trip to P.R. Last year, my husband proposed to me on our balcony at the Courtyard Marriott. We decided to go back there for our honeymoon since we had such a wonderful time. Thanks to Mr. Arroyo, we were able to book the exact same waterfront suite from last year! Thank you so much Mr. Arroyo for making our honeymoon even more special. We were greeted my friendly staff at check in. We were there an hour before check in, so we took our 2 free drink voucher and headed for the bar. The bartenders are so friendly! They made the best coconut mojito ever! We got a call on our cell phone saying our room was ready. We headed up and when we opened the door, we were cheesing! We couldn't believe we were in the same room again :) The view is spectacular! We learned from our last trip to get a rental car this time. It's actually much easier than we thought to drive around P.R. We didn't get lost at all! We were able to do all the things we weren't able to do the last trip. We drove to El Yunque (simply gorgeous!!!), We ate at La Casita Blanca (Delish), We went dancing at the water club, Had delicious sandwiches at Espana, Old San Juan, the Outlets, Laquillo beach, drove up and down the coast etc...... We didn't want to leave! I must say.... Courtyard Marriott is no 5 star, chi chi type hotel, however, It is definitely wonderful place to stay. Clean, professional and the FRIENDLIEST STAFF EVER!!!!!!! I have never seen an establishment where the Managers themselves bus tables, restock the food, gets your drinks etc.... They were constantly checking on us. Mr. Hector Sanchez (I think that was his name) and Mr. Gonzales, I believe they are both restaurant managers and they were unbelievable! They were so accommodating and extremely hospitable. They were bussing tables, restocking food and everything else! Raphael, the pool attendant was the greatest! He hooked up our beach chairs with pillows made of towels!!!! So comfy! Raphael was not only our pool/beach attendant, but our concierge, mapquest and photographer!!!! He takes awesome pictures! We asked for 1 photograph and he made us pose in different spots for 4 pictures!!!! They all came out wonderful with beautiful backdrops of the hotel and beach! Thanks Raphael!!! The buffet was DELICIOUS!!!!!! I thought it was good last year, but this year was even better! Much more to choose from and more variety by the day!!!! My husband had the concierge set up a massage for me in our room and OMG.... You HAVE TO GET A MASSAGE FROM RICK! I have had massages all over the world and you will NEVER, EVER get one like this!!!!!!!! He was AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I wish I could have brought him home with me! Overall, I must say... my honeymoon was spectacular! The Courtyard Marriott is filled with such friendly staff. My husband asked me during dinner on our last night "Do you think they smile like this when they are home too?" Everyone is just that friendly :) Thank you again Mr. Arroyo for help making our honeymoon a beautiful experience. You and your staff is the greatest!!!!! We are already planning a family trip (whole family this time) to come back!

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of heaven in Isla Verde...”
Reviews.Author: GOD-BLESSED
Reviews.Content: I never would have thought I would have taken a better vacation than my last trip to Puerto Rico, but itâ€™s true. God blessed me last week with the most exciting, adventure-filled, and yet, relaxing vacation Iâ€™ve ever had. My thanks to Alfredo Arroyo and his fabulous staff for their exceptional service. They truly are the best hotel in Puerto Rico! The Marriott Courtyard is on the Isla Verde strip, next to the Ritz, within walking distance to all the stores and shopping youâ€™ll need, is cost convenient and well worth it â€“ rooms are spacious and service phenomenal â€“ I stayed in one of their ocean front suites the size of a 1-br apartment, fridge, microwave, sink, and coffee pot, DVD/VCR player, etc., you name it. I love that on the day it rained I was able to watch a movie on the super big HDTV. Movies average $10-12, same as the theatres and all most recent releases. If youâ€™re not up for a movie, plug your IPOD in and listen to your favorite tunes on the IPOD docking station/CD player. Housekeeping staff are courteous, polite, and the sweetest ladies Iâ€™ve come across. All are hard-working and remind me of mi abuela (grandma), so please be kind and tip them well. Even the beach chair/towel guys are helpful and will set up an umbrella or cabana over your chair and tie in your towel so it wonâ€™t blow away. Ask them for help, as theyâ€™re great at what they do and will even angle your chair to get the best rays of the sun or to hide from them if you just want the breeze and to read a good book or magazine. Make sure you fill out your Marriott Rewards profile with all your drink/food preferences. Itâ€™s such a lovely treat to have water, orange juice, fruit and yogurt already in my room. They really make you feel right at home. Even at the front desk the girls would address me by name or inquire about my stay. Very nice. I purposely steered clear from one of the hotels in Condado because the reviews mentioned that check-in took over an hour, and one review listed several hours. When I stepped out of the elevator one morning I overheard a few guys checking in at the Marriott Courtyard. Their room was not ready, but the staff was going to set them up in lounge chairs on the beach with drinks. It was so funny to see these same guys who could have been fussing, wiggling their toes and basking in the sun â€“ they werenâ€™t even checked in and were already having a good time! The Salsa restaurant is great for breakfast. I ate there every morning. I think it came to $14.95 for the breakfast buffet, which is unlimited. Great for me since Iâ€™m a runner and it meant plenty of egg-white omeletâ€™s with veggies and turkey, fruit and yogurt, and I could even make my own sandwiches there. Great service and smiles from all the hostesses, the waiters and waitresses, and the omelets/waffle makers are kind, polite and helpful. Almost forgot, one of the reviewers mentioned the costly food, so I was a bit reluctant to order lunch while I was on the beach, but one of the staff told me Iâ€™d love the chicken strips and she was so right! I had them 3-days in a row. Theyâ€™re crunchy, meaty and the fries remind me of the Boardwalk fries in the Jersey Shore or Ocean City. I didnâ€™t have time to ask for vinegar, I ate them so quickly! The gym is equipped with a Stairmaster, 3 treadmills, free weights and equipment. Great being away from work; I could still watch the market highlights on CNBC and MSNBC, and get in a good morning run. The Jacuzzi is great also and good to know that the pool, Jacuzzi, lounge, casino and business center are all open 24-hours. In the casino the staff is polite and courteous. They serve complimentary drinks and hot sandwiches with turkey and cheese or ham and cheese. The game room is adjacent to the casino and has old and new video games for the kids. The front desk staff were all polite, professional and even helped me with a last minute emergency when I checked out and forgot to print my boarding pass. I realized as soon as I got to the airport that if they hadnâ€™t been so fast in helping me I would have missed my flight. The line was almost out the door for Jet Blue check-ins! The Marriott Courtyard is the only hotel Iâ€™ve come across that makes you feel like extended family. Check out the salsa dancing with live bands at Picante in the lobby bar. The pina coladas are so sweet and delicious. The business center is next to the front desk, includes free internet and printer abilities (Blackberry access is fine, too) I was able to zip in, check emails all free of charge without having to hook up a laptop. Thereâ€™s a gift shop where you can buy basic toiletries, and the front desk offers complimentary Skintastic spray for those no-see-um gnats. If youâ€™re into tours they have maps and guides near the front desk, or you can venture out on your own. You can walk to the local shops. Just stay on the right side of the street, pass the Ritz, a few small diners, Lupiâ€™s bar, etc. Dennyâ€™s, and Walgreens are just past the Ritz and before the Intercontinental and El San Juan, Itâ€™s about a 15-min walk. The fast food area is across the street from the Intercontinental Hotel, (a small grocery store that sells fresh fruit and anything you can microwave, no fresh meat or fish though, but tons of hot pockets and beer is reasonable. I donâ€™t drink, but thought Iâ€™d mention it), UPS, Subway, MiCasita, Wendyâ€™s, Burger King, etc.) MiCasita serves breakfast, lunch and dinner, where entrees are $9-14 and include red snapper, steak, lasagna, spaghetti and chicken dishes, I definitely did not like their chicharron de pollo â€“ so much better in New York! If you like buffet-style, stop at Dennyâ€™s. Also, be careful crossing the street. Thereâ€™s no light near the Intercontinental, but a crosswalk is there, and the cars go really fast at times. The A-5 bus stops a few blocks to the right of the Intercontinental Hotel, just past the Ritz Carlton where for .75-cents you can ride the bus to the end of the line â€“ a cheap tour of San Juan, Old San Juan and Condado. At the end of the line you can walk two blocks over to catch the ferry to the Bacardi Rum Factory Tour. Just ask anyone for directions to Acqua Express or say the ferry. Basically after you get out of the bus, walk towards the water and youâ€™ll see it â€“ past Westbank and the Sheraton. The cruise ships are there also. I think the last ferry is at 4-430pm, so keep an eye out and if youâ€™re too tired to see El Morro (the fort/castle, etc) you can check it out and take pics from the ferry. The tour is great, mini-movie included about the Bacardiâ€™s, learn to make mojitos, free coupons for drinks, etc. I think the tour is free. I went the last time I was here. Itâ€™s the transportation that you have to pay for. All I remember is getting off the ferry the guys argue in Spanish over the price to drive you to the Factory and maybe itâ€™s $6-8 a person, but donâ€™t quote me. Itâ€™s not walking distance, so you need the drivers to take you and theyâ€™re always waiting to bring you back â€“ maybe not the same driver, but a few are right outside the waiting area where they serve the free rum drinks. If you want to stay close to the hotel and still enjoy the beach, walk to the El San Juan Hotel and go directly behind the hotel. There youâ€™ll find the water sports area. I didnâ€™t know this spot existed until the day before I left to head back home. Iâ€™m anxious to go back and sample all their rides. You can rent jet skiâ€™s, go parasailing $65, ride a hobie craft, banana boats are $20, but a minimum of 4-people, and kayaks are $20. Youâ€™ll love being on the water. Kenney runs the San Juan Waterfun. I would call ahead to reserve times, (939) 642-4510. Ask for Dana (pronounced Don-yah). Sheâ€™ll tell you whatâ€™s available â€“ and for parasailing wear sandals or flip flops. Youâ€™ll get wet from the waist down. Careful getting into and out of the boats â€“ very slippery. Tip the guys if you can, as theyâ€™re in the hot sun all day and will take all the pictures you want of you going up in the air. Better to leave your camera with them for pics unless you have a disposable or water proof one that you can tie or fasten to your life vest. Again, my thanks to Alfredo Arroyo and all the staff at the Marriott Courtyard. This trip was such a treat. I hope Mr. Arroyo is going to be promoted soon â€“ he truly deserves it and works so very hard. He responds to emails, inquiries and requests, gives directions and from what I saw is there around the clock - such a great asset and hard worker. The hotel, the grounds, the staff are all exceptional. Sit in one of their hammocks and watch the sunset, or drink coffee from your balcony and watch the sunrise. You decide. Iâ€™ve never seen so many people work so hard to help make my visit enjoyable. Iâ€™ve already booked my next trip and am looking for additional dates over the holidays! But please, save me a suite, a hammock and a treadmill! Iâ€™ll be back soon enough! And lastly but always first in my life: Praise God from Whom All Blessings Flow!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NENASABIA
Reviews.Content: The best thing that I enjoyed about this hotel, was the view from my private balcony, in my room. It was a view of the Isla Verde Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: pr237
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed by my stay here. First of all, there is no room service in the hotel. The restaurants in the hotel are of poor quality, with little in the way of variety or healthy eating options. The hotel charges you for a beach chair or umbrella, which I felt was ridiculous for a beach resort. The bathroom near the pool area was never clean, to the point that I went back into the hotel rather than use it. Nor was the bathroom in the lobby especially clean. The concierge was very unhelpful, and seemed put off by being asked questions. Our room was fine, nothing special. However, it felt a little old. For example, the bathroom was outdated and the tiles were stained with age. Overall the whole place felt a little trashy. I would definitely not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: ccumomsc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days before departing on a cruise. The hotel and amenities are great! Nice restaurants, nice pool & beach, good workout facility VERY FRIENDLY STAFF! Mr. Arroyo and his staff did everything possible to make us feel like we were the most important guests there. Carlos the bartender was very nice and Rose in the Salsa Restaurant went out of her way to make our dining experience one to remember. Bananas Ice Cream shop has great salads and sandwiches if you are looking for something lighter than a full meal. Our oceanfront room was spacious and clean. Some reviews did say that the proximity to the airport was a problem with noise. There were a lot of planes during the day but at night we didn't notice anything from our room. We will definitely stay there again when we return to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: LadyBug04
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, everything was avaliable in just one place: breakfast, lunch, dinner, bar, music, casino, pool, beach, in-store, etc.. The room was very comfortable and pleasant and was attended readily and quick by the maids each morning. A little above price but we had a very good time. We even got to watch two wonderful weddings in the garden by the pool during the weekend. The airport was near and so we could watch airplanes departing and airplanes arriving.

Reviews.Title: “Nice beach but noisy”
Reviews.Author: kellir
Reviews.Content: The hotel is dated but clean. The staff was fine. Restaurants in the hotel are mediocre but it is fun to watch locals dance in the Salsa bar in the evenings. The beach is better than we experienced at The Intercontinental or El San Juan up the road. However, this hotel is very close to the airport and every twenty to thirty minutes you hear one of the jets take off from the airport. You don't really hear the jets from inside the hotel but definitely while on the beach. Not many restaurants within walking distance and it is a $20-30 cab ride to Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: ATL23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is best suited for a short stay or overnight stop. Having traveled extensively within the Marriott brand, this hotel falls short of expectations. Would not recommend this hotel for a family vacation or long stay. On the positive side, the hotel does have a nice selection of restaurants, bars and buffets, though they are a little on the expensive side. The hotel itself is updated with nice furnishings and large LCD televisions. Airport noise was not a disturbance inside the hotel, it is well insulated. On the negative side, this hotel is not the cleanest Marriott in which I've stayed, but it is not the worst either. The beds and pillows were quite uncomfortable and during the week the hotel began some renovations of the pool area and casino. Nearly all slot machines were closed (they left five 1 cent slots, but cleverly--and to my disappointment--left all the high roller slots. The beach service was very good, but be advised that they have only a handful of umbrellas for guests. On the weekends it can become a fight for the umbrella--leave your chairs and someone takes them--I even saw someone run over and pull am umbrella out of the sand when a couple got up to walk. This was irritating. Staff service was also not up to expectations, especially for an elite member. Also note sand fleas are active at dawn and dusk. While signs in the room indicate the hotel will provide insect repellant, we found this difficult to obtain. The front desk looked at us like we were crazy when we asked for it and then told us they did not have any and to try again later. The jet traffic also effectively ruins the pleasant beach experience, which is very active during certain times of the day. In summary, would not stay at this particular hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stop over spot”
Reviews.Author: kcoombs1209
Reviews.Content: I had seen the reviews regarding the jet noise and I thought that was pretty silly - it's obvious from the map where the hotel is located. The bellcaps and the desk staff were great - helpful & playful with my daughter. We were unsure about the luggage transfer - the bellcap said leave it there & he'd watch it, but we weren't sure if he was bringing it. If you go to the restaurants, you have to be patient. A Czech man who has lived in PR for many years said you have to get used to the slower pace. We sat at our table on the patio for about 15 minutes before getting a menu. There was only one waitress at lunchtime. Brunch was better because I could serve myself at my own pace. For some reason, the pool bar closed around 6 PM. That seemed silly. The casino staff was very difficult to understand and they had some different standards than US casinos like Atlantic City. But their poor English made it tough. Don't know how long I'd want to stay there

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel If You Want to Be by the Airport”
Reviews.Author: JohnGuyD
Reviews.Content: If you want to be close to the airport ( 5 minutes), this is a great place. Its right on a great beach, has local restaurants close by and live music (mostly salsa) in the bar most nights. The obvious downside is the noise from the aiport which didn't seem like much of a problem to me.

Reviews.Title: “Good base to explore!”
Reviews.Author: sueq575
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Courtyard Isla Verde November 1, 2007 to November 3, 2007 and November 10, 2007 to November 13, 2007 as part of a pre and post cruise stay. The hotel was right on the beach and very close to the airport. We did hear the airplanes, but we noticed that they were much louder when we had a higher floor room. The higher floor had a better ocean view, but the planes could shake the windows! I would advise you to book a lower floor room. The hotel was very clean and the staff were friendly. We ate breakfast at the little cafÃ© they have in the lobby. It was convenient and relatively inexpensive (5.00 for a continental type breakfast. I loved the Salsa club at night with all the dancing! They have lessons one night a week. We had dinner twice a restaurant down the street called Metropol. It had great Cuban and Puerto Rican food. The flan was incredible. The beach was nice, but we might have spent more time there if they had umbrellas for the beach. We were always off sightseeing, so we used the hotel as a convenient base for our travels. We rented a car and went down the coast to Fajardo and Humacao. If you can, you have to go to the Bioluminescent Bay on the island of Vieques! This was the most awesome thing we did! The water literally glows and sparkles with the microscopic creatures in the water. Tours leave from the town of Fajardo. We also snorkeled on the island of Culebra, which was beautiful! Old town San Juan was great to visit, but I was glad our hotel was off the beaten path a little.

Reviews.Title: “A Simply Perfect Vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: KK66
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a five day stay at the Marriott and we cannot wait to go back. Our suite overlooked the ocean and it a magnificent view when you awaken in the morning--. (Highly recommend room 927!!) I had the pleasure of meeting one of the managers, Ã…lfredo Arroyo when we checked in, as I had been exchanging emails over the previous weeks prior to our arrival (Thank you so much Mr Arroyo!). We had a fruit platter waiting in our room with a card "welcoming us home!". He could not have been nicer. We received a follow up message on our phone from another front desk manager just "making sure" that things were the way we wanted. The bed was so comfortable. The temperature in the room was perfect. We received the absolute best service from everyone at the hotel, from Maribel and Moraima at the front desk, to Axel and Jennifer at the swim up pool bar. Rafael greeted us each morning when we went to the beach or pool and set up our chairs and towels. While the other major hotels on La Isla Verde may appear more glamorous --I think for a true Puerto Rico experience, a warm and welcoming atmosphere, and truly relaxing vacation--look no further than the Courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: kimcheer10
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard by Marriott was a great place to stay in Puerto Rico. I stayed with my parents and my three brothers. The first day we went to the beach, which was very nice. The waves were pretty rough but the sand was nicer by the hotel than other parts of the beach. We went to Old San Juan for dinner outside, which was very enjoyable. The second day we went on a tour of the El Yunque Rainforest. The tour was pretty short- only three stops and I was expecting to see a lot of animals and I didn't see any. I suggest taking a tour walking through the forest and not on a bus. The third day was another beach day at the hotel. We sat in the sun played in the pool and the ocean. By the way, there were 3 pools. One was a kiddy pool. Another was a pool intended for younger children with a small slide. Both were very dirty and grouse. The last pool was the largest and was pretty well kept. The swim up bar was really neat. The forth day we went on a scuba diving excursion, which was the highlight, in my opinion, of the vacation. We went out on a cool boat to 2 amazing islands to see the fish in the coral reefs. Although I was disappointed that there wasn't as many fish as I expected, I was amazed at how clear and extremely blue the water was. As for the hotel, well there were 3 nice restaurants, a casino, a pool, and the beach. There wasn't much to do at the hotel so we were kept occupied by the above things. The hotel wasn't crowded at all! The staff was nice especially at the travel desk. My mom wasn't happy with the room keeping because they didn't vacuum or clean up the room or bathroom well. I thought the beds were soooooooo comfy and the balcony was nice too. However, we not only overlooked the beach we also could see run-down apartments in the next building which ruined the whole beach thing. The airport noise you got used to but it was so annoying. In general, I was pleased the hotel but there were some flaws.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing and fun hotel for a May trip”
Reviews.Author: Roadwarriorrelaxing
Reviews.Content: Before we even arrived, this hotel was awesome. For the past 20 years, 8-12 friends from all over the US, gather together once a year, at different locations. (Most of us are regular road warriors). This year the location was in San Juan. Before arriving, people told us to stay in Isla Verde. They were right. After an extensive search, the Marriott seemed like the right place for us. Ahead of time we were contacted by Alfredo, Manager at the hotel and he asked what we were interested in doing on our 5 day trip. We gave him some topics and then his staff took over. Check in was friendly and I must have been asked at least five times if everything was okay. Which it was. From the moment we arrived in our awesome rooms, (views that go on for miles), we were well looked after. The rooms were normal size, however, you don't come to Puerto Rico to sit in your room. I had read that the service at the pool was terrible. Nothing could be further from the truth. From the first moment we met Jennifer and Miguel (pool servers), there were drinks and food in a flash. We are not gourmet diners (cheeseburgers, hot dogs, chicken wings, etc) but the beer and margaritas were cold and the food was hot. A couple of comments, about the airplane noise, yes it is there, but the view, the hammocks and the hotel more than make up for it. I thought one review said it best that, "the airport noise is a non-issue". At night time, there was Salsa dancing and in the casino Paul (pit boss) and (dealers) Annette, Anita, and Jasmine, were keeping us entertained. The free food while gambling was an unexpected treat. Late at night and early in the morning you are alone on the beach, make sure you take a stroll. Just be careful of the machinery, as this is when the beach is being cleaned. Puerto RIco is not inexpensive, but this hotels' location, service and quality, made it all the better. If you don't relax and have a good time at this hotel, it is your own fault. Bring your flip flops and bathing suit for the day and flip flops and Tommy Bahama shirts for the night, Finally, don't get too frustrated with the waiting when you visit downtown San Juan for dinner, drinks and street life. Remember you are on "Island Time" and you are a guest, so relax and have fun on this awesome island.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; enjoyable stay overall”
Reviews.Author: Hank52
Reviews.Content: My room was spacious, comfortable, and clean. Although I could hear it intermittently in my room, I soon got used to the airplane noise, and the noise stopped in late evening. More annoying was the noise from the ice machine directly across from my room (Room 815, to be exact). The breakfast buffet at Salsa was good for the price ($13.95, plus tax and tip), with eggs and omelets cooked to order. Skip the Puerto Rican buffet. It was bland and not worth the price ($23.95, plus tax and tip). I enjoyed Old San Juan tremendously even though I endured the A5 bus. Each one-way trip took 40 minutes to an hour, depending on traffic. Condado is closer to Old San Juan, but it doesn't have as nice a beach as Isla Verde.

Reviews.Title: “just so-so”
Reviews.Author: vacationerny2008
Reviews.Content: A decent place, but very boring for a family with a teen-aged child. No activities at all. Staff did not do anything to create a fun atmosphere. Casino, lobby, and restaurants all small and dull. Room was nice, maid was good and hard working. Surf was rough. Had elevator problems. Beach was filfthy. Jet noise wasn't a day at the beach. Just an OK place, that's it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a quick getaway”
Reviews.Author: abc31
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through my vacation club (Royal Holiday). I went for a quick 4 night getaway. I left the kids and my husband at home and went with my girlfriend just to relax. It was perfect for out purposes. It was close to the airport and on a beautiful beach. The room was a little on the small side, but nicely decorated. It would have felt a little cramped with more than 2 people, but it was fine for the two of us. We had a room with 2 queen beds. I guess a king room would leave more area to walk around or sit. Our view was a mixed bag. We had a partial view of the ocean, which was hindered by a view a roof with, what I think were air conditioner compressors. The noise from the airplanes was definetly audible, but we were not bothered by them. However, on Saturday night, I could hear a band playing in my room (320) until 3:00 am.. I know there was a party in the hotel that night, so that may have been unusual. The public areas of the hotel were very nice. It was open and airy looking. The pool area was beautiful. There were plenty of lounge chairs. The beach was beautiful too, but when we were there it was so windy, we couldn't sit there, because the sand was blowing all over the place. The workers by the pool and beach were very helpful and friendly. In general, all of the employees were. We ate at Salsa Restaurant in the hotel one night and it was delicioius. I still can't stop thinking about their Plantain Soup! We tried Metropol nearby and didn't think it lived up to its wonderful reviews. Lupi's Mexican Grill was very good, also in walking distance. Other than that, there is not much near the hotel. All in All, the hotel was perfect for what we wanted. I would not stay here more than a few days, because there isn't much to do. But all we wanted to do is relax and this was the perfect place to do it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel, far from everything”
Reviews.Author: NycCarmenSanDiego
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in June, 2006 for about 4 nights. The hotel is rather small, and the rooms are modest, though the balcony and view was amazing. Staying here basically puts you far away from everything. There are places to eat, other hotels, and supermarkets nearby in wlaking distance, but thats about all. The pool and hot tub at the resort were amazing, and as the name implies, also connects to Isla Verde beach. The pool was open all night so that was a definite plus. They also had the most comfortable hammocks there. We walked all of Isla Verde beach, passing all the other resorts along the way. There is a casino, though it is rather small, but they did give us some coupons, as well as one for a free drink ticket. There is a lovely fountain in front of the hotel, and a nice restaurant that has a buffett everyday. The bar there was really nice, but very crowded...it took forever just to order a drink, but they play great salsa music, and you can dance or just watch everyone else. We definetly regret not renting a car here, as the bus schedule was irratic and a cab charged us 20 dollars each way to go to Old San Juan. El Morro, the old fort was one of the highlights of our vacation. It is simply stunning! Old San Juan is also Filled with Authentic Puerto Rican restaurants, other restaurants, and upscale shopping. I wish we would have stayed here and not in Carolina. We also took tours to El yunque rainforest, but the tour guide took us on easy trails and only saw vegetation and coco falls. We also took one to Camuy caverns and Areceibo Observatory. They were both great, except that with Arecibo we were stuck in a museum for about an hour. While here, please try the mofongo....delicioso! There is no tax in PR! yes, even on cigarettes.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Key”
Reviews.Author: RNY
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel between the beach and the airport runway and the location of rooms in relation to those two are key to enjoying a room here. Our first night we were in a low, even numbered room (lower numbers are closest to the front of the hotel, the busy main road, and the airport runway). The advantage to even numbered rooms is that they look down the beautiful empty beach to the east. The disadvantage to them, beyond being near the road and runway, is they overlook the roof of the casino with its vent fan noise. You can see the surf but you can't hear it. It sounds like any downtown hotel. To make the rooms quiet the hotel has provided double glass doors to the balconies and they are very effective. But when we have a balcony overlooking a beautiful beach we want to be on it when we're in the room. Not possible here. When a jet lands or takes off all conversation stops and you can feel the sound waves reverberate through your body. Someone in an earlier posting said the airport was a non-issue because of so few jets but we must have been there on a busy week because we heard lots. Our second morning we upgraded to an oceanfront room (for $75. per day extra). The noise problem was solved. It was amazing how quiet the ocean front rooms were with only the sound of the surf. The beach views to the east and west were lovely. As many others have said, we found the hotel staff very helpful. We didn't receive any extra trays of fruit or goodies like others did but perhaps that's because our basic room was a Marriott rewards certificate and we were just paying for the upgrade. The front desk staff were very helpful with any questions we had as were the concierge and the bellman. The concierge set up a trip for us to El Yunque and our guide Robert was extremely informative about the rain forest, the history of the island, current political and cultural issues and events, and anything else our group of about ten could think to ask him. We'd request him again if we visit the hotel in the future. The concierge also recommended a supermarket to us our first afternoon so we could stock the room refrigerator. There is a local chain called Pueblo an easy five to ten minute walk from the hotel. Having some of our own drinks and snacks saved a few dollars since food is quite expensive. While we were there the government announced the price of milk was going up to over $5.00 a gallon!!! Everything isn't that expensive but it does reflect the high costs of food in the supermarkets and in restaurants. The main attraction for many people are the casinos in the hotels. It seems to be a law that only hotels can operate casinos so that brings in lots of business. We never went into the casino so found the beaches pretty empty most of the time. We ate dinner our first night at the hotel's oceanfront restaurant Sirena. There were only two or three tables with guests. The service was quite slow but the waitress and other staff were pleasant and of course the view of the ocean on the patio made any wait enjoyable. The food was surprisingly good. If you like ice cream there is a diner just past the Ritz., I can't remember the name, but I think it's on the corner of the road after the Ritz. It's before you get to Lupi's. You'll recognize it because you'll be able to look inside and see two large cases filled with lots of gelato flavors. It seems to be run by a young couple from the U.S. They are very nice and let you taste before making a choice. We had almond, banana, and pineapple. They even had small pieces of almonds and pineapple in them. The flavors are very intense and delicious. It's worth the walk. If we had discovered it earlier in our visit we would have been there several nights. I agree with a previous comment that the taxi drivers are not chatty. Their quiet was okay with us. Because of the location of the hotel about a half hour from Old San Juan it is necessary to find some transportation. We took the public bus back and forth on the two days we went in. It cost $.75 each way. The bus stop is a little way past the Ritz in front of Denny's. You have to have exact change. The ride ends at the bus terminal in Old San Juan next to the cruise ship piers and a few steps from the cobblestone streets of the historic city. We felt safe riding the bus during the day and even in the early evening after dinner. The buses were clean and the drivers helpful when we were first timers and didn't know the routine. For future trips to Puerto Rico I think we might stay right in Old San Juan for a couple days so we'd be able to spend all our time in the historic center and then move to a beach/golf resort in another part of the island. After visiting San Juan we spent two nights at the Copamarina Beach Resort in Guanica on the south side of the island and it was a quiet restful retreat from the activity of San Juan. Renting a car and getting away from the big city was a great way to see the beauty of the rest of the island. For a first visit to Puerto Rico, and especially being able to use a Marriott Reward certificate to do it, the Courtyard was a good choice but now that we've seen the possibilities that Puerto Rico has to offer I think we'd try a new experience next time.

Reviews.Title: “I just love this place so much we came back for a second visit”
Reviews.Author: ragtiki1958
Reviews.Content: Kudos to Alfredo and his staff! I decided to stay here post cruise after staying here the past September. The hotel is well kept and I liked the idea of staying on the beach and having a nice pool nearby where I could relax after a long week of cruising. On my last stay I also enjoyed hanging out at the beach with my binoculars and watch the planes from the nearby airport take off. Upon my arrival on Sunday was given a warm welcome by the front desk staff and the manager on duty whos name I can not recall came out to welcome me personally. We arrived a bit early after our cruise and before check in time but we allowed to check into our beautifull rooms. Later on in the afternoon upon returning to my room to prepare for my kayak excursion up in Farjado I noticed the staff had delivered a very tasty fruit platter. The food in the hotel is very good. After a very long walk on the beach the following morning I was extremely hungry and tried the breakfast buffet which offered any type of breakfast food you could imagine. I would recommend if you really enjoy a good breakfast. The hotel service that I experienced was top notch. Kudos to the front desk staff, the waiters and waitress in the buffet who work hard to make your meal enjoyable, Axel at the pool bar and the pool towel boys who will set up your chair with a towel on the beach. The bellhops were extremely friendly and allowed me to store my bags after checkout at noon on Monday and was allowed to use the beach and hotel facilities until leaving at 4:00 P.M. for my flight back to CT. Overall, I just love this resort and would recommend it to travelers wishing to stay close to the airport. Bob from CT.

Reviews.Title: “Unsurpassed Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: philtortorice
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a family vacation with our 2 daughters (8 and 11) from The Courtyard Isla Verde for 5 nights, April 5-10. Remember that this is a Courtyard, not The Ritz, so if you're a "hotel snob" this may not be your first choice. However, The Courtyard made up for all of it (and more) by providing excellent customer service throughout our stay. For example, upon check-in, we were greeted by the Assistant General Manager, Alfredo who hooked us up with a room featuring a large balcony overlooking the ocean with an incredible view - (see pictures). We were also given $25 in match play coupons for the casino, a couple free drink coupons for my wife and I (try the Rum Punch with your choice of Puerto Rican rum) and 2 beach buckets, shovels and plastic sand molds for the kids. It didn't stop there. After checking in and heading down to the incredible beach/pool area, we returned to find a plate of assorted cookies and a cheese and meat tray in our room complements of the staff. In fact, every staff members that we met were kind and helpful. This is a reflection on the incredible management team that runs this property. It's a perfect place for kids as well. One more cool thing about the property is that it sits on the far East side of Isla Verde beach, so just to the West (towards Old San Juan) are a number of other hotels, however, just to the East of the hotel is an undeveloped beach area so the location kind of provides the best of both worlds. Perhaps the highlight of our stay was renting a car (Martin, the concierge will take care of this for you) and driving East on 187 past Pinones. With no real agenda, we simply pulled over on a deserted beach which was one of the most beautiful beaches I have ever seen. We swam for about 2 hours and saw no more than maybe half a dozen people the entire time we were there. You will also have to go to Old San Juan and enjoy the European style feel the city has to offer. Don't miss out on visiting El Moro de Felipe fort which is an absolute must when in San Juan! The only downside about the Courtyard was that there are not a lot of restaurants within walking distance of the property. Metropol (Cuban and Puerto Rican) was one but we thought the food was kind of bland. The other was Lupi's (Mexican) which was actually one of the best meals we had when we were there. Otherwise, you may have to grab a cab ($20 1-way to Old San Juan) or just eat at hotel restaurants. Enjoy your stay at The Courtyard Isla Verde! We had a great time and can't wait to make it back some day.

Reviews.Title: “Not that impressed. Could have been better.”
Reviews.Author: Deedaydreamer
Reviews.Content: It wasn't the worst experience, nor the best. I would have to agree with another reviewer about the Kids Club issue. The hotel staff did not appear to know anything about it. Finally, I was directed to the Casino where they told us that the lady who ran the Kids Club had quit. Obviously, they could not have necessarily known this ahead of time but it would have been nice if they had a backup plan. Having brought a child, it was my number 1 requirement for picking this hotel and the fact that I am a loyal Marriott rewards member. We realized that my 9-year-old would not be interested in a lot of the sightseeing and activities we were so we had our heart set on him having a club for activities so we could do our thing too. Imagine our surprise..no kids club..Their alternative consisted of hiring a babysitter at $15 an hour for a minimum of 4 hours. No thanks. Just another way to charge outrageous fees. So, in turn, we did not get to experience a majority of things that we felt PR would have to offer. We were reduced to hanging out at the hotel with a not so great beach. The water in front of the hotel was disgusting and garbage had washed ashore..and I mean garbage, cans, bottles, old sunglasses. I shutter to think if anyone would walk on the beach barefooted and get a cut. I hate to sound like a whiner but another complaint was the service. It was so slow. I feel everyone did the bear minimum, yet I am sure expected a tip. One night we went down to eat at the cafe and they had one person working and the place was full. Most people did not even get served so they left. We are frequent visitors to Mexico and we'll take our dollars there. I do have to say also that the taxi drivers were not friendly at all. They never said one word to us..NONE of them and we used several. I would also have to agree that all charged different rates to the same places so that was wierd. Just very not friendly. My impression as a whole is that Puerto Rico just does not embrace tourism like Mexico does. We won't be returning to Puerto Rico. Mexico here we come.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the Sun”
Reviews.Author: vitDseeker
Reviews.Content: We (myself, my husband and 2 teenage sons) just spent 4 nights at the Courtyard during Spring break, March 26-30. I booked 2 rooms through marriott.com and then emailed Alfredo, the assistant general manager to request that the rooms be close to one another. Thank you Alfredo for the wonderfully located rooms. Breakfast and watching the sunset on the lanai was superb. We really enjoyed our stay at the Courtyard. The staff were all very kind and willing to help you, especially the guys on the beach. We basically spent our days on the beach sunning ourselves and boogie boarding (we brought our own). As for the comments from others about the airplane noise--I looked at it this way, those on the airplane were leaving and we were still on the beach! The noise did not bother us. In the evening our family would walk to the local restaurants and enjoy the local cuisine. After resting on the beach all day we needed a little exercise. On Saturday night we stayed at the hotel and enjoyed the buffet dinner at the Salsa Restaurant. We really enjoyed the roasted pig and other local foods. Overall we had a great 5 days/4 night vacation at the Courtyard and would not hesitate on returning again.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: rkgood
Reviews.Content: We just spent six nights at this hotel and had a completely fine time. Here are some of the positives: - extremely well run - friendly and accomodating staff; particularly concierge, wait staff, front desk - fun and free entertainment - clean and perfectly air conditioned room; fine housekeeping - fabulous beach, very good pools - attractive and well maintained grounds; wonderful sunsets! - great location near airport, bus line (we used the A5 into Old Town), rain forest, museums and attractions of San Juan and Old San Juan, nearby small towns. - fair 'hotel' prices in bars and restaurants, where the food could be very, very good There's a small casino we did not visit. I travel a great deal on business and pleasure and if you read my reviews on tripadvisor you know I hold no prisoners. So many American resorts are like our major airlines (e.g American, the one we flew down from Boston on): miserable customer service, lack of attention to detail, ripoff prices. So if I had a beef you would hear about it here! I simply do not. Of course, there are always little glitches, and here are a couple: - there must have been molasses in the wireless/ethernet system; communication was often at a turtle's pace, but they did offer wireless in rooms (!) and there was a nice business center to take up slack.; if you go try to use it off hours - service in the more expensive outdoor restaurant could be very slow, and one evening an appetizer was forgotten (quickly made up by free wine), though we thought the food extremely good. In the indoor restaurant service was over the top friendly (at one point we had female staff fighting over who was helping us the most!) and, happily, they had a standard menu, not buffet every night. The airplane noise issue was there, but it was something most folks just laughed off; my thought was that the hotel should provide a printout of departures so we could try to check on what plane was going where in the world. Our room was pretty well soundproofed. Some things we enjoyed particularly included the magnificent National Gallery and the Puerto Rican Museum of Art (with a wonderful garden and absolutely five star food). The former has a breathtaking lighting system to illuminate landscapes by Oller and other famous PR painters; just magnificent and maybe the highlight of our trip. We went to a a very good beach restaurant over at Pinones (Soliel), and enjoyed a free pickup and return., and Roberto, our tour guide to the rain forest was great; he imparted a tremendous amount of information on Puerto Rico and the gorgeous forest. The fact that the day the PR governor and some buddies were arrested by the feds for corruption led to some wonderful background political info and constant updates on 'breaking news'. Oh, if you do travel American AIrlines avoid the bar-restaurant near gate 7. Ultimately you will have to choose between your flight and food; just about the worst service we've ever had anywhere and for crying out loud they are in an airport! So to sum up, our first trip to Puerto Rico was very enjoyable and it was made better by one of the best resorts of its kind we have ever visited; as a regular Marriott user I was very pleased because some Courtyards can be pretty scruffy. This place is clean, efficient, friendly, well-located, fairly priced and not pretentious. I suspect we'll go back!

Reviews.Title: “Some Nice Features ... Service Bad”
Reviews.Author: TimAsterisk4
Reviews.Content: My family of four (including two boys, 9 and 10) stayed for six nights. The hotel itself is close to attractions as we visited Old San Juan, Art Museum, and Botanical Gardens ... along with relaxing at the hotel. The restaurants are pretty good and allow you to sample some Puerto Rican cuisine. We had a beach front room so sitting out on the balcony was a favourite pastime. Both the beach and pool areas are nice as well. The rooms are nice and clean. Now to the bad! I made a pre-arrival request that was acknowledged by the hotel, but wasn't done when I arrived. At the time of booking, the hotel and their website will tell you about a Kids Club. But once at the hotel we had a hard time finding anyone that knew anything about it (including the concierge). When we did find someone, at the casino, we found out that the Kids Club is only on weekends ... and only some weekends ... and wasn't operating the weekend we were there. Too bad they weren't truthful about this beforehand as that was one criteria we had for choosing our our hotel. The housekeeping is unacceptable. On many days we left the hotel by 8am ... put out the sign to indicate we wanted the room cleaned ... and arrived back at 5pm to find the room still untouched. When I went to the front desk to request an earlier housekeeping time the person was very rude and acted like I was nuts for thinking housekeeping could be done before 5pm. Frankly, the physical hotel itself is OK with a good location on the beach ... the service is terrible. I'd advise a stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Three Nights at the Marriott Isla Verde San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Lecarrow
Reviews.Content: Our visit to the Marriott Courtyard Isla Verde came at the end of a twelve day vacation in Puerto Rico. Our stay was Saturday, March 22nd to Tuesday, March 25th. It was strange that weekend vs. weekday it seemed like two entirely different resorts. Saturday and Sunday the hotel was extremely busy with a very mixed clientele. Many people in just for the Easter weekend at the Casino and the bars. I can't say I was a fan, too many people drinking in the pool and the hot tubs, extremely loud disco music at the pool, kids waiting at tables in the lobby for their parents in the casino, women at breakfast in the restaurant with curlers in their hair - overall a little too trashy a scene for me. Sunday evening and Monday morning it changed dramatically and became a much nicer vacation type hotel. The beach was nice, however the pool was a little small and in the shade most of the day. My twenty year old son took me down to the casino (I had never been to a casino before) and I found it pretty entertaining-he won $100. quickly at blackjack (on an initial $25 investment). The room was a nice typical business hotel room. Nicely decorated with clean and relatively new furniture and free internet in the room. We were on the third floor (room 322) with a nice view of the ocean over the roof. The breakfast buffet was good and reasonably priced ($13.95). We didn't try the restaurants for other meals. The people at the front desk were nice and helpful. Our express check out was wrong and when I went to check out the computers were down. Maribel assured me that she would take care of it and email me a revised bill. When I arrived home in Boston sure enough the corrected receipt was in my email. The hotel is very close to the airport, virtually on the runway and the takeoffs were very loud out by the pool. The noise from the airport wasn't noticable in the room since the patio doors were double doored (I have never seen that before). Surprisingly the cab to the hotel from the airport was $10. and our cab rides were all over the place in terms of price. Forget about the meters or the posted rates, cabdrivers would set their own price and there seemed to be money changing hands between cabdrivers and bellmen at the hotel. As example the first night we asked for a cab to the Intercontinental (about 4 blocks) and the fare was $10., the next night we went to the El San Juan Hotel (also about 4 blocks) and the fare was $8. the next night we went to the Embassy Suites Hotel and the fare was $10 but the return fare was $7, finally our fare to the airport (3 people, less than 1 1/2 miles) was $16. The only part of this that reflected back on the hotel was seeing $$$ pass hands between the cabdriver and the bellman. The best part of the visit was that the room was free with my Marriott rewards points. In summary, nice place,nice beach, reasonable price, nice room, nice people. I would go back but I would be very careful not to go on a weekend again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accomodating Staff”
Reviews.Author: pinhillpam
Reviews.Content: Basic oceanfront nice accomodations close to the airport, and cruise terminal. Rooms have recently been updated. Same beach as the Ritz.. There is jet noise. Staff is nice and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place To Stay. Good Value”
Reviews.Author: JERSEYGROWN
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 5nights at the Marriot Courtyard Isla Verde. while attending a convention /meeting at the Ritz Carlton Hotel next door. I should prefice again, my major reason for choosing the Marriott was its proximity to the Ritz Carlton where I knew I had to go each day at 7:30AM for meetings. Frankly, I couln't stomach the $475+ per night "conference rate" which my group was given for the Feb high season. So my $240/night rate saved me about $200 a night. I was very pleased however, with this resort which is on the same beach/as the Ritz Carlton/Hoel Casino a brief 3 minute walk down a common sidewalk. As in typical Marriott fashion my room king/size faced the ocean with a small balcony with wrought iron table and 2 seats. This was an upgrade which they offered me at no additional charge when I checked in. Maybe because I am a Marriott Rewards/timeshare owner. The room wa perfect for business with a small refrig (free daily water bottles), free internet hook up, large flat screen TV with cable, pull out sofa/bed couch with chairs in room. Daily room service with daily replenishing of toiletries., small coffee pot/ with Puerto Rican Cofee, and Herbal Tea bags in bathroom. I had a complimentary Rum drink at the bar. I did not eat at the restaurant as I usually like to try local ethnic food/restaurants when I travel. There was an Ice Cream Parlor on site which many of the kids seemed to enjoy. Never went to the casino, beach was nice with hammocks, pool with swim up bar, quiet location. I could walk down the beach from the Ritz Carlton to the Marriott, again same beach front property. Of course the Ritz Cartlon is very delux with beautifull grounds, pool, never ate there other than in conjunction with conference, and would be a fabulous place to stay for a special occassion or if money is no object, but the Marriott more than met my needs. I ate twice for lunch and dinner at a a local Cuban Restaurant Metropol , a short walk, down the road, and across the street ( take care crossing what is a busy road to get to the restaurant). I thought the food was excellent and a great price/value. For dinner one night had Fresh Snapper, with Cuban Beans/rice, plantain, flan, Virgin Pina Colada, fresh garlic bread, with tip came to about $25.00. Excellent service local Puerto Rican/Cuban Food. Do'nt be afraid to take the A5 bus which stops nearby for $0.75 cents one way takes you into the bus terminal in OldSan Juan where you can get off and take the free Trolley around or walk the streets to El Moro and other sites. The bus will take you through the local areas of Isla Verde, Condadda, etc and you will see where the local people live. The bus seems to run about every 15-20 minutes until maybe 8-9:00pm at night. I took during the day and may once at about 7:00PM back to hotel. You will travel with the local people but there were other non-natives like myself on the bus. A cab will cost you about $20.00 one way, and you can alway's find someone who speaks English, so you can save some money with the bus. My only comment about the Isla Verde Courtyard Marriott, Ritz Carlton is that you will feel like and you are very close to the Airpot. I would have to disagree with others that the location is noisey, and although I couln't see the planes 1 or 2 nights I felt like a plane was either landing or taking off in my room. The flights seem to stop about midnight. so if you are there strictly for vacation/leisure you might want to look around for a quieter location. Feb is a great time to go, weather in the 80/s, very low humidity, ocean water comfortable, nice evening breeze, loads of sun and little rain, brief sec shower here or there at most, .

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
