Reviews.Author: Cocolococanuck
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the Marriott through our travel agent as a pre-cruise stop. We encountered no problems to speak of. Rooms are nice and clean and the food was excellent. The pools and beach are above average and wish we had booked a longer stay. We would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: dkona
Reviews.Content: After a 10 hour flight to San Juan, we arrived at the Courtyard by Marriott Isla Verde, a hotel highly recommended by many Tripadvisor readers. A short unspectacular driveway from the street to the hotel and a reception area that is overwhelmed by adjacent casino activities did not provide an initial "wow" factor, and we immediately questioned ourselves whether the long journey was worthwhile. (It also made us think twice about tripadvisor comments). The spacious room and comfortable bed compensated our feelings. However the carpet was very damp and the room air much more humid than at other Caribbean hotels we stayed. (We asked about the carpet situation the following day, but did not receive a response). Daylight revealed a nice beach, however the water was more of a surfer's delight. The pool and surrounding garden area were unspectacular. Overall our positive feelings about the hotel are: -The room was a good size, clean and with a comfortable bed (although feather/down pillows were scarce). -The staff members are excellent- friendly, and helpful. -The night music is great- the place really swings during weekends with locals who dance fantastic. -The breakfast buffet was good and reasonably priced (for San Juan). Our negatives were: -The reception area and outside grounds are not to par of other Caribbean hotels in the same price range. They looked "tired". The feeling of being "on vacation" was diminished. -The casino appears to be the main focus of the hotel. -The airport runway is very close to the hotel (the takeoffsstart at a runway parallel to the hotel about 300 meters away). The hotel has tried to quench the noise, although it is not entirely successful (our room faced the ocean not the runway). -Isla Verde is quite far from areas of interest such as Old Juan (a $20 20-minute cab ride) or any shopping area. The few restaurants near the hotel were several blocks away. Stores (clothing, art, etc) are not near the hotel. -The supper cafe is squeezed in a small paved area between the beach and the hotel. The supper prices are a bit outrageous even for San Juan. -There should be more information about local activities, such as placement in the rooms of booklets such as "Places to Go- your passport to San Juan" and "Que Pasa" rather than by-chance enounter at the conciege desk. Copies of the local newspaper were scarce (even at the hotel store). If we had to do it again we would look for a place at the Condado area where there is more activiity and proximity to places of interest- the total cost of the Marriott at Condado would have been the same, given that the latter offered one night free following 4 nights occupancy.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkIlt
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fabulous! The service was excellent, as was the location. It's located on the end of the strip and wasn't very busy. People had told us that it's located VERY near the airport and it was noisy. We thought that seeing planes landing and taking off was very cool. We couldn't hear it at night, with our door closed but it was definitely audible during the day. But our experience was so wonderful that this factor didn't affect us at all.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: sunitharay
Reviews.Content: This was an awesome resort / hotel and one of the best customer service I have experienced! The property is right on the beach - with a great pool and spa tub. The part of the ocean near the property is quite shallow and gets great waves. The restaurants are great with excellent food (though a little pricey). The buffets are great. Cons are: The casino could do with some increased square footage and bigger stakes - but good nevertheless. Taxes and fees are high - but that's typical of Puerto Rico I guess. On the differentiated side, the staff is unbelievable! so courteous and always ready to chat you up - the managers at the restaurants visit each table to ask if the food is alright - one of hte times, the manager actually brought me some new dish to try! Every night the whole hotel livens up with music. It's also very family friendly. The concierge services are great as well. On the whole, it's a great place to stay and one of my best experiences!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: zamku
Reviews.Content: We read many reviews of many hotels in this area. And based on previous reviews on this site, we choose this hotel. I think it was a great value for the money. Yes, the food is overpiriced at the hotel; we had prepared ourselves for this before we went. But we went out & explored local restaurants (also pricey). Beach was nice. Hotel provides clean towel everyday if needed. We booked outings everyday through the hotel & were very satisfied w/ this. On one outing, the concierge had forgotten to confirm our reservations w/ the company & the hotel called the company which held the catamaran up & paid a taxi to get us there. We would stay there again, no probelm. The staff was friendly & the hotel was clean.

Reviews.Title: “BEST of The BEST!”
Reviews.Author: greatscott2
Reviews.Content: My husband, sister and I just spent a glorious week (11/3/07 - 11/10/07) at the Courtyard by Marriott Isla Beach Resort. I, too, had checked out Tripadviser reviews before our trip and even emailed the Assistant Manager, Alfredo Arroyo, with a few questions prior to our arrival...His prompt replys led me to believe this was going to be a SUPER week and we were not disappointed!!!! Perla at the reservation desk checked us in .... gave us info about the resort, including 3 free drink tickets and $25 in match bets to use in the casino....About 5 minutes after we got in our room, Mr. Arroya called and welcomed us to the Marriott and wanted to meet us. WE WERE TOTALLY BLOWN AWAY WITH THIS PERSONAL SERVICE.... We met at the beautiful outside restaurant (Sirena) and Mr. Arroya was so gracious and introduced us to some of the staff....the food was beautifully prepared and excellent in taste. Service was A+ at this restaurant, as well as the Salsa Buffett and Bananas. You can sure tell that Management and all the employees at this resort respect each other and aim to give their very best in personal service to all their guests. We have never EVER been treated so nice before in all our travels.... We had a great room overlooking the beach and pool with a large-screen t.v., small refrigerator (that is stocked each day with FREE bottled water) coffe pot and coffee, CD player, DVD/VCR player, black-out curtains and the most comfortable beds and luxurious linens. The maids were wonderful and gave us extra coffee and bottled water when we asked and we were more than pleased to reciprocate with a nice tip each time. The Casino was fun and something we have never encountered before....they serve FREE drinks, sandwiches and soup on the casino floor, but be sure and give these hard-working people a nice tip. One of our favorite servers in the casino was "Angel" and he was an angel...We couldn't get over the trays he would carry with so many drinks, and food on it and then remember who got what. Free internet station 24 hours/day is really a BONUS! They have 3 screens and we always were able to use one of them whenever we wanted to check email. About the noisy planes...we were aware of this before we came, but the patio doors are double and this takes away a lot of the noise. My sister and I made a game of it....We tried to guess whether the planes were an "inny" or an "outty." From our patio we could see the planes take off (outty) but we couldn't see them land (inny). This was my husband and my third trip to Puerto Rico and my sister's first. We have stayed at the Sheraton in Old San Juan and the Condado Plaza Hotel & Casino. They are all nice resorts, but our experience this past week at the Marriott Courtyard far exceeds any expectations. We walked to the bus stop..across the street from Denney's and took the A-5 bus into Old San Juan for 75cents each and did the self-walking tour...then we took the ferry for 25cents each to the Bacardi Rum Factory and did the tour (free) and received 2 free drink tickets. Bought some wonderful homemade soap & a wallet from the street vendors in Old San Juan and took in the casino at the Sheraton for a short-while...This was all done in a day and it happened to be the "best weather day" we had all week. For some reason...every day around 2p.m. the sky opened up and it rained for about an hour or two and every morning it was just beautiful and sunny. Other places we visited were: El San Juan Hotel & Casino, The Ritz-Carlton Hotel & Casino, Hotel El Convento in Old San Juan and Restaurant Ajili-Mojili in Condado. The Picante lobby bar has a live band and the Salsa dancing is fun to watch. The people know how to have fun and are super good dancers. Drinks here are great too!!! Thank you again for our wonderful week in Puerto Rico. Alfredo Arroyo...you are one first-class act...and KUDOS! to your wonderful staff.....As our CA Governor would say.."I'LL BE BACK!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OhioGirl7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from 9/20/07 to 9/25/07 with three girlfriends; we are all 22 years old. The hotel staff was more than nice and they really honestly did take care of our every need. The building itself is nice and the beach is gorgeous as well as the pool area. We rented a car(which everyone should just suck it up and do) and so we were able to make the 5-10 minute ride to Old San Juan any and every time we wanted. the only complaints I have is that the house keeping rarely cleaned our room before like 4 or 5 pm (i know its a big hotel, but still...) and upon check out they tried to charge me for international calls that I did not make. but other than those two snags, it was quite possibly the best 5 days of my life. I 100% recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Didnt live up to the Marriot brand.”
Reviews.Author: rayaberry
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my stay in San Juan Puerto Rico, at the Courtyard Marriot on Isla Verde. I have to say that I was disappointed with the service. The first night we arrived, we noticed that the floor mat in the bathroom was wet and we could not figure out where the water came from. Also, the bathroom was not very clean and was a little moldy. We then noticed a watermark on the wall. When we called the frontdesk to tell them there was a leak, they said they would get back to us. We heard nothing back. The next morning we called again. The front desk said they would look into getting us another room. They said they would call us back. We went out for about 6-7 hours and heard nothing from them. When we came back to the room, the whole bathroom floor was wet and water was leaking from the ceiling. We called the front desk for a third time and finally they relocated us and told us a pipe was broken. The new room was better but I was very upset that they took so long to accomodate us. The dinner buffet downstairs was about 23 dollars and the food was really not impressive and a little dry. But the ice cream bar was excellent and the mojitos at the dar were great! I enjoyed the live band downstairs. The service, however, spoiled my stay. In addition, the concierge seemed to have no idea how to direct us to basic places in San Juan. I would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A real value among beachfront Isla Verde resort hotels!”
Reviews.Author: mimart
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned to Houston from a wonderful stay at the Courtyard Isla Verde Resort in Puerto Rico. It was our first trip to Puerto Rico and our first experience with the hotel. We were not disappointed. The positive reviews of the property on this website from previous guests were right on the money. The staff were professional, accommodating and just downright friendly. We were made to feel like valued guests. The first night at the hotel we had dinner in the Salsa restaurant. Our hostess, Ruby, remembered our names from that point on. She stopped by our table two nights later while we were in the lounge and greeted us by name. It may seem like a little thing, but it made us feel "special". The lounge showcased live high-energy Latin music every night from a variety of bands and most nights the dancefloor was hopping. The last night there, a Monday, a trio of balladeers entertained on acoustic guitars with percussion accompaniment. This was a nice change of pace from the frenetic dance music of the previous nights. The casino was buzzing all the times I was there and although I didn't win any money, I had fun with what little dinero I was willing to let go of. Note: It is illegal to serve alcohol in a casino in Puerto Rico. You may bring your drink inside as long as it's in a plastic cup. The beach was beautiful and very clean. The sea lapping against the shore was a soothing balm for the senses. The water was a sparkling aquamarine hue just like in the Caribbean travel brochures. My wife spent most of her days there and commented to me that she felt completely safe there by herself. I was impressed with the professonalism and friendliness of Elizabeth and Amy, the two desk clerks who handled my reservation inquiries. Amy went above and beyond in assuring me that she would "block" a room to my liking, although it is not hotel policy to reserve a particular room for guests in advance. The room we were booked into was exactly as I had requested. We were in Rm. 722 which is the closest non-smoking ocean view room to the beach on that floor. The rooms facing fully the beach are considered ocean front and are premium priced. Our room afforded a very good angled view of the beach and the sea, as well as the palm-studded pool area, which was particularly attractive at night. The bed was the most comfortable that I have ever slept in in a hotel. There were plenty of pillows and plenty of room. I can't say enough about the bed. And last but not least, the service was great. We called the front desk twice during our stay. Once, to ask for more in-room tea bags and once for more of the excellent in-room coffee. Both times, an employee arrived at our room in less than 5 minutes with more than what we asked for. Now, I do have a few comments about what I didn't like: (1) Although, there are 5 restaurants at the resort, the menu in 3 of them, except for the salad option, is akin to fast-food (sandwiches, hot dogs, chicken fingers, etc.). Also, of the five, only the three fast-food types are open for lunch: Picante (lounge), Playa Grill (swimming pool) and Banana (deli). (2) Although as a guest you are paying for the amenities of a resort in your room rate, the hotel management charges you extra to use their chaise lounge chairs for the beach. (3) Granted, I've never stayed at a resort before and my opinion on this next subject might be uninformed, but I felt the charge for the Salsa restaurant buffet was excessive. The restaurant offers a breakfast and dinner buffet at $12.95 and $21.95, respectively. The choices at both are abundant, but at the times I dined there the quality of the offerings were only slightly above average. Overall, though, we were well pleased with our experience at this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dantemiami
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant to book this hotel, since my previous experiences with Courtyard has not been great; not at this Courtyard. The hotel is in tip top shape, everybody was attentive and friendly. Beach is beautiful, even though a little rough (watch your kids), and the pool was nice and clean. Food is kind of expensive but good and plenty of choices for kids. At our arrival we were met and escorted to our room by Mr. Aroyo and he kindly explained hotel amenities and local attractions. We were very impressed with the level of service at this little hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay, superb staff”
Reviews.Author: annie_10_pr
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from Sept 27-29 and words just cannot express how fantastic everything and everyone there is. From the warm greeting we got at the front desk to the wonderful bartender at the pool. We were celebrating my girlfriend's birthday and also a quick honeymoon. The pool was great, the bartender Axel was very very nice and attentive with us. We told him we were celebrating a birthday and he gave my gf a free drink in her honor.... His mojito is WONDERFUL !!! And we also tried their burgers and wrap and they were really good and not expensive at all. Overall, I would definetely stay there again. Their pool was just the best and the beach is not bad at all... I like the beach at The Ritz Carlton better...I plan to visit again in Nov.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Labor Day Weekend at a great resort”
Reviews.Author: ellyaponte
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four day trip at the Marriott beach resort. Thank you Mr. Arroyo for your warm welcome and the fruit tray was fantastic. We were given a beautiful oceanfront room that was on the 9th floor. Carmen was a great housekeeper and always had extra water in our room. The room always had extra towels and always clean. with a plasma tv, dvd and a small refrig. The food was great at the salsa restaurant, breakfast especially. We didn't get to experience la sirena restaurant but we will next time we are in town. There were three salsa bands every friday, saturday and sunday nights and the dancing was spectacular/ We enjoyed every minute of it. The barenders at the picante bar are very friendly and service you immediateley. During the afternoon we laid at the pool area and even met a couple of folks at the pool bar. We had plenty of towels and the hot tub was fabulous. We also enjoyed a day at the beach and my husband Richard laid in the hammock and fell asleep with a rum island ice tea in his hand. After some dancing at night we would go to the casino and stay there to the wee hours. It is hard to get a slot machine because the locals take them all, but if you are patient, one always become avaiable. The drinks keep coming around as long as you are gambling and they also give you sandwiches if you asked for them. We even took the bus which is only .65 cents and visited old san juan. Overall I would say this is the best resort we have ever stayed in on a holiday and we will go again! Thanks again Mr. Arroyo for a wonderful time! Elizabeth & Richard Marrero Orlando, Florida

Reviews.Title: “Hats Off!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mecaNewYork
Reviews.Content: Hats off, to this hotel. This was my second visit to this hotel, this time I brought a critic and not always easy to get along companion - My Mother and sister. Any hotel that treats one's 76yr old Mom with a walker with such genuine care and personal attention, you can't help but love the personnel. At the coffee shop and pool area, they sensed exactly how much and what kind of attention my Mom needed, so they were unusually attentive. The omelet maker in breakfast room was personable, warm; overall the food was good as long as you can wait about 10 min for an omelet. Everyone provide the kind of loving attention you'd expect from your kindest relative. None of the employees have the corporate, enforced smiley friendliness. Hotel has a very good location; there are good restaurants, ice cream, and pizza parlors. Mr. Arollo handled all our needs with total tact, kindness and professionalism. If you ever visit this hotel make sure you meet this very helpful young man. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “A vacation i would love to forget!”
Reviews.Author: linanewjersey
Reviews.Content: I think your rooms are very nice and your hotel is situated in a beautiful place. waking up to that beach every day was amazing! But I would love to forget the dinig experience I had in your restaurant. Salsa restaurant is a poor excuse for a restaurant the food was horrible and the service dreadful! I think thereyou should re-train an employee she was very rude to me and my husband. She was an older lady with long black hair. It`s a shame that you have people like that working for such a great company like it is Marriott!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel on nice beach”
Reviews.Author: Rusty2280
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard Marriott is a decent hotel on a good beach. It is certainly not in an interesting area for tourists, basically across the street from the airport if that interests you (see the photo). Being walking distance to the Ritz Carlton and their restaurants and casino is nice but other than that, nothing to do in the area but walk on the beach. Rooms were just ok, nothing fancy although you get a walk out balcony with 1/2 the rooms facing the ocean. Ask for a room with the new plasma/lcd tv. Their website makes it sound like all rooms have them, and that's not true yet.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay...”
Reviews.Author: soumya23
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent business traveler so I had used my marriott rewards points for my stay here. I was worried that since I was using points, I would not end up with a nice room. But to my surprise, all of my requests were met - including my request for an upgrade. I was extremely pleased with my room. It was clean, spacious, and had a gorgeous view. I also liked that the rooms had free wireless internet access. The hotel staff was excellent - very friendly and helpful. Good service seemed to be a priority for them, and that plays a huge part in my choice for a hotel. The live music provided for great entertainment (be ready to dance!). The hotel is literally right on the beach, which was the best part of all - I had several lovely naps on the hammocks lining the beach. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the staff”
Reviews.Author: no1meemaw
Reviews.Content: We had the luck to be invited to Puerto Rico for a wedding at the Marriott. We had a problem with getting a room and at 3:45 with no sleep the night before as we had to be at the airport at 4am, I was starting to get upset. Well between Jose and Alfredo the problem was taken care of right now. Our room was a mini suite and we were so comfortable. I never got the name of our maid but we were in rm 1024 and she was great. Our room was spotless every day we came in. She left us extras of anything we needed. What can I say about Alfredo and Jose? Everytime I saw them they called us by name and wanted to make sure we were taken care of. We travel alot and that really impressed my husband and I. Pool was great, ocean was clean and men right there to take care of your needs. I gamble alot and enjoyed the casino, or should I say the casino enjoyed me as i didnt have much luck. Went to el San Juan to gamble and that was not good at all. The planes did not bother our party at all. Salsa music was a great treat. And the wedding they took care of was beautiful. what a great place to get married. We danced by the pool and just had the best of times. My hat is off to Alfredo and his staff. We are already planning our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: Gator1815
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and modern. We stayed 10 days from July 30th through August 9th and we loved every moment. We had an Ocean View room and the view was spectacular! The pool and beach is wonderful! You can relax in a lounge chair or Hammock made for two in the sun or shade or swim up to the pool bar for a "cool one!" The staff is very friendly and helpful should you need assistance. Meals are more expensive in the Isla Verde area but not unreasonable. There are several restaurants within walking distance of the hotel as well as two very fine restaurants within the hotel. About a mile from the hotel there is a small strip mall with Burger King, Church's Chicken, Ponderosa Steak House and my favorite ... Mi Casita! Mi Casita is a small restaurant that offers local fare. Breakfast is a real treat with eggs, bacon or ham, breakfast potatoes and toast and coffe ao tea for under $4.00/person!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: naktia51
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews before going to Puerto Rico and I have to say I am very glad I picked this hotel to stay at. We stayed for 8 days we were only going to stay 3 .. The staff was the greatest I have every come across even at a 5 star hotels. If it wasnâ€™t for the staff our stay would have been so-so. the room was bearable we asked for 2 beds but only got 1 king and a pull out couch. The decor was not like others that we have stayed in a little disappointing. We were on the 12th floor, a great view of the ocean and beach. We watched the kids play on the beach which we enjoy very much. It is very nice to see kids enjoy them selfâ€™s as much as the adults. We spent most of our time at the pool, loved the swim up bar, the staff there were very friendly and helpful, we would like to thank them all very much for making our stay very enjoyable. The ice machine did not work on our floor, they tried there best to get it fixed but no go. The maintenance crew was not on top of things . The maids even offered to get ice for us. The food and service was great. The only thing I have to say bad was it would have been nice not to have to walk through the lobby to get to and from there the pool. Marriott you better be thankful for your staff they make your hotel a very pleasant place to stay if it wasnâ€™t for them we would not of stayed.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay.”
Reviews.Author: NY1LOU
Reviews.Content: I was thiking about how I would review the Marriot Courtyard resort without sounding too negative. It was not like we did not enjoy our stay, because we did, but it was average to what we are normally used to. First off, this hotel does have the best spot on the strip as far as the beach is concerned. The sand was clean, the water was nice and there were palm trees around for shade. I did not like the fact you needed to pay for your beach chairs or umbrella but that is the case. FREE use would be nice. The pool was cool, it is open 24 hours a day which is rare and nice. I hardly ever used the swim up bar but it is a nice feature. The food shack had some good eats just incase you where hungry, they had a DJ playing music which made the atmoshpere a bit more vacation like. Overall, the pool was a good place to hang out by. Cleaning service was lacking, serveral times we would leave our room by 10am and come back by 4pm and the room was still not cleaned. I am not a 5 star type of guy but the basics are a must. Some work needs to be done in that area. TV channels where good and the DVD player saved us with our 2 year old. The view was fantastic and the condo building that you here about in other reviews was not all that bad. The Salsa buffet restaurant was fine. The pork is great and the rice dishes are a must. It did not have the variety I am used to but it was good. Never ate at the Sirena restaurant. I decided to go more ethnic and eat dinner outside of the hotel. Metropol restaurant which is a few blocks away from the hotel never dissapointed. Ok, like I said, not all of it was great but we did have a good time at the place. The casino is a blast if you like that sort of stuff and what I liked the most was the Picante Bar. My hats off to Sandra the bartender she took care of me on my first night and when I got back to the bar on Sunday she took one look at me and remembered what I liked to drink and mixed it right up. She makes great drinks and is a very nice to talk to. To sum it all up, The Marriot was ok, but my main reason for going was to see the Island and that did not dissapoint. Puerto Rico is beautiful in every sense of the word and I invite you all to see it for yourselves. Old San Juan is amazing and for 5 bucks you can see both main Spanish forts and take in the history behind it all. Safe travels to all.

Reviews.Title: “A Few issues but overall A great hotel! Would Def Come Back”
Reviews.Author: geminigurl612
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel from July 17-23rd. 7 Days and 6 Nights so you could imagine we put some thought into our choice of hotel. We read many reviews on trip advisor and we chose to stay here. For the most part we had a great stay. We did have some issues though. We arrived at the hotel around 11:00am. We had an early flight into San Juan that morning. When we arrived at the hotel we were told that our room was not ready which was to be expected since check in was at 3pm. They did store our luggage and we were able to change and go to the beach/pool. we were told that we would get a phone call when our room was ready. well we never got that call. finally aroud 3:30pm we inquired about our room and we were given one at 4pm. We got to the room on the 6th floor and as soon as we opened the door the room was humid. We walked in thinking perhaps the AC was not on. As we walked into the room I slipped on the carpet. The carpet was completley wet. My boyfriend then decided to use the restroom and the floor had foot prints all over the floor. I sat on the bed which was rock hard and turned on the tv and none of the channels were working. I finally got off the bed and realized that my pants soaked b/c the bed was wet due to the humidity in the room. I then heard a noise from coming from the celing and it was a malfunctioning smoke alarm.This was enough for me. we took our things and went downstairs and told the front desk that we needed to have our room changed. we let her know everything that was wrong and appologized. We were given a new room at 5pm. at this point i was exhausted and i wanted to sleep. This new room was an upgrade. It was located on the 7th floor. I was scared to open the door but im glad we did. the room was very clean and smelled good. we had a beautifal view of the ocean. I couldent believe that this room was in the same hotel. everything worked properly in this room and from here on our stay was great. The Pool, and beach are great. Yes the airport is accross the steet and you hear some planes but honestly im from New York and eventually you dont hear the planes anymore. The staff here is very friendly. The casino is a pretty good size but you do get some locals in the weekend. Particularly this young group of buys that think they run the place. other then that the casino is great. All the resturants in the hotel are great too. Wh had on issue at the buffet at salsa and that was resolved with a free meal. This hotel is very customer service oriented and try their best to accoadate your every need. This is a very relaxing atmosphere and is also great for kids. great music every night in the lobby and they have a great happy hour as well. This hotel is convenient to San Juan and if you dont want to pay for a cab jump on the A-5 bus for $.75. This hotel is convenient to all and even with the issues i had i would definatly come back. All due to the customer service i did recieve.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Good Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_GoddessNY
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June for a wedding. The hotel overall was nice. The beach is beautiful and if your a beach person you will definatly enjoy it! Unfortunately when I arrived my luggage did not arrive with me and I was not a happy camper. My room was not ready when I checked in and I had to wait an additional 2 hours for a room. They do give you to free drink tickets when you check in so I waited at the bar. The front desk did provide me with a basket of toiletries when I mentioned that my luggage had not arrived yet. The room was a good size and was clean. The balcony however overlooked the back of the building next door!!

Reviews.Title: “The Only Hotel I Would Stay at La Isla Verde”
Reviews.Author: MiggysGirl
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our nine day stay at the Marriot and thought the Hotel was wonderful. It was very colorful, pretty, clean and the lobby alone was just beautiful. My one problem with the Hotel itself was the fact that we got there and had to wait awhile for our room. The beach was beautiful. The pool area was very nice. The service at the Hotel was good and the people there were courteous (sorry I can't say the same for the service outside the Hotel). The Salsa restaurant was very reasonable and the food was delicious. (If you venture outside the Hotel, Lupis is a must). The Picante Bar was a lot of fun, great bands, especially Friday and Saturday nights, people were dancing as far as the lobby elevators. The casino was a lot of fun, but I wished it was bigger and if it had more .25 slot machines and Wheel of Fortune machines would have been nice. But overall, our stay was FABULOUS!!! Don't know when I'm going back, but when I do, I will definitely be staying at the Marriot.

Reviews.Title: “Just stay for the beach....”
Reviews.Author: ddee320
Reviews.Content: Well let me start by saying, I really wanted to like this hotel. When we arrived by taxi in 5 minutes from the airport, the hotel looked great. Our room wasn't ready so they stored our luggage. We were here for 4 nights for our honeymoon. We told the lady checking us in that we were here for our honeymoon and she offered us an upgrade to a suite for $150 more per night???? Anyway after declining that offer, when we got to our room the only thing to impress us was the flat screen t.v. I also like the balcony but we had a view of the apartments next door. I think she deliberately gave us the room with the worst view. Anyway the bathroom is very small and does not have any counter space and it had mold on the wall. Well after a wonderful night on the beach my husband and I decided we were checking out the next morning and we headed straight for Embassy Suites. Loved the beach access here and the flat screen t.v. but if you are planning on spending any time in your room this is not the place for you. MRSB

Reviews.Title: “Good service and pretty good value, right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: suzieboston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to this hotel in May for short trip. We had a good stay. Service: Very good--friendly, and helpful. The front desk people were very polite and efficient. The concierge did a great job of setting us up for a flight to Culebra at the last minute. Food: Also good. The buffet has good Puerto Rican food, including a whole pig every night, and in the lounge the churrasco skirt steak is fantastic. Room service was good for breakfast, accomodating and fast. The coffee is good at this hotel. Casino: Kind of dreary and small. Rooms: Not luxurious, but clean with good linens and toiletries. Our room had none of the mold or musty odors that other complained of, but the hallway did. It's a tropical environment, so I doubt this is a sign of poor upkeep. Housecleaning was more friendly than in most places. The pool and beach areas: Very nice. In May, there were no crowds. Plenty of chairs and umbrellas, plus hammocks. The have a towel attendent. They swim-up bar is fun and the bartenders are good. They have a hot tub, too. We ventured out into a few areas ,and this info might be useful: 1.) San Juan is very much like being in the mainland U.S (except the people are friendlier and the service is better). Everyone speaks English. Most of the stores and restaurant chains are ones Americans go to at home. At some point, we got a little bored! If you want a change of scenery, check out Culebra island. It's a quiet little island with an amazing beach. We went at the urging of a couple of locals and it was worth the trip in a tiny airplane! It defintely made us feel like we got away from it all. The flights are cheap (100 round trip) and lodging on the island is available for under 100 also. If you go, though, apply bug spray and sunscreen before you get on the airplane (we wish we had). The concierge can set this up. 2.) In Old San Juan, if you want good food, go where the locals are eating. In the afternoon, business people and police officers go out for lunch; follow their lead. We found this was the best way to get good local food at reasonable prices. If you want to have a nice meal at an American restaurant, skip Ruth's Chris; the food was not as good as in the States. BLT Steak in the Ritz was fantastic. We ate there twice. The bartenders and sommelier were very good to us.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to really like it, but...”
Reviews.Author: Dartmouth91
Reviews.Content: What we liked: The beach is beautiful - long stretches of soft, white sand, crystal-clear water, comfy chairs. The view was stunning from our balcony and we enjoyed lying out in the hot sun listening to the waves lapping the shore. The pool is fun - lots of lush vegetation, some strolling iguana, and plenty of chairs and towels. We basked in the sun, ordered great fruity drinks, and "swam up" and enjoyed lunch at the pool bar. The staff - Maribel at the front desk was welcoming and endearing upon arrival, the waitstaff in the restaurant were very professional and, when we left one of our passports in the hotel safe, the housekeeping manager retrieved it promptly and professionally. We were able to extend our checkout and stow our luggage and enjoy the pool and beach until our evening flight. An issue with our room was also handled quickly and professionally (see below) with "the customer is always right" approach. For convenience to and from the airport, it doesn't get any better than this. Our taxi experience in both directions was phenomenal - from the very organized system at the airport, to the ready and available line of taxis at the hotel, this was one of the easiest airport-to-hotel-to-airport experiences we have ever encountered. The downsides: We were shown to a room that was so humid, everything felt wet - the carpets, furniture, bedding. Also, the smell of bleach in the room was enough to burn my nostrils and force me into the bathroom where the fan ran continuously with the light on. We phoned the front desk who sent a housekeeping employee who proceeded to spritz some sort of spray all around the room (more bleach?). We requested to change rooms - they put us 2 floors up, a partial ocean view room, but no odors or humidity issue. The finer dining option was closed Sundays and Mondays, so we were given the option of the dinner buffet. The food was really, really average - I don't have a familiarity with Puerto Rican fare, but this was bland, mushy and overcooked. At $25/person, we were shocked to receive the bill for such unmemorable food. The casino, I'm sure, is fun for many, but felt depressing to us. It is small and crowded and seems to draw a large crowd of people not staying in the hotel. We walked in, intent on spending/losing $5 for fun, but left after a quick walk through left us feeling sad and overwhelmed. Overall, this hotel is saved by the beautiful beach and poolside amenities and, clearly, its proximity to the airport. We are very grateful to the staff who so professionally located and returned our passport. We also were not bothered by the airplane noise (it's kind of a low rumble that you don't hear after a while) or any insects, as reported by some other reviewers. Given the issue with the moldy room, we're not sure we'd want to try this hotel again - they were completely booked the day we departed, which would make me worry about the ability to switch rooms if necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good value”
Reviews.Author: usmarineaviator
Reviews.Content: As a gov't employee I was given 2 complimentary drinks, $25 match play in the casino and breakfast buffett. The pool/spa was open 24hrs a day which is nice. I was told that the beach had a lot of sand fleas by the hotel staff and by another guest but never personally had a problem. If you gamble I would encourage you to have the casino validate your parking. Overall nice stay with live Latin music in the lobby bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: Fafffy
Reviews.Content: Courtyard Marriot is a beautiful place to stay. The beach was wonderful, it has hammacks on the beach which was really relaxing during the day as well as the night. My hubby and I walked on the beach at night which was really nice. They have salsa night on saturday i think. the pool is nice and clean and the Staff people were friendly too. The room was great with small balcony (ours wasn't directly facing the ocean, but we were able to see the waves). The only reason i didnt give this place an 'excellent' rating because i was bitten by bugs at night time. I didnt see any bugs during the day but when i woke up i had been bitten miserably. Overall, the place was very fun to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: destination
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in late May and had a fantastic time. I will say we booked online and got our rooms at a discounted price which helped add to our enjoyment. We were expecting an airport hotel. We had not read any reviews so were pleasantly surprised. The beach is beautiful and not crowded. The pool is open twenty four hours so we spent one night sitting out by the water. Planes do constantly fly overhead and we could hear them from our room so this area may not be the best for light sleepers. The food was a little overpriced but reasonable for a hotel. The service was overall great. At Picante, a manager noticed my husband was not getting served quickly enough and came up unsolicited to apologize and correct it. By contrast, the dinner buffet at Salsa was a little disappointing. The restaurant was over half-empty but even being asked how many people were in our party took well over fifteen minutes. Again, not a big deal but a little irritating when you can see all the empty tables while you wait. Overall though, we were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: charlilley
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. All amenities are within the hotel for a relaxing vacation. If you would like to see the sights of San Juan you are in close proximity of the San Juan's greatest treasures. The on-site restaurants featured delicious Carribean food. Drinks were typical for a New Yorker ($8 or more). The beach and pools weren't crowded, but there were enough people to interact and have a good time with. Hotel staff was personable and accomodating. Rooms could have been a little larger, but comfortable nonetheless. Ocean view was a true full ocean view. Casino was nice. Hotel is located at the end of the strip. We did hear planes (the airport is one mile away) while on the beach, however, it wasn't deafening or distracting. Overall an excellent experience. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money.”
Reviews.Author: bstnnrdgrl
Reviews.Content: To be fair, it is true that the staff are pleasant and do their best with what they have--which is essentially an airport mall masquerading as a hotel (one could hardly call it a "resort"). The place is safe and clean enough, has comfortable furniture, large rooms, lightning-fast elevators, and all the necessary amenities as well as a few nice details (energy-saving lightbulbs and water-saving faucets, and an iPod port on the clock-radio-CD player in the room). I was also allowed to check in to my room early (1:30 pm instead of 3 pm). However, my room (#705) absolutely reeked of mold. I have stayed in Courtyard Marriotts before and have never had any complaints. But here, unfortunately, staff were unable to correct the problem (their "solution" involved spraying the air conditioner with Lysol or something similar). Nor could they switch me to a different room (the hotel was completely full). The odor was so overpowering that I felt I ought to have been sent to another nearby hotel at the Marriott's expense. The air conditioning unit--perhaps even the whole duct system--needs to be thoroughly cleaned, serviced, and preferably updated. The carpets were damp to the touch. The fan in the bathroom, although it runs constantly, was useless. I opened the cover and found the inside coated with a thick layer of dust. I tried to air the room out by opening the balcony door, but I couldn't keep it open for long owing to the airplane noise and the fact that there was no screen door, so the sandflies flew right in. In general I felt that that the owners ought to direct their energies and funds toward updating--rather than expanding--the hotel. The gym, too, was in a sad state of neglect, with old machines (the stair-climber was so rusty that it got stuck, and I bruised my leg when it finally popped back up unexpectedly; I later noticed--and pointed out to an employee--that the bars at the bottom were completely covered with rust). There was also no elliptical machine. The food was overpriced and mediocre, and service was p-a-i-n-f-u-l-l-y s-l-o-w--even though the restaurants were half-empty both times I visited. It is true that the beach is clean and spacious, and quiet & relaxing whenever there's a lull in the plane take-offs. And the view from the balcony--even from a partially-obstructed ocean-view room, as mine was--is quite pretty. But at $300 a night, the Courtyard by Marriott Isla Verde Beach Resort is seriously overpriced and over-rated.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful surprise at a good price!!”
Reviews.Author: JENNMCC
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days/4 nights at Courtyard by Marriott Isla Verde in mid-March 2007 as a getaway for our wedding anniversary. The price was great for this time of year. We had read mostly good reviews, but were surprised at just how much we enjoyed the hotel, property and service! The beach was wonderful and very large. Comfy loungers are set up as you get your towels. We walked east and there was no one around, if you wish some privacy. To the west was the Ritz, and their beach was a joke in comparison. We had a nice amount of waves to play in, but nothing dangerous. The no-see-um bugs are around, so be sure to put on bug repellent from your knees down. We did not and had a few bites, but nothing I hadn't gotten in Florida or South Carolina. The pool was fine and not crowded. (It was high season too, I think.) Looked great for kids. We lounged around the pool and had a drink at the swim up bar. Paradise. The airplane noise is there, though I guess you have to determine what you are expecting. If you want silence and peace, go find a secluded cabin rather than a resort. We were ready for it and did not find the noise objectionable at all. Thanks to the wonderful oceanfront room upgrade, if we had our sliding door open, the ocean noise drowned out almost all airplane noise. Would one complain that the ocean is too noisy? The breakfast buffet was bountiful and complete. Made-to-order omelets and waffles, along with a nice variety of warm items including good sausage and bacon. The cold items had eveything one could wish for, and a very wide variety of juices (good OJ!) left one wanting for nothing. The price is your call, as I end up pigging out to get my money's worth, then needed a good nap by the pool. But that's vacation!! Our only minor complaint was the wait staff service at Picante early in the week. Not sure why we were ignored so, but what can one do. We found some of the same kind of service at a couple other restaurants in this tourist area, so perhaps that's the way things are. The Manager's Reception was exactly the opposite, where the food was good and plentiful, the service was outstanding and the mojitos were addictive. (To one of us anyway...) Maybe tipping accordingly will get their attention for the next time? Again, only a minor issue, as there were plenty of other places to try. (We had a great meal and service in Old San Juan.) Conversely, Mr. Caban and the entire C by M staff could have not treated us better. I'm not sure what we will do for next year's anniversary, but the bar has been set high after this excellent experience. We will be back to see you soon, Yodil. Mucho gracias and best wishes on future expansion!!

Reviews.Title: “What an incredible place!!!!”
Reviews.Author: taco92
Reviews.Content: Perfect place!! It is awesome since it is the last hotel on the strip so when you're on the beach-which by the way, was the cleanest in comparison to the other hotels' beaches-you don't feel "crammed-in" with the other hotels around you!! It was absolutely beautiful, never crowded, staff was so helpful, friendly, engaging...TOP NOTCH!!!! yes, you do hear the planes some, but it is not constant and being that we were out sightseeing a lot-not a problem and then when we were there, it was once-in-awhile and for an instant...never did it interfer with my relaxing!! BEAUTIFUL grounds-the landscaping is impeccable, the hotel and all around was super clean and I really enjoyed staying here for my last 3 days-of my almost 9 day-vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard: a Marriott resort by any other name”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda_View
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights in April while we explored Puerto Rico. If this Courtyard was located anywhere other than near the San Juan airport, it would be rated a 4-star Marriott. The hotel is very nice and has the amenties and small touches you would expect from a more expensive beach resort: quality linens; comfortable beach chairs; cozy hammocks for 2, shaded by nearby palm trees; several on-site restaurants; its own (very clean) beach; large swimming pool with a swim-up bar, and more. Our room was large and clean, and our outdoor patio faced a lovely stretch of beach. For us, it was well worth the tradeoff of the flights, which in truth didn't even bother us. We would definitely recommend this hotel. Request a room facing west, on an upper floor, when you make a reservation.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Is Tourist Friendly”
Reviews.Author: SusanMonroeville
Reviews.Content: This was our third time in San Juan. The first two times we stayed on the Condado. This time we wanted to be on the beach so we chose Isla Verde and the Courtyard by Marriott. When our room was not ready at check-in time of 3P.M., we were immediately upgraded to an ocean front room on the fouth floor. The view was spectacular. The bathroom could have used a little updating but it was clean. The staff at the hotel was more than accommodating. We loved the casino, where we won over $600. The only down side was that all the casinos were closed on Good Friday until noon on Saturday. I am anxiously awaiting my next trip to San Juan. My husband is already looking for an Christmas trip but the prices then are much higher!! I would definitely recommend Courtyard By Marriott in Isla Verde.

Reviews.Title: “What a great week”
Reviews.Author: JVas9
Reviews.Content: First of all, the jet noise! Instantly annoying, it becomes entertaining. Check in was a breeze. The oceanfront upgrade is worth it. Nice view. The staff is very helpful. The pool area is a little small, but it is clean and partially shaded. Very nice landscaping. Keep your eyes peeled for Iguanas and other assorted lizards. A nice distraction. The beach area is large, clean and does offer some shade. The hammocks are a bonus. About food and drink; At check in youâ€™ll get drink vouchers to use at the hotel. A nice touch. Most cocktails are reasonable, but beer is in 10oz. cans. The buffets at Papaya and the outdoor grill are over-priced. Instead, Sirena seems a bit more worth it. You can easily make a right and walk to Dennyâ€™s for a very cheap bâ€™fast. Opposite Dennyâ€™s is the Metropol for dinner(local flavor). A bit furthur is the El San Juan, with more restaurants. You can catch the A5 bus ($0.75)to Old San Juan for sight seeing and shopping, a 30 min. trip. A taxi is $20 and 15min. We had a terrific week and would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip to Paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: Deweybeach
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with our 2 kids (ages 6 & 7) just returned from a 7 day stay last night. WE LOVED IT and can not wait to go back. Excellent service from the minute you step off the cab and throughout your stay!! Thank you Mr Caban for the gorgeous oceanfront suite. We loved it!! This hotel is just steps away from the ocean with great ammenities. We ventured off on the island and saw some top resorts but this is the place to stay and as close to a lovely beach as you can get. We will be back next year for another week stay. Our kids loved the yummy treats (fresh cookies, ice cream and etc) at Bananas in the Lobby and I enjoyed my morning iced latte made with Puerto Rican coffee there without having a starbucks. Jean at the concierge desk with a lovely smile and a friendly attitude is ready to guide you to great restaurants and fun things to do. The minute you step on the beach, there are staff ready to set up lounge chairs, cabanas and get you drinks/food from the poolside bar/grill (Papayas). Loved sipping on our awesome Pina Coladas made by Luise the bartender at the swim up bar!! Rooms were very clean and serviced each day before we returned from the beach. The room had an oceanfront suite with 2 comfortable large queen size beds, large flat screen TV. We listened to the ocean sounds just steps away from our room. Talk about service...each time we requested anything from guest services, we received a follow-up phone call within 10-15 minutes to assure that our needs have been met and that we are enjoying our stay. GREAT MANAGEMENT and customer service!! All the locals recommended Metropol for good authentic Puerto Rican/cuban food. It is a very casual place within 5 minutes walking distance from the hotel and we went back several times for the tasty cuban pepper steak and shrimp with garlic sauce. You get lots of food for as little as $10-15 per person. Within walking distance you can rent all kinds of watersports for a very reasonable price (sailing on hobbie cats for 1/2 hr @ $25 and jet skiing for 1/2 hr for $65). OUR FAMILY CAN NOT WAIT TO GO BACK FOR ANOTHER MEMORABLE STAY AT THIS HOTEL. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

Reviews.Title: “It's just OK”
Reviews.Author: Prodance
Reviews.Content: We spent our very last night here before flying out the next day. I do not recommend that an entire vacation week be spent here but for 1 convenient night night near the airport it was adequate. There was some kind of a large white milky spill or stain of some sort smack in the middle of a dark blue bedspread. It was surprising that the staff did not replace it because it was pretty gross. We removed it and put it on the floor in the corner of the room. Other than that, the room was fine and in good condition. We had dinner at Salsa - very dissappointing. It was not good. I was up most of the night with an upset stomach. In retrospect, I would probably not book this hotel for that last night again. We were all over the island and had some very great stays and good times.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly; Great Buffets; Be Aware of Extra Charges”
Reviews.Author: rocknroll52
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two daughters aged 12 and 14 for a weeklong spring break getaway in late March 2007. This hotel has nice amenities for families including: a nicely landcaped pool with separate kiddie pool; beautiful sandy beach; ice cream parlor and arcade room; mini fridge in the room. Be aware, the surf can be strong at the beach and there are no lifeguards at the pool or the beach. What stands out from our experience here are the excellent buffet breakfast and dinner at Salsa Restaurant. There are some pricing options to be aware of, as they are not posted: The full breakfast buffet costs 12.95 for adults, 6.50 for kids under 12. Adults eating the "cold buffet" at Salsa are charged only 7.95. The hot buffet includes: made to order omelets and waffles, breakfast meats, french toast, potatoes, and hot cereal. The cold buffet is bountiful containing cold meats and cheeses, bagels, toast and pastries, fresh fruits, cereal, and yogurt. Coffee, tea, hot chocolate, milk and a selection of fruit juices are provided. You can eat your breakfast inside or on the veranda which looks out on the beach (recommended!). Continental breakfast is also available at Bananas ice cream parlor for about $5, where you can watch CNN on TV while you eat; however, the selection of food is more limited and is not a good value compared to the cold buffet at Salsa. The dinner buffet at Salsa features Puerto Rican specialties and costs 21.95; during our stay a special promotion was available, kids under 12 free with a paying adult. Again, this pricing is not posted and you have to ask. The centerpiece of the buffet is a whole roasted pig ("lechon"). You have to try this! The meat is tender and tasty and the skin is crisp. Other local food items on the dinner buffet included goat (tastes like lamb), red beans and rice, and plantains. We also ate dinner at Sirena's, a "white tablecloth" style restaurant located on the patio. You can't beat the ambiance: palm trees, beach, soft lighting and island music. The a la carte menu is more pricey than the buffet, but the food was great, and compared to other restaurants on the island, was not overpriced. Dinner for four inluding appetizers and main course will run about $35 not including drinks, tips and tax. A wine list is available. A note about extra charges you will run into here: our room rate of 261.25 for an oceanview double (AAA rate) did not include govt tax of 31.61 and a 26.13 resort fee, so the grand total for our room was 318.99 per day. Self-parking in the onsite garage is $15 per day plus 7% tax. You will need a car or taxi to get most places; although you can walk to the Ritz Carlton where a lovely but pricey spa offers everything from payaya and mango facials ($75) to rainforest stone massage ($175). My girls got manicures ($40 each). For a splurge gourmet dinner you might want to try the Vineyard Restaurant at the Ritz (we didn't). I noticed that the pool and beach in front of the Ritz Carlton were much more crowded than ours and didn't provide a lot of shade. A beautiful hotel but I would never spend $580 and up for a room there!

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: musicmaker
Reviews.Content: Totally impressed with everything at this Marriott! The staff is top notch and goes out of their way to make things pleasant. We were greeted with beach balls for the kids, drink coupons for us and an upgraded room (thank you Mr Caban). Staff attitude can make or break the best of places and we never encountered anyone that was not incredible and friendly. Once I had a question that the front desk could not answer and was told they would get back to me...it was very busy and so I thought sure...I was pleasantly surprised witha follow -up phone call and an answer! The room looked brand new and had the most comfortable beds...I want one for home! It had a large flat screen TV and a separate room that had a microwave, refrig, and sink. Great shower with lots of (almost too much) water pressure. We were in room 1124 with an ocean view and balcony. The resort had something for everyone. The pools were great ...had a smaller one for the kids (ages 4 & 7) that was 3 1/2 ft and had a small slide, great beach playground and a nice swim up bar. Good music playing but not blarring as at some hotels. Thought the hotel was at capacity, we never had trouble finding a pool chair or hammock to lounge in. Bananas had pizza and ice cream that made our kids very happy! The lounge bar was nice with music every night! Great way to get your fill of music with little ones in tow! It was great fun to watch as the locals filled the dance floor. The music was great! The breakfast buffet was good and reasonable at $12 for adults. We took advantage of the KIds Club offered by the casino and were happy with it. Yes, you could hear the airplanes land but we never heard them in our rooms and we actually found it great fun to watch the planes take off. It was loud at times but it would not stop me from staying here again! This is a place who knows how to treat you right!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view”
Reviews.Author: jimpoo
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. The view was fantastic and the hotel staff were very helpful and pleasant. The rooms were large and very clean especially for a beachfront hotel. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a blast with the kids”
Reviews.Author: Ann-70
Reviews.Content: I went down to Puerto Rico to get away from the cold weather and used my airline mileage to take the kids. They loved it! The beach was lovely, the playground was great and the staff superb. My kids can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull Stay”
Reviews.Author: shineman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from an excellent 4 night stay at The Isla Verde Courtyard. Upon check-in we were upgraded to a suite, ( thank you Mr Caban ) that was very spacious and had a spectacular "ocean front" view of the beach and water. The room had a comfortable king size bed and a large flat screen LCD TV equipt with a DVD player in the bedroom and another TV w/dvd player in the living room.The room also had an apartment size refridge a microwave and a coffee maker in the dinnette area. The grounds are beautifully landscaped and well maintained. The beach is also beautiful and located right outside the hotel door. Although the hotel was at or near capacity there was plenty of room on the beach and poolside with lounge chairs, umbrellas and cabanas available for hotel guest. There is also plenty of employees to help with such as well as food and drinks.There were a couple of restaurants with very good food and one has live latin music nightly.The employees in the entire hotel were friendly and very accomadating and there are senior management personnel on the premises to address an issues that may arise. As an added bonus there is free high speed internet access available 24 hours a day. YES this hotel is right next to the airport and YES you can hear the airplanes at times,but I would not let that stop me from enjoying this hotel, as I believe it is the best value in the area and would highly recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: MACGermantown
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 5 days in Puerto Rico- traveling with our 19-month-old. Here is the rundown of the good and the bad of the Courtyard Marriott there in San Juan. After having gone to St. Kitts and Cancun the previous two years- staying at Marriottâ€™s at both location- I put San Juan as third on my list of places to visit- especially with a child. The Good ï‚· Pool is great. They have a nice pool with a swim up bar. They also have two other kid pools. One is a pool perfect for kids who have just learned to swim. It isnâ€™t very big, has a slide, and has seating for parents. They also have a baby pool, which was perfect for our son. There are plenty of chairs around each of three pools. ï‚· They have a nice playground. ï‚· I really liked how you could see the ocean from the pool and you were just steps away from the beach. ï‚· They gave my son a bucket, shovel and beach ball when we checked in. They never left his side. ï‚· The breakfast buffet was really good and priced reasonably at $13 per person. ï‚· The food you can get for lunch throughout the hotel is okay. Nothing great but nothing too bad. ï‚· There is a pharmacy within walking distance to get snacks, floats, soft drinks, etc.. ï‚· There is a grocery store within walking distance- about 15 minutes or 3 minutes by cab. We walked it and it is doable despite what they tell you. But if you just need small stuff go to the pharmacy. If you do buy milk, buy a Â½ gallon â€“ a whole gallon wonâ€™t fit in the fridge. ï‚· The rooms had DVD players. The Bad ï‚· The hotel is the last hotel in a line of hotels. You have about a 10-minute walk to other restaurants/hotel restaurants. The sidewalks are not very stroller friendly ï‚· If you do go somewhere else close by- like a two minute cab ride, you are looking at a minimum of $6-7 each way. It was about $35 roundtrip to old San Juan. It adds up after a while and can be difficult to do with a car seat. ï‚· The food at the hotel at night isnâ€™t very good so you have to go out and most places- even American chains- are about 50% higher than what you would pay in the states. ï‚· I didnâ€™t feel the service was that great at the hotel. I had to call the front desk a couple of times for things and it was like they could have cared less- they had a take it or leave it attitude- despite the letter you get from management when you check in. ï‚· The people in San Juan werenâ€™t the most helpful people either. I didnâ€™t feel like they were really into being a tourist destination. Being that I live in Maryland and it is really cold here in the winter- I would only go back if it were a really good deal getting there and staying there at the Marriott. Otherwise I would look for a hotel on Isla Verde but further down the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: julspan
Reviews.Content: My two friends and I came back from a 3 night vacation at the Courtyard. We were upgraded to a junior suite which was very spacious and clean. The staff was extremely gracious, friendly, and helpful during our stay. The pool area was very pretty, the water a bit cool for our tastes. The hot tub was too chlorinated and stung our eyes, and was also way too hot. The pool and beach were right outside the hotel doors which was very convenient. The beach was pretty empty and beautiful but beware of the sand flies in the early morning! (OFF spray did not work) The Sirena restaurant and the Picante lounge had very good food. All in all, we enjoyed the hotel very much!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Courtyard Isla Verde!”
Reviews.Author: labombita22
Reviews.Content: My husband and 13 month old son just got back from a WONDERFUL stay at Courtyard Isla Verde. Staff, ammenities, location, just EVERYTHING in general was super. The noise from the airport takes some getting used to but it's not bad. Will definitely stay here again if we visit PR in the future! The food at all resturants was great and Banana's was an extra plus! You won't be dissatisifed with this place! Cannot saying anything more but FABULOUS!!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: shorty822
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night prior to our cruise. the hotel was clean and the staff were very nice. I wouldn't say it's the nicest hotel, but it's worth the money compared to most san juan hotels located on the beach. One annoying thing, was the hotel is very close to the airport so it was loud at times (not the end of the world). The area was good and there are some restaurants in the area (walking distance). I would recommend this hotel and would consider returning if in the area!!

Reviews.Title: “Second stay - even better than the first!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mauie4me2
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Courtyard by Marriott Isla Verde Resort. Last Feb. we stayed one night prior to our cruise which was leaving from San Juan. We loved the hotel then and decided to return this year - same time of year and for just one night prior to a cruise. My only regret is that it couldn't have been longer. The hotel is right on the ocean - walk out the door and the beach is right there. The pool area is very nice as well. We had a wonderful room with a balcony facing the ocean. We had a great dinner at the hotel, listened to some lively Salsa music and a great girl singer in the lobby, visited the Casino and didn't have to leave the property - everything we wanted was right there. The accomodations were nicely decorated and very clean. The Staff is friendly and helpful Next time we are in San Juan, we will arrange to stay at this hotel for a week - - one night is not enough.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but close to the airport and a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: seattlewaseattlewa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and the beach is gorgeous. My wife and I read that it was close to the airport, so we should have been more prepared for the frequent plane noise. Another drawback is that it's out of the way, so you need to take a cab to get to San Juan. For the price it's very good, I don't want to be too negative.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: george01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Courtyard for 4 nights right before New Year's. We had booked an ocean front room, well worth the extra money, and quite reasonable by Puerto Rico standards for the high season. The view was awesome, the beach was great, although the ocean was very rough during our stay, and that meant algie on the beach. They do an excellent job grooming the beach every morning, however they don't pick it up, thus it goes in and back out during the tides. We had a couple of minor problems during our stay. One was corrected by staff within minutes, and the other, when management got involved, it was satisfactorily corrected. It was rather refreshing to see management take such an active role in the running of the hotel. Although common in small properties, it's quite rare among the bigger ones. Gracias Mr. Caban. As for the biting gnats, they are for real. Just like in Florida, they bite during early morning and evening. They got me in the balcony, but no big deal. The noise of the planes was not an issue for us, we didn't mind at all. Do not sleep with the sliders open though, because you'll hear them in the morning. Close the sliders, turn on the AC, and you'll hardly hear them. Breakfasts were excellent, and reasonably priced, and the lounge really rocks at night (with salsa sounds, of course) A message for the Concierge: Yes, there is public transportation in Puerto Rico to go places all over the island. When we asked, were told by a young lady at the concierge desk that it didn't exist, and that we had to either rent a car or use taxis, which we didn't want to do. We wanted to go out of San Juan, inland, to see other towns. We asked a local, and he told us about the guagua (bus) terminals, depending on the destination, and how to get there (via subway- which by the way, was fantastic, so clean and beautiful). Granted, I'm fluent in the language and while it's perhaps not the most confortable means of transportation (the guagua) - they are small vans, have erratic schedules - it truly gives you a sense of the real Puerto Rico, and its people. We used it to go to Caguas, a small town about an hour or so from San Juan, and enjoyed it tremendously, the people we met were wonderful and the entire experience was just what we were looking for. All in all, we had a great time at the hotel and in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect way to end a cruise vacation!”
Reviews.Author: macinMN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had just completed a 3 day cruise thru his company. We had booked two nights at the Isla Verde Courtyard for afterwards for some relaxation to celebrate our 15th wedding anniversary. When I made the reservation, Marriott could not guarantee that we would be receiving a king, non-smoking room. I had emailed the hotel directly and the asst general manager made a note on our reservation. When we arrived the front desk they treated us like VIP's offered us an upgrade to oceanfront suite and later that evening had complimentary appetizers brought to our room. Everything about the hotel is great - clean, staff friendly & helpful, beautiful beach, small casino, 3 restaurants, ice cream/coffee shop, bar - you really never have to leave! They do have a tour desk and we did book a Bacardi Rum factory and Old San Juan tour which was fun and interesting and worth the $40. The hotel is right down the way from the Ritz Carlton which has nicer, powdered sand but limited space - one chair on top of the other. The Courtyard is spread out with staff immediately there to assist you with your chair/cabana. The pool is really nice with swim up bar, not crowded. The planes/helicopters for us were interesting, not at all a problem, an occasional roar. At night with the air conditioner going you don't really hear them. There are plans for future expansion with condos and Puerto Rico's largest swimming pool. We can't wait to go back for a longer visit at this wonderful hotel and time to do more tours, specially the bioluminescent bay by kayak. We highly recommend this hotel for a fun and relaxing time!

Reviews.Title: “excellent precruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: Romnan
Reviews.Content: My wife,myself and two friends that were going on a cruise stayed at the hotel for two days prior. Flew in from Tampa and was at the hotel within 10 minutes After picking up our luggage. Overall we found everything about the hotel to be very appealing.Staff was very outgoing,cheerful and helpful. The room were large and the views were wonderful.What was helpful was helpful was that this was a very special trip and we wanted a room with "THE PERFECT VIEW" front desk allowed us to see the room before we chcked in, not after The pool and beach area are just beautiful,really must be seen to appreciate. I know people have written about the airport noise but truthfully this amounted to a jet taking off periodically and the take off noise lasted a few minutes. Dining options are available at the hotel and excellent. checked out for the cruise on Sunday met a couple there that was going so we became a partof six staff very helpful with getting a cab forsix with 14-16 pieces of luggage wold recommend staying here to anyone, and plan to stay here on my next trp

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: jams34
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from an eight night vacation stay at the Courtyard. There are not enough good things I can say about this hotel and we have been to Puerto Rico many, many times. I would recommend the the Courtyard over the Marriott in Condado where we have also stayed. First, the rooms were excellent - clean, spacious and very comfortable. As for all the staff we encountered - outstanding. Two days I forgot to leave a note that the money left out was a tip for the housekeeping staff and they did not take it. The food was excellent - from the breakfast buffet were there were made to order omelettes to Siera, their best restaurant, just great - we ate there three times. Sandwiches in the little restaurant in the lobby were also great. We loved the beach - no seawood and great swimming. Casino staff was so friendly which too often is not the case in Puerto Rico - we stopped going to the El San Juan Casino just down the street for that reason. We are small gamblers but love it and the Courtyard was the only place we won. Overall we had such a great experience and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time at Isla Verde”
Reviews.Author: elcicuta
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed week at this Hotel. We had a great room with a view to the ocean and the pool. Our room was spotless and very comfortable. The hotel met our needs and then some. We chose this hotel through Tripadvisor and all the positive reviews we read about it. When we arrived and during our stay the staff was wonderful to us and they were very helpful at all times. The people at the front desk were always very attentive to our requests. Special thanks to Tijuana and Perla. The food in the hotel was not that great and very expensive. One exception though, the Hotelâ€™s restaurant La Sirena was fantastic. The food was wonderful and we were treated like royalty by the staff there. When we asked for a dish that was not on the menu, the staff was very glad to help us out and make it special for us. Very special thanks to Benjamin and to Carlos Gomez the restaurant manager. The only annoying thing was the noise of the airport. If youâ€™re at the beach or at the pool the landing and the takeoff of the planes can be loud enough to stop any conversation. Apart from that we had a great time and would readily go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Travelfool11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a recent business trip to San Juan. The hotel was much better than expected. All rooms have a view of the ocean and the facilities at the hotel were great. The rooms appeared to be recently renovated, was larger than expected and very clean. The view was wonderful. There were a number of restaurants and although I did not each lunch or dinner there, I did eat breakfast there both days. The breakfast buffet with omelette and waffle bar was great. I believe it only cost about $12-13 which is not too bad for a decent hotel breakfast. The casino was also much better than expected, especially for a hotel of this side. When we checked in we even got $25 in match play coupons. The table game and slot machine selection was one of the best I've seen on the island. The Courtyard is in the Isla Verde section which has what I think is the best beach in San Juan. The main beach in Puerto Rico (the Condado Section) is very rocky and much rougher although this is where most of the large resorts are (ie the Marriott Stellarios, Caribe Hilton, Condado Plaza, etc). Isla Verde is also further away from Old San Juan than the hotels in Condado but you can take a taxi there for $19, the ride takes about 10-15 minutes depending on traffic. The downside of Isla Verde is that all of the hotels (the Courtyard included) are located on a strip directly adjacent to the runway. Although some reviewers indicated you couldn't hear the planes very well, I definitely heard them even in my room. In fact one was so loud I thought it was crashing into the hotel (at about 5:45 am). Outside the noise can be deafening. The pool and beach area are oustanding for a hotel of this size. I especially like the hammocks which were great for enjoying the warm Caribbean breeze. This hotel is ideal of business travelers and for vacationers looking for a short trip. I would not recommend this for anyone looking for a relaxing, get away from it all luxury vacation. The noise is just not conducive to it. Also, please note that in the winter the ocean can be VERY cold. If you are looking for a beach vacation I would definitely look for someplace outside San Juan, preferrably on the Eastern or Southern Coasts. The water there just seems to much warmer in the winter. I would DEFINITELY stay at this hotel again if traveling on business or as a stop over for a few nights in San Juan before traveling elsewhere on the island. If you are vising San Juan and staying at the hotel you probably don't need a car. The airport is a short cab ride as is Old San Juan. You can take a short walk to numerous restaurants around the hotel. It's probably cheaper and less of a hassle. Driving can be a bit challenging here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaProf
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending four nights at this hotel. We had a great time. The hotel met our needs very well, but it might not be equally excellent for everyone. First, let me say that everyone at the hotel -- heck, everyone in Puerto Rico -- was wonderful to us. It was a friendly, relaxed and pleasant place to vacation. We traveled with our two *special* children, one autistic and one with ADHD, and occasionally one or the other does something odd; we don't expect things to always be trouble-free in the interpersonal relations department.
