In this case, however, it was. Two men even appeared from nowhere to help us free our rented car from the sand when we got stuck while taking beach photos. One thing you ought to know about this hotel, however, is that it is very near the airport. The soundproofing in the building is quite good. There are, for example, double sliding glass doors on the room's balcony that seal out much of the noise. While we could still hear the planes from our room, the sound was faint and not annoying. Outside in the hot tub, however, you absolutely had to suspend conversation when one took off. This did not bother us (after all, we have children, and noise is no novelty) but it might be an issue for someone else. Also, the beach in front of the hotel, while very scenic, isn't the best for swimming. There is, or was during our visit, quite a bit of seaweed floating in the water. The huge hammocks swinging there, however, are wonderfully enticing, and lying there in the evening watching the moon float overhead is the kind of experience you hope for on a Caribbean vacation. The hotel's pools are nice and they were not crowded when we used them. However, they are a bit small. You are not going to mistake them for Blizzard Beach in Disneyworld. The beach situation did not bother us, though, because we had a rental car and knew that the beach at Liquillo was gorgeous. We drove down there (about 30 miles) and had a great time on two different visits. The room was clean. Pretty standard for a nice hotel/motel. No issues there. The biting insects -- most likely it was the no-see-ums -- did take a chunk out of us on the beaches. We neglected to use bug spray, and one thing I would recommend to others is to buy some kind of insect repellent and use it. If you forget, Benadryl's anti-itch spray relieves the symptoms pretty well, as we can personally attest. The food at the hotel was good, but expensive. If you want a cheaper breakfast and you have a car, take a right turn out of the hotel and drive about a half mile and you will find a Dennys on your right. There is a bar and a casino in the spacious lobby area. I am not a gambler, so the casino was no big deal for me. The bar had live nightly music, usually featuring a lively Latin beat, and the dance floor filled and spilled into the surrounding lobby by 9:30 or so in the evening. I believe it went into the wee hours of the morning, but I can't say I stayed up to find out.The musicians were good -- at least, these are not the sad sacks you sometimes see singing "yellow bird" and panhandling some places in the Caribbean. They were professionals. If you like dancing to a salsa beat, you could spend many happy hours in the lobby. The place rocked - the scene at New Year's Eve surpasses any party I have ever seen before. The hotel also runs a kids club, where you can have the children entertained, provided you are willing to spend your free time on the hotel grounds. You must pledge to stay on grounds while the children are with them. Having seen the "kids club" on a Disney cruise ship, mine were chomping at the bit to go to this one. When we got there, though, it reminded me more of the toddler nursery at our church than the Disney kids club. My son pulled my arm and whispered in my ear "This place is lame." We left them anyway, and when we returned a few hours later to pick them up, they did not want to leave. My 10 year old son had been playing Twister and my 8 year old daughter had been imaging herself a sophisticated grown-up, drinking pina coladas (with no alcohol) prepared by the adult running the show. The kids wanted to go back and did so a couple days later. Again, they did not want to leave when we went to pick them up. So again, friendly staff mattered more than posh surroundings and state-of-the-art electronic games. The photos of our trip are available online at http://www.flickr.com/photos/cmichener/sets/72157594455779395/ if you are interested.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nuyorquina
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay at the Courtyard. Asst. Mgr. Yodil Caban met us upon arrival just as he said he would on this site. He upgraded our room and we had a fabulous view of the beach. The customer service was wonderful and everything was top notch. I am definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel! Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkTravelmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and two children (ages 8 and 4) stayed there for 5 or 6 nights in November. We had an oceanfront 1bdrm suite. The room was very nice and clean. The view was AMAZING! Every staff member was helpful and eager to please. The other guests were friendly too. The food was average (I only ate the breakfast buffet). We had a very nice, low-key vacation. I've spent lots more and had more luxurious accomodations on other vacations, and I'm pretty picky, but this hotel was was pleasant surprise. And you can't beat the price. We had friends who paid more for their tiny room, over looking the city(not beach) at the Intercontinental. When they saw our room, they said they'd stay at the Courtyard on their next trip. It is a great hotel for families although we never did find the advertised "kids' club." The pool is nice; the beach was a bit rough and the water is not crystal clear, but it was still fun. One of the nicest things about the hotel is that it is at the end of the "hotel strip" so it feels much more secluded than the other hotels on the strip. The view from our large balcony (15ft long probably) was ALL ocean and unspoiled beach- not commercial at all! The airplane noise is real, but you get used to it and it's not really annoying. We could not hear it when we were inside our room. If you're looking for constant action, it's not the best hotel for you- the Courtyard is quiet, although it does have a small casino open 24 hrs. and a lobby bar. When we wanted action, we went to the El San Juan or the Intercontinental or other restaurants in the city. We will definitely go back to the Isla Verde Courtyard Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “A Surprising Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Michael/Steven
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard by Marriott Isla Verde expecting very little and we were very pleasantly surprised. The rooms are quite large, modern and comfortable and they far exceeded our expectations of a "Courtyard" brand hotel. The hotel has several restaurants, a casino, a coffee bar, and a beautiful beach and we can very easily recommend it to our friends and family as a good bargain hotel in Puerto Rico. A tip for an evening out: go to The El San Juan Hotel just down the beach a bit for a wonderful evening in their lobby bar or casino. What a fantastic scene!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel bar none”
Reviews.Author: jaclin
Reviews.Content: My husband was in Puerto Rico on business, so I tagged along. The Courtyard was great.. the friendliest staff I have seen, especially Patrica at the Banana Bar. The location was great.. the pool beautiful and the view from our room was perfect. The beach is steps away from the hotel door. I cant remember the last time I was so relaxed as I was reading on the hammocks. Since my hubbie was gone during the day, I was on my own.. never felt uncomfortable anywhere in the hotel. Would recommend and stay here again

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel I have stayed at for a long time!!”
Reviews.Author: gonzn
Reviews.Content: I spent my birthday at the Mariott Courtyard. It was my sister's present to me after we read the reviews on TripAdvisor. It was so fantastic I cannot even beleive it. The hotel is beautiful! The rooms are clean and spacious. The staff is eager to help you in any way they can. The band that played in the Bar Picante (it was Salsa) was beyond reproach. They made you want to get on that floor. The drinks were fabulous and not expensive. The food was excellent. Did I mention the beach and pool? That was fantastic! I can only say that it would be a mistake not to stay there. It made my birthday so memorable, I will never forget it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service Wonderfull Staff”
Reviews.Author: ellenpenn
Reviews.Content: These guys saved my daughters destination wedding. We had guest coming from all over the US and Puerto Rico and had booked about 80 room nights at the Intercontinental. The Intercontinental turned out ot be a construction site with the pool area totally torn up. We moved our entire group to the Marriott and it was wonderful. The staff was extremely nice and very attentive. The bar is a jumping place with live music every night, the pool is great with swim up bar, almost every room is ocean view and a mile long beach is right there. Every one of our guest had a great time. We have travelled all over the world and have not had any better service anywhere. The best views are higher up in the hotel and on the even numbered side, the higher the number the closer you are to the ocean. I will definitely stay at the Courtyard Marriott Isla Verde next time we are in Puerto Rico. This is not your normal Courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bug alert!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ilove2travelalso
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel10/07/06. I was excited being that it had a pool, beach, casino, lounge. but at the end of my stay I knew it was tooooo good to be true!!!! I had bed bug bites all over my body!!!!!!! When I brought it to the assistant manager's attention he told me they were fruit flies from the avocados I had!!!!!! So once I arrived to New York, I went straight to the doctor because the itching just wouldnt stop!!!! It happened to be that I was bed bug bitten!!!!!!! I am so saddened that Marriott would not stay on top of their rooms to make sure guest wouldnt have to go experience such an ordeal!!!!!! Bed Bugs Alert !!!!!!!Room 411 people beware!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “much nicer than any courtyard ive seen”
Reviews.Author: veggggyy
Reviews.Content: room came with 2 coupons for alcoholic drinks, had wonderful dual pools (very large!!) with swim up bar and pool-type food, right on the beach with hammocks, nice restauraunt (and seperate ice cream parlor) with live music right next to the casino......marriott gave us 25$ in match play so we could double our earnings at the casino....in room fridge, tv has DVD AND VCR PLAYER! (not many tv channels)...very nice staff, 24 hour fitness center (stairmaster, treadmill, bike, weights). we had a car, so that helped us see more of the san juan area. the hotel is very nice, much nicer than any courtyard ive stayed at, and i would stay at this one again. you wont be disappointed! PS-- free wireless in room!

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing family experience.”
Reviews.Author: adriellesmum
Reviews.Content: My two young children and I were accompanying my husband on a business trip.We opted for this hotel because there was no availability at the San Juan Marriott and I wanted a hotel on the beach.This has a really great beach front with surprisingly good hammocks. We booked a corner suite and the connecting king room.Both had balconies and faced the ocean. The suite was very large and had a decent sized kitchen with a full sized fridge/freezer.Apart from some cups and glasses from the bathroom,there are no utensils,plates or cutlery of any kind. We had a rental car and ended up buying plastic plates etc.bottled water and some cereal from a local Walgreens. The rooms were clean and the bathrooms adequate.This is not a luxury hotel by any means,but having a large(clean) space for the four of us to spend a week in was paramount.Not to mention the spectacular view from our balconies. The air conditioning worked well,although in the evenings my husband and I would switch ours off and open the sliding doors and sleep with the sound of the ocean.Because of the humidity everything gets very damp.Not too big a deal though. We found the staff to be helpful and polite,especially Tijuana at the front desk.If you have any problems at all with booking your rooms,ask for Tijuana,she's a miracle worker! Unfortunately,the one place where this hotel really needs improvement is in it's restaurants.The food is not acceptable and overpriced. We drove in to Old San Juan almost every evening and had some fabulous(be prepared however,pretty costly)meals. AquaViva is an absolute must for seafood lovers.It is located on one of the side streets off of the Plaza de Colon in Old San Juan. Nearby is the Parrot Club(same owners as AquaViva)another great place. All in all we found the Courtyard Isla Verde to be great value for the money.The staff were very accomodating and the Assistant Manager arranged day passes at the Ritz Carlton(2 hotels up the beach)for us when the Coutyard decided to drain and clean their pool.Have to say the Ritz Carlton Pool really is fabulous if one gets a chance to visit. It was fairly quiet when we were there,I could see that perhaps it wouldn't be quite as good during peak season.Only worth staying here if you can get a room with a view of the ocean,helps to make up for some of the things that aren't quite up to par. Definitely not a business hotel nor a hotel for young people out for a good time in PR. Just so that I won't be the only reviewer that doesn't mention the planes......outside they are pretty loud,but somehow that wasn't really a problem for us.The glass sliding doors in the rooms shut out the noise pretty successfully. Once again,because we weren't in PR during peak season,maybe there were less planes flying in and out.Certainly pretty handy getting to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared to relax”
Reviews.Author: sfltraveler
Reviews.Content: We loved the rooms at the marriott! They were large and attractive. I am not sure why, but you will notice the carpeting and bedspreads are damp, but it wasn't a problem for us. All the staff was extremely friendly (with the exception of the gift shop). And although I was worried about being so close to the airport, the noise wasn't really bad. I am a light sleeper, so I did use earplugs at night just in case, and it was fine. I am not a gambler, but the casino seemed ample, and got quite a crowd in the evening. The nightclub have live music and dancing every evening, and we enjoyed sitting with a drink after a busy day of seeing the island. We were mostly out on the go, but did enjoy the beach and swim up pool bar our last morning. If you are going to be out sightseeing, I would recommend staying an extra day just to relax here at the hotel. The only down side I see to this hotel is that you must walk quite a distance or take a cab to go to any restaurant or hotel other than the ones on site, and the restaurants have somewhat limited selection for a very high price. We did walk to the Metropol, it was good cuban food for a reasonable price (about 10 min walk). Other than that, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Too far and little to do.”
Reviews.Author: RosiNYC
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were looking forward to our first trip to Puerto Rico, after researching several hotels we decided on the Courtyard Marriott which had a decent price and "walking distance". We stayed at the Courtyard from Agust 28-Sept. 1. The noise from the airport did not bother us and we slept soundly. Where do I start..... Check- in went really smoothly and we had a nice room with a view of the ocean. The room is clean and spacious, the bathroom is large yet the bathtub was moldy, had soap scum and mold starting to form on the ceiling. Our housekeeping did a wonderful job making sure we had clean towels and came to clean up the room daily. Most of the staff is nice and always had a smile. One problem I encountered was at the Banana Cafe in the lobby, the young lady was counting her cash register and we were standing in front of her waiting to be served, I did not want to disturb her since she was in the middle of counting and figured she will acknowledge us once she finishes the set of change she was counting...well she went to the next set without bothering with us. I asked her is she is going to serve us and she said "just a minute" meanwhile the other person working with her, passed us several times didn't bother either....Breakfast was too expensive at the hotel so we ate at Denny's most of the time There was a wonderful friendly hardworking young man named Marcelino who set up a chairs ($6)and umbrella ($9) and can get quite expensive, which mean 21 dollars a day. The pool was nice although we never used it since the beach is right there and beautiful to see, it is not white sand, a lot of seaweed and very sandy, I would rate it a C. and THERE ARE SAND FLEAS!!!! At first I thought I was getting bitten by mosquitoes (I am allergic, swells almost like a welt and turns red blue), which did not happen, then I thought they were bed bugs, that was not the case either, and recalling some of the reviews regarding Sand Fleas, I figured that must be it...I am not a doctor yet it is a good speculation. Since my friend and I do not drive, taxi fare was turning out to be expensive, 20 dollars (one way) to go to Plaza Las Americas which is a 10 minute cab ride. We tried to save by taking the bus to Old San Juan which was 75 cents and get a chance to see the inner barrios. The hotel is far from the nearby restaurants, and NOT walking distance as many claimed. I'm from NY and I am not afraid to walk long distances in a fast pace, yet restaurants are not close. We ate at the Oyster bar which was not that great and that the Mexican restaurant on the rooftop at the El San Juan Hotel which was reasonably price and the food was good. Some cab drivers charge you different rates as well. The cab going to El San Juan hotel charged us $5 on our way back another cab driver charged us $8....the cab ride being 3 minutes away! The cabs we used are designated for Tourists to avoid being scammed....well I can't help but wonder if this really works! The entertainment at the hotel needs improvement and for two young women on vacation, much is left to be desired. The bar Picante was very stingy with their alcohol and PR being the main distributor of Rum, they seemed very cheap and their drinks ranging from $7-10, was watered down...We were also wondering were everyone was there was no more than a handful of people in the bar it started getting better by Thursday...we assumed they were saving the rum for the weekend. Located in a quiet location, the hotel is better for business travellers and families or for those that have a car rental. Otherwise it gets expensive and the nightlife is not that great. I will not return to this hotel for vacation, it is far from most attractions and restaurants. We were looking forward to a Caribean island and found ourselves in a replica of Miami with a Burger King at every street corner. The locals are really warm and friendly and always there to help and give you information; we enjoyed talking to many of them.

Reviews.Title: “Had A great time!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Trishy86
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort from July 13-18th. We had a wonderful stay! The resort has a casino, 3 restaurant and nice entertainment. Every night there is a live salsa band playing at the bar...it gets so packed. The rooms are very nice and clean. We had an ocean view room. The food there is good...I wouldn't recommend the outside restaurant Serena, it has steep prices and food that I never heard of before. They had a buffet which I only went to for breakfast because there was really no food that looked good for dinner. Its only 12.00 for breakfast and they give you A LOT of food to chose from, itâ€™s a great deal. The pool and beach area are very nice and the beach isn't too crowded like some of the other beaches we went to on the island. The beach is wonderful and the water is nice and blue. The pool has a great grill restaurant that is good for lunch. Reasonable prices and great food. I enjoyed the swim up bar at the pool, they make good drinks :) This resort is about a 10 min walk from other resorts and night life. If you take a taxi to these places or anywhere in Isla verde it will cost between $6-8 one way. There are a couple excellent restaurant near by. We went to the "ranch" in the el San Juan hotel which is on the 10th floor of the hotel and is completely open and overlooks the whole city....its so pretty at night to see San Juan lit up. All the waiters were dressed up like cowboys and they make the place actually look like a "ranch". The prices were actually very reasonable. They ranged from $12-22. We also went to Outback Steakhouse located in the Embassy Suits. Both of these restaurant are exactly $6.00 cab rides one way. When you get to the resort I would recommend booking the snorkeling excursion The beach they bring you to is breathtaking...the water is clearer than my swimming pool. The rainforest excursion was fun also. The tour guys is really funny and makes the excursion interesting. Overall, I had a wonderful stay. They are doing some major renovations on this hotel and its going to be 10 times bigger and better according to the model of it in the lobby. I would Def. stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong with the Courtyard!”
Reviews.Author: step
Reviews.Content: I am an avid reader of the Trip Advisor reviews when I travel. I typically read the bad reviews first to see if there is any continuity than the good to get an overall impression. I do extensive research before we stay at hotels for quality and price. The courtyard delivered both and then some. We stayed at the Courtyard in Isle Verde a day before our cruise. It is a very nice hotel, though I don't think I would spend more than a few days here due to the city around the property. Airport noise was very loud outside. I could handle it for a couple days though, I would prefer to be more removed from the hustle and bustle. An early check in went smooth. The room was a ocean front, very clean and fresh and worth the extra money for a great view. The bed was fine, not sure what why other review complained.. Bar area was festive with live band. The pool was GREAT!! very tropical. Swim up bar, quick food at restaurant outside very good. The dinner buffet was not the greatest! Go off property! We don't gamble so all casino's look the same. Beach was clean. I would stay again. Last time (2004) we stayed at El San Juan and had a great experience, though after reading many bad reviews we decided to switch. It was a good choice!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: knokkak
Reviews.Content: I have absolutely no complaints.... My daughter and I checked in with no problems, we actually were able to get into our room when we arrived at 11:00. Our room was great...CLEAN...and comfy...by the way we slept good every night. Those planes roaring overhead that I read about...never bothered us once..I cant even tell you how much they traveled over..lol The restaurants were excellent! We also ate out in town at Metropal...the food was great! The beaches were nice.....it rained the first day but after that...the sun was out, got a great tan. Let me say this...the hotel staff at the Marriot are awesome. How many times can I say the word NICE. Every person we made contact with was extremely cordial and went out there way to make our stay great. I saw many interactions with the Marriot staff and other visitors, and the staff is extremely professional and made you feel at home. I mean you could see someone that maybe works in the pool area assisting a visitor in the bar area. The service was outstounding in every area of the resort. The hotel is in great condition and the grounds are simply lovely. I would stay here again in a heartbeat! Feel free to ask questions

Reviews.Title: “Has it all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at the Courtyard and it is a reasonably priced hotel with ocean beach out the backdoor plus pools and casino on site. The newly updated decor of bed and bedding, made the room light and airy a nice improvement. The baloncy faced the beach front and was beautiful and relaxing sitting out at night. The service is excellent with personnel friendly and knowledgable about the area. Look forward to returning to the Couryard again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and reasonable”
Reviews.Author: POSITIFFANY
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott for my birthday from 5/17 to 5/21/06. The hotel is nice for the price. Our check in was a little slow but the rooms were nice. The hotel is right on the beach...please be aware that the beach is public and the water is very sandy. I did discover some beautiful and odd sea shells. However,you may want to visit another beach such as Liquillo beach to experience what a caribeean beach shoud look like. The hotel beach had sand fleas and they got us really bad. The pool area is nice and so are the beach hammocks. The hotel is close to the airport but after a couple of drinks the plane noise fades out and you get use to it. The hotel staff was helpful and accomdated us when our toliet overflowed and we had to be moved to another room. For the inconveince they sent us breakfast and a nice fruit basket. The hotel is walking distance from many resturants pharmancies and groceries stores. The bus stops right near the hotel and is only 75 cents to Old San Juan...Also do not take the tour to the Barcardi factory to get a more scenic route take the A5 bus to the last stop and walk over to pier 2 catch the ferry and then a cab to the factory...the entire trip cost us $4.75 per person one way. The hotel will try to charge you $40 for the tour so be aware. The Puerto Rican people were so friendlyand nice.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to visit Puerto Rico for our 1st year anniversary during the Memorial Day Weekend. Initially, we were booked to stay at another hotel, but when we checked in, we checked right out . We were in a bind since all the hotels were booked up for the Memorial Day Weekend Holiday. We ended up by getting one of the last few rooms at this hotel. Be advised that this hotel is directly across from the airport. You do hear planes take off but it isnt so bad if you have a room not close to the airport side of the building. We complained at the location of our room and were immediately changed and upgraded. The pool and beach are nice. They have plenty of chairs and umbrellas and a nice pool with a swim up bar but be aware that you do hear planes take off. It reminded my wife of the show 'Lost'. The rooms seems to have thick window panes which helped, and was very clean, and nice. It , had a safe, a fridge which includes 2 bottled waters which were replacaced daily, and a balcony to sit in. The housekeeping and staff were always helpful and polite. The hotel has a casino and five restaurants. There is a restaurant where you sit outside which is very good. When you check in, they give you some coupons for free drinks and a $ 25 match bet for the casino. The casino is a smaller knockoff of Vegas. The dealers were all natives and spoke more spanish than english. I noticed that if you had a good hand which you might want to hit on, they sometimes decided for you (literally moving to the next person). One of the dealers was really annoying because he wouldnt stop talking to one of the patrons. They allow you to sit even if you are not gambling. One piece of advice : The bar in the middle of the lobby had the worst customer service. They dont make drinks well, you will wait literally 10-15 minutes for a drink, and they take over an hour for an order! not to mention how expensive it is. Overall, we had a great stay, Melody at the front desk was very kind and helpful. If you are visiting Puerto Rico, try and stay close to some of the attractions -- the cab fares are expensive!

Reviews.Title: “This was a mistake”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved San Juan, Puerto Rico. The sun, the people, the laissez faire attitude and the food is all just reasons to stay. The only thing that ruined my trip was the hotel. They made us wait four hours for a room that did not have a beach view. They did not send housekeeping as daily as they should have. The toilet pressure system was low which met a plumber call at night and to top it off they tried to charge us 350 dollars for excess fees for not using items or making phone calls. The pool was cool and the service was okay but I just would not recommend staying here. Aside from that, Old San Juan is your best bet for food , fun and shopping. You should also visit Luquillo, go to the rainforest and rent bikes to ride to Pinones. Watching the sunrise is fantastic and romantic if you are with the ones you love. You should also go on the FunCat catamaran and go sailing and snorkeling. Food is great. There is a lot of restaurants that are good. Old San Juan is home to the Dragonfly, which is fantastic. Uncle Tio's was good too. Where we stayed in Isla Verde we ate at Metropol and Oyster Bar and to eat breakfast you should go to Denny's and down the street to the Ritz because this hotel sucks for that. If you are into party, we did Brava's white party on Memorial Day that was hosted by Christina Milian and Angie Martinez at the El San Juan and Two J's down the street. In Old San Juan, there is Arena, Laser and another hot hotel which is escaping me. I definitely recommend staying in Old San Juan which cuts down costs for partying and cabs. Everyone goes there anyway to eat and shop during the day and play at night. PR as a whole is hot and anyone who is anyone should be there. Just don't stay at Isla Verde.

Reviews.Title: “Below average”
Reviews.Author: MariaLaboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at that hotel by the end of April, 2006, rooms are average in apperance, ocean view if you stand in the corner of the balcony, no mini bar at the frigde in the room, just two bottles of water, I doubt they would even replaced them on a daily basis. The casino is poorly presented, no permanent personnel assigned to valet parking, then who will park your car? The service at bar/lounge area is very poor. The place, almost empty and had to wait around 10 mins. to get the waitress attention, twice. Very slow service. At the restautrant the first impression was bad. The welcome was, "we are almost closed". Thanks God, the hostess came to assit us, she was the only person professionally capable to deal with guests. NO room service!!!. Not recommended, if you have the chance to choose another hotel, please DO IT. You won't regret. It is not worth the money, even for businness travelers.

Reviews.Title: “"Loved The Courtyard"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I just got back from Puerto Rico we spent five days there and had a great time!! I read alot of reviwes before and after booking my trip and I was not sure if I had made a good choice but I must say do not go by what you read off of the internet as far as reviwes go this hotel was not bad at all. The place is great and you have to be there on the weekend and enjoy ther live bands the place gets packed great music if your not a party pooper!! Get out of the hotel enjoy what's near by there is alot to do and good places for dinner in the area that is not as expensive as the hotel. You can go to Metropool, Shotz, and the 101 Lounge good food great music and it's all in walking distance. We really enjoyed ourselves and will be returning soon this hotel is worth it the others are to pricey and over crowed. This was a great trip so do not go by what you read it is not all true belive me I know!

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of heaven”
Reviews.Author: witchcitytraveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a short cruise, followed by a stay at the Courtyard Marriott. The hotel is fantastic. The rooms are large and the hotel is very clean. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. The beach is beautiful and the pool area is very comfortable with food and drinks available. Yes, there is the airport noise, but I had so much fun with my friends (we decided on this group vacation after many years of friendship...I won't say how many!) that the noise didn't affect our enjoyment of the hotel. I really didn't notice much noise at night, but maybe that's because I slept so well in the very large and comfortable bed. The food was good, especially the buffets (breakfast and dinner) at Salsa. There are other dining choices at the hotel, but we did feel it would be nice to have one more inside restaurant. Needless to say, we were sad to leave the beauty of Puerto Rico and the comfort of the Courtyard Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Just average for us”
Reviews.Author: orr333
Reviews.Content: First of all, PR is completely overpriced. Having visited islands and resorts all over the US and Carribean, the rates for what you get in PR are outrageous. POSITIVES The check in was smooth. Proximity to SJU is good with $10 cab fares from the airport. The casino was nice and average size for Puerto Rico. Concierge was good and knowledgeable. 10 minute walk to bus in front of Denny's (route A-5 goes all the way to Old San Juan for .75 per person and is safe). Walk to L&M Car Rental and Ritz-Carlton. Another reviewer suggested this is not a resort. TRUE but the pool and beach are very nice. NEGATIVES (Hotel) The beds are like rocks. The ocean view is angled (see the photo) but OK. I think even numbered rooms would have better views than ours (odd side). No nightlife close by and hotel bar is not fun. THE AREA: Old San Juan is a cruise ship tourist trap. If you rent a car, there is nowhere to park near clubs, etc. It seems the better area for action and fun is near the Intercontinental but at their price, you may as well stay at the all-inclusive Paradisus (which we did also) and get your party for free with the resort cost. The primary excursions are the Rainforest and catamarans both of which will be 1 1/2 to 2 hours from San Juan because of traffic. Fajardo, where the ferries and catamarans leave from is a long ride away. If you are looking for good value on a nice beach, I would go elsewhere. If you are in a city with great fares to San Juan and like the convenience of not needing a passport, the area and Courtyard are just fine. Questions on the area or Courtyard, feel free to email me.

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful place in the world”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to puerto rico to spend to sometime with our family. After a relaxing time in the southern part of the island, we decide to stay a couple of days at the courtyard from march 8-13. It was priceless, the view, the ocean, the pool it coudn't have been better. The staff was great, the beach was wonderful, it was clean. The rooms were spotless, the bathroom was so clean. They would come every morning and clean everything, they would put fresh towels and a clean rug everyday. And i'm a clean freak. Not like some people have stated in this forum. The building next door is not runned down. i wish i lived on that building but anyway. From old San juan to crashboat on the west coast I guarantee you will have the best time ever. To eat try mofongos inside the sheraton hotel, metropole in isla verde, about 2 minutes from the hotel, Latin Star in Ashford ave in condado. Also if you like seafood go to the best place in the island Ladi's place located salinas, just take 52 all the way to salinas about a 40 minute ride. Ladi's place is located ocean front right on the water that view is priceless not to mention the food, I've ate in many seafood restaurants but that was the best. I invite all of you to enjoy my island, Happy travels

Reviews.Title: “Business Traveler-Yes Vacation Traveler -No No No No!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ladymax
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights the last week in March with my husband. We are in our early 30's. This was a vacation, not business travel. I read all the previous reviews on this property before choosing this hotel. The majority were glowing reviews about the hotel and how awesome the beach was. Here is our experience by topic.... The Room....we booked a ocean view room, we got a view of an EXTREMELY run down condo/apartment building next door, a view of a dumpster -but if we stood in the corner of the balcony we could see the ocean from the balcony.... My husband said that they should switch the balcony to the other window, he would rather of had a view of the planes taking off from the airport! We could not use the balcony because there were nasty people sitting in there run down apt staring at us some in their underwear ...not pleasant. The room was clean, but the bathroom had some mildew in the shower and it was very very small. At night when I turned off the light off by the bed it fell out of wall. Great first impression. Alrighty then! On to the next topic. The Beach/Pool- The main reason we chose this property was because of the GREAT reviews of the pool/beach. We are used to the beutiful white powder beaches in the Bahamas and Mexico. Here is what we saw--My husband and I walked out on to the beach our first night and when we looked to the left.... down the beach their were a string of run down condo/apt buildings lined up ..when we looked down to the right their was a small community of homeless people living in tents and huts made out of sticks and palm tree leaves right next to the Marriott property. That is all I will say on that topic. Not exactly a vacation atmosphere or paradise. I could not believe that this had not been mentioned in any previous reviews! If I would have read that I would have definitely not stayed here!!! The beach water is not calm with warm water. The sand was brown and the water was not clear or calm. The pool is not anything special. Normally we spend our days lying around the beach and pool on vacation then do a little exploring in the later afternoon. We really did not want to hang out at the beach and pool because it was not a nice environment. We both were really disappointed with that ! The staff- As mentioned before the check in was easy and the individual that checked us in was friendly. The people that are working behind the hopitality/tourism booth need some serious training. We wanted to take the bus to Old San Juan- The bus is 75 cents compared to a 20.00 taxi ride one way. We asked the girl at the travel desk if their was a bus that we could catch to Old San Juan? She told us where the bus stop was and the bus number. Well it turned out she gave us the wrong bus number. After waiting at the bus stop for 45 min for a bus # that did not exhist we gave up and walked down to the Embassy Suites. I went to the travel desk and a very nice man at their travel desk told us the correct bus #, when the bus came, and an abundance of information I did not even ask for. Kudos to the Embassy employees! The bartenders at the Marriott are rude. We sat for minutes and minutes just to be waited on when their were only 2 others at the bar. After 2 drinks they just handed us our bill, they did not even ask if we wanted another drink, it was as if they were trying to get you to leave, so they could go back to doing nothing! That happened to us 2 days in a row. 2 drinks then your bill. Food- We did not eat at any of the Marriott restaurants. We went to the Embassy Suites and ate at the OutBack Steak house. We also went to a nice casual sports bar/grill- (I highly recommend) called Lupis. Very affordable beer/food. A full bottle of beer is 2.75 to 3.75 depending on what you drink. At the Marriott a small glass of draft house brand is $4.00 and a 10 oz can at the beach is 5.00. Rip Off!!!! If you are traveling to this area and you are on business or need a place to stay before a cruise, then I would say stay here. If you are a vacation traveler and this is your only destination....do not stay here! My husband and I ventured to other properties and the Intercontinental definitely has a tropical / resort atmosphere. The Embassy Suites is nice and the people working there are very friendly but this property has more of a business atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but don't have too high expectations”
Reviews.Author: Dave7702
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four days and three nights at this hotel (Mar 23-26, 2006). This hotel is good as long as you know what it does and does not offer. Probably the reason why it is slightly less expensive than the other hotels in the area. We kept on being told that the hotel was booked solid and as a result we had to wait for the 3:00PM check in time to get to our rooms. Hotel seemed a bit quiet though and that may be because by the end of march, it is nearing the end of the vacation season. The room itself was great. Big, with a couch, separate chair, normal hotel fridge, DVD player and balcony with plastic table and chairs. The room looked pretty new and the bathroom worked out well. The DVD player is free to use but if you don't bring your own, they advertise a DVD rental machine in the lobby. Also, we had an "oceanview" room, but it really was a side room with a balcony on an angle so you saw about half the water. We didn't care either way, but just wanted to make that clear. The one constant every review talks about is the noise. This hotel is VERY close to the airport and you WILL hear the jets as they take off either in your room or on the beach. By the weekend, though, there seemed to be less planes or maybe we just got used to it. The beach and pool were both great, and well cared for. No problems at all with getting towels, etc. The beach is technically public but no problems. Everyone was just having a great time. (The beach by the Ritz about 500 yards down the beach actually was mobbed and had a lot of seaweed.) The bar is good by the pool but the food options are limited and like every hotel in the caribbean, overpriced. We rarely ate at the hotel. The buffet always seemed expensive and nothing special. We did enjoy the ice cream/coffee bar they have open almost all day and night. The unique thing that this hotel has is an outside restaurant right by the beach. It is only open for dinner. We didn't get to try it and that is one regret. Picante's the main bar/dance floor is pretty quiet during the week, but come Friday and Saturday nights is packed! But not with people from the hotel, mainly local residents who salsa anywhere they find some floor. The bands were awesome and the energy that Puetro Rico is known for was definitely there. The place was still going strong well after 2am. Taxis to Old San Juan are $19 one way and this hotel is the farthest resort from Old San Juan (the positive is the beach is probably the best). There are few places to eat in the area. We ate at Lupi's. You can also try the Intercontinental or El San Juan Hotel, all about a 15 minute walk. In the end, have dinner in Old San Juan. (Marakias and the El Convento hotel are 2 suggestions). Overall a good time, but realize what you are getting. This is NOT an all-inclusive resort. It is relaxing during the day but not someplace to have that much fun at night. Better for maybe slightly older couples or people who just want to rest and relax on their vacation. P.S. If you go, you MUST try the hammocks by the beach...could have spent days in them....

Reviews.Title: “Could Have Been Better”
Reviews.Author: patches762
Reviews.Content: Alright. 3 friends and I headed out to the Courtyard Marriott for a week during our college Spring Break. My friend's dad had Marriott points and she didnt have any problem using them. Being college students, it's not hard to impress us, so we loved our room and our balcony that over looked the ocean. Our room was very standard--2 queen beds, a tv (it did have a DVD player you could use for free, so bring DVDs!)and a TINY mini fridge that fit about 4 small water bottles. So it was really hard keeping perishables from the grocery store bc we needed food for the week since we had little moeny (I suggest you bring a collapsable cooler, I had one and it was awesome). Yes, the airport and hotel is literally separated by trees, so when the planes took off it was so loud you couldnt even hear someone talk to you. Didnt really bother us tho. THE GOOD: The beach was AMAZING. Gorgeous beach, gorgeous water, great pool, awesome hammocks. The pool guys and guys who bring out the chairs were all really nice and accomodating. We spent hours a day outside at the beach (wear LOTs of sunscreen---it gets HOT). The concierge was helpful with places to eat and things to do. We scheduled a trip to the rainforest through the hotel ($40 for a 1/2 day) and it was awesome. EAT AT METROPOL!!! Its right across from the Ritz Carlton, and has fantastic cuban-puerto rican food (plus, we could afford it). Hotel also has a really cool casino. Lost $10 there, tho :( THE BAD: I wouldnt eat at the hotel restuarant. They wanted $21.95 for the dinner buffet, which looked really crappy, and when me and my friends would go eat and split our meals amongst ourselves (bc we're poor) the waitresses were ----- and one time even "accindentally" charged us extra on our check. All in all, we only stayed here bc it was basically free for us. I wouldnt really recommend it for families if they had a choice, it was full of business people. If you're going to San Juan either way, you HAVE to do 3 things: Visit Old San Juan, go to the rainforest, and go snorkeling. We went snorkeling with the Salty Dog catamaran (----) and had THE time of our lives ($74 a person, including round trip taxi). The crew was awesome, accomodating, and so much fun :) Anywho, good luck. If you have any questions feel free to email me. San Juan is a lotta fun :)

Reviews.Title: “Stay at another hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a resort hotel. It is only located in the resort area. If there is another hotel available -- take it. If other hotels have no vacancy ... either change your travel dates or stay at home. This hotel is completely mis-represented starting from the hotel description to the location. It offers nothing (no shopping, no spas, no salons. It has a daily buffet section that serves as fuel for breakfast and dinner. The same 2 style scrambleld "eggs" are presented in steam tables. The so called sausage is mushy and steam cooked served on bread to soak up the grease. The bacon is a lard melt in your mouth. The only good thing at the buffet was the fried potatoes, but $12.95 for potatoes? The room: The advertised panoramic view is very deceiving. Two people cannot move about freely. We had to move the furniture in order to get to the sliding glass doors onto the roof top. Two glass doors are needed to mask the constant jet sounds from the airport runway which is about 300 yds. from the hotel. We paid extra for Oceanview. What view? You can see the ocean, but you have to look over the many noisy air-handlers on the hotel roof. We were on the 5th floor, which sat 2 floors above the roof. We're sure glad we paid extra for that oveanview. We sat on the patio the first morning,but couldn't have a conversation because of all the noise. When we asked Management the first three days of our stay for a room change they said there was nothing better. The room itself is in dire need of updating and repair ... although they advertise that it is "newly renovated". The bathroom floor tile was disgusting. We felt we had to lay towels down to walk. The shower rod was barely secured to the tile. The shower curtain didn't extend full length to catch the shower water. (That explains why they slanted the tile floor),and the bathroom door couldn't stay open. The concierge (when not out to lunch) couldn't remember which Hotels had Restaurants, but was quick to offer the Marriott buffet as substitute dining. It took her 3 days to attempt to arrange a golf tee time. She said she couldn't get through, but when we called the Golf course @$3.60 phone charges - we had no trouble getting through. As you can see we have nothing good to say about this place. This is literally the worst accommodation I have ever had to pay for. They even charged a daily $15.00 parking fee to park our rental car in their garage -- along with a surprise daily $26.00 resort fee. I would not recommend this facility. At $260.00 per day plus the daily $31.46 government tax and daily $26.00 resort fee totalling $317.46 per day - the Holiday Inn would have been a better value.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelbug73
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a brief stay at the Courtyard by Marriott Isla Verde Beach and Resort and we were definitely impressed with this resort. It was full of life at all hours of the day, the staff was nothing but accomodating always, the rooms were clean and as Platinum members with small children, we were upgraded to a one bedroom suite with a full size refrigerator, microwave, and sink. It was ideal for us..and MUCH APPRECIATED. The beach was nice and clean, the waves were rough but the red flag was up and everyone was adequately warned (unlike other places that I learned the hard way). We loved our stay here. We were certainly leery of staying at a Courtyard and had heard that the beaches were not so good in Puerto Rico, but we were pleasantly surprised with both. We will be returning to both!

Reviews.Title: “Average place, great beach, mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rooms: The standard rooms overlook the parking lot and the highway. The ocean view rooms overlook the hotel roof and the lovely beach. The deluxe ocean view rooms look straight out onto the beach and the water. Beds are clean and comfortable. The bathroom is clean and serviced daily. The king-bed room we booked was not available when we arrived so we had to settle for 2 queen beds. Pool: Good with a nice amount of sun and shade. There is a jacuzzi and a kids pool so everyone is satisfied. Otherwise an uninteruppted mass of concrete sprinkled with palm trees. Beach: Wonderful beach with warm water and calm seas. The gent who erects the umbrellas/sunshades is very helpful and a hard worker. Service from the bar is spotty and slow. Casino: The casino is primarily slot machines with a few roulette, blackjack and craps tables. The crowd is definitely local/retiree but the minimum bets are lower than some of the nearby casinos. Service: Concierge is literally 'out to lunch' for most of the day. Service at other times is pretty suspect. Front desk will not honor late checkout requests; claiming the hotel is totally booked. Dining: Breakfast is pretty poor buffet style. Bar entertainment is great and drinks are strong. Outdoor/pool bar is good, but not great. Location: Isla Verde is a nice beach location and there are some restaurants and other hotels in the area. The Marriot is directly across the street from the airport takeoff/landing strip so plane noise is very noticeable throughout the day. The frequency of arrivals and departures dwindles to almost zero after 9PM. Summary: If one doesn't mind the certain inconveniences, airplane noise, and minimal amount of posh available at the Marriott, then I'd say it's a good value for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marriott - with a few glitches”
Reviews.Author: ckrobynToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott for several nights pre-cruise, January 25-29/2006. I had read all the reviews of the property prior to booking it and was willing to take the chance regarding airplane noise. I had booked this hotel several months before our stay, 2 nights were to be on Marriott rewards points, and we were paying for 2 nights at a rate of $199USD for an ocean front room. Due to our flight being delayed out of Miami, I called the hotel to tell them we would not be arriving until after midnight...they assured me this would not be an issue since I had guaranteed my reservation with Visa and the fact I was a Marriott Elite Member. Much to our shock we arrived at the hotel shortly after midnight to find the hotel completely sold out - there were NO rooms available....not even the one's that were confirmed for us! Lucky for me, because of my Marriott Elite status, they paid for us to stay the night at the Intercontinental - including taxi fare there and back. The Manager at the Marriott was highly apologetic - we were furious. The next morning we arrived back at the Marriott to find that we had been upgraded to Ocean Front Suites! The Manager made sure to find us and invite our whole party to a complimentary dinner. The suites were wonderful - they were very large with spectacular ocean views. The suites were very clean and in excellent condition, there were no issues with our accommodations whatsoever. The property itself is indeed located very close to the airport although we heard NO airplane noise at night at all. True, you could hear the planes taking off during the day - but honestly, it was not offensive in the least. Do NOT let this detail deter you from booking this hotel, it truly is a non-issue. The beach is lovely, and the pool area very spacious and clean with a swim up bar. There were wait staff available at the pool area to take your order for drinks as well as a beachfront grill that served hamburgers, hot dogs, nachos etc. The restaurant food was very good - we ate there twice and enjoyed the buffet for dinner. Breakfast was also good and I found the price $12.95 to be very reasonable for the vast selection and custom omelettes. The cafe in the lobby area (Bananna) served delicious snacks and the pizza was outstanding. As well, try the milkshakes - we really liked them! Yes, the lobby is a bit on the busy side with the bar located smack dab in the middle of it, but we found this exciting rather than annoying. The casino was a good size for a hotel casino and we managed to make a few dollars at the slots. I would totally recommend this hotel to anyone that is travelling to San Juan. The staff were very friendly and more than willing to accommodate. Considering what we went through that first night - hats off to the Management for promptly fixing it. I now know why I continually choose Marriott - excellent customer service. Enjoy the Courtyard Isle Verde! Please feel free to email me with any specific questions you may have.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Isla Verde”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard Feb. 2-5 2006. I thought the facilities were fine. The pool and beach area were very nice. Room was clean and comfortable. Service was fine. Casino is small, but dealers were friendly. We avoided Picante Bar in the evening, as I don't really like loud salsa music. If you do, it looked like it would be a lot of fun. The only issue is that you can DEFINITELY hear the airplanes taking off from the airport. It's right across the street, and the hotel seems to be positioned right about where planes typically start lifting into the air. We stayed in room 903 (which faces northwest, away from the airport), and we still heard planes. We were woken up by the Continental flight that leaves at about 4AM on one of our three nights. If you're a light sleeper, this could be a real problem for you.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Vacation Value”
Reviews.Author: michman
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant stay at the Courtyard Isla Verde Beach Resort. I was a guest of the hotel for a week. I arrived late on a Sunday night and before I entered the hotel lobby, I could hear the salsa music. The hotel desk clerk, "Helen" was very nice and made me feel comfortable. Check-in was quick and easy. I then went to my room located on the eleventh floor and was very impressed when I entered the room. It was just like the pictures I had seen on the web concerning the hotel. After I had unpacked, I went back to the lobby to partake in the festivaties. The casino was small and most of the locals were playing the penny and nickel slots. The card games seemed to be quite busy as well. There was hardly anyone playing the quarter and dollar slots. So, during my stay I would drop maybe up to twenty dollars from time to time in the casino. I believed I broke even. Back to the Picante lobby bar, just as it has been previously written, on the weekends, its very crowded. The patrons are practically dancing everywhere, even the hallways of the lobby. I observed that the majority of the patrons were in their 30's although the would be a pack of twenty somethings. Unless you were sitting at a table it was hard to get a drink because the waitresses and bartenders are very busy doing their jobs. Also, you could hear the weekend music while riding the elevators even up to the eleventh floor! When I checked into the hotel I was given tickets to the breakfast buffet at the Salsa, which was a real value and I suggect to anyone to include this in their package. There was some complainants I heard such as the food was cold and they weren't given enough tickets for their package, I found the servers to be exceptionally pleasant and in fact, made my stay at the hotel. One morning it was very busy and I was waiting outside the buffet area for a table to be cleaned. One of the servers recognized me and immediately cleared a table for me. I did not eat at the dinner buffet which I thought like others that it was too expensive ($21.95). However, after eating or dining out in town, I spent at least the same amount of money so I would suggest to try the dinner buffet at least once, it includes everything. The Banana Ice and Sandwich Lobby Snack Shop seemed to be alittle expensive. The cheapest sandwich, ham and cheese, cost about $7.00. I did have a pistrami sandwich for about $10.00 and it was good. The kids seemed to like the idea that they could climb up on the bar stools and order a soda or ice cream :-) Now back to my room, yes you can hear the jets land and takeoff! The hotel is practically on the airfield. But I'm a former student pilot so this was a great motivator for me and I will be persuing the matter at a later time. Depending upon the size of the jet, the pictures on the wall would shake. I thought that this was funny just like watching movies where the hotel or motel in near the railroad tracks everything would shake. At night the noise did tape off so I would leave my balcony doors open to hear the ocean waves hit the beach. I had a very pleasant time at the hotel and stayed at the hotel the majority of the time. The hotel guest were a variety of people, families, honeymooners, businessmen, and those pre-cruisers. I don't have any complaints except, CHECK YOUR RECIEPT upon checking out. My stay was through my time-share which meant I had to pay for the government and resort fees. One guest of the hotel was not aware of these fees and was highly upset. The hotel desk clerk was very professional in explaining the taxes to the guest who threatened that no one from the stated would want to stay at the hotel. My lesson came after I got home and reviewed the bill. I learned that my room was charged the self-parking four times at $15.00 each ($60.00). I did not park any vehicle on hotel property and when I did rent a car, it was returned that night to the car rental agency. I blame myself for not checking the bill so please check all receipts. I think that this was an honest mistake but still I can't see how the hotel charged my room and not check with the occupant of the room if someone had given my room number. So the bottom line for me is that I will stay at the hotel again and the next time I will have my son with me :-) I just hope that with expansion plans for the hotel, it will not be overly crowded and lose its present ambience. Furthermore, someone stated in this form that the pool was dirty. Everyday, I observed the hotel employees working their a-- off keeping the place clean and tidy. They all wore name tags and appeared to be proud of their job.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Courtyard - nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Courtyard, Isla Verde on 1/14/06 before a cruise and had a good stay. The rooms are comfortable, clean and modern. The main lobby is beautiful but a little noisy as there is a nightclub there, but we could not hear any noise from the music on the 8th floor. The beach and pool looked very nice(we didn'y use either). The only problem for some people would be that the hotel is located next to a runway at the airport. Although you can't see the runway, you can occasionally get a whif of jet fuel fumes while outside and the noise is very loud outside. Although I didn't hear any jets after 11:00 PM in my room, I did hear them at 7:00 AM and a little on the muffled loud side while sleeping. But still had a good night's sleep. We didn't eat there as there are some great restaurants a couple of blocks away. Overall, a very satisfying stay.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Courtyard by Marriot”
Reviews.Author: cjd
Reviews.Content: We went to San Juan over New Years and had a great time. The Marriot put on a great party and gave away hats and noise makers and champagne at midnight. The rooms had a great view of the ocean and had nice amenities. It was away from town but in a major tourist area. The casino was small and friendly. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “it is an oK hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found my stay to be OK. The reason for this is that I asked for a beach front and realized that most of the rooms faces sideways so what I got for a beach front was part of the hotel's roof top and side view of the beach. Be alert in using their sheets and towels. Check it before you use it. Personally, I found some stains on the towels from prior users as well as pubic hair on the sheets. Soon after I brought it to the attention of the staff in charge, they immediately exchanged them to clean ones. However, I was disappointed that their sheets and towels did not have a cleaning smell to them. Aside from these pointers, everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “Overnights OK”
Reviews.Author: stephen_phillips
Reviews.Content: This is just not my type of Hotel. Although, its a great place to overnight if you are coming or going from somewhere else. Its incredibly close to Pinos which has great little stands selling all sorts of food and a sweet beach with a promenade. Isla Verde is close and walkable also. I was not impressed with breakfast. We paid $350.00 to stay one night in this hotel and they should have a sitdown breakfast area with wait people outside on the terrace. I did not want to be grazing at a potato bar all-u-can-eat style. The room was great and we had a beach front with wonderful views. The airport is spitting distance and it was fun watching the planes take off. The Pool is very large and there are 2 bars out there and lots of sitting areas. I could have done without the Karaoke, Though!

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard by Marriott is the best choice and nicest beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Puerto Rico on New Years Eve and so glad we stayed at the Courtyard by Marriott on Isla Verde Beach. This is the best each of all. We took a cab to visit the other hotels and beaches to compare. This beach is so spacious, clean, and room for all the lounge chairs. Some of the other beaches had lounge chairs inches from each other. We had lots of space inbetween. The first night we had an unpleasant odor in our bathroom. I complained the next morning and they immediately changed our room to a room with the two beds we needed and a better view. The front desk trainee, Ana was great. She was very courteous and willing to make us happy. Everynight we walked to the other hotels down the street. There are lots of people walking and we felt safe. The El San Juan Hotel and Casino, down the street, was fun to visit for drinks and snacks. They have a great restaurant inside that serves salads, pizza and all kinds of food. They stay open until 2:00am. The pizza was delicious. The Courtyard by Marriott pool bar stays open later, so you can sit outside by the pool and listen to the waves wash up on the beach. They have an express breakfast for those that get up early. For $4.95 you can get a cup of coffee, a muffin and orange juice. We also tried the breakfast buffet for $12.95. There is an ice cream bar that serves all kinds of food. We had a great time and will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for an overnight stay.”
Reviews.Author: Gordy2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this Hotel prior to embarking on a cruise. On arrival, we were greeted by a very friendly receptionist with a lovely smile.I asked if it was possible to have a quiet room with a sea view, and was told it was no problem. Our room overlooked the beach and had a great view.We did not have dinner in the Hotel due to tiredness after a long journey, however breakfast was more that adequate with plenty of choices. I would stay in this Hotel again, however it is some distance from any shops etc, and the aircraft noise could be troublesome to people not fortunate enough to stay on the quiet side of the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.. one small problem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful, right on the beach with a casino and salsa band at night. The bar in the pool is fun too, but THE BED BUGS ATE ME ALIVE!!! I must have had over 50 bites, and it was the ichiest thing I have ever had! The 4 days of discomfort were notwirth the three of enjoyment!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great hotel, great time!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. They made us feel really comfortable. Jose L. at the lobby suggested really good restaurants, clubs, lounges, etc., and he provided us with directions on how to get everywhere. We asked for an even number room and he gave us a wonderful pool and beach view room. The room was very spacious and a nice size bathroom. The hotel was really clean, the pool area was very nice. The beach was a few steps away from the pool area. The hotel is at a great location; less than 5 minutes from the airport, about 15 minutes from the Old San Juan and walking distance to other hotels and clubs. We had a busy schedule for the weekend, but we liked the hotel so much that instead we decided to just hang out by the pool and beach. We loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean Hotel....”
Reviews.Author: SDOTBARBIE
Reviews.Content: I wasn't really expecting much, based on the reviews that I've read. This hotel was clean and very nice. Our room(ask for an even # room and higher floor...they face the beach) had a great view and we couldn't even hear the airplanes...My boyfriend and I had a great time there....The only problem was on Sat. when it seemed like the Hotel catered more to the locals than the guests...no beach towels and a VERY crowded pool area. The city itself is not as lively as I thought it would be, but walk(instead of the $10 cab ride) up the block and you'll be in the middle of everything. METROPOL has to be the best restaurant on the island, Mi casita is ok...but not the best...Overall this hotel was pretty good...the staff was more than willing to help and by the time we came back to our rooms they were clean with all of our belongings still there...Thanks Courtyard...

Reviews.Title: “Totally disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ZZia
Reviews.Content: Hotel and beach were extremely disappointing. As one local said, if you've never seen a beach before, this might be nice, but otherwise don't bother, lots of seaweed and a rotting smell. We had a partial oceanview, which actually meant that we looked directly into the windows of a run-down highrise apartment complex with a glimpse of the beach. Being frequent travellers around the world, we chose a Marriott since we expected at least a basic level of comfort, this did not meet expectations at all. Our room smelled horrid, the bed, furniture and carpet were all damp and clammy and the spare pillows had a foul smell. there are no screens on the door so don't plan on enjoying any ocean breezes. No restaurants worth visiting in the area, just one over-priced place that the hotel recommended. If you have a car, drive 5 minutes east to the Pinones, lots of friendly shacks with good local food for great prices. Bus (a few blocks away) got us to Old San Juan for 25cents, which is much cheaper than a taxi. Hotel tours were incredibly over-priced compared to renting a car, roads are in very good condition with American signage, and the hotel tour is really only transport since all tourist sites are well marked. Had to walk through both restaurants to get to the pool or beach from the elevator, past all the business men in their suits and meeting rooms, guess that was good for the business men.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jbwise316
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just recently returned from a stay at the Courtyard Marriott. We stayed for four nights and five days. Our overall experience at the hotel was very good. I really only have two complaints about the hotel. The first day we arrived at the hotel, the pool area was swarmed by locals. This was a Monday, I believe it was some sort of holiday. All the pools were so packed there was no room for anybody elsa to get in. Although, that really was not a problem for us because we just walked down to the ocean. There was hardly anybody at the beach. It just made us feel a little uncomfortable. This problem only occured the first day, the rest of the time was great. The second complaint I had about the hotel is I believe the cleaning lady stole some of my colonga. I usually keep a bottle in my travel bag just for traveling. I don't use it that much, so I know it was just about full. I came back one day and the bottle was empty. If that is the only thing she stole from me, I am happy. Overall the hotel was great. The staff was very helpful and accessable. I really got the feeling the hotel was trying do everything they could to make every guess have an enjoyable experience. I really liked seeing the management of the hotel in the presents of the guesses overseeing the operations of the hotel. The rooms were pretty nice. They have just been recently updated. They had a very modern feel. The oceanveiw rooms are nice. They have a balconie with two chairs and a table. Our view was a partial view of the beach and more of a view of the apartment building next door. My advice is to make sure you get an even numbered room. The even numbered rooms get a full view of the pool and beach. The property ammenities were very nice. The lobby featured a bar, ice cream parolor, restaurant, and casino. The bar was very nice and seemed to be very crowded everynight. The ice cream parolor was very good. They offered sandwiches and ice cream desserts. The casino was pretty cool. They had a ton of slot machines and the regular tables for roullette, black jack and poker. I think the selling point of the hotel is the pool area. The landscaping features a ton of palm trees around the pool with other tropical plants. The pool also has a swim up bar that is a lot of fun to sit there and drink pina colodas and listen to Bob Marley. I really enjoyed the fact that you could just walk straight out from the pool and jump into the ocean. I have read other reviews about the airplanes taking off. They are right the planes are loud. The hotel is litterly right across the street from the main runway. It really did not bother my wife and I. Every once in a while you can here them in your room. The concierge was very helpful. We ventured off from the hotel on two day trips. The first was to Old San Juan. It is a $16 cab ride. The concierge hooked us up with a map and circled places to see. We went to the forts and shopped the historic streets of Old San Juan. The other day trip we went on was a snorkling adventure. Although we did not book that through the concierge because it was already full. I believe this was due to poor weather the day before. We went through a company called EastWind. It was a great trip. We went to the island of Calabere. A minimal populated island off the east coast of Puerto Rico. It had beautiful coral reefs and beachs. Some of the best in the world. Overall it was a great vacation. The Courtyard Marriott rooms were considerably cheaper than most of the hotels in the Isla Verde area. They offered just about the same ammenities that the high dollar hotels do. I was very satisfied with my stay and would recommend it to somebody elsa. A precaution, be prepared to pay double and tripple for food and beverages at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: CandidAdvisor
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in this hotel. The filthiest bathroom I've ever stayed in, absolutely disgusting!! The pool was full of bugs and debris with a strange froth on the surface. The engineers who designed and built this hotel are to be commended, as the noise from planes taking off is barely noticable.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but expected better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed here recently to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We were disappointed at the escalated pricing in the hotel's restaurants ($10 for a sandwich??), and the "ocean view" was more of a view of the apartment building next door than the ocean (although you could see a corner of the ocean between the buildings....). The maid service was great, however. They left any personal belongings in their place, folded clothing they found on the beds, and straightened toiletries on the counter in the bathroom. Very unexpected, but appreciated. The location throws you a little. You will need to walk quite a bit to get to the local restaurants or the grocery store (the fresh food market carries great prices on rum, by the way), and what they consider "next door" (such as the Ritz Carlton) are still at least a 10 minute walk. If you don't mind being on your feet, this is ok. We still would have appreciated better prices within the hotel. The pool was also a disappointment. The main pool does not seem to circulate well, and carries a host of bugs and critters floating on the top. We spent any time in the pool in the "kiddie pool" since it was better circulated. We highly suggest going to another hotel to find cheaper tourist pricing on tours to El Yunque or the bioluminscent bay. Hampton Inn has decent prices and is another short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business trips”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard for a week in June on business. Isla Verde is great, but this hotel is somewhat removed from the main area (about one mile). The rooms were very clean, internet service is free and the view from the room was terrific. Stay away from the buffet, the food is not good quality for $22. For $150 per night I think the place is great and I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from San Juan. Rooms The rooms were clean and internet service is free. There is free wireless service in the lobby. The first room they gave us was on the 3rd floor facing a dumpster. The a/c was very noisy. We asked for a better view. We were visiting SJ on business & staying for a week. It took three days & many requests before we were moved to the eight floor. We asked for a room facing the water, they said yes and they would get back to us. After several more requests, a receptionist finally told us that the rooms facing the water were $300+/night and we would have to pay the difference. We had three restless nights, for two nights the next room housed kids that screamed all night, the next night housed a girls party. Beach The beach is great. Clean. The water is absolutely fabulous. They do take the chairs back at 5:00. There are only 4 umbrellas available. On Mon-Thu they charge $6/chair and $9/umbrellas, free on the weekends - but the weekends are really busy. Pool Yes, the pool is dirty. Everytime you move your hand, hair gets trapped in your fingers. The workers at the pool sit around, blabbers on the phone and don't bother to clean. Towels are free. Once a day, a waiter/ress will come around & ask if you would like something from the bar. Don't hold your breath. ** I noticed that a lot of the locals or people who work at the hotel use the pool. Two fellows came out of the pool with their walking shorts & leather belt on. Food You don't get much for breakfast at $12.95. Buffet style. I had the fruit one morning, did not feel well for the rest of the day. We had dinner at the restaurant one night. Very average. The Banana counter sell sandwiches ($10) and ice-cream. We walked along the strip. Lupi's is burritos & tacos, Metropol & Mi Casita are Puerto Rican fare (very avg food), about $10/plate. Lobby Musicians practically every night. I love the way everyone gets up and dances. Overall This is the Courtyard & not the Marriott. Average price & I suppose they offer great package deals. The hotel courts a lot of rambuncous folks. A lot of locals come for a day or two. During the weekday, there are a lot of business people. I saw a lot of managers walking around looking important, but no work was delegated. The hotel is a "Courtyard Marriott" and the Marriott. The Ritz is 3 buildings over. The airport is practically across the highway. The planes make a tremendous amount of noise. You dont hear it at night because the a/c rumbles all the time. Conclusion Next time, I would spend a few more dollars and stay at the Ritz or the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: aphroduckie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during Spring Break 05. In general the staff was very accomodating and friendly. The lobby was very small, breakfast is NOT included in the price and was very expensive for just a regular buffet ($12.95 pp) I never once saw the pool being cleaned or maintained. It was extremely dirty with leaves, bugs, hair etc. The jacuzzi was wonderful. Beach chairs being returned for lock up at 4:30 was ridiculous. I paid so much money to stay there and you're going to tell me when to get off my chair. Very disappointing. The tours I recommend were El Yunque rainforest, book it thru the lobby, with Debbie as your guide, she was amazing and the price WELL worth it, and snorkeling with Spread Eagle II. You can book it online at their website. El Metropol is near the hotel and the food was really good and reasonable. But I do agree, with another poster, my next trip will be Mexico!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard Marriott was a very nice hotel. Very friendly and accomodating staff. The room was comfortable and clean. What I did not like about this hotel was that by 4:30 - 5:00pm you had to give up your beach lounge chair because the staff wanted to stack and lock them up for the night. I feel that this should be done much later like 7:00pm. Getting us up while we were relaxing was very annoying. The pool on some days did not look clean and of course everyone else's complaint -- the plane noise which was only loud when bigger planes were taking off on the runway. I never heard the planes at night and I slept like a baby! I would recommend this hotel because overall it was a pleasurable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
