Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were great and made good recommendations of places to eat and see outside of the hotel rooms were clean and comfortable. Pool area and beach were nice. Only complaint is for just a few dollars more could have stayed at a major resort.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in the world ”
Reviews.Author: gaika66
Reviews.Content: This is the WORST hotel i have stayed in.... Forget the fact that the food is unbearable and the prices are unreasonable... there is NOTHING to do ... we are in our twenties and thought we would go to PR and have a wild spring break.. guess what... we had a horrible time... there are no good clubs, no entertainment in the hotel and worst of all the PLANES... the airport runway is literally across the street from the hotel therefore every five minutes a plane takes off (hard to sleep in the morning)... also make sure to never ask for extra anything in your drink because they will charge you a leg and hand... should 2 pina coladas really cost 28 bucks because i asked for some extra rum.. all in all... PR stinks and the hotel ---.... word of advice... MEXICOOOO

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cleveland926
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in March 2005 for two nights. We had a room with a great ocean view. The Staff was friendly and accommodated all of our requests. It has a good location on the beach and was within walking distance of many stores and restaurants. The only drawback was it is located across the highway from the airport runway and you can hear the planes taking off and landing all day long but it wasn't loud enough to disrupt your sleep as long as you kept the double sliding doors of your balcony closed. I was satisfied and would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great area of SJ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First trip to PR for sis and I and am very pleased. The beach was great - blue-green water just right, waves calm on most days. One day they were stronger, but fun. Sunny all week. Beach was never crowded. Families enjoyed themselves. Front desk and restaurant staff were very friendly & welcoming. Live salsa band every night. Had a standard room with awesome views of ocean and east and west of Isla Verde. High rise hotels scattered the view to the west but to the east, no tall buildings. Refreshing to have that open view. Very convenient to LMM airport, and yes- heard maybe 2 planes during the day, but not annoying at all. No plane noise at night. Room was clean, bed was fine. Unless you're very, very high maintenance and need a lot of pampering, you'll like this place. Lobby is spacious, clean and attractive. Casino was fine - not a big gambler, but did some slots - why not? Some big hotels have that stiff, always look presentable feeling - this one has a nice, relaxed ambiance - come in from the beach get an ice cream from Banana (snack shop in lobby) feeling. Hotel was never crowded during the day - ie, in the lobby, elevators, beach, around the pool. The abudance of personal space and elbow room - well who doesn't appreciate that? More ppl toward the weekend. Easily drive or take cab to sightsee in Old SJ; walk up the Avenue in Isla Verde for more restaurants, shops, etc. Ate at Platos (up the street 5-10 mins. walk)-average food, over-priced. El Yunque was okay. Liked Isla Verde beach better than Loquillo beach.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have family in PR and did not get to see them all on a trip last year, so I convinced my wife to go back at the end of Feb. Last year, we stayed at the Ritz while in SJ area. The Ritz is, well, the Ritz. Fantastic place. This place is kinda Ritz lite. It is located about three properties down the same beach. The Courtyard has everything you need. Food is excellent if you are staying on the weekends. We arrived on a Sat. after 9 pm and ate at the poolside restaurant at a table right on the beach. My wife had seafood and I had steak and they were both close to perfect. This food service is only available on weekends, though. During the week, the lobby restaurant serves an above average meal, but going into Old SJ for a real good one is better. I ate at my Aunt's table, which was best of all. The Courtyard has a decent but very busy bar area and a small but not crowded casino. My wife and I were able to walk on the beach at night, while last yr the Ritz closed off beach access after dark. The staff was helpful and pleasant and the grounds very well kept. Overall, this is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Just plain ok”
Reviews.Author: blrod
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival at the Courtyard, everything seemed nice. We were there for 4 days/3 nights (Monday - Thursday). My husband and I decided to hit the beach and the pool immediately after checking in. The waves were very rough. However, both the pool and the beach were very clean. We had breakfast and dinner at the hotel on our second night. TWO THUMBS DOWN! For those of us that know what real, good latin food is, the food at the Courtyard was anything but. Extremely overpriced and poor selections. For a delicious and economical lunch (or dinner), we recommend El Metropol - which is about an 8 minute walk from the hotel. The staff in the Lobby can direct you towards the restaurant. Great, great food and reasonably priced. The view from our hotel room (Duplex Ocean Front view) was awsome (pictures attached). That's about it. Nothing spectacular about the room, other than the view. The room was very clean all around. The hospitality and courtesy of the staff was way beyond expected. They were phenomenal and this is what made our stay worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: SunnyNJ
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 nights at the Marriott and I have no complaints. The rooms were nice and clean and we had ample space for three people. The pool was great and kept clean all day. I can't really think of anything bad to say, everyone that worked there was very friendly and accomodating. I thought the hotel was a good value and would definitely go back. Don't be turned off by negative reviews for this hotel-some people are just very hard to please.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place. Few Ups, Couple of Downs”
Reviews.Author: janinelouie
Reviews.Content: Spent last 6 nights at the Courtyard Marriot in Isle Verde. I'd give this hotel an 8 and mostly because of the pool and lobby area. I will say the pool is very very nice. Large, lot's of chairs, clean refreshing water. If you don't require lots of assistance this place is great. I felt that the staff was a little slow. Mostly when it came to food service.Sometimes they didn't even acknowledge your standing there waiting. Since I didn't really care much about that I was fine with it. My son loved the pool with the little slide. Also loved the beach. The lobby was so nice. Big and clean. There was a nice band playing at night with a nice bar area with small tables. It did not feel crowded at all and the hotel was at capacity when I was there due to Feb vacation. I didn't think I was going to be happy with the beach because my view of it which was ocean front was an area of the beach that was quite murky with black ocean matter at the shore. However, the beach area that is directly in front of the pool and used by hotel guests was clean and not murky at all. I suppose my view was of an area that was inbetween hotels. The water was a little rough but not so much so that my son couldn't place at the shore and get in a little bit. The sun certainly helps the beach. When it is out the water is a pretty green color. It doesn't look as pretty when the clouds are out which they were for two days. The salsa restaurant that had the buffet for breakfast and dinner was nice. I like the selections of food for dinner. It was all fresh and very good. Children under 12 ate free with a paying adult which was great.They also had a ala carte menu that was fine for dinner. Nothing elaborate but okay. Breakfast was just ordinary but fine. Even an omelette area. It was free with my room so definetly make sure that is included in the price. We did get take out from this restaurant to bring up to the room one night and the chicken was raw. GROSS That was not so nice. They were not very apologetic about it so that kind of turned me off. The rooms are just okay. I would say over all that was the biggest downfall of the hotel. We had deluxe ocean view and deluxe ocean front which was a jr suite. I needed more space so paid 290 for the jr suite which was just a regular room with a little more sq footage and a microwave and mini sink. I like to have a nice room and this was not so nice. It was clean though. Towels were fluffy. Bed was just okay and nothing else. They did have complimentary internet access that was good. There are major taxes added to the rooms. Resort tax and PR tax etc. It added up to about 45 dollars on top of your rate so consider this when booking. We gambled in the casino one night and it was fun. There was a five dollar blackjack table on a Saturday night tha I stayed at for 4 hours. The dealers and host were very friendly. The area around the hotel up and down the street is okay. NOt so great walking at night but stay in groups and you will be fine. I heard the planes in the day but not at night. Had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “If you want an absolutely beautiful pool area stay here..”
Reviews.Author: scaredofflying
Reviews.Content: We just spent 11 days on vacation...2 days pre cruise at the Sheraton Old San Juan and one day post cruise at this hotel..after some of the reviews we read about some of the hotels in Puerto Rico I took my own soap and towels just in case. I felt ridiculous when I saw these 2 hotels..this hotel was great for after the cruise because we just wanted to relax and did not want to sight see. The hotel was clean, we had plenty of towels and all those little products you usually see. The service was very good and I thought the hotel staff really went above and beyond to try to please us. We got off our cruise ship about 9:30 in the morning and our check in time was not until 4pm. I had called this hotel before leaving home to see if they would store our bags until check in and they said yes that we could store them and then enjoy their facilities. Not only did they do that but they also let us check in before noon, as soon as a room was available. They have numerous bathrooms near the pool area where you can change into your bathing suits or if you just want to lounge around the pool in your street clothes you can do that also. They also have numerous tables and chairs near the lobby where you can just relax and have a cool drink while you wait if you want to do that in air conditioned comfort. If you arrive during the evening they had a great latin band playing and they had a very nice dance area also. We asked for an ocean view room and we did have one but as noted in one review if you looked down you could see a garbage dumpster at street level but all you had to do was look out and you had a great partial view of the beach that was just beautiful..given a choice where would you look?? It was great watching the surfers on the waves..I've never seen surfers in person before. They were probably about 1 mile or so from the beach area by the Marriott so did not interfere with being in the surf at this hotel. If you want a full view of the beach you need to ask for a beach front suite. We were happy with our room. It had a great little balcony. There was a building next to it undergoing a little renovation but it did not affect our stay there at all and the Ritz is just down the street a block or so, so it's a nice area. The Marriott is gated and the staff also put lounges and umbrellas on the beach are for your convenience. (All the beaches in San Juan are public beaches). You do hear the planes flying overhead during the day since you are so close to the airport but I did not hear any at night..also if you're on the beach the sound of the surf drowns out he noise from the planes. Their pool area is just beautiful. They have regular pools, kiddie pools, a nice hot tub and numerous loungers so there was never problem finding a place to relax. It is also open 24/7. They have a swim up bar that is open from about 11am until sometime in the evening. We did not buy a lot of drinks there since they were $7.00 each and we have gotten some alcohol on the cruise to take off with us anyway. You can get an all you can drink all day soda deal for 3.95 which I thought was good. FYI..the American hamburgers served at the swim up pool area are 9.95 each. The have a casino downstairs which we tried briefly. They have a gift shop with limited selections but you could get a really cold can of soda for $1.00. They have an area where they sell rather expensive ice cream concoctions but you could also get a hot dog for $2.95. If you wanted a drink and chips with it the price was 4.95. Needless to say after the cruise we did not have a lot of money left so we got the hot dog combo before leaving for the flight home. They also have a restaurant called Salsa where they serve breakfast and dinner buffets during the week and also a lunch buffet on the weekends. We did not try it since we went into Old San Juan to eat at Mofongo's but we did inquire as to the price which was about $10 each for breakfast and lunch. We did take the bus into Old San Juan because we just fell in love with that area when we arrived in Puerto Rico. The buses are supposed to run every 20 minutes but believe me that is a suggestion not a schedule. We waited about 45 minutes for a bus but the concierge had warned us the buses did not run as often on Sunday. But then again for 0.25 cents you can't expect perfection...There were some areas between Isla Verde and Old San Juan in Condado that were really run down and I would not have felt safe walking thru them even during the day. I'm glad we stayed in Old San Juan and Isla Verde during our stay and not in the Condado area. We found a great restaurant in front of the Sheraton Old San Juan called Mofongo's..Our waiter was Omar and he was just great...The food was really good and the prices were reasonable. Try the Mojitos, they are really good for a cool refreshing drink. I will also write a review of the Sheraton and more suggestions for that area. If you want to get from the Marriott to Old San Juan per bus you need to take the A5 bus. When we were done we did take a taxi back to the Marriott which cost $15.00 and was much faster. The pool area at the Marriott and the beach beyond that were so great we just wanted to get back there and relax. Some of the taxi drivers speak fluent English and some speak no English at all so you may want the valet in front of the hotel to tell the taxi driver where you want to go just in case if you don't speak Spanish. All in all this is a great place to stay if you want to swim, sun and play in the surf.. If you have any questions I will be glad to try to answer them...

Reviews.Title: “not stellar but we have no complaints”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Puerto Rico before, this hotel looked fine for a 3-night stay without spending a ton of money. It was. When we checked in we were told the only room with a king-sized bed was a smoking room (we are not smokers.) After a slight hesitation we decided to take the room anyway. Although it was completely clean it did have a slight odor but nothing terrible. This hotel IS very close to the airport, and yes you will hear aircraft taking off and landing during the day. Not a big deal for us, and most importantly we slept great at night and if there was any air traffic during the wee hours, we didn't notice it. Watching the planes lifting off the ground as we sat on the beach was actually kind of entertaining. This beach is not for snorkeling, water is too churned-up. I enjoyed being in it, however: jumping over each big wave as it came crashing in...fun! The pool was very pretty, they landscaped around it more so than other pools we've been to, it added a nice touch of tropical greenery. (Look for the native bird of Puerto Rico flitting around the palm trees while you're there). The Marriott's buffet was (not surprisingly) nothing great. We ate there one night because it was easy and then found restaurants in San Juan the other 2 nights. The American breakfast was adequate but again, you won't love it. Staff were all pleasant & competent. We didn't venture into the casino at all. All in all, there are definitely fancier places to stay in San Juan. If you are looking for an ultra-quiet upscale place with fantastic cuisine, this isn't for you. If you want a clean, nice-looking room with a comfy bed & pillows, a balcony where you can sit and see the beach, a nice pool, and you don't want to break the bank, this might work for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice beachfront value hotel”
Reviews.Author: WaTerBaBy58
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard Isla Verde for one night due to our flight being delayed. Much to our surprise the renovation was done very tastefully. Loved the decor in the lobby, the room, and the restaurants. The hot tub is tucked into a little area away from the pools so it is restful and the pools were very clean. The pool towels were in short supply, but a hotel staffer happily produced some when I asked. The front desk staff was friendly and the concierge was very helpful. For a beachfront resort with many amenities, this is a very good value for a short stay. The airport is 5 minutes away and the jet noise was there, but did not affect my enjoyment of the resort. The Salsa restaurant was nice and had reasonable priced meals and good service. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Will NOT be Staying Here Ever Again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in mid-January...overall, the beach was nice (not great--Culebras was great) and the hotel was okay. Half of the staff I came into contact with were very professional and extremely helpful; the other half were incompetent and unprofessional, some were downright rude. We got stuck on a smoking floor, which they did not tell us about, and every morning, we woke up coughing. As soon as we left the hotel, we felt better. We also got a room with the connecting door--we could hear the family of four (with a baby & a toddler) talking, using the toilet, the baby's cries as if they were in the room with us. I wonder if they knew that they were on a smoking floor? As for the room, everything looked clean, at first. Then I noticed that the fixtures in the bathroom were rusty and loose, there was a fine settling of dust everywhere, and the maid got progressively sloppy with the cleaning of the room, making the bed, replacing towels, etc. When we called down to the front desk to make several complaints, they were not very helpful. At one point, one of them actually said that their hotel isn't exactly the most expensive hotel in the area and implied that if we wanted all these things we were asking for, that we should have stayed at the Ritz. The casino is cheesy, but if you just like to gamble for fun, then there are plenty of $.05 slot machines, unlike other casinos, and you don't have to wait for a seat at a low-minimum table. The breakfast buffet was awful--completely over priced and what they were touting as made to order breakfast was just an omelet station, which was almost always closed (and we were there one hour before they stopped serving). The only time in the week that I saw it open was when we got there very early (we had vouchers, so it was a cheap way to have some simple b'fst). The noise of the airport is unbearable--I didn't realize how CLOSE this hotel was to the airport. If you are planning on going anywhere, I'd recommend renting a car--it's cheaper than taking all those taxis. I couldn't believe those tour operators were charging more than $40/person to take you to El Yunque!

Reviews.Title: “Too close to airport”
Reviews.Author: robiii
Reviews.Content: There were a lot of good things about the Courtyard; nice beach, great staff, music, bar, pool, etc. But I thought it was a little pricey (they charged me extra for a room with a ocen view, but loks to me like they all have a partial view), and the proximity to the airport bothered me. The place is directly across the street from the airport runway. Sometimes the planes taking off is so loud it set off car alarms in the hotel parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: BizTravlr1
Reviews.Content: Beach property with authentic Puerto Rican food and salsa music! Property is recently renovated and has everything you need whether you're there on business or pleasure. Not as overwhelming as the Marriot on the Condado but has all the same pleasures for a modest price. Yes you can hear planes but not at night and during the day I was out so who cares!! I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed It!”
Reviews.Author: stone50
Reviews.Content: Today is Tuesday, the 27th of October 2004, and I just returned from a four-day weekend stay at the Courtyard Marriott Isla Verda. This is obviously the slow season, because the resort was not crowded. I can say that I really enjoyed myself, and I was treated quite well by the staff. I had to pay for my breakfast buffet ($10.00), but it was well worth it. My room was on the 8th floor, a non-smoking floor, and it included a mini-fridge, dvd and cd player. It was very nice. I have read complaints about the noise from the airport, but, at night time, you do not hear the noise. As a matter of fact, I only heard the planes about three times from my room, and it was in the daytime. If you are going to visit Old San Juan, wear loose clothing and your walking shoes. If possible, bring an umbrella to sheild yourself from the heat. I caught a bus about three blocks from the Marriott to get to Old San Juan, the fare was only 25 cents. Old San Juan is beautiful and historic. I enjoyed the street vendors because they did not try to hustle me. I purchased many bottles of water for $1.00 because of the heat. I drank the bottled water because I do not like the taste of the tap water in San Juan. If you ride the bus to Old San Juan, and intend to walk to places like the museums and forts, be advised that it is all uphill, and very strenuous. The people are very friendly as well as beautiful. There are many eating places in Old San Juan, and I regret that I did not get the name of the one where I ate. The food was good and the prices were decent. But back to the Marriott Isla Verde. The "Bananas" restaurant in the lobby serves pretty good food, such as soup, sandwiches, and ice cream. The grill around the pool also serves decent food, but the prices are not great (five dollars for a cup of beer). The evening buffet in the lobby restaurant is adequate, but you should also try some of the other hotels or restaurant for your evening meals. While lounging on the beach Sunday, I was suprised to learn that I could order food from the outdoor grill,and a staff member would bring it to me. Check your bill before you leave! Someone charged two cocktails to my room. I contested it and insisted on seeing the bill with my signature. The bill was brought to me, and when the signatures were checked, it was obvious that it was not my signature, It was promptly handled by the staff. My only problem was my nextel world-wide phone does not work in San Juan. When I called them to find out why, I was told that nextel does not have service in San Juan. The world-wide nextel is a joke. But I digress! I will return again to the Marriott Courtyard Isla Verde in the future, it is a beautiful place, and I enjoyed the casino as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 10-15 thru 10-23. We had a wonderful time. The staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. If we had a problem they fixed it. The pool area is beautiful and always being cared for. The pool staff was great, especially Angel who taught my daughter how to Bogie board and showed a genuine interest in our family. The breakfast buffet was wonderful each morning. The choice of eating establishments in the Isla Verde area is limited and that was disapointing but that certainly isn't the Courtyards fault. Old San Juan,The El Yunque Rain Forest and snorkeling are must do's in Puerto Rico. Could not beat this place for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay with Little Caveats”
Reviews.Author: CommGuy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Courtyard for a weekend getaway Oct. 22-24, 2004. I booked a fall special rate direct with marriott at $129/night. This was a very good rate in comparison to other hotels in San Juan. The hotel was remodeled/reopened sometime after the year 2000, but I am not sure of the year. I believe this property used to be a Crowne Plaza, as that is how it is labeled on an old map I found online of San Juan and the Isla Verde area. The hotel itself is very nice and very clean. Everyone on staff were very friendly and made our stay pleasant. It is fairly compact and not a sprawling resort, so it is easy to get around. The lobby basically contains three open restaurants (somewhat interesting to see where one starts and another stops.) The options are good for kids and adults, and the breakfast buffet is very good. We loved sitting beachside to eat. There is also a nice casino ... I think I played $2 and won a nickle. Not big gamblers. There is a small gift shop and a DVD rental machine, but we had heard they skip some, and we had our own. The DVD/VCR in the room was a nice touch and we enjoyed watching our movies when it was raining or in the evenings. The pools are nice and the service good. There is one freeform pool, a hot tub (which is tucked away in one of the curves of the freeform pool.) There is a smaller kids pool with seats like a hot tub and a very short waterslide (about three feet tall), then a very shallow pool that looks like a hot tub but does not have heat or bubbles. The chairs poolside are nice with a canvas covering, and towels are provided poolside. There is an exercise facility, but we did not go in it. Our room was a king bed with a couch. Room 522. It is the last room going toward the ocean (away from the street) before the four real oceanfront rooms start on the end of the hotel. If you can get a room with an even number, you'll have a BEAUTIFUL view of Carolina beach. If you can get a room ending in 22 on any of the floors (the higher the better), there is one less wall obscuring the view. The rooms with an odd number through 21 appear to face a condo complex, so the view is not as open. There are no buildings to the east of the Courtyard as it is basically at the end of the strip. But it's VERY convenient to the airport. And yes, you can hear and see jets taking off, but it didn't really bother us. We never smelled jet fuel. I found it fascinating to see the large planes rise up over the trees, right across the four lane that the Courtyard fronts. Our room also had free high-speed Internet access and Wi-Fi access in various places on the property, but I had promised myself that the laptop was not traveling on this trip. I understand the business center also offers Internet access, but we never sought it out. The beach is very deep and clean ... they smoothed it out every evening or early morning. It is the same beachfront that the Ritz Carlton has about four or five buildings west of the Courtyard. To the east, it is open beach with public facilities and lifeguard stands. The entire time we were there, the beach was practically deserted. The food in the restaurants was good, but a bit pricey, even for the sandwiches, etc. We bought two drinks poolside and they were $6 each, but really watered down and not very good. We walked down the sidewalk west of the hotel, past Pine Grove and the Ritz Carlton, and had lunch at Shots sports bar and grill, which was good. There is also a Denny's, and there is a full service drugstore where we bought Cokes and snacks. We took a taxi to Plaza las Americas, the largest mall in the Caribbean, and it was very nice (and very loud ... we think some politicians were passing through with mariachi bands!) There is an Outback Steakhouse at the Embassy Suites a short cab ride away, and Ruth's Chris is at the Intercontinental (I think that's right), also a cab ride. Above all, it was a very nice and relaxing stay, which is what we were looking for. We would definitely choose to stay there again, even despite the noise from the airport. We would probably opt to eat out more and less at the hotel. But for the money, the lodging was well worth it. One note regarding the airport ... either we missed signage or there is no signage, but be sure to have your luggage run through the USDA checkpoint BEFORE you check it at your ticket counter for your flight. We had to double-back to have them run through, and had it not been for the fact that we just missed the rush, we could have missed our flight.

Reviews.Title: “No Room Service? Come on!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine with a nice beach, but the lack of room service and restaurant choices (buffet-only) makes this a poor choice for those who prefer those amenities. Making matters worse, there are no outside restaurants within walking distance. Get with the program, guys!

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I did some hotel research before we booked our hotel We wanted something safe and affordable during our stay at P.R. This hotel got favorable reviews so we decided to check it out. When we got there, the hotel was clean. Parking secure ($10 a day). We ate the breakfest buffet. The food was tasty and well cooked. Our room was at the higher floors facing the pool and ocean. If we had a lower floor, we would have a view of the hotel roof and parking lot. Even though we were close to the airport I expected to hear planes flying all day long, but this was not the case. The room was quiet and comfortable. The hotel is on a beach. The beach was clean and our son loved it.The hotel pools were clean and well maintained. My husband enjoyed the casino. He won a couple of dollars there. Puerto Rico is a beautiful island. We rented a car to do our sight seeing. We didn't eat at the hotel or used the swim up bar. We mostly stayed out and enjoyed the views. Overall, we had fun!

Reviews.Title: “Watch your valuables!!”
Reviews.Author: CtChris
Reviews.Content: This place should only be frequented by business travelers who receive reimbursement through their company. The noise from the airport is deafening! It is not a real family place. Although a select few of the staff were very nice, we were violated by someone on staff who entered the room without permission and took money. We were somewhat compensated (although not totally) and later found another item missing. Also- some of the male staff were extremely rude after the incident...making provacative gestures and yelling up at our balcony when they didn't beleive management was looking. Not a very safe nor secure feeling. We didn't want to spend our entire vacation complaining and just decided to watch our backs! Use the in room safe and don't leave anything you value in the open! Also-for the prices and taxes that are charged, there isn't an airport shuttle, you have to rent lounge chairs and umbrellas at the beach. Guests cannot use the open air patio frequently since it it rented out to locals for bingo much of the time. AND don't rent a DVD through the machine! We were not able to view the whole movie since it was skipping all over the place! What a waste. Recommend staying somewhere else...it's not worth the aggravation and feelings of insecurity! However, if you do stay and find something missing, the security staff and management are responsive. Wish they would screen employees better.

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This large hotel is fine. The rooms are comfortable. The location is OK being on a good beach, very close to the airport, you can hear the jets big time. The restaurant is not very good for this caliber hotel. It's OK for an overnight, but don't spend your holiday in Puerto Rico here. It lacks charm. Jan 2004

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel, Excellent Location, My only problem was that ask for an early check in over the phone and they told me it was OK until I got to the hotel at !:00PM and they said I had to wait until 3:00PM. They took my laugagge and I just had a quick lunch and walk around the hotel until it was the regular check in.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in San Juan and Isle Verde”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here july 7th till july 14th.This hotel was excelent. The Breakfast was very nice. On the the weekends it goes on till 10:30 otherwise its 9:30 on weekdays. The hotel is clean and very nice. The Resteraunts are moderatly expensive but convenient. The Pools are small and they dont get cleaned often. Sometimes you are swimming around and all of a sudden there is about 20 dead bugs floating around you. The internet is a big PLUS and the beach and pool are not crowded except on weekends. During the weekends you might want to go out to Old San Juan and visit the forts (San Cristobal,El Morro). In san Juan some very good resteraunts is Rico Puerto, Or MOFONGOS next to the Whyndam Old San Juan. The location is very nice and so is the noghtlife. Specificly ask for a room facing the Pool,If not you have a great view into somebdys apartment. The casino is awsome and if you have kids you can still go to the BACARDI factory.+++++ STAY AT THIS HOTEL+++++

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: nstarks
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel July 3 - 8, 2004. As a matter of fact, I am still here now. This is a great hotel that is conveniently located. It is directly on the beach of Isla Verde, which is stunningly beautiful. Definitely book an oceanfront room! Rooms are clean and large with nice big patios. Housekeeping is thorough and quite accomodating. Front Desk and Concierge are very polite and helpful. Gotta love the free internet in the business center as well. Never crowded and there are three computers for your convenience. Casino is nice too. If you come to the area, definitely visit the town of Pinones, rent a bike and ride down the coastline, visit the Rainforest, tour El Morro (the fort in Old Ponce), check out a Cockfight at Gallistica, definitely do the Bacardi Distillery Tour, and eat at Ajili Mojili (go on a Sunday to eat the buffet so you can sample everything), Metropol (the cornish hen and the Mojito drink are amazing), Lupis (perfect margaritas and the fish tacos rock), and Mi Casa (can't lose no matter what you order)... By the way, the breakfast at the Marriott rocks! Make sure you hang out at the Wyndham El San Juan on Saturday night (about 6 blocks away). There is a huge party every saturday night there. Also, have a drink at the Wet Bar at the Water Club Hotel (approximately 8 blocks away) because the Wet Bar sits on top of the hotel and is very cosmopolitan and posh. Also, make sure you take the local bus (A5) to Old San Juan. It costs 25 cents versus a $16 cab ride one way. Also, you can take the Ferry to Catano, which is where the Bacardi Distillery is located. The ferry will cost 50 cents each way. Remember, you will have to take a cab from the ferry drop off, which will cost $2 per person. DO NOT sign up for a tour through the hotel to Bacardi. It will cost two peoplel $80 when you can do it via bus and ferry and taxi for less than $20 total... Enjoy Puerto Rico and the Marriott. You can't beat it! I don't work for Marriott and I don't have any family or friends that work for Marriott. This review is as accurate and truthful as it gets folks...

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was completely satisfied with every aspect of this hotel (:

Reviews.Title: “Good but couldn't understand the final bill”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Generally a good hotel as the rooms where clean, with good TV, internet connections, phones, good bed but there is no room service and the restaurants are very ordinary if they are open. Breakfast is early as it finishes at 9.30 and they start trying to get you out about 9.15am. I found trying to get food was difficult whilst in the hotel so I spent my time their hungry but if you want to lose a few pounds this might be the place. When I booked I was quoted US$160 a night but when I left they add a 10%($16.00) Hotel Tariff and the government taxes of $19.36 so the total is $195.36. I queried the hotel tariff and taxes and could not get a sensible answer from the staff. My understanding from staying at other hotels in San Juan is the hotel tax is 9% so where they came up which the hotel tariff of 10% and the other of 11% I still don't know. A ordinary hotel but by Puerto Rico standards above average and some of the staff even seem to be trying to make an effort.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it at all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at another Marriott facility in Hong Kong, The New World Renaissance and that's why I chose to stay...This place was terrible...I stayed on the tenth floor...The entire floor smelled of mold and mildew, as did my room...The staff sprayed some citrus stuff in my room, but then it smelled like a rotten orange...The room was not clean, it had a multitude of starburst wrappers behind the nightstand and looked as if nothing had been wiped down...Had a problems with ants in the bathroom...None of the glassware was wrapped in plastic to show it had been sterilized...When staff cleaned the room, all they did was rinse out the glasses and coffee mugs...I never got clean, new ones...The casino was very small and had litter strewn about as well as cigarette butts crushed out on the sides of the machines...The food was overcooked, chicken, turkey and pork all overdone and tasteless in both the restaurant and pool bar...The utensils in the restaurant had dried food on them...One day I got locked out of my room because my key cards did not work and a member of the housekeeping staff let me in without determining if it in fact was my room...Wonder who else could have gotten into my room...The beach was not very clean...Sand was course and litter abundent, as were cigarette butts...Upon check out, was ignored by two clerks for several minutes the I was refused a receipt for my stay...All in all, a bad experience...I was happy to leave...The food on the airplane was 5 star compared to what I tried to eat at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back, we stayed just last weekend. It was great! The staff (everyone) was very nice. The room was clean and nicely decorated. It also had a wonderful view of the ocean. The free breakfast each morning was very good and each morning had a beautiful view of the ocean. I would highly recommend this hotel and I plan to return shortly. It is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT value Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the hotel. We arrived on Tuesday, May 25, 2004 in the mid afternoon. We registered, I asked what type of room I had gotten (got reservations through Expedia), the host stated that I was in a standard room. I then gave him my Marriott Rewards card, he said that he could give me a much better room, and proceeded to look. We went from a 3rd floor no view room to a 12th floor beach view room! The room was very good, excellent view, on the beach side looking over the pool. The room had internet connection and a king bed with a pullout sofa. Customer service was excellent, they knew my name at the desk, without even looking me up! Pool was excellent, love the swim up to the bar, ate a lunch there and drank SEVERAL Pina Coladas! Beach access was excellent, even though it was the NEXT beach over from the big beach. There are NO other hotels to look at down the beach, as the rest of the beach is a public beach! It was very quite and restful, beach was clean, pool was nicely set-up! Seeing as we where there on the leading edge of memorial day weekend, LOTS of 20 something girls (pretty too) where in the pool and on the beach most of the time! ONLY Markdowns: 1. free breakfast, GREAT idea, Poor quality food (only the eggs, VERY DRY), rest was very good, lots of juice, and PR coffee; warm milk, strong coffee! 2. Buffet Dinner, pass if possible, marginal quality. (Went to Lupi's for dinner twice, a short walk toward InterCont). 3. Paying for parking, was a $10.00/day charge? Guests should be free!? 4. Concierge, was no help, just should pictures in a book, some knowledge, not going "Above and Beyond". Thought it was okay to go to El Yungue on the Friday before Memorial Day, we tried..traffic and crowds where terrible! TIP: Reserve a Snorkel trip out of Fojardo before you go, we used Spread Eagle II, excellent trip, do it on week days ONLY! Old San Juan should be seen during the week, make sure there are NO cruise ships in!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the courtyard by marriott from 5/6-5/9/04. The hotel room was spacious! (junior suite) The bar/lounge was jumping every night we were there, the live music was great and the best part was that we couldn't hear the music when we went up to our rooms (3rd fl). Complimentary breakfast was excellent, even my mother-in-law liked it! The only knock I have is that there were only 1 place to dine if you didn't want to have the music blaring at you, and that was outside. Otherwise, there was no room service to order in. Other than that, however, our stay was very enjoyable. I especially liked the wifi internet access, I was able to bring my laptop down and work while I was eating. would definitely recommend this place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent resort with friendly staff and nice accommodations. I would recommend this resort to all my friends and when i return to Puerto Rico i will stay there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach resort for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a clean hotel with a great beach and pool area. The free breakfast buffett is a real plus. The rooms are comfortable and most have a great view of the Ocean. The service was very good. Isla Verde is very close to the airport. You can hear the plans from all of the hotels in Isla Verde. The courtyard is at the end of the Isla Verde "strip", so it is a bit of a walk to get to the other hotels or shopping and restaurants. The only other negative things I noticed were the price of the drinks, and 6 dollars for a beach chair rental. The chairs at the pool are free, and the beach is right there...you can easily go from pool to beach. I enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Courtyard in Isla Verde on the Sunday following our cruise. Despite the fact that check-in time was 3 p.m., our room was ready and waiting for us just before 11:30 a.m.! Our reception was warm and courteous, and our room was absolutely perfect--spacious, comfortable, and with a panoramic view of the beautiful beach and pool grounds. There were San Juan excursions available at the desk in the lobby, which we immediatley took advantage of. Denny's, Outback, and Ruth Chris Steakhouse were all within minutes of the hotel, although we did enjoy the complimentary buffet breakfast each morning at Salsa's, just outside of the lobby. Because we arrived on Sunday, and thousands of cruisers were departing from the adjacent airport, the noise was rather annoying, setting off car alarms in the hotel parking lot. However, things did calm down a bit on the weekdays. Because our flight wasn't until 5 p.m. on the day of our departure, they stored our luggage for us and allowed us to continue to use the facilities. I certainly would recommend the Courtyard--regardless of the airport noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent property. We went in to our stay, which was one night after our cruise, knowing we were right next to the airport. Staying in this remodeled property with a beautiful beach and pool only steps away was well worth the airplane noise. We were very satisfied with all the staff and the pool/bar staff were especially nice. Food and drinks at the pool were very tasty and worth the cost. We'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: K&J-TRIP
Reviews.Content: We wnjoyed our stay at the courtyard. It is close to the airport, so there is the noise of planes. Great beach, fun outdoor grill and swim-up bar in thr pool by the beach. There was live music every evening with good dancing. The Banana Bar, uses Ben & Jerry's icecreams and had wonderful concoctions. The staff was very courtious. The rooms are large and clean. Breakfast Buffett is included.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifullly clean and well maintained. Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard Marriott March 21-26, 2004 and was very impressed with how well maintained everything was. The buffet breakfast was fantastic and the food at the pool bar was also wonderful. I never at dinner inside but heard that it was also good if you liked Puerto Rican food. All of the staff were very helpful and friendly and I will go back there again and again. The music in the lounge was also very good and the rooms were very nice. A very clean, well maintained hotel. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone and can't wait to go back next winter!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Fun and Loved It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our room was an Ocean Deluxe, and sitting on the balconey was very peacful, relaxing and beautiful. The Hotel and Casino staff were very friendly and accomedating. If I get the wonderful opportunity to visit San Juan again, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Unless you like Rudeness & attitude, go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The trip from hell started with bad weather. We have all experienced and understand it's part of travel. We were tired and weary, and honestly a little pesimistic. So we called the hotel - JUST TO MAKE SURE that we still had a room. Note that at this time it was 2:30 am. Sure enough, the Marriott had overbooked and had no rooms left for us. Apparently the late arrival guarantee is worthless. We were informed that we would have to go to the hotel, fill out paperwork, then get in a taxi to go to the hotel we would stay at. Did I mention it was 2:30?? We were assured after the second call that we had rooms for the next night and we would be upgraded at no charge.Welcome to the next night. No upgrades available. When I asked, they said it was merely a "request". I informed them that it was THEIR request for the upgrade, not something I had requested, but apparently that means nothing. No upgrade was provided.Don't waste your money on this hotel unless you REALLY like frustration.A fruit plate was provided to ease mine. It didn't work.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard from Feb 28 to March 5, 2004 following a cruise. The hotel is beautiful and looked just like the pictures on the internet. Everything was clean and we were well taken care of. Our room was incredible. This hotel is more expensive than we normally book, but worth every penny. We took a standard room and were very pleased with the ocean view. Yes, we heard the planes, but no big deal. I would not hesitate to stay another time.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but too close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall the Couryard is a very well run and maintained hotel. My partner and I vacationed there the first week of March after doing research on the internet including Trip Advisor. Yes, the hotel is very close to the airport. The runway is just over the highway directly next to the hotel. The jets can definitely be heard. However, just about any hotel in Isla Verde will be within range of the noise of the jets. Also keep in mind that the Isla Verde area while offering great beaches is about a 20 minute taxi ride into Old San Juan. About $20 each way including tip. Sunday evening seemed to be the worse day for take offs, after that they were less frequent. If you close your balcony doors, the sound is muffled. Bottom line is that we had a very nice time despite the jets. The pool area is great with friendly waiters at the swim up bar and grill. The beach was fantastic, clean with a fantastic view. Plus it was not crowded at all. The beach is right off the pool area, so you really don't need to pay for a beach lounge chair, just stay at the pool and stroll to the beach. While you can save a lot on dinner costs by utilizing the Courtyard's dinner buffet for just $20 per person, you are in walking distance to the Ritz-Carlton and Wyndham El San Juan which offer a wide array of restaurants. The complimentary breakfast was also excellent and a great way to keep your food costs down. The place offers a great stay for the price. You really just need to decide how much the jets will bother you. After a day, they really were not that big a deal. We will most likely go back on our next stay in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: RicoFan
Reviews.Content: Sure it's noisey -- you"re close to the airport! But anyone writing a review of this hotel has probably researched on the internet before booking and didn't mind paying a little less and getiing better value. We spent a week at the Marriott in mid Jan "04 prior to boarding a cruise ship and enjoyed our stay -- the beach is as good as reported providing great fun in the moderate surf, the complementary breakfast is very good, the hotel cleanliness and staff friendlyness are both excellent and the casino is good at taking your money. We rented a car and enjoyed the beauty of the island and the great restaurants within fifteen minutes driving. Puerto Rico is expensive -- just check the rates at the Ritz which is only a few hundred yards away although it does have a couple a very good restaurants. What you save on your room will pay for a car rental and a couple of great meals. Give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week 12/24/03-12/31/03. Room we were given was horrible, there are no rollaways, they charge $6/beach chair which is not in the website anywhere, lunch was prepared differently 4 days in a row even tho ordered same food, dinner was just a disgusting buffet, maid stole change from room on first day, a/c sounded like jet engine and was finally replaced at 1 a.m., mgr refused to respond to complaints orofer assistance, gneeral staff was unfreindly except for young man who got us taxis daily, there was no watersports or beach volleyball on premises as was promised in website and was very important to my kids--this is just the beginning--DONT EVER STAY HERE THEY DONT CARE ABOUT U !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A terrific hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: SassyNY
Reviews.Content: After researching almost every hotel in Puerto Rico, I decided on the Courtyard. I must say I was pleasantly surprised. From check in to check out we had no problems. The room was very nice, clean, and had all the ammenities we needed. The pool was beautiful and there were always enough towels for everyone. The swim up bar was great. There was plenty of food - they have a grill by the swim up bar and you can have lunch on the tables there. The restaurant was open for breakfast and dinner. We brought our own food, but it looked like the people were enjoying the food there. You were able to hear the planes, but if you stayed at the Ritz down the block you would hear them too. It wasn't so bad, you get used to it after a while. They didn't wake me up in the morning or prevent me from going to sleep at night, so it wasn't so terrible. They have a small casino and bar/club in the hotel if you are looking for something to do. Basically we went to relax and that is exactly what we did. The staff was friendly and helpful and if you are looking for stuff to do, the tour guide in front can help you. I would go back again if I had a chance.

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard by Marriott Isla Verde Beach Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 7012 Boca de Cangrejos Ave, Isla Verde 00979, Puerto Rico
